and also preaching
mokSha-dharmam
the path of liberation
tvaM bhrAtRRimAn
Thou along with Thy brother (Nara)
badarikAshramam-adhyavAtsI:
dwelt in Badarikaashrama
shakra:-atha
Indra then
te shama-tapa:-bala-nissaha-AtmA
unable to bear because of jealousy Thy prowess acquired by discipline and penance
divyA~NganA-parivRRitam
surrounded by celestial beauties
prajighAya
sent
mAram
cupid
---------
Practicing and teaching the path of disciplines, leading to liberation, Thou with Nara Thy brother, dwelt in Badarikaashrama. Indra who was jealous of Thy spiritual powers, which Thou had acquired by penance and discipline, sent cupid along with celestial beauties to disturb Thee.

kAmo vasantamalayAnilabandhushAlI
kAntAkaTAkShavishikhairvikasadvilAsai: |
vidhyanmuhurmuhurakampamudIkShya cha tvAM
bhIrustvayA.atha jagade mRRiduhAsabhAjA ||5||
---------
kAma:
Cupid
vasanta-malaya-anila
with Vasant (spring) and Malaya breeze
bandhushAlI
as his friends (associates)
kAntA-kaTAkSha-vishikhai:-
with the arrows in the sidelong glances of the damsels
vikasat-vilAsai:
and amorous movements
vidhyan-muhu:-muhu:-
piercing again and again
akampam-udIkShya cha tvAm
and seeing Thee unwavered
bhIru:-
(were) frightened
tvayA-atha jagade
then, were told by Thee
mRRidu-hAsa-bhAjA
(Thee) who were smiling

Cupid accompanied by spring season and the Malaya breeze, tried to attack Thee many times by the arrows consisting of the damsels' sidelong glances and their amorous movements. Finding Thee unaffected, they were frightened. Thou then smilingly spoke to them.
---------
bhItyA.alama~Ngaja vasanta surA~NganA vo
manmAnasaM tviha juShadhvamiti bruvANa: |
tvaM vismayena parita: stuvatAmathaiShAM
prAdarshaya: svaparichArakakAtarAkShI: ||6||

bhItyA-alam-
do not fear
a~Ngaja vasanta surA~NganA va:
you (all) Cupid, Spring, damsels
mat-mAnasam tu-iha
here, however, (you all) product of my mind
juShadhvam-
enjoy
iti bruvANa:
thus saying
tvaM
Thou (showed)
vismayena parita:
(who were) surrounded by wonder (wonder-struck)
stuvatAm-atha-aiShAm
who were praising Thee, then to them
prAdarshaya:
(Thou) showed
svaparichAraka-kAtarAkShI:
the beautiful damsels attending on Thee
---------
Thou told Cupid and others who were standing around Thee struck with wonder, and praising Thee -" O Kaamdeva, Spring and damsels! Do not fear. Look at these products of my mind." So saying Thou revealed to them the beautiful handmaids attending on Thee.

sammohanAya militA madanAdayaste
tvaddAsikAparimalai: kila mohamApu: |
dattAM tvayA cha jagRRihustrapayaiva sarva-
svarvAsigarvashamanIM punarurvashIM tAm ||7||
---------
sammohanAya
to enchant (Thee)
militA madana-Adaya:-
Cupid and others who had assembled
te
Thee
tvat-dAsikA-parimalai:
by the fragrance of Thy handmaids
kila moham-Apu:
indeed were enchanted
dattAM tvayA cha
and given by Thee
jagRRihu:-trapayA-eva
accepted (Urvashi) with shame indeed
sarva-svarvAsi-garva-shamanIM
who humbled the pride of all celestial damsels
puna:-urvashIM tAm
again that Urvashi

Kaamadeva (Cupid) and others who had come to overpower Thee, were themselves captivated by Thy handmaids' fragrance.Then, they, feeling ashamed, accepted Urvashi, who was given by Thee and who humbled the pride of all the celestial damsels.
---------
dRRiShTvorvashIM tava kathAM cha nishamya shakra:
paryAkulo.ajani bhavanmahimAvamarshAt |
evaM prashAntaramaNIyatarAvatArA-
ttvatto.adhiko varada kRRiShNatanustvameva ||8||

dRRiShTvA-urvashIM
on seeing Urvashee
tava kathAM cha nishamya
and hearing Thy story
shakra:
Indra
paryAkula:-ajani
became perplexed
bhavat-mahimA-avamarshAt
on realising Thy glory
evaM
in this manner
prashAnta-ramaNIyatara-avatArAt
gentle and so beautiful than this incarnation (avataara)
ttvatta:-
of Thee
adhika:
greater (surpassing)
varada
O Bestower of boons!
kRRiShNatanu:-tvam-eva
is Thy incarnation as Krishna, only
---------
Seeing Urvashi and hearing about Thy achievements, Indra was perplexed, and thus realized Thy glory. O Bestower of Boons! This incarnation of Thee as Nara Naaraayana which is so gentle and beautiful, is excelled only by Thy incarnation as Krishna.

dakShastu dhAturatilAlanayA rajo.andho
nAtyAdRRitastvayi cha kaShTamashAntirAsIt |
yena vyarundha sa bhavattanumeva sharvaM
yaj~ne cha vairapishune svasutAM vyamAnIt ||9||
---------
dakSha:-tu
Daksha, indeed
dhAtu:-ati-lAlanayA
due to excessive indulgence shown by Brahmaa
raja:-andha:
blinded by Rajoguna (haughtiness)
na-ati-AdRRita:-tvayi
without much respect for Thee
cha kaShTam-
and Alas!
ashAnti:-AsIt
was unpeaceful in mind
yena vyarundha sa
because of that he became antagonistic to
bhavat-tanum-eva sharvaM
Shiva who is a form of Thee alone
yaj~ne cha vaira-pishune
and during the Yanjya which he did to show his enmity to Shiva
sva-sutAm vyamAnIt
insulted his own daughter

Owing to the extreme indulgence given to him by Brahmaa, Daksha was blinded with haughtiness and overpowered by Rajoguna. Alas! He had no respect for Thee and had lost his mental calmness. So he became antagonistic to Shiva who is Thee alone in another form. He performed a sacrifice to show his enmity towards Shiva and also slighted his own daughter Sati.
---------
kruddheshamarditamakha: sa tu kRRittashIrSho
devaprasAditaharAdatha labdhajIva: |
tvatpUritakratuvara: punarApa shAntiM
sa tvaM prashAntikara pAhi marutpuresha ||10||

kruddha-Isha-mardita-makha:
enraged, Shiva disrupted the Yanjya
sa tu kRRitta-shIrSha:
and that Daksha was beheaded
deva-prasAdita-harAt-atha
from Shiva who was propitiated by the gods, then,
labdha-jIva:
was restored to life
tvat-pUrita-kratuvara:
whose Yanjya was completed by Thy grace
puna:-Apa shAntiM
(he) regained peace of mind
sa tvaM prashAntikara
That Thou O Bestower of calmness!
pAhi marutpuresha
protect O Lord of Guruvaayur!
---------
Enraged, Shiva disrupted the sacrifice of Daksha and also cut off his head. However on being propitiated by the gods, Shiva restored Daksha to life again. His sacrifice was then completed by Thy grace, and he also achieved mental peace. O Lord of Guruvaayur! O Bestower of calmness! deign to protect me.

Narayaneeyam D017

Dashaka 17
---------
uttAnapAdanRRipatermanunandanasya
jAyA babhUva suruchirnitarAmabhIShTA |
anyA sunItiriti bharturanAdRRitA sA
tvAmeva nityamagati: sharaNaM gatA.abhUt ||1||
---------
uttAnapAda-nRRipate:-
king Uttaanpaad's
manu-nandanasya
who was the son of Manu
jAyA babhUva suruchi:-
wife became Suruchi
nitarAm-abhIShTA
extremely dear
anyA sunIti:-iti
the other (wife) named Suneeti
bhartu:-anAdRRitA sA
she was neglected by her husband
tvAm-eva nityam-
in Thee alone, who are eternal
agati:-sharaNaM
refuge of the helpless (she)
gatA-abhUt
(in Thee) took refuge

To the king Uttaanpaada, the son of Manu, his wife Suruchi was extremely dear. The other wife Suneeti being ignored by her husband, was helpless and took shelter in Thee alone who are eternal refuge of the helpless.
---------
a~Nke pitu: suruchiputrakamuttamaM taM
dRRiShTvA dhruva: kila sunItisuto.adhirokShyan |
AchikShipe kila shishu: sutarAM suruchyA
dussantyajA khalu bhavadvimukhairasUyA ||2||

a~Nke pitu:
on (his) father's lap
suruchi-putrakam-uttamaM taM
Suruchi's son, that Uttama,
dRRiShTvA dhruva: kila
seeing Dhruva indeed
sunIti-suta:-adhirokShyan
the son of Suneeti (who was) about to get up,
AchikShipe kila shishu:
the child was severely scolded
sutarAM suruchyA
as a result by Suruchi
dussantyajA khalu
indeed (jealousy) cannot be given up
bhavat-vimukhai:-
by those who are not devoted to Thee
asUyA
jealousy
---------
Seeing Uttama, Suruchi's son, seated on his father's lap, Suneeti's son Dhruva also tried to get up. But as a result, the child was severely scolded by Suruchi. Indeed, jealousy cannot be given up, by those who are not devoted to Thee.

tvanmohite pitari pashyati dAravashye
dUraM duruktinihata: sa gato nijAmbAm |
sA.api svakarmagatisantaraNAya puMsAM
tvatpAdameva sharaNaM shishave shashaMsa ||3||
---------
tvat-mohite pitari
being under the influence of Thy Maayaa, the father
pashyati dAr-vashye
seeing hen-pecked
dUraM durukti-nihata: sa:
he (Dhruva) was taken aback and hurt by the cruel words
gata: nija-ambAm
(he) went to his own mother
sA-api
she also
sva-karma-gati-santaraNAya
for getting over the effects of ones own actions
puMsAM
for human beings
tvat-pAdam-eva sharaNaM
Thy feet are the only refuge
shishave shashaMsa
(thus) she advised the child

The hen-pecked king who was under the influence of Thy Maayaa, silently looked on as Dhruva was scolded by Suruchi. Hurt for being scolded, Dhruva then went to his own mother Suneeti who advised him that the only way to overcome the evils of ones own past actions is to seek shelter at Thy feet.
---------
AkarNya so.api bhavadarchananishchitAtmA
mAnI niretya nagarAt kila pa~nchavarSha: |
sandRRiShTanAradaniveditamantramArga-
stvAmArarAdha tapasA madhukAnanAnte ||4||

AkarNya sa:-api
hearing, he also
bhavat-archana-nishchita-AtmA
determined to devote himself to Thy worship
mAnI niretya nagarAt
he who had self respect, leaving the town
kila pa~ncha-varSha:
(though) indeed five years of age
sandRRiShTa-nArada
meeting Naarada,
nivedita-mantra-mArga:-
and receiving instructions in the path of Mantra (japa)
tvAm-ArarAdha tapasA
propitiated Thee by penance
madhu-kAnana-ante
at the end of the forest named Madhu
---------
The self respecting Dhruva, who was only five years of age, hearing his mother's words, became determined to worship Thee, and so left the town. In the forest of Madhuvana, he propitiated Thee by penance, following the method of Mantra japa and the Mantra given to him by Naarada, whom he had met on the way.

tAte viShaNNahRRidaye nagarIM gatena
shrInAradena parisAntvitachittavRRittau |
bAlastvadarpitamanA: kramavardhitena
ninye kaThoratapasA kila pa~nchamAsAn ||5||
---------
tAte viShaNNa-hRRidaye
while the father was full of remorse,
nagarIM gatena shrInAradena
by Shri Naarada, who had gone to the town
parisAntvita-chitta-vRRitau
(his) upset mind was consoled
bAla:-tvat-arpita-manA:
(meanwhile) the boy with his mind fixed on Thee
krama-vardhitena
with increasing
ninye kaThora-tapasA
intensity carried out severe penance
kila pa~ncha-mAsAn
indeed for five months

The king who was full of remorse, was pacified and consoled by Naarada who had gone to the town. Dhruva, the boy with his mind fixed on Thee, spent five months in severe penance, with increasing intensity.
---------
tAvattapobalaniruchCh-vasite digante
devArthitastvamudayatkaruNArdrachetA: |
tvadrUpachidrasanilInamate: purastA-
dAvirbabhUvitha vibho garuDAdhirUDha: ||6||

tAvat-tapo-bala-niruchCh-vasite
then,suffocated by the power of penance (of Dhruva)
digante
all the directions
deva-arthita:-tvam-
to the devas who were seeking relief, (to them) Thou
udayat-karuNA-Ardra-chetA:
with a mind surging with compassion
tvat-rUpa-chit-rasa-nilIna-mate:
(Dhruva) whose mind was absorbed with the Supreme Consciousness Bliss, which had assumed Thy form
purastAt-
in front ( of Dhruva)
AvirbabhUvitha
(Thou) appeared
vibho
O Lord!
garuDa-adhirUDha:
mounted on Garuda
---------
Then, when all around in all the directions there was suffocation by the power of Dhruva's penance, the devas were seeking relief. Then, Thou surging with compassion, appeared seated on Garuda, in front of Dhruva, whose mind was absorbed in contemplation of the Supreme Consciousness Bliss which had assumed Thy form.

tvaddarshanapramadabhAratara~NgitaM taM
dRRigbhyAM nimagnamiva rUparasAyane te |
tuShTUShamANamavagamya kapoladeshe
saMspRRiShTavAnasi dareNa tathA.a.adareNa ||7||
---------
tvat-darshana
at the sight of Thee
pramada-bhAra-tara~NgitaM taM
which completely overwhelmed him with waves of Bliss and ecstasy
dRRigbhyAm nimagnam-iva
as if his eyes were submerged
rUpa-rasAyane te
in the nectar of Thy entrancing form
tuShTUShamANam-
desirous of singing Thy praise
avagamya
understanding (Thou)
kapola-deshe
on the cheek
saMspRRiShTavAn-asi
Thou did touch (him)
dareNa
by the conch
tathA-AdareNa
and with great affection

At Thy divine sight, Dhruva was completely overwhelmed and was full of the the waves of Bliss and ecstasy. As his eyes were submerged in the nectar of Thy entrancing form he was desirous of singing Thy praise. Realising his incapability of finding words, Thou with great affection touched his cheek with the conch.
---------
tAvadvibodhavimalaM praNuvantamena-
mAbhAShathAstvamavagamya tadIyabhAvam |
rAjyaM chiraM samanubhUya bhajasva bhUya:
sarvottaraM dhruva padaM vinivRRittihInam ||8||

tAvat-
then
vibodha-vimalaM
who had been cleansed of all taint by knowledge
praNuvantam-enam-
who was profusely praising Thee
abhAShathA:-tvam-
Thou did tell (him)
avagamya tadIya-bhAvam
knowing what he had in mind
rAjyaM chiraM samanubhUya
(that) after enjoying kingship for long
bhajasva bhUya:
attain, thereafter,
sarvottaraM dhruva padaM
the loftiest of status of Dhruva
vinivRRitti-hInaM
from which there is no return
---------
He then sang Thy praise profusely, having been purified and enlightened by pure knowledge. Knowing what he had in mind, Thou blessed him to enjoy the kingdom for long and then attain the loftiest of states, that of Dhruva, from where there is no return to lower states.

ityUchiShi tvayi gate nRRipanandano.asA-
vAnanditAkhilajano nagarImupeta: |
reme chiraM bhavadanugrahapUrNakAma-
stAte gate cha vanamAdRRitarAjyabhAra: ||9||
---------
iti-UchiShi
having said so
tvayi gate
when Thou had gone away
nRRipanandana:-asau-
this prince
Anandita-akhila-jana:
pleasing all the people
nagarIm-upeta:
reached the town
reme chiraM
enjoyed for a long time
bhavat-anugraha-pUrNa-kAma:-
with all his aspirations fulfilled by Thy grace
tAte gate cha vanam-
and when his father had gone to the forest
AdRRita-rAjya-bhAra:
taking over the administration of the kingdom

When Thou disappeared after having said so, this prince Dhruva came back to town delighting all people. When his father had gone to the forest, taking over the administration of the kingdom, with all his aspirations fulfilled by Thy grace, he lived happily for a long time.
---------
yakSheNa deva nihate punaruttame.asmin
yakShai: sa yuddhanirato virato manUktyA |
shAntyA prasannahRRidayAddhanadAdupetA-
ttvadbhaktimeva sudRRiDhAmavRRiNonmahAtmA ||10||

yakSheNa
by Yaksha
deva
O Lord!
nihate puna:-
being killed, then
uttame-asmin
this Uttama (Dhruva's brother)
yakShai: sa yuddha-nirata:
he engaged in a fight with the Yakshas
virata: manu-uktyA
and withdrew on Manu's advice
shAntyA prasanna-hRRidayAt-
who was happy at the peaceful nature (of Dhruva)
dhanadAt-upetAt
from Kuber who had approached him (Dhruva)
tvat-bhaktim-eva sudRRiDhAm-
Thy firm devotion alone
avRRiNot-
asked for as a boon
mahAtmA
the great souled one (Dhruva)
---------
When Uttama, Dhruva's brother was killed by Yaksha, Dhruva battled with Yaksha, but withdrew on Manu's advice. Pleased with Dhruva's peaceful nature, Kuber came and offered him a boon, but the great soul asked only for firm devotion to Thee.

ante bhavatpuruShanItavimAnayAto
mAtrA samaM dhruvapade mudito.ayamAste |
evaM svabhRRityajanapAlanaloladhIstvaM
vAtAlayAdhipa nirundhi mamAmayaughAn ||11||
---------
ante
finally
bhavat-puruSha-nIta-vimAna-yAta:
going in the celestial car brought by Thy attendants
mAtrA samaM
along with his mother
dhruvapade mudita:-ayam-Aste
(he) is living happily even now in Dhruvaloka
evaM
in this manner
sva-bhRRitya-jana-pAlana-lola-dhI:-tvaM
Thou who are ever eager minded to protect Thy devotees
vAtAlayAdhipa
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
nirundhi
cure
mama-Amaya-aughAn
my hoards of ailments

Finally, leaving along with his mother in the celestial car brought by Thy attendants, he is even now living happily in Dhruvaloka. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Who are ever intent on protecting Thy devotees, cure my hoards of ailments.

Narayaneeyam D018

Dashaka 18
---------
jAtasya dhruvakula eva tu~NgakIrte-
ra~Ngasya vyajani suta: sa venanAmA |
yaddoShavyathitamati: sa rAjavarya-
stvatpAde nihitamanA vanaM gato.abhUt ||1||
---------
jAtasya dhruvakule-eva
who was born in the line of Dhruva itself
tu~Nga-kIrte:-a~Ngasya
to Anga of great fame
vyajani suta: sa vena-nAmA
was born the son named Vena
yat-doSha-vyathita-mati:
saddened by whose evil deeds
sa: rAjavarya:-
that noble king
tvat-pAde nihita-manA
with his mind fixed on Thy feet
vanaM gata:-abhUt
took to the forest

In the line of Dhruva was the very famous king Anga whose son was Vena. Distressed at the evil nature of his son, the noble king took to the forest with his mind fixed on Thy lotus feet alone.
---------
pApo.api kShititalapAlanAya vena:
paurAdyairupanihita: kaThoravIrya: |
sarvebhyo nijabalameva samprashaMsan
bhUchakre tava yajanAnyayaM nyarautsIt ||2||

pApa:-api
though evil minded
kShiti-tala-pAlanAya
for the governance of the country
vena: paurAdyai:-upanihita:
by the leading citizens, Vena was made the king
kaThora-vIrya:
being of very great prowess
sarvebhya: nija-balam-eva
to all his might alone
samprashaMsan
boasting about
bhUchakre
all over the earth
tava yajanAni-
sacrifices to Thee
ayaM nyarautsIt
prohibited
---------
Though evil minded, Vena who was of great prowess was made the king by the leading citizens for the governance of the country. He always boasted of his strength and prohibited the practice of all forms of Thy worship and sacrifices.

samprApte hitakathanAya tApasaughe
matto.anyo bhuvanapatirna kashchaneti |
tvannindAvachanaparo munIshvaraistai:
shApAgnau shalabhadashAmanAyi vena: ||3||
---------
samprApte
approaching him
hitakathanAya
to advise him in regard to right conduct
tApasa-aughe
when a group of sages
matta:-anya: bhuvanapati:-na kashchan-iti
other than me there is no lord of the earth saying thus
tvat-nindA-vachana-para:
indulging in defaming Thee
munIshvarai:-tai:
by those great sages
shApa-agnau
in the fire of their curse
shalabha-dashAm-anAyi
was destroyed like a moth
vena:
Vena

When a group of sages approached him to advise him as to the right conduct, he indulged in abusing Thee declaring that there was no other ruler on the earth other than himself. The enraged sages cursed him. In the flame of the curse Vena was destroyed like a moth.
---------
tannAshAt khalajanabhIrukairmunIndrai-
stanmAtrA chiraparirakShite tada~Nge |
tyaktAghe parimathitAdathorudaNDA-
ddordaNDe parimathite tvamAvirAsI: ||4||

tat-nAshAt
because of his death
khalajana-bhIrukai:- munIndrai:-
afraid of the wicked people, the great sages
tat-mAtrA chiraparirakShite tat-a~Nge
from his body preserved by his mother for a long time
tyakta-aghe
removed sins
parimathitAt-atha-urudaNDAt-
by churning his thighs
dordaNDe parimathite
then (when) the hands (were) being churned
tvam-AvirAsIt
Thou manifested Thyself
---------
After his destruction, the sages feared that the absence of a ruler would lead to the tyranny of wicked people. So they took the body of Vena from his mother who had preserved it for a long time and churned the thighs. Thus his body became sinless. Then when his arms were churned, from there Thou appeared (in the form of Prithu).

vikhyAta: pRRithuriti tApasopadiShTai:
sUtAdyai: pariNutabhAvibhUrivIrya: |
venArtyA kabalitasampadaM dharitrI-
mAkrAntAM nijadhanuShA samAmakArShI: ||5||
---------
vikhyAta: pRRithu-iti
famous as Prithu
tApasa-upadiShTai:
thus being advised by the great sages
sUta-Adyai:
the minstrels and others
pariNuta-bhAvi-bhUri-vIrya:
sang in praise of Thy future achievements
vena-ArtyA
tormented by Vena
kabalita-sampadaM dharitrIm-
the earth who had withdrawn her resources into her interior
AkrAntAm nija-dhanuShA
was attacked by Thy arrow
samAm-akArShI
(and was) made even

This was the famous incarnation of Thee as Prithu, the sages declared thus. The minstrels and others sang in praise of Thy future achievements. The Earth who had withdrawn all her resources into her interior because of the oppression of Vena, was attacked by Thy bow and arrow, and was made to yield back the resources.
---------
bhUyastAM nijakulamukhyavatsayuktyai-
rdevAdyai: samuchitachArubhAjaneShu |
annAdInyabhilaShitAni yAni tAni
svachChandaM surabhitanUmadUduhastvam ||6||

bhUya:-tAM
then the earth
nija-kula-mukhya-vatsa-yuktai:-
with the leader of each group as the calf
deva-Adyai:
by the gods and others
samuchita-chAru-bhAjaneShu
in appropriate special vessels
annAdIni-abhilaShitAni
food and other things as desired
yAni tAni
this and that
svachChandaM
unhesitatingly
surabhi-tanUm
(the earth) in the form of Surabhi (the celestial cow)
adUduha: tvam
Thou milked
---------
Thou then made the gods and other species of beings to freely milk the Earth who had become like the celestial cow Surabhi. The leaders of the different groups of gods and others acted as calves milking their desired requirements in appropriate special vessels.

AtmAnaM yajati makhaistvayi tridhAma-
nnArabdhe shatatamavAjimedhayAge |
spardhAlu: shatamakha etya nIchaveSho
hRRitvA.ashvaM tava tanayAt parAjito.abhUt ||7||
---------
AtmAnaM yajati makhai:-tvayi
as Thou were sacrificing to Thyself by Yanjyas
tridhAman-
O Lord of the three worlds!
Arabdhe shatatama-vAji-medha-yAge
(and) at the starting of the hundredth Ashwamedha Yanjya
spardhAlu shatamakha:
jealous Indra
etya nIchaveSha:
came as a barbarian
hRRitvA-ashvaM
stealing away the horse
tava tanayAt
by Thy son
parAjita:-abhUt
was defeated

O Lord of the three worlds! As Thou (as Prithu) were performing sacrifices to Thyself, and were to begin the hundredth Ashwamedha Yanjya, Indra became jealous. In the guise of a lowly person he stole the Yanjya horse. He was then defeated by Thy son (Vijitashwana).
---------
devendraM muhuriti vAjinaM harantaM
vahnau taM munivaramaNDale juhUShau |
rundhAne kamalabhave krato: samAptau
sAkShAttvaM madhuripumaikShathA: svayaM svam ||8||

devendraM muhu:-iti
Indra again and again thus
vAjinaM harantaM
who was stealing the horse
vahnau taM
in the fire, him
munivara-maNDale juhUShau
when the sages were about to offer as oblation
rundhAne kamalabhave
prevented by Brahma
krato: samAptau
at the end of the Yanjya
sAkShAt-tvaM
Thou in front of Thee (Prithu)
madhuripum-aikShathA:
saw Madhuripu (Maha Vishnu)
svayaM svam
Thyself Thou
---------
Indra who was again and again trying to steal the sacrificial horse, was about to be offered into the fire by the sacrificing sages, but they were restrained to do so by Brahmaa. When the sacrifice was completed Thou as Prithu saw Thyself manifested in Thy real form as Vishnu, the slayer of the demon Madhu.

taddattaM varamupalabhya bhaktimekAM
ga~NgAnte vihitapada: kadApi deva |
satrasthaM muninivahaM hitAni shaMsa-
nnaikShiShThA: sanakamukhAn munIn purastAt ||9||
---------
tat-dattaM varam-upalabhya
getting a boon given by Him
bhaktim-ekAM
firm devotion
ga~NgA-ante vihita-pada: kadApi
on the banks of Gangaa having established residence, once
deva
O Lord!
satrasthaM muni-nivahaM
to the group of sages who were doing Yanjya
hitAni shaMsan-
preaching spiritual welfare
aikShiShThA:
(Thou as Prithu) saw
sanaka-mukhAn munIn purastAt
the sages Sanaka and others in front

O Lord! After getting firm devotion alone as a boon from Him (Vishnu), Thou established Thy residence on the banks of Gangaa. Once as Thou were expounding Dharma to the sages who had assembled there for Yanjya, Thou saw the Sanaka and other sages before Thee.
---------
vij~nAnaM sanakamukhoditaM dadhAna:
svAtmAnaM svayamagamo vanAntasevI |
tattAdRRikpRRithuvapurIsha satvaraM me
rogaughaM prashamaya vAtagehavAsin ||10||

vij~nAnaM
the (ultimate) knowledge
sanaka-mukha-uditaM
imparted by Sanaka and the other sages
dadhAna:
receiving
sva-AtmAnaM svayam-agama:
Thou attained Thy own self
vana-anta-sevI
living in the forest
tat-tAdRRik-pRRithu-vapu:-Isha
O Lord! Of such nature embodied as Prithu!
satvaraM me
hastily my
rogaughaM
all ailments
prashamaya
eradicate
vAtagehavAsin
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
---------
Receiving the ultimate knowledge imparted by Sanaka and other sages, and living in the forest, Thou realised Thy own self. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Who embodied Thyself as Prithu! Be pleased to quickly cure me of all my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D019

Dashaka 19
---------
pRRithostu naptA pRRithudharmakarmaTha:
prAchInabarhiryuvatau shatadrutau |
prachetaso nAma suchetasa: sutA-
najIjanattvatkaruNA~NkurAniva ||1||
---------
pRRitho:-tu naptA
Prithu's great grand son
pRRithu-dharma-karmaTha:
intensely performing righteous deeds
prAchInabarhi:-
named Praacheenbarhi
yuvatau shatadrutau
through young Shatadruti
prachetasa: nAma
by the name of Prachetas
suchetasa: sutAn-
pure minded sons (ten)
ajIjanat-
gave birth to
tvat-karuNA-a~NkurAn-iva
like sprouts of Thy compassion embodied

Prithu's great grand son Praacheenbarhis, who was reputed for his undertakings for the good of the world had the young lady Shatadruti for his wife. From her, as though sprouts of Thy compassion ,ten noble minded sons were born to him known by the group name of Prachetas.
---------
pitu: sisRRikShAniratasya shAsanAd-
bhavattapasyAbhiratA dashApi te
payonidhiM pashchimametya tattaTe
sarovaraM sandadRRishurmanoharam ||2||

pitu: sisRRikShA-niratasya
the father who was intent on creation
shAsanAt-
by his direction
bhavat-tapasyA-abhiratA dasha-api te
those ten engrossed upon meditating on Thee
payonidhiM pashchimam-etya
going to the western sea
tat-taTe sarovaraM sandadRRishu:-
on its shore saw a lake
manoharaM
beautiful
---------
Commanded by their father to multiply the species, these ten brothers, being firm believers in the importance of Thy worship, went to the western sea to meditate. On the shore of that sea they saw a beautiful lake.

tadA bhavattIrthamidaM samAgato
bhavo bhavatsevakadarshanAdRRita: |
prakAshamAsAdya pura: prachetasA-
mupAdishat bhaktatamastava stavam ||3||
---------
tadA bhavat-tIrtham-idam
then this Thy holy lake
samAgata: bhava:
frequented by Shiva
bhavat-sevaka-darshana-AdRRita:
eager to see Thy devotees
prakAsham-AsAdya
manifested himself
pura: prachetasAm-
before the Prachetas
upAdishat
and taught
bhaktatama:-
(himself) a great devotee to (Thee)
tava stavaM
Thy great hymn

Then, Thy greatest devotee, Lord Shiva who is always eager to see Thy devotees, came to this holy lake of Thine and appearing before the Prachetaas, taught them a great hymn in praise of Thee.
---------
stavaM japantastamamI jalAntare
bhavantamAseviShatAyutaM samA: |
bhavatsukhAsvAdarasAdamIShviyAn
babhUva kAlo dhruvavanna shIghratA ||4||

stavaM japanta:-tam-amI
that hymn singing, these (Prachetaas)
jala-antare
in the water
bhavantam-AseviShata-
on Thee meditated
ayutaM samA:
for ten thousand years
bhavat-sukha-AsvAd-rasAt-
because of the joy they were experiencing in meditating on Thee
amIShu-
for them
iyAn babhUva kAla:
such a long time passed
dhruvavat-na shIghratA
like Dhruva it did not happen quickly
---------
These devotees chanting the hymn, spent ten thousand years in water, in Thy worship and meditation on Thee. For the attainment of the bliss of Thy realisation, they had to spend this long period in austerities unlike Dhruva who got it very quickly.

tapobhireShAmatimAtravardhibhi:
sa yaj~nahiMsAnirato.api pAvita: |
pitA.api teShAM gRRihayAtanArada-
pradarshitAtmA bhavadAtmatAM yayau ||5||
---------
tapobhi:-eShAm-
by their penance
ati-mAtra-vardhibhi:
which was increasing in intensity
sa yaj~na-hiMsA-nirata:-api
he, though engaged in killing animals for the sacrifices
pAvita:
became purified
pitA-api teShAM
(he) their father
gRRihayAta-nArada-
(to whose) house Naarada went
pradarshita-AtmA
(from Naarada) obtaining the knowledge of Aatman
bhavat-AtmatAM yayau
attained to Thee

By the increasing strength of their penance, their father Praacheenbarhis also became purified who had slain many animals in the sacrificial fires. Naarada who had gone to his house, gave him the knowledge of Aatman by which he attained a form like Thine.
---------
kRRipAbalenaiva pura: prachetasAM
prakAshamAgA: patagendravAhana: |
virAji chakrAdivarAyudhAMshubhi-
rbhujAbhiraShTAbhiruda~nchitadyuti: ||6||

kRRipA-balena-eva
by Thy compassion alone
pura: prachetasAM
before the Prachetas
prakAsham-AgA:
Thou manifested Thyself
patagendra-vAhana:
having Garuda as vehicle
virAji chakra-Adi-vara-Ayudha-aMshubhi:-
lustrous by the resplendent discus and other divine weapons
bhujAbhi:-aShTAbhi:-
glorious with eight arms
uda~nchita-dyuti:
spreading lustre
---------
By virtue of Thy compassion alone, Thou appeared before the Prachetas. Thou were seated on Thy vehicle Garuda, having eight arms, holding the resplendent discus and other divine weapons and spreading lustre all around.

prachetasAM tAvadayAchatAmapi
tvameva kAruNyabharAdvarAnadA: |
bhavadvichintA.api shivAya dehinAM
bhavatvasau rudranutishcha kAmadA ||7||
---------
prachetasAM tAvat-
to the Prachetas, then
ayAchatAm-api
though unsought for
tvam-eva kAruNya-bharAt-
Thou Thyself out of infinite compassion
varAn-adA:
gave boons
bhavat-vichintA-api
even the thought of Thee
shivAya dehinAM bhavatu-
may be for the benefit of the humans
asau rudranuti:-cha
this Rudra hymn also
kAmadA (bhavatu)
may be a fulfiller of desires

Out of Thy infinite compassion, Thou gave the Prachetas boons,even without their asking. May even Thy thought be for the benefit of the humans and confer welfare on them, and may the Rudra hymn be the fulfiller of all desires.
---------
avApya kAntAM tanayAM mahIruhAM
tayA ramadhvaM dashalakShavatsarIm |
suto.astu dakSho nanu tatkShaNAchcha mAM
prayAsyatheti nyagado mudaiva tAn ||8||

avApya kAntAM
getting as wife
tanayAM mahIruhAM
the daughter of the trees
tayA ramadhvaM
with her enjoy
dashalakSha-vatsarIm
for ten lakhs of years
suta:-astu dakSha:
may you have a son named Daksha
nanu tat-kShaNAt-
immediately then
cha mAM prayAsyatha-iti
attain me also, thus
nyagada:
saying so
mudA-eva tAn
pleasingly to them
---------
Being highly pleased with the Prachetas Thou blessed them that they would get the daughter of the trees as their wife. They would lead a happy life with her for ten lakh of years. Also that they would have a son named Daksha and soon thereafter they would attain Thee.

tatashcha te bhUtalarodhinastarUn
krudhA dahanto druhiNena vAritA: |
drumaishcha dattAM tanayAmavApya tAM
tvaduktakAlaM sukhino.abhiremire ||9||
---------
tata:-cha te
then they (the trees)
bhU-tala-rodhina:-tarUn
which were covering the whole surface of the earth, the trees,
krudhA dahanta:
burning (the trees) in anger
druhiNena vAritA:
were stopped by Brahmaa
drumai:-cha dattAM tanayAm-
the trees gave their daughter
avApya tAM
(they) getting her
tvat-ukta-kAlaM
for the duration mentioned by Thee
sukhina:-abhiremire
they lived happily

Then the Prachetas who were angered by the dense growth of the trees which were covering the surface of the whole earth and causing obstruction, started to burn them. They were dissuaded by Brahmaa to do so. Obligingly the trees gave them their daughter in marriage and they lived with her happily for the time specified by Thee.
---------
avApya dakShaM cha sutaM kRRitAdhvarA:
prachetaso nAradalabdhayA dhiyA |
avApurAnandapadaM tathAvidha-
stvamIsha vAtAlayanAtha pAhi mAm ||10||

avApya dakShaM cha sutaM
and getting the son named Daksha
kRRita-adhvarA:
(and) having performed Brahma Satra
prachetasa:
the Prachetas
nArada-labdhayA dhiyA
with the knowledge received from Naarada
avApu:-Ananda-padaM
attained the state of bliss
tathA-bidha:-tvam-
Thou who are thus
Isha
O Lord!
vAtAlayanAtha
Lord of Guruvaayur!
pAhi mAm
protect me.
---------
After begetting the son Daksha and performing several sacrificial rites and having received the highest knowledge from Naarada they attained liberation. O Lord! O Lord of Guruvaayur! Who are of such merciful nature, grant protection to me.

Narayaneeyam D020

Dashaka 20
---------
priyavratasya priyaputrabhUtA-
dAgnIdhrarAjAdudito hi nAbhi: |
tvAM dRRiShTavAniShTadamiShTimadhye
tavaiva tuShTyai kRRitayaj~nakarmA ||1||
---------
priyavratasya
of Priyavrata
priyaputrabhUtAt-AgnIdhra-rAjAt-
from the dear son king Aagnidhra
udita: hi nAbhi:
was born Naabhi, indeed,
tvAM dRRiShTavAn-iShTadam-
(he) saw Thee the fulfiller of desire
iShTi-madhye
during the Yanjya
tava-eva tuShTyai
for propitiating Thee alone
kRRita-yaj~na-karmA
(who) had performed a Yanjya

King Priyavrata had a dear son named Asgnidhra king, of whom Naabhi was born. While Naabhi was performing a Yanjya, for propitiating Thee, he had a vision of Thee, the bestower of desired boons to devotees.
---------
abhiShTutastatra munIshvaraistvaM
rAj~na: svatulyaM sutamarthyamAna: |
svayaM janiShye.ahamiti bruvANa-
stirodadhA barhiShi vishvamUrte ||2||

abhiShTuta:-tatra
being praised there (in the yanjya)
munIshvarai:-tvaM
by the great sages Thou
rAj~na: svatulyaM sutam-
for the king a son like Thee
arthyamAna:
being prayed for
svayaM janiShye-aham-
I shall Myself be born
iti bruvANa:-
saying thus
tirodadhA barhiShi
(Thou) disappeared in the sacrificial fire
vishvamUrte
O Lord! With the cosmos as Thy form
---------
O Lord of the whole universe! The sages sang Thy praises and the king prayed to Thee for a son like Thyself. Thou then declared that Thou would Thyself be born as his son and then Thou disappeared in the sacrificial fire.

nAbhipriyAyAmatha merudevyAM
tvamaMshato.abhU: RRIShabhAbhidhAna: |
alokasAmAnyaguNaprabhAva-
prabhAvitAsheShajanapramoda: ||3||
---------
nAbhi-priyAyAm-atha
to Naabhi's dear wife, then
merudevyAM
named Merudevi
tvam-aMshata:-abhU:
Thou as a part incarnation were born
RRIShabha-abhidhAna:
with the name Rishabha
aloka-sAmAnya-guNa-prabhAva
endowed with sublime and rare virtues
prabhAvita-asheSha-jana-pramoda:
causing to countless people great delight (with Thy glory)

Then Thou were born as a part incarnation with the name Rishabha to Merudevi the wife of Naabhi. Thou delighted everyone with sublime virtues and glory not commonly seen in the world.
---------
tvayi trilokIbhRRiti rAjyabhAraM
nidhAya nAbhi: saha merudevyA |
tapovanaM prApya bhavanniShevI
gata: kilAnandapadaM padaM te ||4||

tvayi trilokIbhRRiti
On Thee, the ruler of the three worlds
rAjya-bhAraM nidhAya
transferring the responsibility of governance
nAbhi: saha merudevyA
Naabhi along with Merudevi
tapovanaM prApya
reaching the forest
bhavat-niShevI
and worshipping Thee
gata: kila-AnandapadaM
indeed attained the state of bliss
padaM te
abode of Thine
---------
Naabhi entrusted the administration of the kingdom to Thee, who are the ruler of the three worlds and went away to the forest with his wife Merudevi to lead an ascetic life. Worshipping Thee there, he attained to Thy state of Supreme Bliss.

indrastvadutkarShakRRitAdamarShA-
dvavarSha nAsminnajanAbhavarShe |
yadA tadA tvaM nijayogashaktyA
svavarShamenadvyadadhA: suvarSham ||5||
---------
indra:-tvat-utkarShakRRitAt-
Indra by Thy achievements
amarShAt
out of jealousy
vavarSha na-asmin-
did not shower rain on this
ajanAbhavarShe
(land) Ajanaabh-varsha
yadA tadA tvaM
when (this happened) then Thou
nija-yoga-shaktyA
by Thy yogic power
sva-varSham-enat-
on Thy own kingdom brought
vyadadhA: suvarSham
abundant rainfall

Owing to jealousy at the prosperity of the world generated by Thy (Rishabha's) greatness, Indra withheld rain from the continent Ajanaabha. Thereupon Thou by Thy yogic power brought enough rain on this Thy continent.
---------
jitendradattAM kamanIM jayantI-
mathodvahannAtmaratAshayo.api |
ajIjanastatra shataM tanUjA-
neShAM kShitIsho bharato.agrajanmA ||6||

jitendra-dattAM
given by Indra
kamanIM jayantIm-
beautiful Jayanti
atha-udvahan-
then marrying
Atmarata-Ashaya:-api
even though ever absorbed in Brahman
ajIjana:-tatra shataM tanUjAn-
(he) begot hundred sons
eShAM kShitIsha: bharata:-
among them, king Bharat
agra-janmA
was the eldest
---------
Thus defeated, Indra bestowed beautiful Jayanti on Thee as Thy wife. Though Thou were ever absorbed in the Aatman, Thou begot in her one hundred sons, the eldest of whom was king Bharat.

navAbhavan yogivarA navAnye
tvapAlayan bhAratavarShakhaNDAn |
saikA tvashItistava sheShaputra-
stapobalAt bhUsurabhUyamIyu: ||7||
---------
nava-abhavan yogivarA:
nine of them became great yogis
nava-anye-tu-
another nine indeed
apAlayan bhAratavarShakhaNDAn
ruled over the various regions of Bharatavarsha
saikA tu-ashIti:-
one and eighty however
tava sheSha putra:-
Thy remaining sons
tapobalAt
by the power of their austerities
bhUsurabhUyam-Iyu:
attained Braahminhood

Nine of them became great yogis, and another nine ruled over the various regions of Bhaaaratavarsha. Thy remaining eighty-one sons attained Braahminhood by the power of their austerities.
---------
uktvA sutebhyo.atha munIndramadhye
viraktibhaktyanvitamuktimArgam |
svayaM gata: pAramahaMsyavRRitti-
madhA jaDonmattapishAchacharyAm ||8||

uktvA sutebhya:-atha
instructing the sons then
munIndra-madhye
in the midst of great sages
virakti-bhakti-anvita-
comprising of renunciation and devotion
mukti-mArgam
the path of liberation
svayaM gata:
Thyself went (took to)
pAramahaMsyavRRittim-
the way of the life of Paramahansas
adhA:
adopting
jaDa-unmatta-pishAcha-charyAm
the behaviour of idiots lunatics and ghosts
---------
Afterwards Thou instructed Thy sons along with the great ascetics in the path of salvation through renunciation and devotion. Then adopting the life of a total renunciate Thou moved about behaving like an idiot, a mad man or a ghost.

parAtmabhUto.api paropadeshaM
kurvan bhavAn sarvanirasyamAna: |
vikArahIno vichachAra kRRitsnAM
mahImahInAtmarasAbhilIna: ||9||
---------
parAtmabhUta:-api
though one with the Supreme Aatman
para-upadeshaM kurvan
giving instructions to others
bhavAn sarva-nirasya-mAna:
Thou being insulted by others
vikAra-hIna:
free from attachment (or aversion)
vichachAra
wondered
kRRitsnAM mahIm-
all over the earth
ahIna-Atmarasa-abhilIna:
completely absorbed in the bliss of the Supreme Self

Though Thou had attained complete identity with the Brahman, Thou continued to impart knowledge to others. Thou were free from attachment and aversion, though Thou were treated with indifference.Thou wandered all over the earth completely absorbed in the bliss of the Supreme self.
---------
shayuvrataM gomRRigakAkacharyAM
chiraM charannApya paraM svarUpaM |
davAhRRitA~Nga: kuTakAchale tvaM
tApAn mamApAkuru vAtanAtha ||10||

shayu-vratam
the way of the life of the python
go-mRRiga-kAka-charyAm
and the ways of the cow, dear and crow
chiraM charan-
practising for a long time
Apya paraM svarUpaM
attaining oneness with the Supreme Brahman
davA-hRRita-a~Nga:
with body perishing in the forest fire
kuTakAchale tvaM
in the Coorg mountains, Thou
tApAn mama-apAkuru
ailments of mine do destroy
vAtanAtha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
---------
Observing the ways of the life of a python, a cow, a deer, and a crow, Thou wandered about for long, attaining identity with the Supreme Brahman. Thy body then perished in the forest fire in the Coorg mountains. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Deign to eradicate my afflictions.

Narayaneeyam D021

Dashaka 21
---------
madhyodbhave bhuva ilAvRRitanAmni varShe
gaurIpradhAnavanitAjanamAtrabhAji |
sharveNa mantranutibhi: samupAsyamAnaM
sa~NkarShaNAtmakamadhIshvara saMshraye tvAm ||1||
---------
madhya-udbhave bhuva:
in the middle of the earth
ilAvRRita-nAmni varShe
in the region called Ilaavrata
gaurI-pradhAna-vanitAjana-mAtra-bhAji
Gauri as their chief, inhabited solely by women
sharveNa
by Lord Shiva (as Ardhnaareeshwara)
mantra-nutibhi:
by mantras and hymns
samupAsyamAnaM
(Thou) being worshipped
sa~NkarShaNa-Atmakam-
in the form of Sankarshana
adhIshvara
O Almighty Lord!
saMshraye
(I) seek refuge (in)
tvAm
Thee

In the middle of the earth is the region called Ilaavrata which is inhabited exclusively by women with Gauri as their chief. I seek refuge in Thee O Lord! Who are present there as Sankarshana and are worshipped with holy chants by Sharva (Shiva) in his 'man-woman' form known as Ardhanaareeshwara.
---------
bhadrAshvanAmaka ilAvRRitapUrvavarShe
bhadrashravobhi: RRiShibhi: pariNUyamAnam |
kalpAntagUDhanigamoddharaNapravINaM
dhyAyAmi deva hayashIrShatanuM bhavantam ||2||

bhadrAshva-nAmaka
(known) by rhe name Bhadraashva
ilAvRRita-pUrva-varShe
in the region east of Ilaavrata
bhadrashravobhi: RRiShibhi:
(where) by the Rishis known as Bhadraashwaras
pariNUyamAnam
praised (Thou)
kalpAnta-gUDha-nigama-uddharaNa-pravINaM
at the end of the Kalpa, (which were) lost, the Vedas, in restoring, who is expert, (Thou),
dhyAyAmi
I meditate on (Thee)
deva
O Lord!
hayashIrSha-tanuM bhavantam
Thou who has taken the form of Hayagreeva
---------
In the region known as Bhadraashva, situated to the east of Ilaavrata, O Lord! Thou resides as Hayagreeva. I meditate on this horse-necked form of Thine which is famed as the restorer of the Vedas lost in the deluge at the end of the cosmic cycle. This Hayagreeva form of Thine is worshipped by the Rishis Bhadraashwara with hymns of praises.

dhyAyAmi dakShiNagate harivarShavarShe
prahlAdamukhyapuruShai: pariShevyamANam |
uttu~NgashAntadhavalAkRRitimekashuddha-
j~nAnapradaM narahariM bhagavan bhavantam ||3||
---------
dhyAyAmi
I meditate (on Thee)
dakShiNagate harivarShavarShe
towards the south (of Ilaavrata) in Harivarsha
prahlAda-mukhya-puruShai:
by Prahlaad and other leading people
pariShevyamANam
(being) worshipped
uttu~Nga-dhavala-AkRRitim-
(as one) who is very tall, calm and white in color
ekashuddha-j~nAna-pradam
who bestows the highest pure knowledge
narahariM
in the form of Narahari
bhagavan
O Lord!
bhavantaM
Thee (I meditate on)

To the south of Ilaavrata is Harivarsha. There Thou are worshipped by Prahlaad and other leading devotees as Narahari, whose body is tall and white and who is calm and bestows the knowledge of Supreme Brahman. O Lord! I meditate on that form of Thee.
---------
varShe pratIchi lalitAtmani ketumAle
lIlAvisheShalalitasmitashobhanA~Ngam |
lakShmyA prajApatisutaishcha niShevyamANaM
tasyA: priyAya dhRRitakAmatanuM bhaje tvAm ||4||

varShe pratIchi
in the region to the west of Ilaavrata
lalita-Atmani
in the very beautiful
ketumAle
Ketumaala
lIlA-visheSha-lalita-smita-shobhana-a~Ngam
with a divine sporting and charming smile, having a resplendent form (Thou)
lakShmyA
by Lakshmi
prajApatisutai: cha
and by the sons of Prajaapati
niShevyamANam
worshipped
tasyA: priyAya
for her pleasure
dhRRita-kAma-tanum
taking the form of Kaamadeva
bhaje tvAm
I worship Thee
---------
To the west of Ilaavrata, in the beautiful region of Ketumaalaa, Thou resides as Kaamadeva, for the pleasure of Lakshmi. Thy form is resplendent with a divine sportive and charming smile. Thou are worshipped by Lakshmi and the sons of Prajaapati. I worship Thee.

ramye hyudIchi khalu ramyakanAmni varShe
tadvarShanAthamanuvaryasaparyamANam |
bhaktaikavatsalamamatsarahRRitsu bhAntaM
matsyAkRRitiM bhuvananAtha bhaje bhavantam ||5||
---------
ramye hi udIchi khalu
In the beautiful (region) to the north of Ilaavrata
ramyaka-nAmni varShe
in the region called Ramyak
tat-varSha-nAtha-manuvarya-
by that region's ruler, Manu
saparyamANam
(Thou) being worshipped
bhakta-eka-vatsalam-
(Thou) who is benevolent to His devotees
amatsara-hRRitsu bhantaM
in the hearts of all pure hearted people (thou) who shines,
matsya-AkRRitiM
in a fish form
bhuvananAtha
O Lord of the Universe!
bhaje bhavantaM
I worship Thee

In the beautiful region of Ramyak to the north of Ilaavrata whose ruler Vaivaswata Manu worships Thee in Thy form of a fish. Thou who are very benevolent to Thy devotees and who shine in the hearts of those who are free from attachments, I worship Thee in the form of the fish.
---------
varShaM hiraNmayasamAhvayamauttarAha-
mAsInamadridhRRitikarmaThakAmaThA~Ngam |
saMsevate pitRRigaNapravaro.aryamA yaM
taM tvAM bhajAmi bhagavan parachinmayAtman ||6||

varShaM
the region
hiraNmaya-samAhvayam-
Hiranmaya', known as
auttarAham-
to the north (of Ramyak)
AsInam-
residing there
adri-dhRRiti-karmaTha-kAmaTha-a~Ngam
the mountain (Mandaar) bearing, capable of, in the form of the tortoise, on the back
saMsevate
who is worshipped by
pitRRigaNa-pravara:-aryamA
the chief of the Pitriganas, Aryamaa,
yaM taM tvAM
Which,That Thee
bhajAmi bhagavan
I worship O Lord!
parachinmaya-Atman
O Supreme Light of Consciousness!
---------
The region called Hiranmaya which is to the north of Ramyak, Thou reside there in the form of the huge tortoise that could bear the Mandara mountain on its back. There Thou are worshipped by Aryamaa the famous chief of the Pitris. O Lord! O Supreme Pure Consciousness! I worship Thy that form.

ki~nchottareShu kuruShu priyayA dharaNyA
saMsevito mahitamantranutiprabhedai: |
daMShTrAgraghRRiShTaghanapRRiShThagariShThavarShmA
tvaM pAhi bij~nanuta yaj~navarAhamUrte ||7||
---------
kim-cha
further
uttareShu
to the north (of Hiranmaya)
kuruShu
(in the region known as) in Kuru
priyayA dharaNyA
by Thy consort the Earth
saMsevita:
well worshipped
mahita-mantra-nuti-prabhedai:
by various great mantras and hymns
daMShTra-agra-ghRRiShTa-ghana-pRRiShTha-gariShShTha-varShmA
(Thou whose) tusks' ends touched the clouds with such a huge body
tvaM pAhi
Thou protect me
vij~na-nuta yaj~na-varAha-mUrte
by the enlightened ones adored, (O Thou) in the form of the Yanjya Varaaha

To the north of Hiranmaya, Thou are worshipped by Thy dear consort the Earth, with the utterances of holy Mantras and hymns of praise. Thou are adored by the wise in the form of Yanjya Varaaha (the divine boar) whose gigantic body rose so high that the tusks' edges rubbed against the clouds. Do protect Thy devotees.
---------
yAmyAM dishaM bhajati kiMpuruShAkhyavarShe
saMsevito hanumatA dRRiDhabhaktibhAjA |
sItAbhirAmaparamAdbhutarUpashAlI
rAmAtmaka: parilasan paripAhi viShNo ||8||

yAmyAM dishaM bhajati
situated to the south (of Ilaavrata)
kiMpuruSha-Akhya-varShe
'Kimpurusha', known as, in that region
saMsevita:
worshipped
hanumatA
by Hanumaan
dRRiDha-bhaktibhAjA
who has firm devotion to Thee
sItA-abhirAma-parama-adbhuta-rUpa-shAlI
(and) Sita is captivated by (Thy) form which is most wonderful and resplendent
ramAtmaka: parilasan
as Raama shining
paripAhi
do protect
viShNo
O Lord! Vishnu!
---------
Towards the south of Ilaavrata, residing in the region known as Kimpurusha, Thou are worshipped by Hanumaan with firm and unwavering devotion. O Lord Vishnu! Thou as Raama do shine with a wonderful and resplendent form form that captivates Sita and is made more charming by her presence. Do protect us, O Vishnu!

shrInAradena saha bhAratakhaNDamukhyai-
stvaM sA~Nkhyayoganutibhi: samupAsyamAna: |
AkalpakAlamiha sAdhujanAbhirakShI
nArAyaNo narasakha: paripAhi bhUman ||9||
---------
shrI-nAradena saha
along with Shree Naarada
bhArata-khaNDa-mukhyai:-
by the foremost (devotees) of Bhaaratavarsha
tvaM
Thou
sAMkhya-yoga-nutibhi:
with the hymns based on Saankhya and Yoga systems
samupAsyamAna:
well meditated upon
Akalpa-kAlam-iha
till Pralaya time, here (in Bhaaratavarsha)
sAdhujana-abhirakShI
the virtuous protecting,
nArAyaNa: narasakha:
(Thou) Naaraayana (who has) and Nara as companion
paripAhi
do protect
bhUman
O Lord of the Universe!

Along with Naarada, by the leading devotees of Bhaarata region Thou are meditated upon and praised with hymns based on Saankhya and Yoga. In Bhaaratavarsha as Naaraayana with Nara as companion, Thou do reside till Pralaya (deluge) time,for the protection of the virtuous. Deign to protect all devotees.
---------
plAkShe.arkarUpamayi shAlmala indurUpaM
dvIpe bhajanti kushanAmani vahnirUpam |
krau~nche.amburUpamatha vAyumayaM cha shAke
tvAM brahmarUpamapi puShkaranAmni lokA: ||10||

plAkShe-arka-rUpam-
in Plaaksha, in the form of the Sun
ayi
O Thou!
shAlmale indurUpaM
in Shaalmala, in the form of the moon
dvIpe bhajanti kusha-nAmani
in the island named Kusha, people worship,
vahni-rUpam
(Thee) in the form of Fire
krau~nche-ambu-rUpam-
in Kraunch as water
atha vAyu-mayaM cha shAke
and then as wind in Shaaka
tvAM brahma-rUpam-api
Thee also in the form of Brahmaa
puShkara-nAmni lokA:
in (the place) called Pushkara by people (are worshipped)
---------
O Lord! Thou are worshipped by the people in the form of the sun in Plaaksha, as the Moon in Shaalmala, as fire in Kushadveep, as water in Kraunch, as wind in Shaaka and as Brahmaa in the place named Pushkara.

sarvairdhruvAdibhiruDuprakarairgrahaishcha
puchChAdikeShvavayaveShvabhikalpyamAnai: |
tvaM shiMshumAravapuShA mahatAmupAsya:
sandhyAsu rundhi narakaM mama sindhushAyin ||11||
---------
sarbai:-dhruva-Adibhi:-uDuprakarai:-
by all, Dhruva etc., the groups of stars
grahai:-cha
and by the planets
puchCha-AdikeShu avayaveShu-
as tail etc., in the limbs
abhikalpyamAnai:
imagined
tvaM shiMshumAra-vapuShA
Thou, the great Fish Sinshumaar bodied
mahatAm-upAsya:
by the enlightened meditated upon
sandhyAsu
at the (three) Sandhyaas
rundhi narakaM mama
eradicate hell (sufferings) of mine
sindhushAyin
O Resident of the Milk Ocean

Dhruva - the Pole star, and all the groups of stars and planets who are imagined as forming the limbs and tail of the great Fish Shinshumaar, in that form , Thou are meditated upon by the enlightened ones, at the three Sandhyaas. O Lord! Reposing on the Milk Ocean! deign to eradicate my suffering and my sins.
---------
pAtAlamUlabhuvi sheShatanuM bhavantaM
lolaikakuNDalavirAjisahasrashIrSham |
nIlAmbaraM dhRRitahalaM bhujagA~NganAbhi-
rjuShTaM bhaje hara gadAn gurugehanAtha ||12||

pAtAla-mUla-bhuvi
of Paataala's bottom surface
sheSha-tanuM bhavantaM
in Aadishesha's form, Thee
lola-aika-kuNDala-virAji-sahasra-shIrSham
(weith)dangling one earring and shining in the thousand heads
nIlAmbaraM
wearring a blue garment
dhRRita-halaM
armed with a plough
bhujaga-a~NganAbhi:-juShTaM
by serpent women worshipped
bhaje
I adore
sheShatanuM bhavantaM
the Aadishesha bodied Thee
hara gadAn
eradicate my ailments
gurugehanAtha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
---------
I worship Thee as Aadishesha the great serpent. Thou residing at the bottom of Paataal, having a thousand heads, which shine with a single ever quivering earing, wearing a blue garment, and having a plough as weapon, are worshipped by Naaga (serpent) damsels. May Thou O Lord of Guruvaayur be pleased to relieve me of my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D022

Dashaka 22
---------
ajAmilo nAma mahIsura: purA
charan vibho dharmapathAn gRRihAshramI |
gurorgirA kAnanametya dRRiShTavAn
sudhRRiShTashIlAM kulaTAM madAkulAm ||1||
---------
ajAmila: nAma mahIsura:
The Braahmin by the name Ajaamil
purA
long ago
charan vibho dharmapathAn
O Lord! Who was leading a righteous life
gRRihAshramI
(and) who was a householder
guro:-girA
at the request of his father
kAnanam-etya
going to the forest
dRRiShTavAn
saw
sudhRRiShTshIlAm
an immodest
kulaTAm
(and) immoral woman
madAkulAm
given to drinking

O Lord! Long ago there was a Braahmin householder named Ajaamil who led a virtuous life. He went to the forest (for collecting sacrificial fuel) at his father's request. There he met an immoral, immodest woman who was given to drinking.
---------
svata: prashAnto.api tadAhRRitAshaya:
svadharmamutsRRijya tayA samAraman |
adharmakArI dashamI bhavan puna-
rdadhau bhavannAmayute sute ratim ||2||

svata: prashAnta:-api
self controlled, though
tat-AhRRita-Ashaya:
his mind being attracted by her
sva-dharmam-utsRRijya
all his duties, giving up
tayA samAraman
her (company) enjoying
adharmakArI
unrighteous
dashamI bhavan puna:-
very old becoming, then
dadhau
gave
bhavat-nAma-yute sute
who bore Thy name, to his son
ratim
attachment
---------
Though by nature a man of self control his mind was attracted to her. He gave up all his duties and revelling in her company led a sinful life. As he became old, he became very much attached to his son who bore Thy name - Naaraayana.

sa mRRityukAle yamarAjaki~NkarAn
bhaya~NkarAMstrInabhilakShayan bhiyA |
purA manAk tvatsmRRitivAsanAbalAt
juhAva nArAyaNanAmakaM sutam ||3||
---------
sa mRRityukAle
he, at death time
yamarAja-ki~NkarAn
the death god's messengers
bhaya~NkarAn-trIn-
very fierce, three (of them)
abhilakShayan
seeing (before him)
bhiyA
in fear
purA manAk
long ago, certainly
tvat-smRRiti-vAsanA-balAt
a (faint) memory of Thee, by its (Thy memory's) strength
juhAva
called
nArAyaNa-nAmakaM sutam
Naaraayana named his son

At the time of death, he saw before him three fierce looking emissaries of Yama - the god of death. He called out in fright the name of his son Naaraayana, induced by the strength of the memory of his past devotion to Thee.
---------
durAshayasyApi tadAtvanirgata-
tvadIyanAmAkSharamAtravaibhavAt |
puro.abhipeturbhavadIyapArShadA:
chaturbhujA: pItapaTA manoramA: ||4||

durAshayasya-api tadA-tu
then even though he was evil minded
anirgata tvadIya-
emerging, of Thy
nAma-akShara-mAtra-vaibhavAt
name's letters,solely by, its glory
pura:-abhipetu:-
before him appeared
bhavadIya pArShadA:
Thy emissaries
chaturbhujA: pItapaTA: manoramA:
having four arms, wearing yellow garments with lovely appearance
---------
In spite of his evil nature, by the glory of the letters of Thy name uttered by him, there appeared before him, Thy emissaries.They had four arms and were wearing yellow robes and were of enchanting appearance.

amuM cha saMpAshya vikarShato bhaTAn
vimu~nchatetyArurudhurbalAdamI |
nivAritAste cha bhavajjanaistadA
tadIyapApaM nikhilaM nyavedayan ||5||
---------
amuM cha saMpAshya
him (Ajaamila) tying up with ropes
vikarShata: bhaTAn
(and) dragging, to the messengers (of Yama)
vimu~nchata-iti-
"Release him" thus (saying)
Arurudhu:-balAt-amI
(were) stopped by force, they
nivAritA:-te cha bhavat-janai:-
and were obstructed by Thy emissaries
tadA tadIya-pApaM nikhilaM
then, all his sins
nyavedayan
(they) narrated

Seeing Ajaamil tied up with ropes and being dragged by the messengers of Yama, they were obstructed by Thy emissaries by force and were stopped to do so. Then the emissaries of Yama narrate all his sins.
---------
bhavantu pApAni kathaM tu niShkRRite
kRRite.api bho daNDanamasti paNDitA: |
na niShkRRiti: kiM viditA bhavAdRRishA-
miti prabho tvatpuruShA babhAShire ||6||

bhavantu pApAni
let there be sins
kathaM tu
how is it
niShkRRite kRRite-api
atonements have been made even
bho daNDanam-asti paNDitA:
are there punishments, O Learned Ones!
na niShkRRiti kiM viditA
is atonement not known
bhavadRRishAm-iti
to persons like you? Thus
prabho
O Lord
tvat-puruShA babhAShire
Thy emissaries spoke
---------
O Lord! Thy emissaries told them that even if there were sins, how was it that there was punishment when atonement had been made. Did people like them who were learned, not know what atonement was?

shrutismRRitibhyAM vihitA vratAdaya:
punanti pApaM na lunanti vAsanAm |
anantasevA tu nikRRintati dvayI-
miti prabho tvatpuruShA babhAShire ||7||
---------
shruti-smRRitibhyAM
in the Srutis and Smritis
vihitA: vratAdaya:
are laid down, the vows etc.,
punanti pApaM
cleanse one of sins
na lunanti vAsanAM
but do not destroy the tendency
ananta-sevA tu
service to the Lord however,
nikRRintati dvayIm-iti
destroys both, thus
prabho
O Lord!
tvat-puruShA babhAShire
Thy emissaries did speak

O Lord! Thy emissaries told them that in the Srutis and Smritis as per the vows which are laid down, they absolve a person from sins, but do not curb the sinful tendency. Whereas, the service of the Lord! Destroys both - the sins and the sinful tendencies.
---------
anena bho janmasahasrakoTibhi:
kRRiteShu pApeShvapi niShkRRiti: kRRitA |
yadagrahInnAma bhayAkulo hare-
riti prabho tvatpuruShA babhAShire ||8||

anena bho
by him (Ajaamil) O! You (messengers of Yama)
janma-sahasra-koTibhi:
in innumerable lives
kRRiteShu pApeShu-api
if he has committed sins also
niShkRRiti: kRRitA
atonement has been made
yat-agrahIt-nAma
because he took (uttered) the name
bhaya-Akula: hare:-iti
overcome by fear, of Hari, thus
prabho
O Lord!
tvat-puruShA babhAShire
Thy emissaries did speak
---------
O Lord! Thy emissaries told the messengers of Yama that though overcome by fear, Ajaamil had uttered the Name of Hari. By that alone he had atoned for all the sins committed by him in innumerable lives.

nRRiNAmabuddhyApi mukundakIrtanaM
dahatyaghaughAn mahimAsya tAdRRisha: |
yathAgniredhAMsi yathauShadhaM gadA -
niti prabho tvatpuruShA babhAShire ||9||
---------
nRRiNAm-abuddhyA-api
of human beings, unknowingly even,
mukund-kIrtanaM
the name of Mukund is chanted
dahati-agha-aughAn
burns up all sins
mahimA-asya tAdRRisha:
its glory is such
yathA-agni:-edhAMsi
like fire (burning) fuel
yathA-auShadhaM gadAn iti
like medicine (curing) disease
prabho
O Lord! Thus
tvat-puruShA babhAShire
Thy emissaries did speak

O Lord! Thy emissaries told them that even if the chanting of The Name of Mukund is done unknowingly, by the human beings, it burns up all their sins. Its glory is like that of fire burning the fuel and like the medicine curing the disease.
---------
itIritairyAmyabhaTairapAsRRite
bhavadbhaTAnAM cha gaNe tirohite |
bhavatsmRRitiM kaMchana kAlamAcharan
bhavatpadaM prApi bhavadbhaTairasau ||10||

iti-Iritai:-
thus being told
yAmya-bhaTai:-
the messengers of Yama
apAsRRite
having left
bhavat-bhaTAnAM cha
and Thy emissaries
gaNe tirohite
in a group having disappeared
bhavat-smRRitiM
having Thy remembrance
kaMchana kAlam-
for some time
Acharan
and worshipping Thee
bhavat-padaM prApi
Thy abode attaining
bhavat-bhaTai:-asau
this (Ajaamil) (led by) Thy emissaries
---------
The messengers of Yama left when they were told thus. The group of Thy emissaries also disappeared. Ajaamil remembered and worshipped Thee for some time and then attained Thy abode led by Thy emissaries.

svaki~NkarAvedanasha~Nkito yama-
stvadaMghribhakteShu na gamyatAmiti |
svakIyabhRRityAnashishikShaduchchakai:
sa deva vAtAlayanAtha pAhi mAm ||11||
---------
sva-ki~Nkara-Avedana-
his messengers reprting1`
sha~Nkita: yama:-
the much concerned Yama
tvat-aMghri-bhakteShu
to the devotees of Thy feet
na gamyatAm-iti
do not go, thus
svakIya-bhRRityAn-
his own messengers
ashishikShat-uchchakai:
instructed strictly
sa deva vAtAlayanAtha
Thou (who are such) Lord! O Lord of Guruvaayur!
pAhi mAm
protect me

Yama was very much concerned at the report of his messengers. He strictly instructed them not to go to the devotees of Thy feet. O Lord! O Lord of Guruvaayur! Who are such, protect me.

Narayaneeyam D023

Dashaka 23
---------
prAchetasastu bhagavannaparo hi dakSha-
stvatsevanaM vyadhita sargavivRRiddhikAma: |
AvirbabhUvitha tadA lasadaShTabAhu-
stasmai varaM daditha tAM cha vadhUmasiknIm ||1||
---------
prAcheta:-tu
a son of Prachetas, indeed,
bhagavan-
O Lord!
aparo hi dakSha:-
another Daksha (not Daksha Prajaapati)
tvat-sevanaM vyadhita
Thy worship performed
sarga-vivRRiddhi-kAma:
the species to multiply desirous
AvirbabhUvitha tadA
Thou appeared then
lasat-aShTa-bAhu:-
with eight resplendent arms
tasmai varaM daditha
(and) gave the boon
tAM cha vadhUm-
and also that bride
asiknIm
(named) Asikni

The son of one of the Prachetas, another Daksha, indeed, desirous of multiplying the progeny, worshipped Thee. Then Thou appeared with eight resplendent arms and gave him a boon and also Asikni as wife.
---------
tasyAtmajAstvayutamIsha punassahasraM
shrInAradasya vachasA tava mArgamApu: |
naikatravAsamRRiShaye sa mumocha shApaM
bhaktottamastvRRiShiranugrahameva mene ||2||

tasya-AtmajA:-
his sons
tu-ayutam-
indeed ten thousand
Isha
O Lord!
puna:-sahasraM
again (also) one thousand
shrInAradasya vachasA
by the advice of Shree Naarada
tava mArgam-Apu:
took to Thy path (of meditation etc)
na-aikatra-vAsam-
(you) will not be residing in one place
RRiShaye
to the sage (Naarada)
sa mumocha shApaM
he (Daksha) gave the curse
bhakta-uttama:-tu-RRiShi:-
highest of (Thy) devotees, the sage
anugraham-eva mene
took it for a blessing.
---------
His eleven thousand sons, on the advice of Shree Naarada took to the path of devotion to Thee, to attain liberation. Daksha was displeased with Naarada and so pronounced a curse on him that he would not have any fixed place of residence. Sage Naarada, the highest of devotees, considered it only as blessing.

ShaShTyA tato duhitRRibhi: sRRijata: kulaughAn
dauhitrasUnuratha tasya sa vishvarUpa: |
tvatstotravarmitamajApayadindramAjau
deva tvadIyamahimA khalu sarvajaitra: ||3||
---------
ShaShTyA tata: duhitRRibhi:
then by ( his) sixty daughters
sRRijata: kula-aughAn
(he) was multiplying the species
dauhitra-sUnu:-atha tasya
then one of his daughter's son's son
sa vishvarUpa:
that (named) Vishwaroopa
tvat-stotra-varmitam-
Thy protective hymn
ajApayat-indram-
made Indra recite
Ajau
in a battle
deva
O Lord!
tvadIya-mahimA
Thy glory
khalu sarvajaitra:
indeed is victorious over all

Then Daksha multiplied the species through his sixty daughters. His daughter's son's son named Vishwaroopa made Indra win the battle against the Asuras. Indra was provided protection and victory by learning from Vishwaroopa the hymn addressed to Thee (Naaraayana Kavacha). O Lord! Thy glory can indeed conquer all.
---------
prAkshUrasenaviShaye kila chitraketu:
putrAgrahI nRRipatira~Ngirasa: prabhAvAt |
labdhvaikaputramatha tatra hate sapatnI-
sa~Nghairamuhyadavashastava mAyayAsau ||4||

prAk-
once upon a time
shUrasena-viShaye
in Shoorsena's kingdom
kila chitraketu:
indeed, Chitraketu
putra-AgrahI nRRipati:
desirous of a son, the king
aMgirasa: prabhAvAt
by sage Angirasa's blessings
labdhvA-eka-putram-
getting one son
atha tatra hate sapatnIsa~Nghai:-
then, there (the son) was killed by the other wives
amuhyat-avasha:-
and overcome by grief, he fainted
tava mAyayA asau
owing to the power of Thy Maayaa
---------
Once upon a time, in the kingdom named Shoorsena the king Chitraketu was desirous of getting a son. By the blessings of sage Angirasa he got a son. The child was killed by his other wives out of jealousy. The king fainted with grief owing to the power of Thy Maayaa.

taM nAradastu samama~NgirasA dayAlu:
samprApya tAvadupadarshya sutasya jIvam |
kasyAsmi putra iti tasya girA vimohaM
tyaktvA tvadarchanavidhau nRRipatiM nyayu~Nkta ||5||
---------
taM nArada:-tu
him, Naarada then
samam-a~NgirasA
along with Angirasa
dayAlu:
merciful (Naarada)
samprApya
approaching
tAvat-upadarshya
then showed
sutasya jIvam
the son's soul
kasya-asmi putra(:) iti
whose son am I, thus
tasya girA
by his speech
vimohaM tyaktvA
giving up delusion
tvat-archana-vidhau
in the ways of Thy worship
nRRipatiM nyayu~Nkta
gave instructions to the king

The merciful Naarada and sage Angirasa went to Chitraketu and showed him the soul of his dead son. The soul asked 'whose son am I?' These words dispelled the king's delusion. The sages then instructed him in the ways of Thy worship.
---------
stotraM cha mantramapi nAradato.atha labdhvA
toShAya sheShavapuSho nanu te tapasyan |
vidyAdharAdhipatitAM sa hi saptarAtre
labdhvApyakuNThamatiranvabhajadbhavantam ||6||

stotraM cha mantram-api
hymns and Mantras
nAradata:-atha labdhvA
from Naarada then receiving
toShAya sheSha-vapuSha:
for propitiation of (Thee) (who were) in the form of Aadishesha
nanu te tapasyan
practising austerities to Thee alone
vidyAdhara-adhipatitAM
the leadership of Vidyaadharas
sa hi sapta-rAtre labdhvA-
he obtained only in seven days
api-akuNThamati:-
still dissatisfied
anvabhajat-bhavantam
(he) continued to worship Thee
---------
Then receiving hymns and Mantras from Naarada, he practised austerities for propitiating Thee who were in the form of Aadishesha. Within seven days he obtained the leadership of the Vidyaadharas. Still dissatisfied, he continued to worship Thee with the same fervour.

tasmai mRRiNAladhavalena sahasrashIrShNA
rUpeNa baddhanutisiddhagaNAvRRitena |
prAdurbhavannachirato nutibhi: prasanno
datvA.a.atmatattvamanugRRihya tirodadhAtha ||7||
---------
tasmai
to him (Chitraketu)
mRRiNAla-dhavalena
as white as a lotus stalk
sahasra-shIrShNA
with a thousand heads
rUpeNa
in (such a) form
baddhanuti-siddhagaNa-AvRRitena
singing hymns of praises,by Sidhdhas, surrounded
prAdurbhavan-achirata:
quickly manifested
nutibhi: prasanna:
with the hymns pleased
datvA-Atma-tattvam-
imparting knowledge of self
anugRRihya
and blessing (him)
tirodadhAtha
Thou disappeared

Presently Thou revealed Thyself to him in Thy form of Aadishesha, with a thousand hoods and white like a lotus stalk,surrounded by bands of Sidhdhaas singing hymns of praise. Pleased with the hymns, Thou blessed him and imparted to him the knowledge of the self and then Thou disappeared.
---------
tvadbhaktamauliratha so.api cha lakShalakShaM
varShANi harShulamanA bhuvaneShu kAmam |
sa~NgApayan guNagaNaM tava sundarIbhi:
sa~NgAtirekarahito lalitaM chachAra ||8||

tvat-bhakta-mauli:-atha sa-
the greatest of devotees ,he, then
api cha
and also
lakSha-lakShaM varShANi
for many many years
harShula-manA
happily (blissfully)
bhuvaneShu
in all the worlds
kAmam sa~NgApayan
made to be sung
guNagaNaM tava
Thy glories
sundarIbhi:
by beautiful Vidyaadharis
sa~Nga-atireka-rahita:
without much sensuous attachment
lalitaM chachAra
happily wandered about
---------
This great devotee Chitraketu for many many years wandered about happily in all the worlds without much attachment. He led the troupe of beautiful Vidyaadharis and also caused Thy glories and excellences to be sung, to his hearts content.

atyantasa~NgavilayAya bhavatpraNunno
nUnaM sa rUpyagirimApya mahatsamAje |
nishsha~Nkama~NkakRRitavallabhama~NgajAriM
taM sha~NkaraM parihasannumayAbhishepe ||9||
---------
atyanta-sa~Nga-vilayAya
to rid (himself) of all sensuous hankerings
bhavat-praNunna: nUnaM
prompted by Thee, it seems,
sa rUpyagirim-Apya
he, reaching the Silver mountain (Kailaash)
mahat-samAje
in the assembly of sages
nishsha~Nkam-
without any inhibition
a~Nka-kRRita-vallabham-
who had seated his consort on his lap
a~NgajAriM taM sha~NkaraM
the destroyer of Kaamdeva, that Shankara
parihasan-
ridiculing (him)
umayA-abhishepe
was cursed by Umaa

To rid himself completely of all sensuous hankerings, prompted by Thee, he once went to Mount Kailaash. There he saw the destroyer of Kaamadeva , Shankara, sitting in the assembly of sages with his consort Umaa seated on his lap without any concern. Chitraketu mocked at him and in turn was cursed by Umaa.
---------
nissambhramastvayamayAchitashApamokSho
vRRitrAsuratvamupagamya surendrayodhI |
bhaktyAtmatattvakathanai: samare vichitraM
shatrorapi bhramamapAsya gata: padaM te ||10||

nissambhrama:-
unperturbed
tu-ayam-
however, he (Chitraketu)
ayAchita-shApa-mokSha:
did not ask for relief from the curse
vRRitrAsuratvam-upagamya
as vritraasura being born
surendra-yodhI
against Indra fighting
bhaktyA-
by his devotion
Atmatattva-kathanai:
and by imparting knowledge of the self
samare
in the battle,
vichitraM
surprisingly,
shatro:-api bhramam-
the delusion of the enemy also
apAsya
removing
gata: padaM te
reached Thy abode
---------
Unperturbed, Chitraketu did not ask for relief from the curse, and was born as Vritraasura. By his devotion, while fighting in the battle against Indra, he imparted the knowledge of the self to Indra and he removed the delusion of even his enemy. Thereby he reached Thy abode. What a wonder!

tvatsevanena ditirindravadhodyatA.api
tAnpratyutendrasuhRRido maruto.abhilebhe |
duShTAshaye.api shubhadaiva bhavanniShevA
tattAdRRishastvamava mAM pavanAlayesha ||11||
---------
tvat-sevanena
by worshipping Thee
diti:-
Diti
indra-vadha-udyatA-api
though wanting to kill Indra
tAn-pratyuta-
them, instead,
indra-suhRRida: maruta:-
Indra's friends Maruts
abhilebhe
begot
duShTa-Ashaye-api
even for evil mind persons
shubhadA-eva
Thy worship
bhavat-niShevA
gives good only
tat-tAdRRisha:-tvam-
Thou who are thus
ava mAM
protect me
pavana-Alaya-Isha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!

Diti, the mother of the Asuras, worshipped Thee in order to have a son who would kill Indra, but instead gave birth to Maruts who became friends of Indra. By worshipping Thee, even an evil minded person receives good only. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Who are like that, deign to protect me.

Narayaneeyam D024

Dashaka 24
---------
hiraNyAkShe potripravaravapuShA deva bhavatA
hate shokakrodhaglapitadhRRitiretasya sahaja: |
hiraNyaprArambha: kashipuramarArAtisadasi
pratij~namAtene tava kila vadhArthaM madhuripo ||1||
---------
hiraNyAkShe (hate)
(when) Hiranyaaksha (was killed)
potri-pravara-vapuShA
by (Thee) in the form of the exalted Boar
deva bhavatA
O Lord! By Thee
hate
was killed (then)
shoka-krodha-glapita-dhRRiti:-
(his brother) who had lost mental balance due to grief and anger
etasya sahaja:
his brother
hiraNya-prArambha: kashipu:-
Kashipu' whose name started with 'Hiranya'
amara-arAti-sadasi
in the assembly of the enemy of the Devas (ie Asuras)
pratij~nAm-Atene
an oath took
tava kila vadhArthaM
for killing Thee, it is said
madhuripo
O Lord! Slayer of Madhu

O Lord! Slayer of Madhu! When Hiranyaaksha was killed by Thee, incarnate as the Divine Boar, his brother named Hiranyakashipu was smitten with sorrow and anger. In the assembly of the Asuras he swore to kill Thee.
---------
vidhAtAraM ghoraM sa khalu tapasitvA nachirata:
pura: sAkShAtkurvan suranaramRRigAdyairanidhanam |
varaM labdhvA dRRipto jagadiha bhavannAyakamidaM
parikShundannindrAdaharata divaM tvAmagaNayan ||2||

vidhAtAraM ghoraM
to Brahmaa, with intensity
sa khalu tapasitvA
he, indeed, performed austerities
na-chirata: pura: sAkShAt-kurvan
soon, caused him to appear
sura-nara-mRRiga-Adyai:-
by god, man, beast etc
anidhanaM varaM labdhvA
of not being killed, the boon getting
dpta:
(became) arrogant
jagat-iha
here, in this world
bhavan-nAyakam-idaM
which has Thee for its Lord
parikShundan-
tormenting
indrAt-aharat divaM
from Indra, snatched the heavens
tvAm-agaNyan
disregarding Thee
---------
He quickly compelled Brahmaa to appear before him by performing severe austerities and made him give a boon that he would not be killed by god, man or beast etc. As a result of the boon he became arrogant and tormented the whole world which has Thee as its Lord. Disregarding Thee, he even snatched the heavens from Indra.

nihantuM tvAM bhUyastava padamavAptasya cha ripo-
rbahirdRRiShTerantardadhitha hRRidaye sUkShmavapuShA |
nadannuchchaistatrApyakhilabhuvanAnte cha mRRigayan
bhiyA yAtaM matvA sa khalu jitakAshI nivavRRite ||3||
---------
nihantuM tvAM bhUya:-
to kill Thee then
tava padam-avAptasya
who had reached Thy abode
cha ripo:-bahirdRRiShTe:-
and from (this) enemy's physical eyes
antardadhitha
(Thou) disappeared
hRRidaye sUkShma-vapuShA
into the heart, in a subtle form
nandan-uchchai:-tatra-api-
roaring loudly, even there (in Vaikuntha)
akhila-bhuvan-ante cha
and in all the other worlds as well
mRRigayan
searching
bhiyA yAtaM matvA
(Thou had) gone away for fear, thinking
sa khalu jitakAshI
he ,indeed, thought that he had won
nivavRRite
returned

To kill Thee, he even went to Thy abode Vaikuntha. Thou disappeared from his gross vision and entered into his heart in a subtle form. Roaring aloud he searched for Thee in all the three worlds, and not finding Thee, he thought that Thou had fled in fear. Considering himself the winner he returned home.
---------
tato.asya prahlAda: samajani suto garbhavasatau
munervINApANeradhigatabhavadbhaktimahimA |
sa vai jAtyA daitya: shishurapi sametya tvayi ratiM
gatastvadbhaktAnAM varada paramodAharaNatAm ||4||

tata:-asya
then, to him
prahlAda: samajani suta:
Prahlaad was born as a son
garbhavasatau
while still in the womb
mune:-vINA-pANe:-
from the sage Naarada
adhigata-
learning
bhavat-bhakti-mahimA
the glory of devotion to Thee
sa vai jAtyA daitya:
though he was by birth an Asura
shishu:-api
and a child also
sametya tvayi ratiM
attaining,love towards Thee, intense love
gata: tvat bhaktAnAm
(he) became, among Thy devotees
varada
O Bestower of Boons!
parama-udAharaNatAm (gata:)
the most outstanding example
---------
To him was born a son named Prahlaad. Even when he was in the womb, he had learnt the glory of devotion to Thee from sage Naarada. Though by birth he was an Asura, and just a child, O Bestower of Boons! He had intense love for Thee, and became the most outstanding example for all Thy devotees.

surArINAM hAsyaM tava charaNadAsyaM nijasute
sa dRRiShTvA duShTAtmA gurubhirashishikShachchiramamum |
guruproktaM chAsAvidamidamabhadrAya dRRiDhami-
tyapAkurvan sarvaM tava charaNabhaktyaiva vavRRidhe || 5 ||
---------
surArINAM hAsyaM
the ridicule of the Asuras
tava charaNa-dAsyaM
(and) devotion to Thy feet
nija-sute sa dRRiShTvA
of his son, he seeing
duShTAtmA
the evil minded (Hiranyakashipu)
gurubhi:-ashishikShat-
by the teachers made (him) learn
chiram-amum
him for a long time
guru-proktaM cha-asau-
and (but) he, all that was said by the teachers
idam-idam-abhadrAya dRRiDham-iti
all this will certainly cause evil, thus
apAkurvan sarvaM
rejecting all
tava charaNa bhaktyA-eva
by devotion to Thy feet alone
vavRRidhe
grew up

The evil minded Hiranyakashipu had Prahlaad brain washed by competent instructors for long, because he saw signs of devotion to Thee and also the ridicule of the Asuras in his son. He however rejected all their teachings as leading only to evil and grew up with his devotional zeal.
---------
adhIteShu shreShThaM kimiti paripRRiShTe.atha tanaye
bhavadbhaktiM varyAmabhigadati paryAkuladhRRiti: |
gurubhyo roShitvA sahajamatirasyetyabhividan
vadhopAyAnasmin vyatanuta bhavatpAdasharaNe ||6||

adhIteShu shreShThaM kim-
among what (you have) learned, what is the best?'
iti paripRRiShTe-
thus when asked
atha tanaye
then the son,
bhavat-bhaktiM varyAm-
devotion to Thee as the greatest
abhigadati
replied
paryAkula-dhRRiti:
(He, hiranyakashipu) agitation minded
gurubhya: roShitvA
(and) got angry with the teachers
sahaja-mati:-asya-
(this) is his natural inclination'
iti-abhividan
thus understanding
vadhopAyAn-
means of killing
asmin vyatanuta
him (Prahlaad) planned
bhavat-pAda-sharaNe
at Thy feet, who had taken refuge
---------
On being asked about what was the best that he had learned, he answered that devotion to Thee was the greatest. Agitated at this, Hiranyakashipu was very angry with the teachers, but they told him that this was his son's natural inclination. At this he started planning ways to kill Prahlaad who was Thy great devotee, having taken refuge at Thy feet.

sa shUlairAviddha: subahu mathito diggajagaNai-
rmahAsarpairdaShTo.apyanashanagarAhAravidhuta: |
girIndravakShipto.apyahaha! paramAtmannayi vibho
tvayi nyastAtmatvAt kimapi na nipIDAmabhajata ||7||
---------
sa:
he (Prahlaad),
shUlai:-Aviddha: subahu
pierced by tridents, many times
mathita: diggaja-gaNai:-
trampled upon by herds of huge elephants
mahA-sarpai:-daShTa:-
bitten by huge snakes
api-anashana-
and also going without food (starving)
gara-AhAra-vidhuta:
tormented by poisoned food
girIndra-avakShipta:-
thrown down from high mountains
api-ahaha
even then, what a wonder
paramAtman-ayi vibho
O All Pervading Supreme Being!
tvayi nyasta-AtmatvAt
unto Thee having surrendered himself
kim-api na nipIDAm-
did not any kind of suffering
abhajat
feel

O All Pervading Supreme Being! What a wonder! Though he was pierced with tridents many times, trampled again and again by herds of huge elephants, bitten by great serpents, starved, poisoned and thrown down from the mountain peaks,he did not feel any suffering as his mind was completely fixed on Thee.
---------
tata: sha~NkAviShTa: sa punaratiduShTo.asya janako
gurUktyA tadgehe kila varuNapAshaistamaruNat |
guroshchAsAnnidhye sa punaranugAn daityatanayAn
bhavadbhaktestattvaM paramamapi vij~nAnamashiShat ||8||

tata: sha~NkA-AviShTa: sa: puna:-
then being frightened, he again
ati-duShTa:-asya janaka:
very cruel, his father,
guru-uktyA
following the advice of the teacher
tat-gehe kila
in his (teacher's) house, it appears
varuNa-pAshai:-
with ropes
tam-aruNat
tied him up
guro:-cha-asAnnidhye
and when the teacher was not present
sa: puna:-
he (Prahlaada) again
anugAn daitya-tanayAn
(with the ) Asura boys who were with him
bhavat-bhakte:-tattvam
the real nature of devotion to Thee
paramam-api vij~nAnam-
and also the Supreme knowledge
ashiShat
taught
---------
The very cruel father was frightened at this. At the advice of the teacher, Prahlaad was tied up with ropes at the teacher's house. But whenever the teacher was away, Prahlaad began to teach the Asura boys, who were with him, the doctrine of love for, and knowledge of Thee.

pitA shRRiNvan bAlaprakaramakhilaM tvatstutiparaM
ruShAndha: prAhainaM kulahataka kaste balamiti |
balaM me vaikuNThastava cha jagatAM chApi sa balaM
sa eva trailokyaM sakalamiti dhIro.ayamagadIt ||9||
---------
pitA shRRiNvan
(the) father on hearing
bAla-prakaram-akhilaM
(that) all the groups of boys
tvat-stuti-paraM
are intent on singing Thy praise
ruShAndha:
blinded by rage
prAha-enaM
asked him
kulahataka ka:-te balam-iti
O traitor of our race, who is your strength (support)?
balaM me vaikuNTha:-
My strength is Vishnu,
tava cha
and your's,
jagatAM cha-api sa balaM
of the whole universe also He is th strength,
sa eva trailokyaM sakalam-
He alone is the three worlds as a whole',
iti dhIra:-ayam-agadIt
thus, that courageous and wise boy replied

Hearing that all the boys were now singing Thy praise, Hiranyakashipu became blind with rage. He shouted at Prahlaad that the traitor that he was, who was his strength? That courageous boy replied that Lord Vishnu was his strength, in as much as He was also his (father's) strength and of the whole universe. Also that the three worlds were his manifestation indeed.
---------
are kvAsau kvAsau sakalajagadAtmA haririti
prabhinte sma staMbhaM chalitakaravAlo ditisuta: |
ata: pashchAdviShNo na hi vaditumIsho.asmi sahasA
kRRipAtman vishvAtman pavanapuravAsin mRRiDaya mAm ||10||

are kva-asau kva-asau
Oh where is he? Where is he?'
sakala-jagata-AtmA hari:-
the soul of all the worlds', that Hari
iti
thus (saying)
prabhinte sma staMbhaM
struck at a pillar
chalita-karavAla:
brandishing his sword
diti-suta:
the son of Diti (Hiranyakashipu)
ata: pashchAt-
thereafter (what happened)
viShNo
O Vishnu!
na hi vaditum-Isha:-asmi sahasA
O Lord! I am not able to say immediately
kRRipAtman
O All merciful!
vishvAtman
O Supreme Aatman!
pavanapuravAsin
O Resider of Guruvaayur!
mRRiDaya mAm
deign to make me whole
---------
O where is he? Where is he? The soul of all the worlds who is known as Hari? The son of Diti asking struck the pillar brandishing the sword. O Vishnu! O Lord! What happened then I am unable to describe immediately. O All Merciful! O All pervading One! O resident of Guruvaayur! Deign to make me whole.

Narayaneeyam D025

Dashaka 25
---------
staMbhe ghaTTayato hiraNyakashipo: karNau samAchUrNaya-
nnAghUrNajjagadaNDakuNDakuharo ghorastavAbhUdrava: |
shrutvA yaM kila daityarAjahRRidaye pUrvaM kadApyashrutaM
kampa: kashchana saMpapAta chalito.apyambhojabhUrviShTarAt ||1||
---------
stambhe ghaTTayata:
(as he) was striking at the pillar
hiraNyakashipo:
of Hiranyakashipu
karNau samAchUrNayan-
splitting the ears
AghUrNat-jagat-aNDa-kuNDa-kuhara:
making everything inside the vessel of Brahmaanda tremble
ghora:-tava-abhUt-rava:
(so) frightening was Thy roar
shrutvA yaM kila
hearing which indeed
daityarAja hRRidaye
in the heart of the Asura king
pUrvaM kadApi-ashrutaM
(the roar) which had never been heard before
kampa: kashchana saMpapAta
an indescribable trembling arose
chalita:-api-ambhojabhU:-
shaken even was Brahmaa
viShTarAt
on his throne (in Satyaloka)

As Hiranyakashipu struck at the pillar, he heard a terrific sound which split his ears.Thy roar was so fierce that it made everything inside the vessel of Brahmaanda tremble. Hearing this sound which was never heard before, the Asura king felt an awesome and incredible shiver within. Even the lotus born Brahmaa was shaken from his throne.
---------
daitye dikShu visRRiShTachakShuShi mahAsaMrambhiNi stambhata:
sambhUtaM na mRRigAtmakaM na manujAkAraM vapuste vibho |
kiM kiM bhIShaNametadadbhutamiti vyudbhrAntachitte.asure
visphUrjjaddhavalograromavikasadvarShmA samAjRRimbhathA: ||2||

daitye dikShu visRRiShTa-chakShuShi
as the Asura with his eyes rolling all around
mahAsaMrambhiNi
in great excitement
stambhata: sambhUtaM
emerging from the pillar
na mRRigAtmakaM
(a form) neither of beast
na manujAkAraM
nor of a human being
vapu:-te vibho
Thy form O Lord! (seeing)
kiM kiM bhIShaNam-etat-
What o what this terrifying
adbhutam-iti
and wondrous (being) is, thus
