in (the land of) Kosala, (when) sage Rishyashring
putrIyAm-iShTim-iShTvA
the Putrakaameshti Yanjya had performed
daduShi dasharatha-kShmAbhRRite
(he) gave to king Dashratha
pAyasa-agryam
the divine Paayasa (pudding)
tat-bhuktyA
by eating which
tat-purandhrIShu-api tisRRiShu
his three wives
samaM jAtagarbhAsu
simultaneously conceived
jAta: rAma:-tvaM
(then) Thou were born as Raama
lakShmaNena svayam-atha
then yourself as Lakshmana
bharatena-api
also as Bharat
shatrughna-nAmnA
(and) Shatrughna, by names

The Devas prayed to Thee for the destruction of Raavana. In the kingdom of Kosala, the sage Rishyashringa performed the Putrakaameshti Ynjya on the request of the King Dashratha. From the Yanajya emerged the divine paayasa which the king distributed among his three wives, by eating it they conceived simultaneously. Thou were born to them as Raama, then yourself as Lakshmana ,also as Bharat, and Shatrughna, by these names.
---------
kodaNDI kaushikasya kratuvaramavituM lakShmaNenAnuyAto
yAto.abhUstAtavAchA munikathitamanudvandvashAntAdhvakheda: |
nRRiNAM trANAya bANairmunivachanabalAttATakAM pATayitvA
labdhvAsmAdastrajAlaM munivanamagamo deva siddhAshramAkhyam ||2||

kodaNDI
carrying the bow Kodanda
kaushikasya kratuvaram-avituM
Vishwaamitra's great sacrifice to protect
lakShmaNena-anuyAta:
followed by Lakshmana
yAta:-abhU:-tAta-vAchA
(Thou) proceeded at the bidding of (Thy) father
muni-kathita-manu-dvandva-
instructed by the muni, the two Mantras (Bala & Atibala)
shAnta-adhva-kheda:
to remove the fatigue of the way
nRRiNAM trANAya bANai:-
for the protection of the people, with arrows
muni-vachana-balAt-
by the order of the muni
tATakAM pATayitvA
slayed Taatakaa
labdhvA-asmAt-
received from him (the sage)
astra-jAlaM
instructions into the use of several divine missiles
muni-vanam-agama:
with the sage went to the forest
deva
Thou O Lord!
siddhAshrama-Akhyam
to the hermitage known as Sidhaashrama
---------
At the bidding of Thy father, followed by Lakshmana, Thou proceeded to protect the great sacrifice of Vishwaamitra, carrying the bow Kodanda. To remove the fatigue of the way, the sage imparted two Mantraas -Bala and Atibala. By the order of the sage, for the relief of the men, Thou destroyed the demoness Taadakaa, with arrows. After receiving from the sage instructions in the use of several divine missiles, Thou went to the forest with the sage and then to the hermitage named Siddhaashrama.

mArIchaM drAvayitvA makhashirasi sharairanyarakShAMsi nighnan
kalyAM kurvannahalyAM pathi padarajasA prApya vaidehageham |
bhindAnashchAndrachUDaM dhanuravanisutAmindirAmeva labdhvA
rAjyaM prAtiShThathAstvaM tribhirapi cha samaM bhrAtRRivIraissadArai: ||3||
---------
mArIchaM drAvayitvA
chasing away Maareecha
makha-shirasi sharai:-
at the beginning of the sacrificial rites, by arrows
anya-rakShAMsi nighnan
killed the other Raakhsasa
kalyAM kurvan-ahalyAM
and purified Ahilyaa of her sins
pathi padarajasA
on the way by the dust of Thy feet
prApya vaideha-geham
reaching Janaka's palace
bhindAna:-chAndrachUDaM dhanu:-
(and) breaking the bow of Shiva
avani-sutAm-
the daughter of the Earth (Seetaa)
indirAm-eva labdhvA
(Who) was Lakshmi herself having won
rAjyaM prAtiShThathA:-tvaM
Thou set out for Thy kingdom
tribhi:-api cha samaM
along with the three
bhrAtRRivIrai:-sadArai:
great brothers and their wives

At the beginning of the sacrificial rites, Thou chased Maareecha and with arrows killed the other Raakshasas. On the way Thou purified Ahilyaa of her sins by the dust of Thy feet. On reaching Janaka's palace and breaking the bow of Shiva, Thou won Seetaa, the daughter of the earth, as Thy consort, who was Lakshmi herself. Along with the three great brothers and their wives Thou set out for Thy kingdom.
---------
ArundhAne ruShAndhe bhRRigukula tilake saMkramayya svatejo
yAte yAto.asyayodhyAM sukhamiha nivasan kAntayA kAntamUrte |
shatrughnenaikadAtho gatavati bharate mAtulasyAdhivAsaM
tAtArabdho.abhiShekastava kila vihata: kekayAdhIshaputryA ||4||

ArundhAne ruShAndhe
Thou were confronted, blinded by rage
bhRRigukula tilake
by the foremost of the Bhrigu clan, Parashuraama
saMkramayya svateja: yAte
(in the end) transmitted all his powers to Thee and went away
yAta:-asi-ayodhyAM
Thou went to Ayodhyaa
sukham-iha nivasan kAntayA
where Thou lived happily with Thy wife Seetaa
kAntamUrte
O Radiant Lord!
shatrughnena-ekadA-atha:
then one day with Shatrughna
gatavati bharate
when Bharat had gone
mAtulasya-adhivAsaM
to his uncle's kingdom
tAta-Arabdha:-
started by Thy father
abhiSheka:-tava kila vihata:
Thy coronation was obstructed
kekaya-adhIsha-putryA
by the daughter of the king of Kekaya, (Kekayee)
---------
O Radiant Lord! Parashuraama, the foremost of the Bhrigu clan, confronted Thee with great anger and was defeated. He then transmitted all his powers to Thee and went away. Thou went to Ayodhyaa and lived happily with Thy consort Seetaa. Then one day, when Bharat along with Shatrughna had gone to his uncle's kingdom,Thy father fixed Thy coronation which was obstructed by the daughter of the king Kekaya, i.e., Kekayee.

tAtoktyA yAtukAmo vanamanujavadhUsaMyutashchApadhAra:
paurAnArudhya mArge guhanilayagatastvaM jaTAchIradhArI|
nAvA santIrya ga~NgAmadhipadavi punastaM bharadvAjamArA-
nnatvA tadvAkyahetoratisukhamavasashchitrakUTe girIndre ||5||
---------
tAta-uktyA
to keep Thy father's words
yAtukAma: vanam-
desirous of going to the forest
anuja-vadhU-saMyuta:-
accompanied by Thy younger brother and wife
chApa-dhAra:
bearing a bow
paurAn-Arudhya mArge
sending back the citizens on the way
guha-nilaya-gata:-tvaM
Thou went to the residence of Guha
jaTA-chIra-dhArI
wearing matted hair and bark cloth
nAvA santIrya ga~NgAm-
crossing the Gangaa in a boat
adhipadavi puna:-taM
on the way again, him
bharadvAjam-ArAt-natvA
to Bharadwaaj who lived near by offered obeisance
tat-vAkya-heto:-
by his instructions
ati-sukham-avasa:-
Thou lived very happily
chitrakUTe girIndre
on the great mountain Chitrakoot

To keep Thy father's words Thou proceeded to go to the forest accompanied by Thy consort Seetaa, and brother Lakshmana, armed with a bow. The crowd of citizens stricken with grief, who followed Thee, Thou sent back and on the way went to the residence of Guha. In an ascetic garb of bark cloth and matted hair Thou crossed the Gangaa in a boat and paid obeisance to sage Bharadwaaja who lived near by. On the sage's instruction Thou camped on the great mountain Chitrakoota and lived there very happily.
---------
shrutvA putrArtikhinnaM khalu bharatamukhAt svargayAtaM svatAtaM
tapto datvA.ambu tasmai nidadhitha bharate pAdukAM medinIM cha
atriM natvA.atha gatvA vanamativipulaM daNDakaM chaNDakAyaM
hatvA daityaM virAdhaM sugatimakalayashchAru bho: shArabha~NgIm ||6||

shrutvA putra-Arti-khinnaM
on hearing (that) saddened by the pain (of separation)of the son
khalu bharata-mukhAt
indeed from Bharat's mouth
svarga-yAtaM sva-tAtaM
about the death of Thy father
tapta: datvA-ambu tasmai
tormented, (Thou) performed Tarpana for him
nidadhitha bharate
bestowed on Bharata
pAdukAM medinIM cha
(Thy) sandals and the kingdom
atriM natvA-atha
paying homage to sage Atri, then
gatvA vanam-
went to the forest
ati-vipulaM daNDakaM
Dandaka which was very vast
chaNDakAyaM
the ferocious bodied
hatvA daityaM virAdhaM
Asura named Viraadha killing
sgatim-akalaya:-
salvation bestowed
chAru bho: shArabha~NgIm
beautifully, O Thou! To (the sage) Shaarabhanga
---------
Hearing from Bharat about Thy father's demise on account of the pangs of separation from the son (Thee), Thou were tormented and performed Tarpana for him. Then Thou bestowed Thy sandals and the kingdom to Bharata and paid homage to sage Atri. Going into the dense vast forest Dandaka, Thou killed the ferocious bodied demon Viraadha, and Thou graciously gave salvation to sage Shaarabhangee.

natvA.agastyaM samastAsharanikarasapatrAkRRitiM tApasebhya:
pratyashrauShI: priyaiShI tadanu cha muninA vaiShNave divyachApe |
brahmAstre chApi datte pathi pitRRisuhRRidaM vIkShya bhUyo jaTAyuM
modAt godAtaTAnte pariramasi purA pa~nchavaTyAM vadhUTyA ||7||
---------
natvA-agastyaM
(after) paying obeisance to sage Agastya
samasta-Ashara-nikara-sapatrAkRRitiM
the whole demon multitude will be killed to the core
tApasebhya: pratyashrauShI:
to the sages, promised
priyaiShI tadanu cha
(Thou) the well wisher, and after that
muninA vaiShNave divya-chApe
by the sage the divine Vaishnava bow
brahmAstre cha-api
and also the Brahmaastra
datte pathi
was given, on the way
pitRRi-suhRRidaM vIkShya
seeing Thy father's friend
bhUya: jaTAyuM modAt
again Jataayu happily
godA-taTAnte
on the banks of Godaavari river
pariramasi purA
Thou lived then
pa~nchavaTyAM vadhUTyA
in Panchvati with Thy consort

After paying obeisance to sage Agastya, Thou the well wisher of the sages, promised to destroy the multitude of demons to the core. Then the sage gave Thee the divine Vaishnava bow and also the Brahmaastra. Thou also met Thy father's friend Jataayu and lived happily with Thy consort Seetaa in Panchawati on the banks of the river Godaavaree.
---------
prAptAyA: shUrpaNakhyA madanachaladhRRiterarthanairnissahAtmA
tAM saumitrau visRRijya prabalatamaruShA tena nirlUnanAsAm |
dRRiShTvainAM ruShTachittaM kharamabhipatitaM dUShaNaM cha trimUrdhaM
vyAhiMsIrAsharAnapyayutasamadhikAMstatkShaNAdakShatoShmA ||8||

prAptAyA: shUrpaNakhyA
approached by Shoorpanakhaa
madana-chala-dhRRite:-
(who was) overcome by passion
arthanai:-nissahAtmA
by (her) entreaties being annoyed
tAM saumitrau visRRijya
sending her away to Lakshmana
prabalatama-ruShA tena
by whom in great rage
nirlUna-nAsAm
(her) nose was cut off
dRRiShTvA-ainAM ruShTa-chittaM
seeing her (thus) in great anger
kharam-abhipatitaM
Khar attacked (Thee)
dUShaNaM cha trimUrdhaM
Dooshana and Trishiraa
vyAhiMsI:-AsharAn-api-
(Thou) destroyed (them) and other Raakshasas also
ayutasama-adhikAn-
who were more than ten thousand
tat-kShaNAt-
then and there
akShata-UShmA
Thou! Whose powers know no decline
---------
Shoorpanakhaa approached Thee overcome with passion. Annoyed by her love lorn advances, Thou sent her away to Lakshmana who in great rage cut off her nose. Khar Dooshana and Trishira seeing her state came to attack Thee in great anger. O Thou! Whose powers know no decline, Thou killed them and other more than ten thousand Raakshasas all at once then and there.

sodaryAproktavArtAvivashadashamukhAdiShTamArIchamAyA-
sAra~Nga sArasAkShyA spRRihitamanugata: prAvadhIrbANaghAtam |
tanmAyAkrandaniryApitabhavadanujAM rAvaNastAmahArShI-
ttenArto.api tvamanta: kimapi mudamadhAstadvadhopAyalAbhAt ||9||
---------
sodaryA-prokta-vArtA-
by (his) sister (he was) told the account
vivasha-dashamukha-
infatuated Raavana
AdiShTa-mArIcha-
ordered Maareech
mAyA-sAra~Nga
(to become) the illusive dear
sArasAkShyA
by the lotus-eyed (Seetaa)
spRRihitam-anugata:
(it was) desired, (Thou) went after
prAvadhI:-bANa-ghAtam
(and) killed with an arrow
tat-mAyA-kranda-
by him an illusive cry
niryApita-bhavat-anujAM
sent out by her (Seetaa) Thy younger brother
rAvaNa:-tAm-ahArShIt-
Raaavana abducted her
tena-Arta:-api
because of that even though grieved
tvam-anta:
Thou inwardly
kim-api-mudam-adhA:-
were somewhat pleased
tat-vadha-upAya-lAbhAt
for getting a reason for killing him

Raavana's sister Shurpanakhaa gave an account of Seetaa by which he was infatuated and ordered Maareech to become the illusive deer. The lotus eyed Seetaa, made a desire for the deer and Thou went after it and killed it with an arrow. As Maareech died, he gave an illusive cry imitating Raama. Hearing the cry , Seetaa sent away Thy younger brother Lakshmana after him. Finding her alone Raavana abducted Seetaa. Though Thou were grieved at this, Thou also felt some joy as this gave a good reason to kill Raavana.
---------
bhUyastanvIM vichinvannahRRita dashamukhastvadvadhUM madvadhene-
tyuktvA yAte jaTAyau divamatha suhRRida: prAtano: pretakAryam |
gRRihNAnaM taM kabandhaM jaghanitha shabarIM prekShya pampAtaTe tvaM
samprApto vAtasUnuM bhRRishamuditamanA: pAhi vAtAlayesha ||10||

bhUya:-tanvIM vichinvan-
thereafter, searching for the beautiful one
ahRRita: dashamukha:-
Raavana abducted
tvat-vadhUM mat-vadhena-
Thy consort by killing me
iti-uktvA yAte jaTAyau
saying thus (when) Jataayu went to
divam-atha suhRRida:
heaven, then of his friend (Jataayu)
prAtano: pretakAryam
(Thou) performed funeral rites
gRRihNAnaM taM kabandhaM
who had caught hold of Thee that Kabandha
jaghanitha shabarIM prekShya
(Thou) killed, bestowed salvation to Shabari
pampAtaTe tvaM samprApta: vAtasUnuM
on the banks of Pampaa getting to meet Hanumaan
bhRRishamuditamanA:
Thou were greatly delighted
pAhi vAtAlayesha
protect O Lord of Guruvaayur!
---------
While searching for Seetaa, the dying Jataayu informed Thee that Raavana had abducted Seetaa and also had inflicted fatal wounds on him, when offered resistance.Thou performed the funeral rites of this friend Jataayu. On the way the monster Kabandha obstructed Thee and was killed. Thou then gave salvation to the ascetic woman Shabari and also got to meet Hanumaana on the banks of the river Pampaa, to Thy great delight. O Lord of Guruvaayur! protect me.

Narayaneeyam D035

Dashaka 35
---------
nItassugrIvamaitrIM tadanu hanumatA dundubhe: kAyamuchchai:
kShiptvA~NguShThena bhUyo luluvitha yugapat patriNA sapta sAlAn |
hatvA sugrIvaghAtodyatamatulabalaM bAlinaM vyAjavRRittyA
varShAvelAmanaiShIrvirahataralitastvaM mata~NgAshramAnte ||1||
---------
nIta:-sugrIva-maitrIM
having taken alliance with Sugreeva
tat-anu hanumatA
after that by Hanumaan
dundubhe: kAyam-
the corpse of Asura Dundubhi
uchchai: kShiptvA-a~NguShThena
having flung far away with Thy toe
bhUya: luluvitha yugapat
then (Thou) cut asunder
patriNA sapta sAlAn
by a single arrow seven Saala trees
hatvA sugrIva-ghAta-udyatam-
killed (the) eager to kill Sugreeva
atula-balaM bAlinaM
Baali who had incomparable strength
vyAjavRRityA
by using a strategy
varShA-velAm-anaiShI:-
(Thou) spent the rainy season
viraha-taralita:-tvaM
tormented by the pangs of separation (from Seeta)
mata~Nga-Ashrama-ante
near the Aashram of sage Matanga

Having taken alliance with Sugreeva which was brought about by Hanumaan, Thou flung far away the corpse of the Asura Dundubhi with Thy toe and also cut through seven Saala trees by a single arrow simultaneously, to demonstrate Thy strength to Sugreeva. Baali who was incomparable in strength and was eager to kill Sugreeva was killed by Thee by using a strategy. Thou then spent the rainy season tormented by the pangs of separation from Seetaa, near the hermitage of sage Matanga.
---------
sugrIveNAnujoktyA sabhayamabhiyatA vyUhitAM vAhinIM tA-
mRRikShANAM vIkShya dikShu drutamatha dayitAmArgaNAyAvanamrAm |
sandeshaM chA~NgulIyaM pavanasutakare prAdisho modashAlI
mArge mArge mamArge kapibhirapi tadA tvatpriyA saprayAsai: ||2||

sugrIveNa-anuja-uktyA
by Sugreeva, on Thy younger brother Lakshmanaa's admonitions
sabhayam-abhiyatA
in fear Thou were approached
vyUhitAM vAhinIM tAm-
and marshalled that army
RRikShANAM vIkShya
of monkeys, seeing
dikShu drutam-atha
in all directions quickly
dayitA-mArgaNAya-avanamrAm
to search for Thy wife, before Thee
saMdeshaM cha-a~NgulIyaM
a message and a signet ring
pavanasuta-kare prAdisha:
in Hanumaan's hands gave
modashAlI
Thou who were very delighted
mArge mArge mamArge
in all directions searched for
kapibhi:-api tadA
by the monkeys, even then
tvat-priyA saprayAsai:
Thy consort, with full effort
---------
When Thy younger brother Lakshmana admonished Sugreeva, he in fear approached Thee marshalling an army of monkeys, to search for Thy wife Seeta in all directions. Thou were delighted to see this and gave to Hanumaan who was standing before Thee, a message and a signet ring for Seetaa. The monkeys very diligently started on the mission to search for Thy consort Seeta.

tvadvArtAkarNanodyadgarudurujavasampAtisampAtivAkya-
prottIrNArNodhirantarnagari janakajAM vIkShya datvA~NgulIyam |
prakShudyodyAnamakShakShapaNachaNaraNa: soDhabandho dashAsyaM
dRRiShTvA pluShTvA cha la~NkAM jhaTiti sa hanumAn mauliratnaM dadau te ||3||
---------
tvat-vArtA-AkarNan-
Thy accounts hearing
udyat-garut-uru-java-
having grown wings with great speed
sampAti-sampAti-vAkya-
flies away (Sampaati), (and) by the words of that Sampaati
protIrNa-arNodhi:-antarnagari
(Hanumaan) jumped across the ocean in the city (of Lankaa)
janakajAM vIkShya
seeing Seetaa
datvA-a~NgulIyam
and giving the ring
prakShudya-udyAnam-
destroying the garden
akSha-kShapaNa-chaNa-raNa:
and killing Aksha in the famous battle
soDha-bandha:
put up with the bondage (of Brahmaastra)
dasha-AsyaM dRRiShTvA
and seeing the ten faced one (Raavana)
pluShTvA cha la~NkAm
and burning down Lanka
jhaTiti sa hanumAn
quickly that Hanumaan
mauliratnaM dadau te
gave to Thee the crest jewel (given by Seetaa)

On hearing Thy account Sampaati had grown fresh wings and flew away. As Sampaati had told him the whereabouts of Seetaa, Hanumaan jumped across the ocean and reached the city of Lankaa. There he saw Seetaa and gave her the ring, destroyed the garden, killed Aksha kumaar in the famous battle, and put up with the Brahmaastra bondage. Then he met the ten faced Raavana and burned down Lankaa. Hanumaan then quickly went to Thee and gave Thee the crest jewel sent by Seetaa.
---------
tvaM sugrIvA~NgadAdiprabalakapichamUchakravikrAntabhUmI-
chakro.abhikramya pArejaladhi nishicharendrAnujAshrIyamANa: |
tatproktAM shatruvArtAM rahasi nishamayan prArthanApArthyaroSha-
prAstAgneyAstratejastrasadudadhigirA labdhavAn madhyamArgam ||4||

tvaM sugrIva-a~Ngada-Adi-
Thou, Sugreeva, Angada and other
prabala-kapi-chamU-
warriors of the monkey army
chakra-vikrAnta-bhUmI-
who conquered the earth
chakra:-abhikramya
set out to cross
pAre-jaladhi
to the other side of the ocean
nishicharendra-anuja-
by the younger brother of the Asura king
AshrIyamANa:
who sought refuge in Thee
tat-proktAM shatru-vArtAM
as told by him, the information of the enemy
rahasi nishamayan
hearing in secret
prArthanA-ApArthya-
(when) the requests were in vain
roSha-prAsta-Agneya-astra-
in anger Thou sent the fire missile
teja:-trasat-udadhi-girA
in fright of its power, by the words of the ocean
labdhavAn madhyamArgaM
Thou got a way through (the ocean)
---------
Thou set out with a huge army of monkeys led by great warriors Sugreeva, Angad and others and conquering the whole earth reached the shore of the ocean. Raavana's younger brother Vibheeshana, crossed over to Thy side, and taking refuge in Thee, disclosed the secrets of the enemy which Thou heard in secret. When the requests made to the ocean deity were in vain, in anger Thou sent the fire missile to annihilate the waters of the ocean. Frightened by the power of the missile, as ordered by the ocean deity, Thou got a way through the ocean.

kIshairAshAntaropAhRRitagirinikarai: setumAdhApya yAto
yAtUnyAmardya daMShTrAnakhashikharishilAsAlashastrai: svasainyai: |
vyAkurvan sAnujastvaM samarabhuvi paraM vikramaM shakrajetrA
vegAnnAgAstrabaddha: patagapatigarunmArutairmochito.abhU: ||5||
---------
kIshai:-AshAntara-
by the monkeys from all the directions
upAhRRita-girinikarai:
brought groups of mountains
setum-AdhApya
a bridge getting built
yAta: yAtUni-Amardya
went (to Lanka), destroyed the Raakshasas
daMShTrA-nakha-shikhari-shilA-sAla-shastrai:
teeth, nails, mountains, rocks and trees having as weapons
svasainyai: vyAkurvan
with Thy armies displaying
sAnuja:-tvaM samara-bhuvi
with Thy brother in the battle field
paraM vikramaM
terrific prowess
shakrajetrA vegAt-nAgAstra-baddha:
by Indrajit soon tied down by Naagaastra
patagapati-
by Garuda's
garut-mArutai:-
force of wind of his wings
mochita:-abhU:
were (soon) released

The monkeys from all the quarters brought mountains and rocks by which Thou got a bridge built across Lanka.Crossing over Thy army of monkeys attacked the Raakshasas with teeth claws mountains rocks and palm trees as weapons. With Thy brother displaying terrific power in the battle field, Raavana's son Indrajit soon tied down Thy troops with Naagaastra. Garuda, Thy vehicle soon released them from that state by fanning them with his wings.
---------
saumitristvatra shaktiprahRRitigaladasurvAtajAnItashaila-
ghrANAt prANAnupeto vyakRRiNuta kusRRitishlAghinaM meghanAdam |
mAyAkShobheShu vaibhIShaNavachanahRRitastambhana: kumbhakarNaM
samprAptaM kampitorvItalamakhilachamUbhakShiNaM vyakShiNostvam ||6||

saumitri:-tu-atra
Lakshmana, there indeed
shakti-prahRRiti-
by the missile 'Shakti' being struck
galat-asu:-
was slipping off life
vAtaja-AnIta-
brought by Hanumaan
shaila-ghrANAt
the mountain (on which the herb grew) by smelling
prANAn-upeta: vyakRRiNuta
got his life back and killed
kusRRiti:-lAghinaM meghanAdam
the master of magical arts - Indrajit
mAyA-kShobheShu
disturbed by the magical powers of Raavana
vaibhIShaNa-vachana-hRRita-stambhana:
Thou were relieved from the stunning effect by Vibheeshana's words
kumbhakarNaM samprAptaM
Kumbhakarna, who had come
kampita-urvItalam-
making the earth tremble
akhila-chamU-bhakShiNaM
eating the whole army
vyakShiNo:-tvam
Thou killed
---------
The missile 'Shakti' sent by Raavana, struck Lakshmana who was slipping off life. He was revived by smelling the herb which grew on the mountain which was then brought by Hanumaan. After that Lakshmana killed the master of the magical arts Indrajit. Thou were disturbed by the magical powers of Raavana and were relieved from its stunning effects by Vibheeshana's words. Kumbhkarna who came to join the battle, made the earth tremble and was devouring the army of monkeys, was then killed by Thee.

gRRihNan jambhArisaMpreShitarathakavachau rAvaNenAbhiyuddhyan
brahmAstreNAsya bhindan galatatimabalAmagnishuddhAM pragRRihNan |
devashreNIvarojjIvitasamaramRRitairakShatai: RRikShasa~Nghai-
rla~NkAbhartrA cha sAkaM nijanagaramagA: sapriya: puShpakeNa ||7||
---------
gRRihNan
accepting
jambhAri-saMpreShita-ratha-kavachau
the chariot and armour sent by Indra
rAvaNena-abhiyuddhyan
fighting with Raavan
brahma-astreNa-
by the Brahmaastra
asya bhindan-galatatim-
his row of heads cutting off
abalAm-agnishuddhAM pragRRihNan
Seetaa purified by fire accepting
deva-shreNIvara-
by the Devas of high order
ujjIvita-samara-mRRitai:-
brought back to life who were killed in the battle
akShatai: RRikShasa~Nghai:-
who did not have any wounds, the host of monkeys
la~NkA-bhartrA cha sAkaM
and along with the king of Lanka (Vibheeshana)
nija-nagaram-agA:
to Thy own city returned
sapriya: puShpakeNa
with Seetaa in the (chariot) Pushpaka

Accepting the chariot and the armour sent by Indra, Thou fought with Raavana and cut off his row of heads by the Brahmaastra, and accepted Seetaa after she was purified by fire. The Devas of high order healed and revived the host of monkeys who were wounded and killed in the battle. Then along with the king of Lanka, Vibheeshana, and Thy consort Seetaa, Thou returned to Thy own city of Ayodhyaa in the chariot Pushpaka.
---------
prIto divyAbhiShekairayutasamadhikAn vatsarAn paryaraMsI-
rmaithilyAM pApavAchA shiva! shiva! kila tAM garbhiNImabhyahAsI: |
shatrughnenArdayitvA lavaNanishicharaM prArdaya: shUdrapAshaM
tAvadvAlmIkigehe kRRitavasatirupAsUta sItA sutau te ||8||

prIta: divya-abhiShekai:-
pleased with the coronation done with holy waters
ayuta-sama-adhikAn vatsarAn
for more than ten thousand years
paryaraMsI
ruled happily
maithilyAM pApa-vAchA
(pertaining) to Seetaa, because of the slander
shiva! shiva! kila
what a pity, indeed
tAM garbhiNIm-abhyahAsI:
her, who was pregnant, abandoned
shatrughnena-ardayitvA
by Shatrughna was killed
lavaNa-nishicharaM
Lavanaasura
prArdaya: shUdrapAshaM
(then Thou) killed the shudra ascetic
tAvat-vAlmIki-gehe
after that in Vaalmiki's Aashrama
kRRitavasati:-upAsUta sItA
who was living, Seetaa gave birth to
sutau te
Thy two sons
---------
Thou were pleased to be coronated with the holy waters and ruled happily for more than ten thousand years. Reacting to a scandalous gossip about Seetaa, Thou abandoned her in spite of her being pregnant. O what a pity. The Asura Lavanaasura was killed by Shatrughna and Thou killed the shudra ascetic. Thereafter, Seetaa who was living in Vaalmiki's aashrama gave birth to Thy two sons.

vAlmIkestvatsutodgApitamadhurakRRiterAj~nayA yaj~navATe
sItAM tvayyAptukAme kShitimavishadasau tvaM cha kAlArthito.abhU: |
heto: saumitrighAtI svayamatha sarayUmagnanishsheShabhRRityai:
sAkaM nAkaM prayAto nijapadamagamo deva vaikuNThamAdyam ||9||
---------
vAlmIke:-
Vaalmeeki
tvat-suta-udgApita-
then made Thy sons to sing
madhura-kRRite:-Aj~nayA
the beautiful composition, by his order
yaj~navATe
in the premises of the Yagya
sItAM tvayi-AptukAme
Thou were desirous to take back Seetaa
kShitim-avishat-asau
she disappeared into the Earth
tvaM cha kAla-arthita:-abhU:
and Thou were requested by Kaala Yama
heto: saumitri-ghAtI
for that reason Thou abandoned Lakshmana
svayam-atha sarayU-magna-
then Thou submerged in Saryu river
nishsheSha-bhRRityai: sAkaM
along with all the attendants
nAkaM prayAta:
going to Swarga
nija-padam-agama:
reached Thy abode
deva vaikuNTham-Adyam
O Lord! The eternal Vaikuntha

In the premises of the Yanjya by Vaalmeeki's order Thy sons sang the beautiful composition which was composed by him. Hearing it Raama was desirous of taking back Seetaa, but she disappeared into her mother Earth. At the request of the Kaala Yama to return to Thy abode Vaikunth, Thou first created reason to abandon Lakshmana and then Thou submerged in the river Saryu along with all Thy attendants. Then going to Swarga Thou reached Thy abode the eternal Vaikuntha.
---------
so.ayaM martyAvatArastava khalu niyataM martyashikShArthamevaM
vishleShArtirnirAgastyajanamapi bhavet kAmadharmAtisaktyA |
no chet svAtmAnubhUte: kva nu tava manaso vikriyA chakrapANe
sa tvaM sattvaikamUrte pavanapurapate vyAdhunu vyAdhitApAn ||10||

sa:-ayaM martya-avatAra:-tava
that this human embodiment of Thine
khalu niyataM
indeed happened
martya-shikShA-artham-evaM
for mankind as a lesson only
vishleSha-Arti:-
pangs of separation
nirAga:-tyajanam-api
(and) also abandoning of the innocent
bhavet
happen
kAma-dharma-atisaktyA
due to extreme addiction to attachment and Dharma (duty)
no chet
otherwise
sva-Atma-anubhUte:
(for Thee) who are established in self consciousness
kva nu tava manasa: vikriyA
how come Thy weakness of mind
chakrapANe
O Wielder of the Discuss!
sa tvaM satva-eka-mUrte
That Thou, the very embodiment of the Satvaguna
pavanapurapate
The Lord of Guruvaayur
vyAdhunu vyAdhi-tApAn
eradicate (my) sufferings from the disease
---------
As a lesson to the mankind this human embodiment of Thee happened. Pangs of separation are caused by extreme attachment, as also extreme addiction to Dharma may lead to the abandoning of the innocent. Otherwise for Thee who are established in self consciousness how can such a weakness of mind be explained. O Wielder of the Discuss! Thou That very embodiment of the Satva guna! O The Lord of Guruvayur! eradicate my sufferings from the disease.

Narayaneeyam D036

Dashaka 36
---------
atre: putratayA purA tvamanasUyAyAM hi dattAbhidho
jAta: shiShyanibandhatandritamanA: svasthashcharan kAntayA |
dRRiShTo bhaktatamena hehayamahIpAlena tasmai varA-
naShTaishvaryamukhAn pradAya daditha svenaiva chAnte vadham ||1||
---------
atre: putratayA
as the son of the sage Atri
purA tvam-
long ago, Thou
anasUyAyAM hi
to Anasooyaa indeed
datta-abhidha: jAta:
as Dattatreya was born
shiShya-nibandha
by Thy disciples' pesterings
tandrita-manA:
mentally tired
svastha:-charan kAntayA
(Thou) peacefully moved about with Thy wife
dRRiShTa: bhaktatamena
seen by the great devotee,
hehaya-mahIpAlena tasmai
the king of Hehayaa, (Kaartaviryaarjuna), to him
varAn-aShTa-aishvarya-mukhAn
the boons of the eight Sidhis
pradAya daditha
giving, also gave
svena-eva
by thyself alone
cha-ante vadham
in the end, death

Long ago Thou were born as Dattatreya to the sage Atri and Anasooyaa. Mentally tired by the pesterings of Thy various disciples, Thou wandered about with Thy wife immersed in blissful peace. Thus Thou were seen by the great devotee Kaartaviryaarjuna, the king of Hehaya. Pleased, Thou bestowed on him all psychic powers consisting of the eight Sidhis and also promised him death at Thy hands in the end.
---------
satyaM kartumathArjunasya cha varaM tachChaktimAtrAnataM
brahmadveShi tadAkhilaM nRRipakulaM hantuM cha bhUmerbharam |
sa~njAto jamadagnito bhRRigukule tvaM reNukAyAM hare
rAmo nAma tadAtmajeShvavaraja: pitroradhA: sammadam ||2||

satyaM kartum-
to fulfill
atha-arjunasya cha varaM
and then the boon given to Kaartviryaarjuna
tat-shakti-mAtrA-nataM
(who were) just a little bit subdued by his valour alone
brahnadveShi tat-akhilaM
who were impious, that whole
nRRipakulaM hantuM
the clan of kings to kill
cha bhUme:-bharam
and (who were) burden to the earth
sa~njAta: jamadagnita:
(Thou) were born of Jamadagni
bhRRigukule
in the line of Bhrigus
tvaM reNukAyAM
Thou to Renuka
hare
O Lord!
rAma: nAma
by the name Raama
tat-AtmajeShu
among his (Jamadgni,s) sons
avaraja:
as the youngest
pitro:-adhA: sammadam
to the parents gave great joy
---------
To fulfill the boon given to Kaartaviryaarjuna, Thou were born to Jamadagni and Renuka in the line of the Bhrigus, by the name Raama. Thou were the youngest among Jamadagni's sons and gave Thy parents great joy. Thy purpose to be born as Raama was also to kill the whole clan of kings who were very impious and were a burden on the earth, and were partly held in check only by Kaartaviryarjuna's valour.

labdhAmnAyagaNashchaturdashavayA gandharvarAje manA-
gAsaktAM kila mAtaraM prati pitu: krodhAkulasyAj~nayA |
tAtAj~nAtigasodarai: samamimAM ChitvA.atha shAntAt pitu-
steShAM jIvanayogamApitha varaM mAtA cha te.adAdvarAn ||3||
---------
labdha-AmnAyagaNa:-
gaining (the knowledge of) all the Vedas
chaturdasha-vayA
by the age of fourteen
gandharvarAje
in Gandharva king (Chitraratha)
manAk-AsaktAM kila
a little bit attached, indeed
mAtaraM prati
Thy mother, towards her
pitu: krodha-Akulasya-Aj~nayA
by Thy greatly enraged father's command
tAta-Aj~nAtiga-sodarai:
who did not carry out the father,s command, Thy brothers
samam-imAM ChitvA-
along with them, her cutting off
atha shAntAt pitu:
then, who had calmed down, Thy father, from him
teShAM jIvana yogam-Apitha varaM
their life, to be restored requested the boon
mAtA cha
and Thy mother also
te-adAt-varAn
gave Thee boons

By the age of fourteen years Thou acquired the knowledge of the Vedas. Thy father was greatly enraged with Thy mother who was a little bit attached to the Gandharva king Chitraratha. By the command of Thy father Thou cut of Thy mother's head and also of Thy brothers' as they had failed to carry out the same order of Thy father. After Thy father had calmed down, as a boon from him, Thou got to restore them to life. Thy mother also being pleased gave Thee boons.
---------
pitrA mAtRRimude stavAhRRitaviyaddhenornijAdAshramAt
prasthAyAtha bhRRigorgirA himagirAvArAdhya gaurIpatim |
labdhvA tatparashuM taduktadanujachChedI mahAstrAdikaM
prApto mitramathAkRRitavraNamuniM prApyAgama: svAshramam ||4||

pitrA mAtRRimude
by Thy father, for Thy mother's pleasure
stava-AhRRita-
by prayer was brought
viyat-dheno:-
the heavenly cow (Kaamdhenu)
nijAt-AshramAt
from Thy aashrama
prasthAya-atha
setting out then,
bhRRigo:-girA
on Bhrigu's words
himagirau-ArAdhya gaurIpatim
in the Himaalayaas, worshipping Shiva
labdhvA-tat-parashuM
got his battle axe
tat-ukta-danuja-ChedI
by him pointed out, that asura (Thou) killed
mahA-astrAdikaM prApta:
various divine missiles having got
mitram-atha-
as a friend
akRRit-vraNa-muniM
Akrit-vrana sage
prApya-agama: sva-Ashramam
getting, went to Thy aashrama
---------
To please Thy mother Renuka, Thy father Jamadagni, brought by prayer the heavenly cow Kaamdhenu to his aashrama. On the advice of Bhrigu, Thou set out from Thy aashrama to the Himaalayaa and worshipped Shiva. Thou were bestowed with his battle-axe and other various divine missiles, and killed the asura pointed out by him.Then making friends with sage Akritvrana, Thou returned to Thy aashrama.

AkheTopagato.arjuna: suragavIsamprAptasampadgaNai-
stvatpitrA paripUjita: puragato durmantrivAchA puna: |
gAM kretuM sachivaM nyayu~Nkta kudhiyA tenApi rundhanmuni-
prANakShepasaroShagohatachamUchakreNa vatso hRRita: ||5||
---------
AkheTa-upagata:-arjuna:
for hunting who had come, Kaartaveeryaarjuna,
suragavI-samprApta-sampadgaNai:-
by the celestial cow getting the various riches
tvat-pitrA paripUjita:
by Thy father well entertained
pura-gata: durmantri-vAchA
returned to his town, by the ill advice
puna: gAM kretuM
again, the cow to buy
sachivaM nyayu~Nkta
appointed his minister
kudhiyA tena-
by the evil minded him
api rundhan-
even as he was obstructing
muni-prANa-kShepa
the sage was killed
saroSha-go-
the enraged cow
hata-chamU-chakreNa
killed (by the soldiers emerging from her) the whole army
vatsa: hRRita:
(but) the calf was stolen

The king Kiraatarjuna came hunting to the forest and was treated well by Thy father with the riches and luxuries obtained from the celestial cow Kaamadhenu. When the king returned to his town, he was ill advised by his ministers to buy the cow. The king sent an emissary for the purpose and as Thy father, the sage tried to resist his taking away of the cow, he was killed. Several warriors emerged from the furious divine cow and destroyed the whole army. But the calf was stolen.
---------
shukrojjIvitatAtavAkyachalitakrodho.atha sakhyA samaM
bibhraddhyAtamahodaropanihitaM chApaM kuThAraM sharAn |
ArUDha: sahavAhayantRRikarathaM mAhiShmatImAvishan
vAgbhirvatsamadAshuShi kShitipatau samprAstuthA: sa~Ngaram ||6||

shukra-ujjIvita
by Shukra (who was) brought back to life
tAta-vAkya
by Thy father's words
chalita-krodha:-atha
Thou whose anger increased,then
sakhyA samaM vibhrat
with Thy friends shining
dhyAta-mahodara-upanihitaM
meditated upon Mahodara, (from him) brought
chApaM kuThAraM sharAn
bow, battle-axe and arrows
ArUDha: saha-vAha-yantRRika rathaM
boarding, with horses and the charioteer the chariot
mAhiShmatIm-Avishan
Maahishmati entering
vAgbhi:-vatsam-
by words, the calf
adAshuShi kShitipatau
did not give back, when the king
samprAstuthA: sa~Naram
started the battle
---------
Thy father was brought back to life by Shukraachaarya. When Thy father related the whole incident Thou were very angry. With Thy friend Akritavrana Thou meditated upon Mahodara who then equipped Thee with bow, arrows and the battle axe. Boarding the chariot with the horses and the charioteer, Thou entered Maahishmati. Even when the king was requested, he did not give the calf back, Thou started the battle.

putrANAmayutena saptadashabhishchAkShauhiNIbhirmahA-
senAnIbhiranekamitranivahairvyAjRRimbhitAyodhana: |
sadyastvatkakuThArabANavidalannishsheShasainyotkaro
bhItipradrutanaShTashiShTatanayastvAmApatat hehaya: ||7||
---------
putrANAm-ayutena
with sons ten thousand sons
saptadashabhi:-cha-akShauhiNIbhi:-
and seventeen Akshauhini (armies)
mahA-senAnIbhi:-
great commanders
aneka-mitra-nivahai:-
and numerous friends
vyAjRRimbhita-Ayodhana:
fiercely fighting the battle
sadya:-tvatka-
soon by Thy
kuThAra-bANa-vidalan-
battle-axe and arrows destroying
nishsheSha-sainya-utkara:
(whose) entire army
bhIti-pradruta-
of fear who had fled
naShTa-shiShTa-tanaya:
and so were saved from being killed, with these left over sons
tvAm-Apatat
Thee attacked
hehaya:
the king of Hehaya, i.e., Kartaveeryaarjuna

Kaartveerya with his ten thousand sons and seventeen Akshauhini armies and numerous friends and great commanders fiercely fought the battle. Soon by Thy battle axe and arrows the entire army was destroyed and all his sons were killed except those who had fled in fright. The king of Hehaya then attacked Thee.
---------
lIlAvAritanarmadAjalavalalla~NkeshagarvApaha-
shrImadbAhusahasramuktabahushastrAstraM nirundhannamum |
chakre tvayyatha vaiShNave.api viphale buddhvA hariM tvAM mudA
dhyAyantaM ChitasarvadoShamavadhI: so.agAt paraM te padam ||8||

lIlA-vArita
cleverly impounded
narmadA jala
the river Narmadaa's waters
valat
almost drowning (by releasing the waters suddenly)
la~Nkesha-garva-apaha-
Raavana, and his pride destroying
shrImat-
O! Thyself
bAhu-sahasra-mukta
by his thousand arms who wielded
bahu-shastra-astraM
innumerable weapons
nirundhan-amum
blocking him ((Kaartveeryaarjuna)
chakre tvayi-atha
the discus used on Thee, then
vaiShNave-api viphale
even the Vaishnava (discus) was powerless
buddhvA hariM tvAm
knowing Thee as Hari
mudA dhyAyantaM
with joy, meditating
Chita-sarva-doSham-
(he whose) all sins were purified
avadhI: sa:-agAt
Thou killed, and he went
paraM te padam
to Thy Supreme abode
---------
Kaartaveerya had once with his thousand arms cleverly impounded the waters of the river Narmadaa, and almost drowning Raavana had destroyed his pride who was meditating on the banks downstream. That Kaartaveerya, wielded various weapons with those thousand arms and finding the Vaishnava discus also powerless against Thee, knew Thee to be Hari, and with joy meditated upon Thee. Then, he whose sins were purified, was killed by Thee and he went to Thy Supreme abode.

bhUyo.amarShitahehayAtmajagaNaistAte hate reNukA-
mAghnAnAM hRRidayaM nirIkShya bahusho ghorAM pratij~nAM vahan |
dhyAnAnItarathAyudhastvamakRRithA vipradruha: kShatriyAn
dikchakreShu kuThArayan vishikhayan ni:kShatriyAM medinIm ||9||
---------
bhUya:-amarShita-
thereafter greatly angered
hehaya-Atmaja-gaNai:-
by the king of Hehaya's sons
tAte hate
(when) Thy father was killed
reNukAm-AghnAnAM hRRidayaM
Renuka was beating her breast
nirIkShya bahusha:
seeing many times
ghorAM pratij~nAM vahan
taking a terrible vow
dhyAna-AnIta-
by meditation brought
ratha-Ayudha:-tvam-akRRithA
chariot and weapons Thou made
vipra-druha: kShatriyAn
the enemies of Brahmins, the Kshatriyas
dik-chakreShu kuThArayan
in all the quarters fighting with battle axe
vishikhayan ni:kShatriyAm
rendering devoid of Kshatriyaas
medinIm
the earth

Thereafter the sons of the king of Hehaya were in great rage and killed Thy father. Grieved at this Thy mother Renuka was wailing and beating her breast many times, seeing this Thou took a terrible vow. Thou then got the chariot and weapon by meditation and fought against the Kshatriyaas who were enemies of the Brahmins. With the battle axe Thou killed the Kshatriyaas in all the quarters and rendered the earth devoid of them.
---------
tAtojjIvanakRRinnRRipAlakakulaM trissaptakRRitvo jayan
santarpyAtha samantapa~nchakamahAraktahRRidaughe pitRRin
yaj~ne kShmAmapi kAshyapAdiShu dishan sAlvena yudhyan puna:
kRRiShNo.amuM nihaniShyatIti shamito yuddhAt kumArairbhavAn ||10||

tAta-ujjIvanakRRit-
Thy father reviving
nRRipAlaka-kulaM
the tribe of Kshatriyaas
tri:-sapta-kRRitva: jayan
thrice seven times (21) defeating
santarpya-atha
performing tarpana then
samanta-pa~nchaka-mahArakta-hRRidaughe
in Samant-Panchaka, the vast lake of blood,
pitRRin yaj~ne
to the ancestors , in sacrifice
kShmAm-api kAshyapa-AdiShu
the land also, to Kaashyapa and other Rishis
dishan sAlvena yudhyan puna:
giving away, with Saalva fighting again
kRRiShNa:-amum-nihaniShyati-
Krishna will kill him
iti shamita: yuddhAt
thus restrained from the fight
kumArai: bhavAn
by the Sanat kumaaras, Thou (were)
---------
Thy father was revived and Thou defeated the clan of kings twenty one times. Thou then performed tarpana to the ancestors in the vast lake of blood named Samant Panchaka. In the sacrifice Thou also gave away land to Kaashyapa and other Rishis. Thou fighting again with Saalva, refrained, on being restrained by Sanata Kumaars who told Thee that he was destined to be killed by Krishna.

nyasyAstrANi mahendrabhUbhRRiti tapastanvan punarmajjitAM
gokarNAvadhi sAgareNa dharaNIM dRRiShTvArthitastApasai: |
dhyAteShvAsadhRRitAnalAstrachakitaM sindhuM sruvakShepaNA-
dutsAryoddhRRitakeralo bhRRigupate vAtesha saMrakSha mAm ||11||
---------
nyasya-astrANi
abandoning all weapons
mahendra-bhUbhRRiti
on the Mahendra mountain
tapa:-tanvan
penance performing
puna:-majjitAM
thereafter submerged
gokarNa-avadhi
up to Gokarna
sAgareNa dharaNIM dRRiShTvA-
by the sea, the earth seeing
arthita:-tApasai: dhyAta-
requested by the sages by meditation
iShvAsa-dhRRita-anala-astra-
the bow bearing the fire missile
chakitaM sindhum
the frightened ocean
sruva-kShepaNAt-
by the throwing of the ladle
utsArya-uddhRRita-kerala:
pushing back, scooped out Kerala
bhRRigupate vAtesha
O! Bhrigupati (Parashuraama), the Lord of Guruvaayur!
saMrakSha mAm
protect me

Abandoning all weapons, Thou resorted to the Mahendra mountain for meditation, practicing penance. Finding the land up to Gokarna submerged in the sea, on the request of the sages, who meditated upon Thee, Thou frightened the ocean with the bow bearing fire missile. By throwing a sacrificial ladle Thou pushed back the sea and scooped out the land of Kerala. O Bhrigupati Parashuraama! The Lord of Guruvaayur! Deign to protect me.

Narayaneeyam D037

Dashaka 37
---------
sAndrAnandatano hare nanu purA daivAsure sa~Ngare
tvatkRRittA api karmasheShavashato ye te na yAtA gatim |
teShAM bhUtalajanmanAM ditibhuvAM bhAreNa dUrArditA
bhUmi: prApa viri~nchamAshritapadaM devai: puraivAgatai: ||1||
---------
sAndra-Ananda-tano
condensed bliss incarnate
hare nanu purA
O Lord! Even long ago
daiva-asure sa~Ngare
in the battle between the Devas and the Asuras
tvat-kRRittA api
even though slain by Thee
karma-sheSha-vashata: ye
because of their residual Karma, those who
te na yAtA gatim
they did not attain liberation
teShAM bhUtala-janmanAM
and so on this earth were born
ditibhUvAM bhAreNa
of those Asuras (by their) burden
dUrArditA bhUmi:
the tormented earth
prApa viri~ncham-Ashrita-padaM
approached Brahmaa and sought refuge
devai: purA-eva-Agatai:
the Devas had already reached (there)

O Lord Hari! Condensed bliss incarnate! Long ago, in the battle between the Devas and Asuras, some of the Asuras, even though slain by Thee,did not get liberation because of their residual Karmas. So they were born again on the earth. Mother earth being very much tormented by their burden sought refuge in Brahmaa and reached his abode, where the Devas had already gone.
---------
hA hA durjanabhUribhAramathitAM pAthonidhau pAtukA-
metAM pAlaya hanta me vivashatAM sampRRichCha devAnimAn |
ityAdiprachurapralApavivashAmAlokya dhAtA mahIM
devAnAM vadanAni vIkShya parito dadhyau bhavantaM hare ||2||

hA hA
Alas!
durjana-bhUri-bhAra-mathitAM
by the wicked peoples' immense weight, crushed
pAthonidhau pAtukAm-
into the ocean , about to fall
etAM pAlaya hanta
this (me) protect, pray!
me vivashatAM sampRRichCha
(about) my helplessness ask
devAn-imAn iti-Adi
these Devas, in this manner
prachura-pralApa-vivashAm-
much lamenting and helpless
Alokya dhAtA mahIM
seeing the earth, Brahmaa
devAnAm vadanAni vIkShya
and also of the Devas' faces, seeing
parita:
(who had) assembled all around
dadhyau bhavantaM
meditated on Thee
hare
O Lord!
---------
Crushed by the immense weight of the evil minded people and about to fall in the ocean of the causal waters, this me please protect. Ask the Devas here of my plight,' the Earth lamented. O Lord! Seeing the Earth in such a helpless state and also looking at the faces of the Devas, who had assembled there, Brahmaa meditated on Thee.

Uche chAmbujabhUramUnayi surA: satyaM dharitryA vacho
nanvasyA bhavatAM cha rakShaNavidhau dakSho hi lakShmIpati: |
sarve sharvapurassarA vayamito gatvA payovAridhiM
natvA taM stumahe javAditi yayu: sAkaM tavAketanam ||3||
---------
Uche cha-ambujabhU:-
and said Brahmaa
amUn-ayi surA:
to them , O Devas
satyaM dharitryA vacha:
true are the Earth's words
nanu-asyA bhavatAM cha
indeed hers and yours
rakShaNa-vidhau
in the matter of protection
dakSha: hi lakShmIpati:
capable alone is Maha Vishnu
sarve sharva-pura:-sarA
all of us led by Shiva
vayam-ita: gatvA
we, from here going
paya:-vAridhiM
to the Milk Ocean
natvA taM stumahe javAt-
will prostrate before him and sing his praises, quickly
iti yayu: sAkaM
together (they) went
tava-Aketanam
to Thy abode

Presently, the lotus born Brahmaa said to the Devas that what the Mother Earth was saying was indeed true. In the matter of the protection of the Devas and the Earth, Maha Vishnu alone was capable. So all of them and Brahmaa, led by Shiva would quickly go from there to the Milk Ocean and prostrate before Him and sing hymns of his prise. So together they went to Thy abode.
---------
te mugdhAnilashAlidugdhajaladhestIraM gatA: sa~NgatA
yAvattvatpadachintanaikamanasastAvat sa pAthojabhU: |
tvadvAchaM hRRidaye nishamya sakalAnAnandayannUchivA-
nAkhyAta: paramAtmanA svayamahaM vAkyaM tadAkarNyatAm ||4||

te
they
mugdha-anila-shAli-
(to the ocean) a pleasant breeze comprising of
dugdha-jaladhe: tIraM
to the Milk Ocean's shores
gatA: sa~NgatA yAvat-
went, (and when they were) together standing
tvat-pada-chintana-eka-manasa:-
and when on Thy feet their minds were fixed and meditating
tAvat sa pAthojabhU:
then that lotus born Brahmaa
tvat-vAcham hRRidaye nishamya
Thy words, in his own heart, hearing
sakalAn-Anandayan-
making everyone happy,
UchivAn-AkhyAta:
said, '(I) have been told
paramAtmanA svayam-
by the supreme Lord Himself
ahaM vAkyaM
I (have been told) the words,
tat-AkarNyatAm
which please listen'
---------
They together went to the shore of the Milk Ocean where a pleasant breeze was blowing. As they stood there with their minds fixed on Thy feet, meditating, the lotus born Brahmaa in his own heart heard Thy words. Making everyone happy, he told them that he had been spoken to by the Supreme Lord Himself, and asked them to listen to those words.

jAne dInadashAmahaM diviShadAM bhUmeshcha bhImairnRRipai-
statkShepAya bhavAmi yAdavakule so.ahaM samagrAtmanA |
devA vRRiShNikule bhavantu kalayA devA~NganAshchAvanau
matsevArthamiti tvadIyavachanaM pAthojabhUrUchivAn ||5||
---------
jAne dIna-dashAm-ahaM
(I) know the sad state
diviShadAM bhUme:-cha
of the gods and of the earth
bhImai:-nRRipai:-
(caused) by cruel kings
tat-kShepAya
for its removal
bhavAmi yAdava-kule
(I) shall be born in the Yaadava clan
sa:-aham samagra-AtmanA
that Me with all My powers
devA: vRRiShNikule bhavantu
the gods, in the Vrishni clan, may be born
kalayA
as part incarnation
devA~NganA:-cha-avanau
and also the wives of the Devas, on the earth
mat-sevA-artham-
to serve me
iti tvadIya-vachanam
thus Thy words
pAthojabhU:-UchivAn
Brahmaa told

"I know the sad state of the gods and of the Earth caused by the cruel kings. For its removal I shall be born in the Yaadava clan with all My powers (as a complete incarnation). The gods may be born in the Vrishni clan as part incarnation, and the wives of the Devas also will be born on the Earth to serve me." Thus Thy words Brahmaa told to the Devas and the Earth.
---------
shrutvA karNarasAyanaM tava vacha: sarveShu nirvApita-
svAnteShvIsha gateShu tAvakakRRipApIyUShatRRiptAtmasu |
vikhyAte madhurApure kila bhavatsAnnidhyapuNyottare
dhanyAM devakanandanAmudavahadrAjA sa shUrAtmaja: ||6||

shrutvA karNa-rasAyanam
hearing the (words), to the ears nectar like
tava vacha: sarveShu
Thy words
nirvApita-svAnteShu-
all of them whose minds were freed from sorrow
Isha gateShu
O Lord! (they) having gone
tAvaka-kRRipA-
Thy compassion
pIyUSha-tRRipta-Atmasu
nectar like satiated them
vikhyAte madhurApure kila
in the famous city of Mathura, it is said,
bhavat-sAnnidhya-puNya-uttare
by Thy presence made more sacred
dhanyAM devakanandanAm-
the virtuous daughter of Devak
udvahat-rAjA sa
married that king
shUrAtmaja:
the son of Shoorasena
---------
Hearing Thy compassionate message which was like nectar to their ears they all went away with their minds freed from sorrow, highly delighted and satiated with Thy sweet words. In the famous city of Mathura which is said to be made more sacred by Thy ever presence there, Devaki, the virtuous daughter of Devaka married the king Vasudeva, the son of Shoorasena.

udvAhAvasitau tadIyasahaja: kaMso.atha sammAnaya-
nnetau sUtatayA gata: pathi rathe vyomotthayA tvadgirA |
asyAstvAmatiduShTamaShTamasuto hanteti hanterita:
santrAsAt sa tu hantumantikagatAM tanvIM kRRipANImadhAt ||7||
---------
udvAh-avasitau
when the marriage ceremony was over
tadIya-sahaja: kaMsa:-atha
her (Devaki's) brother, Kansa then
sammAnayan-etau
honouring these two (the couple)
sUtatayA gata: pathi rathe
as a charioteer went on the road, in the chariot
vyoma-utthayA tvat-girA
rising in the sky, by Thy voice
asyA:-tvAm-ati-duShTam-
her, you who are very wicked
aShTama-suta: hantA-iti
eighth son will be the killer, thus
hanta-Irita:
alas, was spoken
santrAsat sa tu
out of great fear, he then
hantum-antikagatAM tanvIM
to kill, who was near by, the beautiful lady
kRRipANIm-adhAt
the sword , took

When the marriage ceremony was over Devaki's brother Kansa, in order to honour the couple became their charioteer and took to the road in the chariot. Rising from the sky Thy voice said, "You who are very wicked will be killed by her eighth son." Alas! Thus spoken, out of great fear, he then drew his sword to kill the beautiful lady who was near by.
---------
gRRihNAnashchikureShu tAM khalamati: shaureshchiraM sAntvanai-
rno mu~nchan punarAtmajArpaNagirA prIto.atha yAto gRRihAn |
AdyaM tvatsahajaM tathA.arpitamapi snehena nAhannasau
duShTAnAmapi deva puShTakaruNA dRRiShTA hi dhIrekadA ||8||

gRRihNAna:-chikureShu tAm
catching hold of her by the hair
khalamati:
the evil minded one (Kansa)
shaure:-chiraM sAntvanai:
by Shauri's (Vasudeva's) repeated conciliatory words
no mu~nchan puna:-
not releasing, again then
Atmaja-arpaNa-girA
his children offering to surrender, by these words
prIta:-atha yAta: gRRihAn
satisfied (he) then went home
AdyaM tvat-sahajam
the first born, Thy brother
tathA-arpitam-api
accordingly, though surrendered
snehena na-ahan-asau
out of love,did not kill, this (Kansa)
duShTAnam-api deva
even in the wicked (people), O Lord!
puShTa-karuNA
great compassion
dRRiShTA hi dhI:-ekadA
is indeed seen in the heart, once in a while
---------
The evil minded Kansa who had caught hold of Devaki by her hair did not release her in spite of the repeated conciliatory words of Shauri (Vasudeva). Then at the offer of Vasudeva to surrender his children, he was satisfied and went home. The first born Thy brother, though handed over to Kansa as promised, he did not kill the child out of love. For, O Lord! even wicked people are found to be very compassionate in the heart, once in a while.

tAvattvanmanasaiva nAradamuni: proche sa bhojeshvaraM
yUyaM nanvasurA: surAshcha yadavo jAnAsi kiM na prabho |
mAyAvI sa harirbhavadvadhakRRite bhAvI suraprArthanA-
dityAkarNya yadUnadUdhunadasau shaureshcha sUnUnahan ||9||
---------
tAvat-tvat-manasA-eva
at that time by Thy will alone
nArada muni:
sage Naarada
proche sa bhojeshvaraM
he told the king of Bhoja (Kansa)
yUyaM nanu-asurA:
you all are indeed Asuras
surA:-cha yAdava:
and Yaadavas are Devas
jAnAsi kiM na prabho
do you not know O King!
mAyAvI sa hari:-
that master of Maayaa, Hari,
bhavat-vadha kRRite
for your killing
bhAvI sura-prArthanAt-
will be born by Devas' prayer
iti-AkarNya
this hearing
yadUn-adUdhunat-asau
the Yadus, drove out that (Kansa)
shaure:-cha sUnUn-ahan
and Vasudeva's sons killed

At that time, prompted by Thy will alone Naarada Muni told to the king of Bhoja, Kansa, that did he not know that his clan was of Asuras, whereas, the Yaadavas were Devas. Hari, the master of the Maayaa, will be born to kill him, as result of the prayers of the Devas. Hearing this, Kansa drove out the Yadavaas and killed the sons of Vasudeva.
---------
prApte saptamagarbhatAmahipatau tvatpreraNAnmAyayA
nIte mAdhava rohiNIM tvamapi bho:sachchitsukhaikAtmaka: |
devakyA jaTharaM viveshitha vibho saMstUyamAna: surai:
sa tvaM kRRiShNa vidhUya rogapaTalIM bhaktiM parAM dehi me ||10||

prApte saptama-garbhatAm-
entered (the womb of Devaki) at the seventh pregnancy
ahipatau
when the king of serpents (Aadishesha)
tvat-preraNAt-
by Thy prompting
mAyayA nIte
by Yoga Maayaa was taken away
mAdhava rohiNIM
O Maadhava! To Rohini's (womb)
tvam-api bho:-
Thou also O!
sat-chit-sukha-eka-Atmaka:
who are Existence Consciousness and Bliss in one soul
devakyA jaTharaM viveshitha
in Devaki's womb entered
vibho saMstUyamAna: surai:
O Lord! Being well praised by the Devas
sa tvaM kRRiShNa
That Thou O Krishna
vidhUya roga-paTalIm
removing the host of ailments
bhaktiM parAM dehi me
supreme devotion bestow to me
---------
At the seventh pregnancy when the king of serpents, Aadishesha entered the womb of Devaki, by Thy prompting, the foetus was transferred to the womb of Rohini by Yoga Maaya. O Maadhava, Thou also who are Existence Consciousness and Bliss alone, entered in Devaki's womb, being well prised by the Devas. O Lord! That Thou O Krishna! removing the host of ailments, bestow to me supreme devotion.

Narayaneeyam D038

Dashaka 38
---------
AnandarUpa bhagavannayi te.avatAre
prApte pradIptabhavada~NganirIyamANai: |
kAntivrajairiva ghanAghanamaNDalairdyA-
mAvRRiNvatI viruruche kila varShavelA ||1||
---------
Ananda-rUpa
Bliss personified
bhagavan-ayi
O Lord! Thou
te-avatAre prApte
(when) Thy incarnation approached
pradIpta-bhavat-a~Nga-
lustrous Thy body
nirIyamANai:
emanating
kAnti-vrajai:-iva
rays of brilliance like
ghanAghana-maNDalai:-
by groups of thick dark clouds
dyAm-AvRRiNvatI
the skies covering
viruruche kila varShavelA
shone indeed the rainy season

Thou O Lord! Who are Bliss personified, when the time of Thy incarnation approached, the rainy season indeed shone with the lustre of Thy body, which emanated the blue rays of brilliance on the thick dark clouds that covered the skies.
---------
AshAsu shItalatarAsu payodatoyai-
rAshAsitAptivivasheShu cha sajjaneShu |
naishAkarodayavidhau nishi madhyamAyAM
kleshApahastrijagatAM tvamihAvirAsI: ||2||

AshAsu
(when) all the directions
shItalatarAsu
had been cooled well
payodatoyai:-
by the rain waters
AshAsita-
what was desired for
Apti-vivasheShu
(when) it was got, overwhelmed (by it)
cha sajjaneShu
by the good people
naishAkara-udaya-vidhau
and when the moon was rising
nishi madhyamAyAM
at midnight
kleshApaha:- trijagatAM
the Remover of the sorrows of the three worlds
tvam-
Thou
iha-AvirAsI:
here ( on this earth) did appear
---------
When all the directions had been well cooled by the rain waters, when the virtuous people were overwhelmed with the joy of the impending fulfillment of their desires, and the moon was rising at midnight, Thou the remover of all sorrows, appeared here on this earth, embodied as Krishna.

bAlyaspRRishA.api vapuShA dadhuShA vibhUtI-
rudyatkirITakaTakA~NgadahArabhAsA |
sha~NkhArivArijagadAparibhAsitena
meghAsitena parilesitha sUtigehe ||3||
---------
bAlya-spRRishA-api
though in the form of a child
vapuShA
by body
dadhuShA vibhUtI:-
Thou adorned the divine majesties
udyat-kirITa-
shining crown
kaTaka-a~Ngada-
bracelets, shoulder ornaments
hAr bhAsA
beautiful necklace
sha~Nkha-ari-
conch, discus
vArija-gadA
lotus mace
paribhAsitena meghAsitena
beautiful like the hue of rain bearing blue clouds
parilesitha
Thou shone
sUti gehe
in the birth chamber

Thou shone in the birth chamber, though in the from of a child, with Thy body adorned with the divine majesties, shining crown, bracelets, shoulder ornaments, beautiful necklace, conch, discus, lotus, mace, beautiful as the hue of the rain bearing clouds.
---------
vakSha:sthalIsukhanilInavilAsilakShmI-
mandAkShalakShitakaTAkShavimokShabhedai: |
tanmandirasya khalakaMsakRRitAmalakShmI-
munmArjayanniva virejitha vAsudeva ||4||

vakSha:-sthalI-
on Thy bosom
sukha-nilIna-
comfortably resting
vilAsi-lakShmI-
the glorious Lakshmi
manda-akSha-lakShita-
casting with shyful eyes
kaTAkSha-vimokSha-bhedai:
the side-glances glancing
tat-mandirasya
of that house (the prison)
khala-kaMsa-kRRitAm-alakShmIm-
the inauspiciousness caused by the evil Kansa
unmArjayan-iva
dispersing away ,as though
virejitha vAsudeva
Thou did shine O Vaasudeva!
---------
O Vaasudeva! Thou did shine in that prison house with the glorious Lakshmi Devi comfortably resting on Thy bosom. The side glances of varied graces, with shyful eyes, cast by her, dispersed away the inauspiciousness of the prison caused by the wicked Kansa.

shauristu dhIramunimaNDalachetaso.api
dUrasthitaM vapurudIkShya nijekShaNAbhyAm ||
AnandavAShpapulakodgamagadgadArdra-
stuShTAva dRRiShTimakarandarasaM bhavantam ||5||
---------
shauri:-tu
Vasudeva indeed,
dhIra-muni-maNDala-
the group of sages
chetasa:-api
to their minds also
dUrasthitaM
unapproachable
vapu:-udIkShya
Thy form, on seeing
nija-IkShaNAbhAm
by his own eyes
Ananda-vAShpa-
(with) tears of joy
pulaka-udgama-
horripilation
gada-gada-Ardra:-
choked and melting voice
tuShTAva dRRiShTi-
sang Thy praises, for the sight (Thou who are)
makaranda-rasam bhavantam
nectar-like as for the bee.

Thy form which is unapproachable to the minds of many aspiring sages, when Vasudeva saw with his own eyes, he had horripilation all over his body, his eyes were full of tears of joy and with a choked and melting voice he sang Thy prises, whose sight is like nectar honey for the bee like eyes.
---------
deva prasIda parapUruSha tApavallI-
nirlUnadAtrasamanetrakalAvilAsin |
khedAnapAkuru kRRipAgurubhi: kaTAkShai-
rityAdi tena muditena chiraM nuto.abhU: ||6||

deva prasIda
O Lord! Be pleased
parapUruSha
O Supreme being!
tApavallI-
the creeper of all sorrows
nirlUna-dAtra-sama-
cutting down with sharp sword like
netra-kalA-vilAsin
with playful eyes
khedAn-apAkuru
remove all sufferings
kRRipA-gurubhi: kaTAkShai:-
laden with compassion, by the side glances
ityAdi tena muditena
thus by him (Vasudeva), who was filled with joy
chiraM nuto-abhU:
for a long time, Thou were praised
---------
Thou were praised with prayers for a long time by Vasudeva who was filled with joy, saying that 'O Lord! cut down the creeper of all my sorrows with Thy sharp sword like playful eyes. O Supreme Being! Remove all my sufferings with Thy side glances laden with compassion.'

mAtrA cha netrasalilAstRRitagAtravalyA
stotrairabhiShTutaguNa: karuNAlayastvam |
prAchInajanmayugalaM pratibodhya tAbhyAM
mAturgirA dadhitha mAnuShabAlaveSham ||7||
---------
mAtrA cha netra-salila-
and by Thy mother's (Devaki), tears
AstRRita-gAtra-valyA
was covered well the body delicate creeper like
stotrai:-abhiShTuta-guNa:
by hymns (Thee whose) excellences were praised
karuNAlaya:- tvam
Thou the abode of mercy
prAchIna-janma-yugalaM
(about) their two previous births
pratibodhya tAbhyAM
explained the two of them
mAtu:-girA dadhitha
at the request of Thy mother assumed
mAnuSha-bAla-veSham
the form of a human child

And by Thy mother Devaki's tears whose delicate creeper like body was covered and made wet , Thy excellences were praised by hymns. Thou, the abode of mercy, then explained to them,Thy parents, about their two previous births. Then at the request of Thy mother Devaki, Thou assumed the form of a human infant child.
---------
tvatpreritastadanu nandatanUjayA te
vyatyAsamArachayituM sa hi shUrasUnu: |
tvAM hastayoradhRRita chittavidhAryamAryai-
rambhoruhasthakalahaMsakishoraramyam ||8||

tvat-prerita:-tadanu
by Thee prompted, then
nanda-tanUjayA
with the daughter of Nanda
te vyatyAsam-Arachayitum
Thy inter-exchange to carry out
sa hi shUrasUnu:
indeed, he the son of Shoorasena (Vasudeva)
tvAM hasthayo:-adhRRita
Thee in his two hands took
chitta-vidhAryam-Aryai:-
by the minds of the sages conceivable only (as though)
ambhoruha-stha-
on a lotus sitting
kala-haMsa-kishora-ramyam
a swan young and beautiful
---------
At Thy prompting, in order to bring about Thy inter-exchanging with the daughter of Nanda, the son of Shoorasena Vasudeva took Thee in his two hands. Thou who can only be conceived in the minds of the sages, in Vasudeva's hands looked like an attractive young swan perched on a lotus.

jAtA tadA pashupasadmani yoganidrA |
nidrAvimudritamathAkRRita pauralokam |
tvatpreraNAt kimiva chitramachetanairyad-
dvArai: svayaM vyaghaTi sa~NghaTitai: sugADham ||9||
---------
jAtA tadA
was born then
pashupa-sadmani
in the house of the cowherd (Nanda)
yoga-nidrA
Yoga-Maayaa
nidrA-vimudritam-
in deep slumber
atha-akRRita paura-lokam
thereafter, caused the people of the region
tvat-preraNAt
at Thy behest
kim-iva chitram-
what is so surprising in this
achetanai:-yat-dvArai:
when the inanimate doors
svayaM vyaghaTi
opened by themselves
sa~NghaTitai: sugADham
which were closed very well

Thereafter, at Thy behest, Yoga-Maayaa, who was born in the house of Nandagopa, caused all the people in the region to fall into deep slumber. This is not at all surprising, considering that the well locked inanimate doors of the prison opened by themselves.
---------
sheSheNa bhUriphaNavAritavAriNA.atha
svairaM pradarshitapatho maNidIpitena |
tvAM dhArayan sa khalu dhanyatama: pratasthe
so.ayaM tvamIsha mama nAshaya rogavegAn ||10||

sheSheNa bhUri-phaNa-vArita
by Aadi Shesha's many hoods the warded off (waters)
vAriNA-atha svairam
the waters then comfortably
pradarshita-patha:
led along the way
maNi-dIpitena
enlightened by the gems (on the hood of Aadi Shesha)
tvAM dhArayan
carrying Thee
sa khalu dhanyatama:
indeed he the most blessed one
pratasthe
set out
sa:-ayaM tvam-Isha
That This Thou O Lord!
mama nAshaya rogA-vegAn
eradicate the force of my ailments
---------
He, Vasudeva, the most blessed one set out carrying Thee in his hands. Aadi Shesha with his many hoods warded off the rain waters and led along the way by him with the gems on his hood s enlightening the way. O Lord! Of such exceeding prowess deign to save me from my forceful ailments.

Narayaneeyam D039

Dashaka 39
---------
bhavantamayamudvahan yadukulodvaho nissaran
dadarsha gaganochchalajjalabharAM kalindAtmajAm |
aho salilasa~nchaya: sa punaraindrajAlodito
jalaugha iva tatkShaNAt prapadameyatAmAyayau ||1||
---------
bhavantam-ayam-udvahan
Thee he carrying
yadukula-udvaha:
this leader of the Yadu clan
nissaran dadarsha
and setting out saw
gagana-uchchalat-jala-bharAm
reaching to the skies the water overflowing
kalinda-AtmajAm
Kalinda's daughter, Yamuna
aho salila-sa~nchaya: sa:
Lo! water collection that
puna:-aindrajAla-udita:
as though caused by Indrajaala, magic
jalaugha:- iva
a flood like
tat-kShaNAt
in that very moment
prapada-meyatAm-Ayayau
to the ankles measuring became

When the leader of the Yadu clan Vasudeva set out carrying Thee, he saw the waters of the Yamuna river flooded to the skies. Lo! As he crossed, the waters were reduced to the ankles of his feet as if the huge expanse of water was an illusory flood caused by magic.
---------
prasuptapashupAlikAM nibhRRitamArudadbAlikA-
mapAvRRitakavATikAM pashupavATikAmAvishan |
bhavantamayamarpayan prasavatalpake tatpadA-
dvahan kapaTakanyakAM svapuramAgato vegata: ||2||

prasupta-pashupAlikAM
fast asleep, (in which) the cowherd women were
nibhRRitam-Arudad-bAlikAm-
gently (where) was crying a girl child
apAvRRita-kavATikAm
open were whose doors
pashupa-vATikAm-Avishan
(that) cowherd's house entering
bhavantam-ayam-arpayan
Thee, he (that Vasudeva) placing
prasava-talpake
on the labour cot
tat-padAt-vahan
(and) from that place taking
kapaTa-kanyakAm
the seeming female infant
svapuram-Agata: vegata:
came back to his city quickly
---------
Vasudeva entered the cowherd chieftain's house, whose doors were open and the cowherd women were all fast asleep, and a baby girl was crying. He gently placed Thee on the labour cot and took the seeming female infant (Yoga Maayaa) in his hands and quickly proceeded to his house, in Mathura.

tatastvadanujAravakShapitanidravegadravad-
bhaTotkaraniveditaprasavavArtayaivArtimAn |
vimuktachikurotkarastvaritamApatan bhojarA-
DatuShTa iva dRRiShTavAn bhaginikAkare kanyakAm ||3||
---------
tata:-tvat-anujA-rava-
then by Thy younger sister's the sound (of crying)
kShapita-nidra-vega-dravat-
awakened and running fast
bhaTa-utkara-nivedita-
the host of attendants informed
prasava-vArtayA-
(about) the delivery news
eva-ArtimAn
(by which) only agitated
vimukta-chikura-utkara:-
(and with) dishevelled locks of hair
tvaritam-Apatan
hastily reaching
bhoja-rAja-atuShTa
Bhojaraaja (Kansa) dissatisfied
iva dRRiShTavAn
as if saw
bhaginikA-kare kanyakAm
in his sister's hands the baby girl

Then awakened by the sound of crying of Thy younger sister, the host of attendants ran fast to inform Kansa of the child's birth. Stricken with fear, Kansa, with dishevelled hair, hastily reached the spot and was surprised and confused to see a baby girl in his sister's arms.
---------
dhruvaM kapaTashAlino madhuharasya mAyA bhave-
dasAviti kishorikAM bhaginikAkarAli~NgitAm |
dvipo nalinikAntarAdiva mRRiNAlikAmAkShipa-
nnayaM tvadanujAmajAmupalapaTTake piShTavAn ||4||

dhruvam kapaTashAlina:
certainly of the deceitful
madhuharasya mAyA bhavet-
Vishnu's trick this must be
asau-iti kishorikAm
this (girl) thus (deciding), the girl
bhaginikA-kara-Ali~NgitAm
in his sister in her arms held close
dvipa: nalini-kAntarAt-iva
(like) an elephant from the lotus pond
mRRiNAlikAm-AkShipan-
a tender lotus stalk plucking out
ayam tvat-anujAm-ajAm-
this (Kansa), Thy younger sister , the birth less one
upala-paTTake piShTavAn
on a block of stone dashed
---------
Kansa decided that certainly this was a trick of the deceitful Vishnu that this girl was born. He pulled the infant away from his sister who had held her close in her arms, just as an elephant would pluck out a tender lotus stalk from a pond of lotus, and dashed her, Thy younger sister, the birth less one, on a block of stone.

tata: bhavadupAsako jhaTiti mRRityupAshAdiva
pramuchya tarasaiva sA samadhirUDharUpAntarA |
adhastalamajagmuShI vikasadaShTabAhusphura-
nmahAyudhamaho gatA kila vihAyasA didyute ||5||
---------
tata: bhavat-upAsaka:
then (as) Thy devotee
jhaTiti mRRityupAshAt-iva
quickly from the clutches of death, like that
pramuchya tarasA-eva
slipping out (of Kansa's clutches) immediately
sA samadhirUDha-rUpAntarA
she (Yoga Maayaa) assumed another form
adha:-talam-ajagmuShI
below the earth not going (rising above the earth)
vikasat-aShTa-bAhu:-
(the form in which) she developed eight arms
sphuran-mahA-Ayudham-
shining with divine weapons
aho gatA kila
what a wonder went away indeed
vihAyasA didyute
in the sky shining

Then, just as Thy devotee would quickly free himself from the clutches of death, she, Yoga Maayaa freed herself from the clutches of Kamsa immediately. Not hitting the earth, she rose above the earth in the sky and assumed another form with eight arms shining with divine weapons.
---------
nRRishaMsatara kaMsa te kimu mayA viniShpiShTayA
babhUva bhavadantaka: kvachana chintyatAM te hitam |
iti tvadanujA vibho khalamudIrya taM jagmuShI
marudgaNapaNAyitA bhuvi cha mandirANyeyuShI ||6||

nRRishaMsatara kaMsa
O cruel Kansa!
te kimu
what is your (gain)
mayA viniShpiShTayA
by my killing
babhUva bhavat-antaka:
has been (born) your destroyer
kvachana
elsewhere
chintyatAM te hitam
think of your welfare
iti tvat-anujA
thus Thy sister
vibho khalam-udIrya taM
O Lord! to the wicked one saying
jagmuShI marudgaNa-paNAyitA
went away (disappeared), being praised by the Devas
bhuvi cha mandirANi-eyuShI
and on the earth, in the temples, entered
---------
"O cruel most Kansa! What is your gain by smashing me? Your destroyer has been born elsewhere. Think of your welfare." Thus saying to the wicked one, Thy sister disappeared. The Devas praised her also as she entered the temples on the earth and was worshipped.

prage punaragAtmajAvachanamIritA bhUbhujA
pralambabakapUtanApramukhadAnavA mAnina: |
bhavannidhanakAmyayA jagati babhramurnirbhayA:
kumArakavimArakA: kimiva duShkaraM niShkRRipai: ||7||
---------
prage puna:-
the next morning, again
agAtmajA-
by the daughter of the mountain (Paarvati-Yoga Maayaa)
vachanam-IritA
the words spoken (which were)
bhUbhujA
by the king (being told to)
pralamba-baka-pUtanA-
Pralamba, Baka, Pootanaa,
pramukha-dAnavA:
the main demons
mAnina:
haughty
bhavat-nidhana-kAmyayA
with the desire to kill Thee
jagati babhramu:-nirbhayA:
all over the land, roamed about fearlessly
kumAraka-vimArakA:
killing children
kimiva duShkaraM niShkRRipai:
what is not possible by the merciless people

Thereafter, the next morning, the king told the main haughty demons, Pralamba, Baka and Pootana, what the daughter of the mountain, Paarvati-Yoga Maayaa had said. They then roamed all over the land fearlessly killing the children. Merciless people are capable of doing merciless deeds.
---------
tata: pashupamandire tvayi mukunda nandapriyA-
prasUtishayaneshaye rudati ki~nchida~nchatpade |
vibudhya vanitAjanaistanayasambhave ghoShite
mudA kimu vadAmyaho sakalamAkulaM gokulam ||8||

tata: pashupa-mandire
then in the cowherd's (Nanda's) house
tvayi mukunda
(when) Thou were O Lord! (Bestower of Liberation)
nanda priyA-prasUti-shayane-
on wife of Nanda (Yashoda's) labour-bed
shaye rudati
lying and crying
ki~nchit-a~nchat-pade
and slightly kicking the legs
vibudhya vanitA-janai:-
waking up, by the women folk
tanaya-sambhave ghoShite
the birth of a boy was announced
mudA kimu vadAmi-aho
overjoyed, O What can I say
sakalam-AkulaM gokulaM
all brimming (with joy), Gokula was
---------
Then, Bestower of Liberation! O Lord! Lying on the labour bed of Yashoda, the cowherd chieftain's wife, Thou raised infant cries as Thou slightly kicked Thy legs. All the women folk were aroused from sleep, and they announced the birth of a boy. O! How can I describe the joy with which the whole of Gokula was brimming.

aho khalu yashodayA navakalAyachetoharaM
bhavantamalamantike prathamamApibantyA dRRishA |
puna: stanabharaM nijaM sapadi pAyayantyA mudA
manoharatanuspRRishA jagati puNyavanto jitA: ||9||
---------
aho khalu yashodayA
what a wonder indeed, by Yashoda
nava-kalAya-chetoharaM
like a fresh Kalaya flower enchanting the mind
bhavantam-alam-antike
Thee, very near to herself
prathamam-ApibantyA
at first drinking thoroughly
dRRishA puna:
with the eyes, then
stanabharaM nijaM sapadi
her own breasts immediately
pAyayantyA mudA
feeding joyfully
manohara-tanu-spRRishA
(Thy) charming body caressing
jagati puNyavanta:
in the world, the most meritorious ones
jitA:
were surpassed

What a wonder indeed that the most meritorious and holy persons were surpassed by Yashoda by her good fortune as she imbibed with her eyes Thy beautiful form fresh as a Kalaya flower lying by her side. Then she joyfully applied Thee to her breasts feeding Thee, as she also caressed Thy charming body again and again.
---------
bhavatkushalakAmyayA sa khalu nandagopastadA
pramodabharasa~Nkulo dvijakulAya kinnAdadAt |
tathaiva pashupAlakA: kimu na ma~NgalaM tenire
jagattritayama~Ngala tvamiha pAhi mAmAmayAt ||10||

bhavat-kushala-kAmyayA
Thy wellbeing desiring
sa khalu nandagopa:-tadA
that, Nanadagopa indeed, then
pramoda-bhara-sa~Nkula:
with extreme joy overwhelmed
dvija-kulAya
to the Braahmin clan (holy men)
kim-na-adadAt
what did not give
tathA-eva pashu-pAlakA:
in the same way the cowherds
kimu na ma~NgalaM tenire
what auspicious act did not perform
jagat-tritaya-ma~Ngala tvam-
O Lord! The beneficiary of the world! Thou
iha pAhi mAm-AmayAt
here save me from ailments
---------
Nandagopa, overwhelmed with joy,and out of the desire for Thy wellbeing gave away limitless gifts to holy men of the Braahmin clan. In the same manner innumerable auspicious rites and observances were performed by the gopas for Thy sake. Thou the harbinger of auspiciousness of the three worlds, deign to save me from my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D040

Dashaka 40
---------
tadanu nandamamandashubhAspadaM nRRipapurIM karadAnakRRite gatam|
samavalokya jagAda bhavatpitA viditakaMsasahAyajanodyama: ||1||
---------
tadanu nandam-
after that to Nanda
amanda-shubha-Aspadam
(who is) of non dimmed virtues the abode
nRRipa-purIm
to the king's city
kara-dAna-kRRite gatam
to pay his tributes (taxes), who had gone
samavalokya
seeing (meeting)
jagAda bhavat-pitA
said (to Nanda), Thy father (Vasudeva)
vidita-kaMsa-
who knew of Kansa's
sahAyajana-udyama:
and Kansa's supporters' activities

Thereafter, Nanda (who is the abode of undiminished virtues), went to the king's city to pay his tributes (taxes). On meeting him, Thy father Vasudeva who knew of the activities of Kansa and his supporters, told him that.
---------
ayi sakhe tava bAlakajanma mAM sukhayate.adya nijAtmajajanmavat |
iti bhavatpitRRitAM vrajanAyake samadhiropya shashaMsa tamAdarAt ||2||

ayi sakhe
O friend!
tava bAlaka janma
to you a son's birth
mAM-sukhayate-adya
gives me pleasure now
nija-Atmaja-janmavat
my own son's birth like
iti bhavat-pitRRitAM
thus Thy fatherhood
vrajanAyake samadhiropya
to the cowherd chief, (he cleverly) attributed
shashaMsa tam-AdarAt
and praised him with affection
---------
"O Friend! The birth of a son to you gives me pleasure as if a son were born to myself." Thus he cleverly attributed Thy fatherhood on Nanda, and praised him with affection.

iha cha santyanimittashatAni te kaTakasImni tato laghu gamyatAm |
iti cha tadvachasA vrajanAyako bhavadapAyabhiyA drutamAyayau ||3||
---------
iha cha santi-
and here there are
animitta-shatAni
bad omens in hundreds
te kaTaka-sImni
at your residence
tata: laghu gamyatAm
therefore soon (you) should go
iti cha tat-vachasA
and thus, by his (Vaudeva's) words
vrajanAyaka:
the cowherd chieftain (Nandagopa)
bhavat-apAya-bhiyA
to Thee danger apprehending
drutam-Ayayau
quickly returned

"Here there are bad omens in hundreds and soon at your residence also it will not be safe, so you should return soon". Thus by Vasudeva's words, apprehending danger to Thee, Nanda quickly returned.
---------
avasare khalu tatra cha kAchana vrajapade madhurAkRRitira~NganA |
taralaShaTpadalAlitakuntalA kapaTapotaka te nikaTaM gatA ||4||

avasare khalu tatra cha
at that time, indeed, and there
kAchana vrajapade
some (female) in Gokula
madhura-AkRRiti:-a~NganA
beautiful looking woman
tarala-ShaTpada-
(with) hovering bees
lAlita-kuntalA
around (her) locks of hair (due to the sweet smell)
kapaTa-potaka
(O Thou) in the guise of a child!
te nikaTaM gatA
went near Thee
---------
Just then there in Gokula, some beautiful looking woman with honey bees hovering around the sweet smelling flowers in her hair locks, entered. O Thou! In the guise of a child, she approached Thee.

sapadi sA hRRitabAlakachetanA nishicharAnvayajA kila pUtanA |
vrajavadhUShviha keyamiti kShaNaM vimRRishatIShu bhavantamupAdade ||5||
---------
sapadi sA
quickly she
hRRita-bAlaka-chetanA
who had taken the children' lives
nishichara-anvaya-jA
of demon clan born
kila pUtanA
indeed Pootanaa
vraja-vadhUShu-iha
among the Vraja women here
kA-iyam-iti
who is this, thus
kShaNaM vimRRishatIShu
for a moment wondering
bhavantam-upAdade
Thee lifted up (in her arms)

Quickly she, Pootanaa, born in the clan of demons, who had taken the lives of many children, lifted Thee up, even as the Vraja women were for a second wondering as to who she was.
---------
lalitabhAvavilAsahRRitAtmabhiryuvatibhi: pratiroddhumapAritA |
stanamasau bhavanAntaniSheduShI pradaduShI bhavate kapaTAtmane ||5||

lalita-bhAva-vilAsa-
by her charming appearance and graceful movements
hRRita-Atmabhi:-yuvatibhi:
with captivated minds, the young women
pratiroddhum-apAritA
to deter (stop) not being able
stanam-asau
her breasts this (Pootanaa)
bhavana-anta-niSheduShI
inside the house sitting
pradaduShI bhavate
gave (her breasts) to Thee
kapaTa-Atmane
the illusive child
---------
Her charming appearance and graceful movements captivated the minds of the Gopis who were unable to stop her from making advances. So this Pootanaa took her seat inside the house as she applied Thee, the illusive child, to her breasts.

samadhiruhya tada~Nkamasha~Nkitastvamatha bAlakalopanaroShita: |
mahadivAmraphalaM kuchamaNDalaM pratichuchUShitha durviShadUShitam ||7||
---------
samadhiruhya tat-a~Nkam-
climbing in her lap
asha~Nkita:-tvam-atha
unhesitatingly Thou then
bAlaka-lopana-roShita:
by the children' killing angered
mahat-iva-Amra-phalam
huge, as if it were a mango fruit
kucha-maNDalaM prati-chuchUShitha
the breast, sucked well
durviSha-dUShitam
with strong poison smeared

Thou who were angered by her killing of the children, unhesitatingly climbed in her lap and sucked well her poison smeared breasts as if it were a huge mango fruit.
---------
asubhireva samaM dhayati tvayi stanamasau stanitopamanisvanA |
nirapatadbhayadAyi nijaM vapu: pratigatA pravisArya bhujAvubhau ||8||

asubhi:-eva samam
her life breath along with
dhayati tvayi stanam-
sucking (when) Thou were the breast
asau stanita-upama-nisvanA
this Pootanaa, with thunder like noise
nirapatat-
fell down
bhayadAyi nijaM vapu:
ferocious her own body
pratigatA
reverting to
pravisArya bhujau-ubhau
out stretching both the hands
---------
Thou sucked the breast along with her life force. This Pootanaa fell down with a thunder like noise reverting to her natural ferocious body with both hands stretching out.

bhayadaghoShaNabhIShaNavigrahashravaNadarshanamohitavallave |
vrajapade tadura:sthalakhelanaM nanu bhavantamagRRihNata gopikA: ||9||
---------
bhayada-ghoShaNa-
the terrifying sound
bhIShaNa-vigraha-
and the frightful form
shravaNa-darshana-
hearing and seeing
mohita-vallave
(which) stunned the gopas
vrajapade
and (the whole of) Gokul
tat-udara:-sthala-
on her chest
khelanaM nanu
playing indeed
bhavantam-agRRihNata
Thee picked up
gopikA:
the Gopis

The whole of Gokul stood stunned hearing the terrifying sound and seeing the frightful form. The Gopis picked Thee up even as Thou were playing on the chest of the dead demoness.
---------
bhuvanama~NgalanAmabhireva te yuvatibhirbahudhA kRRitarakShaNa: |
tvamayi vAtaniketananAtha mAmagadayan kuru tAvakasevakam ||10||

bhuvana-ma~Ngala-
O Thou who confers auspiciousness on the world!
nAmabhi:-eva te
by Thy name alone
yuvatibhi:-bahudhA
by the young women, in various ways
kRRitarakShaNa: tvam-ayi
Thou were protected, O Thou!
vAtaniketananAtha
Lord of Guruvaayur!
mAm-agadayan
making me devoid of ailments
kuru tAvaka-sevakam
make me Thy devotee
---------
O Thou! Who confers auspiciousness on to the world, the young women protected Thee in various ways with chanting Thy names alone. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Making me devoid of my ailments, make me Thy devotee.

Narayaneeyam D041

Dashaka 41
---------
vrajeshvarai: shaurivacho nishamya samAvrajannadhvani bhItachetA: |
niShpiShTanishsheShataruM nirIkShya ka~nchitpadArthaM sharaNaM gatasvAm ||1||
---------
vrajeshvara:
the chieftain of Vraja (Nanda Gopa)
shauri-vacha: nishamya
the words of Vasudeva having heard
samAvrajan-adhvani
returning on the way
bhIta-chetA:
in utter fear (seeing)
niShpiShTa-nishsheSha-tarum
crushed all the trees
nirIkShya ki~nchit-padArtham
seeing (by) some indescribable object
sharaNam gata:-tvAm
took refuge in Thee (prayed to Thee)

The chieftain of Vraja, Nanda Gopa, having heard the words of Vasudeva, was returning home in a hurry. On the way he saw an indescribable form falling down and crushing all the trees around. In utter fear he took refuge in Thee and prayed to Thee.
---------
nishamya gopIvachanAdudantaM sarve.api gopA bhayavismayAndhA: |
tvatpAtitaM ghorapishAchadehaM dehurvidUre.atha kuThArakRRittam ||2||

nishamya gopI-vachanAt
hearing, by the words of the Gopikas
udantam
the news (story of Pootanaa)
sarve-api gopA:
all the Gopas
bhaya-vismaya-andhA:
by fear and wonder dumbfounded
tvat-pAtitam
felled by Thee
ghora-pishAcha-deham
the terrible monster's (Pootanaa's) body
dehu:-vidUre-atha
burnt far away, then,
kuThAra-kRRittam
(the body) by axes cut (into pieces)
---------
The Gopas came to know of the whole incident of Pootanaa from the Gopikas and they were dumbfounded with fear and wonder. They then proceeded to cut the body of the terrible monster who was killed by Thee, into pieces with axes and burnt it at a distance.

tvatpItapUtastanatachCharIrAt samuchchalannuchchataro hi dhUma: |
sha~NkAmadhAdAgarava: kimeSha kiM chAndano gaulgulavo.athaveti ||3||
---------
tvat-pIta-pUta-stana-
by Thee sucked, the purified breasts, from (them)
tat-sharIrAt samuchchalan-
