(from that body) rising up profusely
uchchatara: hi dhUma:
high up indeed the smoke
sha~NkAm-adhAt-
(made) doubt to arise
agarava: kim-eSha
(smell) of agaru is this,
kim chAndana:
(or) is it sandalwood
gaulgulava:-athavA-
or from gulgulu (frankincense)
iti
thus (the doubt)

The breasts of Pootanaa were made pure by Thy having sucked them. Therefore, when her body was burnt, huge volumes of smoke rose in the sky, so fragrant that it produced doubt in the minds of the people as to what it was - agaru, sandalwood, or gulgulu (frankincense) incense.
---------
mada~Ngasa~Ngasya phalaM na dUre kShaNena tAvat bhavatAmapi syAt |
ityullapan vallavatallajebhya: tvaM pUtanAmAtanuthA: sugandhim ||4||

mat-a~Nga-sa~Ngasya
of my body's contact
phalaM na dUre
the fruit is not far
kShaNena tAvat
in no time then
bhavatAm-api syAt
to you also will be (given)
iti-ullapan
thus saying (declaring)
vallava-tallajebhya:
to the higher ones of the cow-herds
tvam
Thou
pUtanAm-atanuthA:
on Pootanaa conferred
sugandhim
fragrance (punya) (blessings)
---------
Thou declared to the higher ones of the cowherd clan that the fruits of the contact with Thy body were not far behind, and that they too would get them soon. The conferring of fragrance / blessings on Pootanaa was, as though, to prove that.

chitraM pishAchyA na hata: kumAra: chitraM puraivAkathi shauriNedam |
iti prashaMsan kila gopaloko bhavanmukhAlokarase nyamA~NkShIt ||5||
---------
chitraM pishAchyA
what a wonder, by the demoness
na hata: kumAra:
was not killed the boy
chitraM purA-eva-
what a wonder earlier itself
akathi shauriNA-idam
it was said by Shauri (Vasudeva), this
iti prashaMsan
thus praising
kila gopaloka:
the cowherd people
bhavat-mukha-Aloka-rase
in the joy of looking at Thy face
nyamA~NkShIt
immersed

The cowherd people were wonder struck that the boy was not killed by the demoness. They also marvelled at the events foretold by Shauri Vasudeva. Realising this, they were fully immersed in the joy of looking at Thy face.
---------
dinedine.atha prativRRiddhalakShmIrakShINamA~Ngalyashato vrajo.ayam |
bhavannivAsAdayi vAsudeva pramodasAndra: parito vireje ||6||

dine-dine-atha
day by day then
prati-vRRiddha-lakShmI:-
increasing in prosperity
akShINa-mA~Ngalya-shata:
(and) undiminished in numerous auspiciousness
vraja:-ayam
Gokul this
bhavat-nivAsAt-
by Thy living there
ayi vAsudeva
O Vaasudeva!
pramoda-sAndra:
full of happiness
parita: vireje
every where shone
---------
O Vaasudeva! Day by day this Gokul developed with prosperity and undiminished auspiciousness as a result of Thy living there. Happiness and undecaying virtue shone everywhere.

gRRiheShu te komalarUpahAsamitha:kathAsa~NkulitA: kamanya: |
vRRitteShu kRRityeShu bhavannirIkShAsamAgatA: pratyahamatyanandan ||7||
---------
gRRiheShu
in (their) house
te komala-rUpa-hAsa-
Thy delicate form and smile
mitha:-kathA-sa~NkulitA:
mutually narrated, gathering together
kamanya:
the beautiful (Gopikas)
vRRitteShu kRRityeShu
having completed their daily chores
bhavat-nirIkShA-samAgatA:
to watch Thee, assembled
prati-ahan-ati-anandan
every day, in great joy

In their houses the beautiful Gopikas kept talking to each other about Thy charming form and smile. Having completed their daily chores they assembled in great joy to watch Thee.
---------
aho kumAro mayi dattadRRiShTi: smitaM kRRitaM mAM prati vatsakena |
ehyehi mAmityupasArya pANI tvayIsha kiM kiM na kRRitaM vadhUbhi: ||8||

aho kumAra:
O! the boy
mayi datta-dRRiShTi:
at me looked
smitaM kRRitaM mAM prati
smile was made in my direction
vatsakena
by the child
ehi-ehi mAm-iti
come come to me, thus
upasArya pANI
stretching out the hands
tvayi-Isha
towards Thee O Lord!
kiM kiM na kRRitaM vadhUbhi:
what all was not done by the women
---------
O the boy is looking at me,' 'his smile is directed towards me', 'come, come to me', thus remarking they stretched out their hands to hold Thee. O Lord! What all was not done by the Gopikas endearingly.

bhavadvapu:sparshanakautukena karAtkaraM gopavadhUjanena |
nItastvamAtAmrasarojamAlAvyAlambilolambatulAmalAsI: ||9||
---------
bhavat-vapu:-
Thy body
sparshana-kautukena
in the eagerness to touch
karAt-karaM
from hand to hand
gopa-vadhU-janena
by the Gopika women
nIta:-tvam-
were taken Thou
AtAmra-saroja-mAlA-
very red lotus garland
vyAlambi-lolamba-
(as though on it) moving about, a beetle
tulAm-alAsI:
resemblance Thou took on

They passed Thee from hand to hand, each one of them eager to touch Thy body. As they did so, Thou looked like a honey beetle moving from one very red lotus to another strung together in a garland.
---------
nipAyayantI stanama~NkagaM tvAM vilokayantI vadanaM hasantI |
dashAM yashodA katamAM na bheje sa tAdRRisha: pAhi hare gadAnmAm ||10||

nipAyayantI stanam-
feeding the breasts
a~NkagaM tvAm
to who were in the lap, Thee
vilokayantI vadanam
admiring the face
hasantI
(and) smiling
dashAM yashodA katamAM
states (of joy), Yashodaa, what all
na bheje
did not attain
sa tAdRRisha: pAhi
That (Thee) who are such, save
hare gadAn-mAm
O Lord Hari! Me from diseases
---------
O ! What states of joy did Yashodaa, Nanda's wife, not attain as she took Thee in her lap and suckled Thee, with her eyes fixed on Thy smiling face. O Lord Hari! Who are thus! May Thou save me from all ailments.

Narayaneeyam D042

Dashaka 42
---------
kadApi janmarkShadine tava prabho nimantritaj~nAtivadhUmahIsurA |
mahAnasastvAM savidhe nidhAya sA mahAnasAdau vavRRite vrajeshvarI ||1||
---------
kadApi janma-RRikSha-dine
once, on the birth star day
tava prabho
of Thee, O Lord!
nimantrita-
having invited
j~nAti-vadhU-mahIsurA:
relatives, their wives and Braahmins
mahA-anasa:-tvAM savidhe
a big cart, Thee near it
nidhAya sA
placing, she (Yashodaa)
mahAna-sAdau
in the kitchen
vavRRite vrajeshvarI
got busy Yashoda

O Lord! Once on Thy birth star day, Yashoda, the queen of Vraja, who had invited the relatives and their wives and the Braahmins, for the occasion, placed Thee near a big cart and got busy in the kitchen organising the feast.
---------
tato bhavattrANaniyuktabAlakaprabhItisa~Nkrandanasa~NkulAravai: |
vimishramashrAvi bhavatsamIpata: parisphuTaddAruchaTachchaTArava: ||2||

tata: bhavat-
then, for Thy
trANa-niyukta-
to protect appointed
bAlaka-prabhIti-
the boys
sa~Nkrandana-
fearfully crying
sa~NkulA-ravai:
the confused voices
vimishram-ashrAvi
which were mingled (with) , were heard
bhavat-samIpata:
from near Thee
parisphuTat-dAru-
cracking and breaking of wood
chaTat-chaTA-rava:
with the crackling sound
---------
Then from near Thee, was heard the fearful cries and confused voices of various boys who were appointed to protect Thee, which was mingled with the sound of the crackling and breaking sound of wood.

tatastadAkarNanasambhramashramaprakampivakShojabharA vrajA~NganA: |
bhavantamantardadRRishussamantato viniShpataddAruNadArumadhyagam ||3||
---------
tata:-tat-AkarNana-
then that hearing
sambhrama-shrama-
(with) the fear and the effort
prakampi-vakShoja-bharA:
heaving with the heavy breasts
vrajA~NganA:
the Gopikas
bhavantam-anta:-dadRRishu:-
Thee saw amongst
samntata: viniShpatat-
all around strewn
dAruNa-dAru-madhyagam
big pieces of wood, in the midst lying

Then hearing the terrific sound, frightened, the Gopikas came running with their heavy breasts heaving because of the effort and anxiety. They saw Thee lying amongst the frightful big pieces of broken wood strewn all around.
---------
shishoraho kiM kimabhUditi drutaM pradhAvya nanda: pashupAshcha bhUsurA: |
bhavantamAlokya yashodayA dhRRitaM samAshvasannashrujalArdralochanA: ||4||

shisho:-aho
to the child, Alas!
kiM kim-abhUt-
what! What has happened
iti drutaM pradhAvya
thus (saying),swiftly running
nanda: pashupA:-cha
Nanda Gopa, the cowherds
bhUsurA: bhavantam-Alokya
and the Braahmins, Thee seeing
yashodayA dhRRitaM
(who was) by Yashoda held
samAshvasan-
felt relieved
ashru-jala-Ardra-lochanA:
(with) eyes wet with tears (of joy)
---------
Alas! What! What has happened to the child!' thus crying, Nanda, the Gopas and the assembled Braahmins rushed to the spot. Finding Thee in Yashoda's arms, they felt relieved and shed tears of joy seeing that the child was safe.

kasko nu kautaskuta eSha vismayo visha~NkaTaM yachChakaTaM vipATitam |
na kAraNaM ki~nchidiheti te sthitA: svanAsikAdattakarAstvadIkShakA: ||5||
---------
ka:-ka: nu kauta:-kuta:
what! What, indeed how? Where? (did it happen)
eSha vismaya: visha~NkaTam
this is a wonder, this huge
yat-shakaTam vipATitam
that (this) cart is shattered to pieces
na kAraNam
no reason
ki~nchit-iha-iti
at all is here, thus
te sthitA:
they stood
sva-nAsikA-datta-karA:-
on their noses placing their hands
tvat-IkShakA:
at Thee looking

What ! What happened and how! This is a wonder! This huge cart is shattered! There seems to be no explanation for this', thus exclaiming, they looked at Thee, awestricken, with their fingers placed on their noses.
---------
kumArakasyAsya payodharArthina: prarodane lolapadAmbujAhatam |
mayA mayA dRRiShTamano viparyagAditIsha te pAlakabAlakA jagu: ||6||

kumArakasya-asya
of this child
payodhara-arthina:
of being breast fed desirous
prarodane
while crying
lola-pada-ambuja-
by the movement of the lotus like legs
Ahatam
was hit (the cart)
mayA mayA dRRiShTam-
I saw, I saw
ana: viparyagAt-
the cart overturned
iti-Isha
thus O Lord
te pAlaka-bAlakA:
the children who were guarding Thee
jagu:
said
---------
O Lord! The children who were guarding Thee, declared 'This child who was desirous of being breast fed, moved his lotus like legs, and hit the cart which overturned. I saw, even I saw.'

bhiyA tadA ki~nchidajAnatAmidaM kumArakANAmatidurghaTaM vacha: |
bhavatprabhAvAvidurairitIritaM manAgivAsha~Nkyata dRRiShTapUtanai: ||7||
---------
bhiyA tadA
out of fright , then
ki~nchit-ajAnatAm-
anything those who did not know (to them)
idam kumArakANAm-
the children's
ati-durghaTam vacha:
(this was) a very improbable statement
bhavat-prabhAva-avidurai:-
Thy prowess' those not knowing
iti-IritaM manAk-iva-
this statement, a little bit
asha~Nkyata dRRiShTa-pUtanai:
was feared (to be true), who had witnessed (the incident of) Pootanaa

Then to the people who knew nothing of Thy prowess, the words of the frightened children were entirely baseless. But to those who knew of even a bit of Thy prowess and had witnessed the incident of Pootanaa, could not reject their statement altogether.
---------
pravAlatAmraM kimidaM padaM kShataM sarojaramyau nu karau virojitau|
iti prasarpatkaruNAtara~NgitAstvada~NgamApaspRRishura~NganAjanA: ||8||

pravAla-tAmraM
tender leaves like pink
kim-idaM padaM kShataM
is this (little) foot hurt
saroja-ramyau nu
lotuses like charming indeed
karau virojitau
(these) hands, have (they) been hurt
iti prasarpat-karuNA-
thus with overflowing sympathy
tara~NgitA:-tvat-a~Ngam-
moved by (such concern), Thy body
ApaspRRishu:-a~NganAjanA:
stroked gently, the women folk
---------
Pink like tender leaves, these legs, have they been hurt? These hands, charming like the lotuses, have they been injured?' Thus with overflowing sympathy and moved with such concern, the women folk stroked Thy body gently.

aye sutaM dehi jagatpate: kRRipAtara~NgapAtAtparipAtamadya me |
iti sma sa~NgRRihya pitA tvada~NgakaM muhurmuhu: shliShyati jAtakaNTaka: ||9||
---------
aye sutaM dehi
O (Yashoda) give (me) my son
jagatpate: kRRipAtara~Nga-pAtAt-
by the Lord's showers of mercy
paripAtam-adya me
(was) saved , today, my son
iti sma sa~NgRRihya
thus collecting
pitA tvat-a~Ngakam
(Thy) father , Thy body
muhu:-muhu: shliShyati
again and again embraces
jAta-kaNTaka:
with his body full of horripilation

O Yashoda! Give me my son. By the Lord's showers of mercy today my son was saved!' Thus saying and collecting Thee in his arms, Thy father embraced Thee again and again, whose body was full of horripilation.
---------
anonilIna: kila hantumAgata: surArirevaM bhavatA vihiMsita: |
rajo.api no dRRiShTamamuShya tatkathaM sa shuddhasattve tvayi lInavAn dhruvam ||10||

ana:-nilIna:
as a cart, disguised
kila hantum-Agata:
indeed, to kill, had come
surAri:-evaM
the Asura, was thus
bhavatA vihiMsita:
by Thee was killed
raja:-api na: dRRiShTam-amuShya
even a speck of him (of Rajo Guna) was not seen
tat-kathaM sa
how can it be that he
shuddha-satve tvayi
who are pure Sattva, in Thee
lInavAn dhruvam
merged certainly
---------
The Asura who had come to kill Thee, disguised as a cart, was destroyed by Thee. But even a trace of his body or evil nature (Rajas) was not seen. How can that be? Certainly, he became pure (by coming in contact with Thee) and merged in Thy pure Sattvic Self.

prapUjitaistatra tato dvijAtibhirvisheShato lambhitama~NgalAshiSha: |
vrajaM nijairbAlyarasairvimohayan marutpurAdhIsha rujAM jahIhi me ||11||
---------
prapUjitai:-tatra
well honoured there
tata: dvijAtibhi:-
then by the Braahamins
visheShata:
specially
lambhita-ma~Ngala-AshiSha:
conferred with auspicious blessings
vrajaM
Gokul
nijai:-bAlya-rasai:-
with Thy childish sweet ways
vimohayan
captivating (delighting)
marutpurAdhIsha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
rujAM jahIhi me
suffering, sheer away, mine

The Braahmins who were invited and were well honoured specially conferred their auspicious blessings on Thee. With Thy captivating childish sweet ways, Thou delighted the whole of Vraja. O Lord of Guruvaayur! May Thou sheer away my sufferings.

Narayaneeyam D043

Dashaka 43
---------
tvAmekadA gurumarutpuranAtha voDhuM
gADhAdhirUDhagarimANamapArayantI |
mAtA nidhAya shayane kimidaM bateti
dhyAyantyacheShTata gRRiheShu niviShTasha~NkA ||1||
---------
tvAm-ekadA
Thee, once,
gurumarutpuranAtha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
voDhuM
to carry (Thee, who)
gADha-adhirUDha-garimANam-
had very much increased in weight
apArayantI mAtA
not being able (to carry), Thy mother (Yashoda)
nidhAya shayane
placing (Thee) on the bed
kim-idaM bata-iti
what is it indeed thus
dhyAyantI
thinking (of Thee)
acheShTata gRRiheShu
performed (her duties) in the house
niviShTa-sha~NkA
overcome with doubt

Once, O Lord of Guruvaayur! Thou who had very much increased in weight, Thy mother not being able to carry Thee, placed Thee on the bed. What indeed was the cause of this, thus overcome with misgivings, she kept busy carrying out her duties in the house. As she did so, she was constantly thinking of Thee and praying for Thy welfare.
---------
tAvadvidUramupakarNitaghoraghoSha-
vyAjRRimbhipAMsupaTalIparipUritAsha: |
vAtyAvapussa kila daityavarastRRiNAva-
rtAkhyo jahAra janamAnasahAriNaM tvAm ||2||

tAvat-vidUram-
then at a distance
upakarNita-ghora-ghoSha-
was heard a terrific sound
vyAjRRimbhi-pAMsupaTalI-
(with the) rising and spreading of a thick dust
paripUrita-Asha:
filling the quarters
vAtyA-vapu:-sa
in the form of a whirl wind, he
kila daityavara:-
indeed, the famous Asura
tRRiNAvarta-Akhya:
Trinaavarta by name
jahAra
carried away (Thee)
janamAnasa-hAriNaM
of the peoples' mind carries away (the one who)
tvAm
Thee
---------
Then the well known Asura Trinaavarta, came disguised as a whirl wind. All the quarters were filled with thick dust and a terrific sound arose and spread all around by the impact of his arrival. He carried Thee away, who carries away the minds of people.

uddAmapAMsutimirAhatadRRiShTipAte
draShTuM kimapyakushale pashupAlaloke |
hA bAlakasya kimiti tvadupAntamAptA
mAtA bhavantamavilokya bhRRishaM ruroda ||3||
---------
uddAma-pAMsu-
intense dust (causing)
timira-Ahata-
darkness and so obstructing
dRRiShTi-pAte
the vision (when it was so)
draShTum kim-api-
to see anything at all
akushale
unable
pashupAla-loke
(when) the cowherds were
hA bAlakasya kim-
O what has happened to the child
iti
thus (worrying)
tvat-upAntam-AptA
near Thee approaching
mAtA bhavantam-
Thy mother, Thee
avilokya
not seeing
bhRRishaM ruroda
loudly cried

The immense dust caused intense darkness due to which the vision was obstructed. All the cowherds and everyone were unable to see anything. Thy mother was full of worry as to what had happened to Thee. She ran in distress towards Thee and not finding Thee at the spot, she began to wail and cry loudly.
---------
tAvat sa dAnavavaro.api cha dInamUrti-
rbhAvatkabhAraparidhAraNalUnavega: |
sa~NkochamApa tadanu kShatapAMsughoShe
ghoShe vyatAyata bhavajjananIninAda: ||4||

tAvat sa dAnavavara:-
then the great demon
api cha dInamUrti:-
also and weakened by
bhAvatka-bhAra-paridhAraNa-
Thy weight (which he was) carrying
lUna-vega:
(because of which his) speed diminished
sa~Nkocham-Apa
(and he) got shrunk
tat-anu
thereafter
kShata-pAMsu-ghoShe
subsided the dust and the noise
ghoShe vyatAyata
in the cowherd village (Gokula) spread (was heard)
bhavat-jananI-ninAd
Thy mother's cries
---------
Then that great demon weakened in power, shrank in size and his speed was diminished because of carrying Thy weight. So the dust storm and the fierce whirling sound had also subsided, and so in the cowherd village Gokula, Thy mother's cries were clearly heard everywhere.

rodopakarNanavashAdupagamya gehaM
krandatsu nandamukhagopakuleShu dIna: |
tvAM dAnavastvakhilamuktikaraM mumukShu-
stvayyapramu~nchati papAta viyatpradeshAt ||5||
---------
roda-upakarNana-vashAt-
hearing the wailing and prompted by it
upagamya gehaM
reaching the house
krandatsu
crying
nanda-mukha-gopakuleShu
(when) Nanda and other gopas and gopis
dIna:
weakened (the Asura)
tvAm dAnava:-tu
Thee, the Asura
akhila-muktikaram
(Thee) who releases all from bondage
mumukShu:-
wanting to release
tvayi-apramu~nchati
(when) Thou did not let go Thy hold
papAt
fell down
viyat-pradeshAt
from the skies

On hearing the wailings of Yashoda, Nanda and the other gopas rushed inside the house crying. Meanwhile, the Asura who had become weak by carrying Thy weight, wanted to release Thee, who releases everyone's bondages. But when Thou did no let go of Thy hold of him, he fell down from the skies.
---------
rodAkulAstadanu gopagaNA bahiShTha-
pAShANapRRiShThabhuvi dehamatisthaviShTham |
praikShanta hanta nipatantamamuShya vakSha-
syakShINameva cha bhavantamalaM hasantam ||6||

rodAkulA:-tat-anu
wailing and exhausted, thereafter
gopagaNA bahiShTha-
the gopas and gopikas, outside (the house)
pAShANa-pRRiShTha-bhuvi
on the rocky land's back (upon it)
deham-atisthaviShTham
the body, very huge and heavy
praikShanta hanta
saw, what a wonder
nipatantam-
falling down
amuShya vakShasi-
on this (body's) chest
akShINam-eva
absolutely unscathed
cha bhavantam
and Thee
alaM hasantam
slightly smiling (saw)
---------
The gopas were exhausted by their crying and wailing. Then outside the house, they saw a huge and heavy body falling on the rock. What a wonder! On the chest of the dead body, they found Thee with a soft smile lying unscathed.

grAvaprapAtaparipiShTagariShThadeha-
bhraShTAsuduShTadanujopari dhRRiShTahAsam |
AghnAnamambujakareNa bhavantametya
gopA dadhurgirivarAdiva nIlaratnam ||7||
---------
grAva-prapAta
(on) the rock (by) falling
paripiShTa-gariShTha-deha-
(being) smashed the huge bodied (Asura)
bhraShTAsu-duShTa-danuja-
(having) died the wicked demon,
upari dhRRiShTa-hAsam
on it, wearing a smile (Thee)
AghnAnam-
beating (about, with)
ambukareNa
(Thy) lotus like hands
bhavantam-etya
Thee approaching
gopA: dadhu:-
the gopas picked up (Thee)
girivarAt-iva
like from a big mountain
nIlaratnam
a blue gem (is picked up)

The wicked demon had died by falling on the rock and his huge body was smashed. Wearing a smile Thou played on that dead body beating about with Thy lotus like hands. The gopas picked Thee up from there as one would pick a blue gem from a big mountain.
---------
ekaikamAshu parigRRihya nikAmananda-
nnandAdigopaparirabdhavichumbitA~Ngam |
AdAtukAmaparisha~NkitagopanArI-
hastAmbujaprapatitaM praNumo bhavantam ||8||

eka-ekam-Ashu
one by one quickly
parigRRihya
taking hold of
nikAma-nandan
very much rejoicing
nanda-Adi-gopa-
Nanda and other Gopaas
parirabdha-vichumbita-
embracing (and) kissing
a~Ngam
the limbs
AdAtu-kAma-
desiring to take (but)
parisha~Nkita-gopanArI-
hesitating (due to shyness) the Gopikaas
hasta-ambuja-
(in) the lotus like hands (of the Gopikaas)
prapatitam
(Thou) jumped into
praNuma: bhavantam
(we) praise Thee
---------
One by one, Nanda and the other Gopaas with great joy took hold of Thee quickly and embraced and kissed Thy limbs.The Gopikaas were also desirous of taking Thee, but did not do so out of shyness. We praise Thee, who then, as a honey beetle jumped into their lotus like hands.

bhUyo.api kinnu kRRiNuma: praNatArtihArI
govinda eva paripAlayatAt sutaM na: |
ityAdi mAtarapitRRipramukhaistadAnIM
samprArthitastvadavanAya vibho tvameva ||9||
---------
bhUya:-api
again and again
kim-nu kRRiNuma:
what should we do'
praNatArtihArI
The redeemer of the devotees
govinda eva
Govinda only
paripAlayatAt
may protect
sutaM na:
our son
iti-Adi
thus etc.,
mAta:-pitRRi-
by mother father
pramukhai:-tadAnIm
and by others at that time
samprArthita:-
prayed
tvat-avanAya
(for) Thy protection
vibho tvam-eva
O Lord! To Thee only

Thy mother and father and the others wondered as to what could they do for Thy protection. Again and again, at that time, they said that only Govinda could protect their son. O Lord! The redeemer of Devotees! So they prayed to Thee alone for Thy welfare.
---------
vAtAtmakaM danujamevamayi pradhUnvan
vAtodbhavAn mama gadAn kimu no dhunoShi |
kiM vA karomi punarapyanilAlayesha
nishsheSharogashamanaM muhurarthaye tvAm ||10||

vAtAtmakaM danujam-
in the form of wind, the Asura
evam-ayi
thus O Thou!
pradhUnvan
having killed
vAta-udbhavAn
arising from the winds
mama gadAn
my ailments
kimu no dhunoShi
why do you not kill (eradicate)
kiM vA karomi
what else can I do
puna:-api-
yet again
anilAlayesha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
nishsheSha-roga-shamanaM
for the eradication of all my ailments (internal and external)
muhu:-arthaye tvAm
(I) again and again beseech Thee
---------
Thus Thou killed the Asura who was in the form of the wind. Why do not Thou kill and remove my ailments which also arise from the wind. What else can I do? O Lord of Guruvaayur! I again and again beseech Thee for the eradication of all my internal and external ailments.

Narayaneeyam D044

Dashaka 44
---------
gUDhaM vasudevagirA kartuM te niShkriyasya saMskArAn |
hRRidgatahorAtattvo gargamunistvat gRRihaM vibho gatavAn ||1||
---------
gUDham
secretly (said)
vasudeva-girA
the words of Vasudeva (directed by that)
kartum te
to do (perform) Thy
niShkriyasya
who are above all rites and rituals
saMskArAn
(Thy) sacraments
hRRid-gata-horA-tatva:
an expert in astrology
garga-muni:
Garga Muni
tvat-gRRiham
to Thy house
vibho
O Lord!
gatavAn
went

O All pervading Lord! Thou are above and beyond all ceremonies and rites. Yet, Garga Muni an expert at astronomy and astrology, went to Thy house at the secret request of Vasudeva, to perform sacraments for Thee.
---------
nando.atha nanditAtmA vRRindiShTaM mAnayannamuM yaminAm |
mandasmitArdramUche tvatsaMskArAn vidhAtumutsukadhI: ||2||

nanda:-atha
Nanda, then
nandita-AtmA
delightfully
vRRindiShTam
the greatest of all
mAnayan-amum
honouring, this (Garga Muni)
yaminAm
(greatest) of all the sages
mand-smita-Ardram-Uche
with a gentle smile said (requested)
tvat-saMskAran
sacraments for Thee
vidhAtum-utsuka-dhI:
to perform (who) was eager
---------
Nanda was very delighted and he honoured the greatest of all the sages Garga Muni, who was eager to perform the sacraments for Thee. He then, with a gentle smile requested the sage to perform the rites.

yaduvaMshAchAryatvAt sunibhRRitamidamArya kAryamiti kathayan |
gargo nirgatapulakashchakre tava sAgrajasya nAmAni ||3||
---------
yaduvaMsha-
of the Yadu clan
AchAryatvAt
being the priest
sunibhRRitam-idam-
very secretly this
Arya kAryam-iti
O Respected One (Nanda), should be done, thus
kathayan garga:
saying, sage Garga
nirgata-pulaka:-
with horripilation
chakre tava
performed, Thy with Thy elder brother's
sAgrajasya nAmAni
naming (ceremony)

Sage Garga said,'O Respected Nanda, since I am the priest of the Yadu clan, this ceremony must be performed in great secrecy'. Saying so, with horripilation over his body he performed the naming ceremony of Thee and Thy elder brother.
---------
kathamasya nAma kurve sahasranAmno hyanantanAmno vA |
iti nUnaM gargamunishchakre tava nAma nAma rahasi vibho ||4||

katham-asya
how, for this (child)
nAma kurve
naming should I do
sahasra-nAmna: hi-
(who) having a thousand names indeed
ananta-nAmna: vA
or rather having endless names
iti nUnaM
thus surely (thinking)
garga-muni:-
Garga Muni
chakre tava nAma
performed Thy naming
nAma rahasi
in great secrecy
vibho
O Lord!
---------
How should I do the naming of this child? He indeed has thousands of names or rather endless names. O Lord! May be that sage Garga thinking like this, performed Thy naming in great secrecy.

kRRiShidhAtuNakArAbhyAM sattAnandAtmatAM kilAbhilapat |
jagadaghakarShitvaM vA kathayadRRiShi: kRRiShNanAma te vyatanot ||5||
---------
kRRiShi-dhAtu-
Krish, the root (verb)
Na-kArAbhyAm
and with N suffix (by putting the two together)
sattA-Ananda-AtmatAm
Existence Bliss (being Thy) real nature
kila-abhilapat
indeed denoting
jagat-agha-karShitvaM vA
or of (the people of) the world, the sins, drawing away
kathayat-RRiShi:
declaring, the sage
kRRiShNa-nAma te
the name Krishna to Thee
vyatanot
gave

The putting together of the root of the verb Krish and the suffix N, denoting the combining of Existence and absolute Bliss, which is Thy real nature, declaring, the sage gave Thee the name Krishna. Also signifying the drawing away of the sins of the people of the world, the name Krishna was given to Thee.
---------
anyAMshcha nAmabhedAn vyAkurvannagraje cha rAmAdIn |
atimAnuShAnubhAvaM nyagadattvAmaprakAshayan pitre ||6||

anyAn-cha nAma-bhedAn
and other different names
vyAkurvan-
giving (like Vaasudeva)
agraje cha rAma-AdIn
and to Thy elder brother Raama etc (calling thus)
atimAnuSha-anubhAvaM
(of a) superhuman disposition
nyagadat-
told (indicated)
tvAm-aprakAshayan
Thee not revealing
pitre
to (Thy) father
---------
The sage also gave Thee other different names like Vaasudeva. Then he gave the name Raama etc to Thy elder brother. Having done so, Garg Muni indicated to Thy having superhuman powers and disposition, to Thy father. Yet he did not fully reveal Thy real identity as Lord Himself.

snihyati yastava putre muhyati sa na mAyikai: puna: shokai: |
druhyati ya: sa tu nashyedityavadatte mahattvamRRiShivarya: ||7||
---------
snihyati ya:-tava putre
whoever loves your son
muhyati sa na mAyikai:
he will not be deluded by Maayaa
puna: shokai:
(and) again by sorrows
druhyati ya:
he who goes against him
sa tu nashyet-
he certainly will be destroyed
iti-avadat-
thus said
te mahattvam-
Thy glory
RRiShivarya:
the great sage

Who so ever loves your son will not be deluded by Maayaa and so will not be overcome by sorrows thereafter. And who so ever assails him will certainly perish.' Thus the great sage described Thy glory and greatness.
---------
jeShyati bahutaradaityAn neShyati nijabandhulokamamalapadam |
shroShyasi suvimalakIrtIrasyeti bhavadvibhUtimRRiShirUche ||8||

jeShyati bahutara-daityAn
will conquer many Asuras
neShyati nijabandhu-lokam-
will take his own people
amala-padam
to the pure realm
shroShyasi
will make you hear
suvimala-kIrtI:-asya-
very pure fame, his
iti bhavat-vibhUtim-
thus Thy greatness
RRiShi:-Uche
the sage spoke
---------
He will conquer many Asuras and will take his own people to the realms of purity. You will have occasions to hear of his untainted pure fame.' Thus the sage spoke of Thy greatness.

amunaiva sarvadurgaM taritAstha kRRitAsthamatra tiShThadhvam |
harirevetyanabhilapannityAdi tvAmavarNayat sa muni: ||9||
---------
amunA-eva
by him alone
sarva-durgam taritAstha
all obstacles (you) will cross
kRRita-Astham-atra
placing your faith here
tiShThadhvam
remain
hari:-eva-iti-
Hari only is this
anabhilapan-
not saying
ityAdi
in this manner
tvAm-avarNayat
Thee described
sa muni:
that sage

By his help alone you will be able to overcome all obstacles. Remain with your full faith placed in him.' Thus without saying that Thou were Hari, the sage thus described Thee.
---------
garge.atha nirgate.asmin nanditanandAdinandyamAnastvam |
madgadamudgatakaruNo nirgamaya shrImarutpurAdhIsha ||10||

garge-atha
then Garg Muni
nirgate-asmin
having left, he,
nandita-nanda-Adi-
delighted Nanda and others
nandyamAna:-tvam
endeared Thou
mat-gadam-
my ailments
udgata-karuNa:
(Thou) full of compassion
nirgamaya
remove
shrImarutpurAdhIsha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
---------
Then Garga Muni went away. Nanda and the others were very delighted and looked after Thee endearingly. O Lord of Guruvaayur! who are full of compassion, remove my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D045

Dashaka 45
---------
ayi sabala murAre pANijAnuprachArai:
kimapi bhavanabhAgAn bhUShayantau bhavantau |
chalitacharaNaka~njau ma~njuma~njIrashi~njA-
shravaNakutukabhAjau cheratushchAruvegAt ||1||
---------
ayi sabala murAre
O Thou! Along with Balaraam, O Muraari!
pANi-jAnu-prachArai:
on hands and knees moving
kim-api
where not also
bhavana-bhAgAn
in the various parts of the house
bhUShayantau bhavantau
adorning, the two of Thou
chalita-charaNa-ka~njau
moving Thy two lotus feet
ma~nju-ma~njIra-shi~njA
the pleasing anklet tinkling (sound)
shravaNa-kutuka-bhAjau
eager to hear, the two of Thou
cheratu:-chAru-vegAt
moved about charmingly fast

O Lord Muraari! Thou and Thy brother Balaraam soon moved about on Thy hands and knees. When Thou moved about, Thou looked so beautiful that it was like your movements adorned the various parts of the house. With Thy movements, Thy ankle trinkets tinkled pleasingly, and so to increase the pleasing sound Thou charmingly moved about with more briskness.
---------
mRRidu mRRidu vihasantAvunmiShaddantavantau
vadanapatitakeshau dRRishyapAdAbjadeshau |
bhujagalitakarAntavyAlagatka~NkaNA~Nkau
matimaharatamuchchai: pashyatAM vishvanRRiNAm ||2||

mRRidu mRRidu vihasantau-
very gently smiling
unmiShat-dantavantau
(thereby) revealing the teeth
vadana-patita-keshau
with hair falling on the face
dRRishya-pAdAbja-deshau
with the lovely sight of the lotus feet
bhuja-galita-kara-anta-
from the arms, slipped down to the hands' end
vyAla-gat-ka~NkaNa-a~Nkau
and marked by the bracelets
matim-aharatam-uchchai:
the minds intensely captivating
pashyatAM vishvanRRiNAm
of the onlookers (and) of all the people of the world
---------
Thy very gentle smile revealed the newly cut teeth. Thy lustrous locks of hair streamed around Thy face. It was a lovely sight to look at Thy lotus feet, and Thy arms, with armlets having slipped down to the wrists which were marked with bracelets. Thou and Thy brother intensely captivated the minds of all the onlookers and also of all the people of the world.

anusarati janaughe kautukavyAkulAkShe
kimapi kRRitaninAdaM vyAhasantau dravantau |
valitavadanapadmaM pRRiShThato dattadRRiShTI
kimiva na vidadhAthe kautukaM vAsudeva ||3||
---------
anusarati janaughe
being followed by all the people
kautuka-vyAkula-AkShe
with extremely eager eyes (set on Thee)
kim-api
some sort of
kRRita-ninAdam
sound (the two of Thou) made
vyAhasantau dravantau
(then) laughed (then) started running
valita-vadana-padmam
(then) turning (Thy) lotus face
pRRiShThata: dtta-dRRiShTI
casting a look behind
kim-iva na
what also did not
vidadhAthe kautukam
(Thou) cause joyful excitements
vAsudeva
O Vaasudeva!

O Vaasudeva! All the people followed Thee with their eager affectionate eyes set on Thee. As the two of Thou ran, Thou made some screaming sounds, then laughed and ran as Thou turned Thy lotus like faces casting a look at the people behind. What incredible joyful excitement Thou caused when Thou did so!
---------
drutagatiShu patantAvutthitau liptapa~Nkau
divi munibhirapa~Nkai: sasmitaM vandyamAnau |
drutamatha jananIbhyAM sAnukampaM gRRihItau
muhurapi parirabdhau drAgyuvAM chumbitau cha ||4||

drutagatiShu
in moving fast
patantau-utthitau
falling down, then getting up
lipta-pa~Nkau
smeared (stained) with dust (mud)
divi
in the heavens
munibhi:-apa~Nkai:
by the taintless sages
sasmitaM vandyamAnau
with a smile (watching the two of Thou) being saluted
drutam-atha
quickly then
jananIbhyAM sAnukampaM
by the two mothers with great care
gRRihItau
being picked up
muhu:api parirabdhau
and again and again were embraced
drAk-yuvAM chumbitau cha
soon Thou two were kissed also
---------
As Thou two moved fast, Thou fell and got up and were smeared and tainted by mud. The taintless sages in heaven, saw these pranks and smiled at Thee and saluted Thee worshipfully. Then Thou two would be with great care quickly picked up by the two mothers and would be embraced and kissed again and again.

snutakuchabharama~Nke dhArayantI bhavantaM
taralamati yashodA stanyadA dhanyadhanyA |
kapaTapashupa madhye mugdhahAsA~NkuraM te
dashanamukulahRRidyaM vIkShya vaktraM jaharSha ||5||
---------
snuta-snuta-kuchabharam-
with overflowing and full breasts
a~Nke dhArayantI bhavantaM
in the lap holding Thee
taralamati yashodA
tender hearted Yashodaa
stanyadA dhanyadhanyA
breast feeding (Thee) was extremely fortunate
kapaTa-pashupa madhye
O Thou! The seeming cowherd boy! In the middle
mugdha-hAsa-a~NkuraM
the bewitching smile sprouting
te dashana-mukula-hRRidyaM
Thy teeth buds-like charming
vIkShya vaktraM jaharSha
seeing (Thy) face was filled with delight

The tender hearted Yashodaa with overflowing and full breasts, held Thee in her lap and fed Thee. How extremely fortunate and blessed she was as she did so. O Thou! The seeming cowherd boy! In between the feeding Thou smiled bewitchingly, revealing the charming jasmine buds like teeth, and seeing Thy face she was filled with delight.
---------
tadanucharaNachArI dArakaissAkamArA-
nnilayatatiShu khelan bAlachApalyashAlI |
bhavanashukaviDAlAn vatsakAMshchAnudhAvan
kathamapi kRRitahAsairgopakairvArito.abhU: ||6||

tadanu-charaNa-chArI
next (when Thou started) on feet walking about
dArakai:-sAkam-
with the other boys
ArAt-nilayatatiShu
in the nearby houses and compounds
khelan
playing
bAla-chApalya-shAlI
(with) the natural childish restlessness
bhavana-shuka-viDAlAn
the domestic parrots and cats
vatsakAn-cha-
and the calves
anudhAvan katham-api
chasing somehow
kRRita-hAsai:-gopakai:-
by the gopaas who were laughing
vArita:-abhU:
(Thou) were restrained
---------
Next, as Thou started to walk about, Thou played with the other boys in the neighbouring houses and compounds with the natural childlike restlessness. The Gopaas witnessed with joyful laughter as Thou also chased the pet parrots, cats and calves of the household and they somehow restrained Thee from doing so.

haladharasahitastvaM yatra yatropayAto
vivashapatitanetrAstatra tatraiva gopya: |
vigalitagRRihakRRityA vismRRitApatyabhRRityA
murahara muhuratyantAkulA nityamAsan ||7||
---------
haladhara-sahita:-tvaM
along with Haladhara (Balaraam), Thou
yatra yatra-upayAta:
where-ever went
vivasha-patita-netrA:-
with helpless (spell bound) watching
tatra tatra-eva gopya:
there there the Gopis
vigalita-gRRiha-kRRityA
neglecting their household duties
vismRRita-apatya-bhRRityA
forgetting their children and servants
murahara
O Slayer of Mura!
muhu:-atyanta-
again and again, very much
AkulA nityam-Asan
excited always were

Where so ever that Thou went with Thy elder brother Haldhar, the Gopis helplessly and spell bound kept watching Thee. They even neglected their household chores and forgot all about their children and servants. O Slayer of Mura! They were always so very much excited as this happened again and again.
---------
pratinavanavanItaM gopikAdattamichChan
kalapadamupagAyan komalaM kvApi nRRityan |
sadayayuvatilokairarpitaM sarpirashnan
kvachana navavipakvaM dugdhamapyApibastvam ||8||

pratinava-navanItaM
fresh butter
gopikA-dattam-
by the Gopikas given
ichChan kalapadam-
desiring sweet songs
upagAyan
singing
komalaM kva-api
charmingly sometimes
nRRityan
dancing
sadaya-yuvati-lokai:
by the affectionate young women folk
arpitaM sarpi:-ashnan
offered butter, eating
kvachana nava- vipakvaM
sometimes freshly boiled
dugdham-api-
milk also
apiba:-tvam
drank Thou
---------
Thou would sweetly sing and sometimes charmingly dance about with the desire of getting fresh butter. The young women full of affection gave Thee butter which Thou ate and also gave freshly boiled milk which Thou drank with delight.

mama khalu baligehe yAchanaM jAtamAstA-
miha punarabalAnAmagrato naiva kurve |
iti vihitamati: kiM deva santyajya yAch~nAM
dadhighRRitamaharastvaM chAruNA choraNena ||9||
---------
mama khalu bali-gehe
indeed my, in the house of Mahaabali
yAchanaM jAtam-AstAm
begging was done, let that be
iha puna:-
here, again
abalAnAm-agrata:
in front of the ladies
na-eva kurve
I will not do so
iti vihita-mati:
thus deciding
kiM deva
did Thou O Lord!
santyajya yach~nAM
giving up begging
dadhi-ghRRitam-
curd ghee etc
ahara:-tvaM
took Thou
chAruNA choraNena
by pleasant stealing

In the house of Mahaabali I had to go begging. Let that be. Here now in front of these ladies I am not going to do so again.' O Lord! Thus deciding Thou gave up begging for curd and ghee etc and resorted to pleasantly stealing in clever delightful ways.
---------
tava dadhighRRitamoShe ghoShayoShAjanAnA-
mabhajata hRRidi roSho nAvakAshaM na shoka: |
hRRidayamapi muShitvA harShasindhau nyadhAstvaM
sa mama shamaya rogAn vAtagehAdhinAtha ||10||

tava dadhi-ghRRitam-oShe
Thy, in the curd and ghee stealing
ghoSha-yoShA-janAnAm-
in the cowherds' colony's women folk
abhajata hRRidi roSha:
did not entertain in their hearts, anger
na-avakAshaM na shoka:
neither dearth nor sorrow
hRRidayam-api muShitvA
(their) hearts also stealing
harSha-sindhau
in the ocean of bliss
nyadhA:-tvaM
put them in, Thou
sa
That Thou
mama shamaya rogAn
my eradicate ailments
vAtagehAdhinAtha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
---------
In the cowherds' colony the Gopikas did not have place in their hearts for either anger or sorrow by Thy stealing of butter and ghee etc. They did not even feel any dearth for its being stolen. It was because Thou also stole their hearts and immersed them in the ocean of Bliss. Such Thou O Lord of Guruvaayur! May Thou eradicate my ailments.

shAkhAgre vidhuM vilokya phalamitymbAM cha tAtaM muhu:
saMprArthyAtha tadA tadIyavachasA protkShiptabAhau tvayi|
chitraM deva shashI sa te karmagAt kiM brUmahe saMpata:
jyotirmaNDalapUritAkhilavapu: prAgA virADrUpatAm || 11||
---------
shAkhA-agre-atha
(at) the branches's front (end) then
vidhum vilokya
the moon seeing
phalam-iti-ambAm
fruit it is, (to) mother
cha tAtam muhu:
and to father again and again
saMprArthya-atha
requesting, then
tadA tadIya-vachasA
at that time, by his (father's)saying
prokShipta-bAhau tvayi
were flung up the two arms by Thee
chitram
amazing
deva shashI sa
deity moon that
te karam-agAt
in Thy hands came
kim brUmahe saMpata:
what do we say of (Thy) lordliness
jyoti:-maNDala-
the luminous aura
pUrita-akhila-vapu:
covering the whole body
prAgA virATa-rUpam
attained cosmic form

On the front end of the branch of a tree, watching the moon, Thou
asked Thy mother and father again and again for it, saying that it was a fruit. At that time, then, going by Thy father's words, when Thou flung Thy two arms,amazingly, the deity moon came into Thy hands! What can we say of Thy splendorous lordliness? Thy whole
body was covered by luminous light and Thou attained Thy cosmic form!
---------
kiM kiM batedamiti saMbhrama bhAjamenaM
brahmArNave kShaNamamuM parimajjya tAtam |
mAyAM punastanaya-mohamayIM vitanvan
Anandachinmaya jaganmaya pAhi rogAt ||12||

kim kim bata-
what what, indeed
idam-iti saMbhram
this (is) thus confusion
bhAjam-enam
contained him (father)
brahma-arNave
in the cosmic ocean
kShaNam-amum
for a moment him
parimajjya tAtam
immersing father
mAyAm puna:-tanaya-
the Maayaa again, of son's
mohamayIm vitanvan
enchanting, drawing
Ananda-chinmaya
bliss, supreme consciousness
jaganmaya
O Universal form!
pAhi rogAt
save from disease
---------
'What is all this! indeed!' thus Thy father was a vessel of
amazement. Thou immersed him in the cosmic ocean for a moment, then again extended Thy Maayaa, and Thou brought about Thy enchanting form of a son. That, Bliss incarnate,Supreme Consciousness, Cosmic form, O Krishna! save me from disease!

Narayaneeyam D046

Dashaka 46
---------
ayi deva purA kila tvayi svayamuttAnashaye stanandhaye |
parijRRimbhaNato vyapAvRRite vadane vishvamachaShTa vallavI ||1||
---------
ayi deva
O Lord!
purA kila
long ago indeed
tvayi svayam-
(when) Thou by Thyself
uttAnashaye
while lying on the back
stanandhaye
and sucking at the breast (of Yashodaa)
parijRRimbhaNata:
by yawning
vyapAvRRite vadane
in Thy open mouth
vishvam-achaShTa
the universe, was seen
vallavI
by the cowherdess (Yashodaa)

O Lord! Once long ago, as Thou were lying flat on the back, in the lap of Yashodaa and sucking at her breast, Thou yawned. As Thou did so, in Thy open mouth, Thou revealed to her the whole universe.
---------
punarapyatha bAlakai: samaM tvayi lIlAnirate jagatpate |
phalasa~nchayava~nchanakrudhA tava mRRidbhojanamUchurarbhakA: ||2||

puna:-api-atha
again also
bAlakai: samaM
with the children
tvayi lIlA-nirate
(when) Thou were engrossed in play
jagatpate
O Lord of the Universe!
phala-sa~nchaya-
in collecting the fruits
va~nchana-krudhA
being cheated and angered (the children)
tava mRRid-bhojanam-
Thy eating of sand
Uchu:-arbhakA:
reported the children
---------
O Lord of the Universe! Again once, as Thou were playing with other children, Thou cheated them in collecting fruits. Angered at this, they reported to Thy mother that Thou had eaten mud.

ayi te pralayAvadhau vibho kShititoyAdisamastabhakShiNa: |
mRRidupAshanato rujA bhavediti bhItA jananI chukopa sA ||3||
---------
ayi
O (Thou)
te pralaya-avadhau
Thee at the time of deluge
vibho
O Lord!
kShiti-toya-Adi-
earth water etc
samasta-bhakShiNa:
everything consuming
mRRid-upAshanata:
by eating mud,
rujA bhavet-iti
sickness may be, thus
bhItA jananI
(Thy) frightened mother
chukopa sA
she became angry

O Lord! At the time of the deluge Thou do consume everything earth water etc. Yet Thy mother was frightened that Thou may fall sick by eating mud and so she became angry.
---------
ayi durvinayAtmaka tvayA kimu mRRitsA bata vatsa bhakShitA |
iti mAtRRigiraM chiraM vibho vitathAM tvaM pratijaj~niShe hasan ||4||

ayi durvinayAtmaka
O naughty (one)
tvayA kimu
by you was it
mRRitsA bata
that mud indeed
vatsa bhakShitA
O son, was eaten
iti mAtRRigiraM
such the words of Thy mother
chiraM vibho
for a long time O Lord
vitathAM tvaM
as false, Thee
pratijaj~niShe hasan
asserted laughingly
---------
O you naughty one! Is it that you have eaten mud O son!' O Lord! These words of Thy mother, for a long time, Thou kept on denying and laughingly asserted that Thou had not done so.

ayi te sakalairvinishchite vimatishchedvadanaM vidAryatAm |
iti mAtRRivibhartsito mukhaM vikasatpadmanibhaM vyadAraya: ||5||
---------
ayi te
O Boy! Of you
sakalai:-vinishchite
by every one asserted
vimati:-chet-
is, if disagreed
vadanaM vidAryatAm
mouth (please) open
iti mAtRRi-vibhartsita:
thus by mother reprimanded
mukhaM vikasat-padma-nibham
the mouth opening, lotus like
vyadAraya:
(Thou) opened

O Boy! If you deny what all the others are saying, please open your mouth.' Thus reprimanded by Thy mother, Thou opened Thy mouth as a lotus in full bloom.
---------
api mRRillavadarshanotsukAM jananIM tAM bahu tarpayanniva |
pRRithivIM nikhilAM na kevalaM bhuvanAnyapyakhilAnyadIdRRisha: ||6||

api mRRil-lava
even a mud trace
darshana-utsukAM
eager to see
jananIM tAM
to mother that
bahu tarpayan-iva
very much trying to please as though,
pRRithivIM nikhilAM
the earth whole
na kevalaM
not only
bhuvanAn-api-
the other worlds also
akhilAn-adIdRRisha:
entirely showed
---------
Thy mother was eager to see just a trace of mud in Thy mouth. As though to please her, and to give her abundant satisfaction Thou showed her in Thy mouth not only this whole earth but the entire universe.

kuhachidvanamambudhi: kvachit kvachidabhraM kuhachidrasAtalam |
manujA danujA: kvachit surA dadRRishe kiM na tadA tvadAnane ||7||
---------
kuhachit-vanam-
somewhere the forests
ambudhi: kvachit
the oceans somewhere
kvachit-abhraM
somewhere the sky
kuhachit-rasAtalam
somewhere the Rasaatala
manujA: danujA:
human beings, demons
kvachit surA:
somewhere the devas
dadRRishe kiM na
seen what not was
tadA tvat-Anane
at that time in Thy mouth

At that time, in Thy mouth what not was seen by Yashodaa? Somewhere the forests and oceans, somewhere the skies and Rasaatala, human beings and demons, gods and devas!
---------
kalashAmbudhishAyinaM puna: paravaikuNThapadAdhivAsinam |
svapurashcha nijArbhakAtmakaM katidhA tvAM na dadarsha sA mukhe ||8||

kalasha-ambudhi-shAyinaM
in the milk ocean, the recliner
puna: para-vaikuNThapada-
as the Paramaatamaa, in the Vaikuntha abode
adhivAsinam
the resident
sva-pura:-cha
in front of herself
nija-arbhaka-AtmakaM
as her own son
katidhA
in how many ways
tvAm na dadarsha
Thee did not see
sA mukhe
she in (Thy) mouth
---------
Yashodaa saw in Thy mouth the recliner in the milk ocean. Again she saw Paramaatamaa, the resident of the Vaikunth abode. Then she saw Thee as her son in front of her. In how many different ways did she not see Thee.

vikasadbhuvane mukhodare nanu bhUyo.api tathAvidhAnana: |
anayA sphuTamIkShito bhavAnanavasthAM jagatAM batAtanot ||9||
---------
vikasat-bhuvane
revealing the worlds
mukha-udare
in the inside of the mouth
nanu bhUya:-api
indeed then again also
tathA-vidha-Anana:
that same type of face
anayA sphuTam-IkShita:
by her was clearly seen
bhavAn-anavasthAM
Thou as the infinitude
jagatAM
of the universe
bat-Atanot
definitely expounded

In the cavity of Thy mouth she saw all the worlds, where even Thou were present with Thy mouth open, once again, in which again all the worlds were seen; and so on endlessly. This definitely expounded Thou as the infinitude of the universe.
---------
dhRRitatattvadhiyaM tadA kShaNaM jananIM tAM praNayena mohayan |
stanamamba dishetyupAsajan bhagavannadbhutabAla pAhi mAm ||10||

dhRRita-tattva-dhiyaM
holding the reality in the mind
tadA kShaNaM
at that time for a moment
jananIM tAM
to the mother
praNayena mohayan
by affection enchanting (deluding)
stanam-amba disha-
breast milk O Mother give'
iti-upAsajan
thus embracing
bhagavan-
O Lord!
adbhuta-bAla
O Wonderful Child!
pAhi mAm
protect me
---------
At that time for a moment, Yashodaa had a flash of illumination. Thou with affection deluded her and clung to her, calling her 'Mother' and demanded to be suckled. O Lord! Thou the Wondrous Child! Deign to protect me.

Narayaneeyam D047

Dashaka 47
---------
ekadA dadhivimAthakAriNIM mAtaraM samupasedivAn bhavAn |
stanyalolupatayA nivArayanna~Nkametya papivAn payodharau ||1||
---------
ekadA
once
dadhi-vimAtha-kAriNIM
the curd churning as she was
mAtaraM
Thy mother
samupasedivAn bhavAn
approached Thou
stanya-lolupatayA
breast milk desiring
nivArayan-
obstructing (the churning)
a~Nkam-etya
up (her) lap climbing
papivAn payodharau
(Thou) sucked her breasts

Once when Thy mother was churning the curd, Thou approached her in the eagerness to be breast fed. Obstructing her churning Thou climbed up her lap and sucked at her breasts.
---------
ardhapItakuchakuDmale tvayi snigdhahAsamadhurAnanAmbuje |
dugdhamIsha dahane parisrutaM dhartumAshu jananI jagAma te ||2||

ardhapIta-
having half drunk
kuchakuDmale
the breasts lotus bud like
tvayi snigdha-hAsa-
(when) Thee with a charming smile
madhura-Anana-ambuje
on the sweet face, lotus like
dugdham-Isha
the milk, O Lord!
dahane parisrutaM
on the fire, having overflown
dhartum-Ashu
to hold it, fast
jananI jagAma te
mother went away, Thy
---------
O Lord! Thou had half-way sucked her lotus bud like breasts, with a charming smile playing on the sweet lotus like face. Just then, Thy mother went away in a haste to quickly hold the milk which had overflown on the fire.

sAmipItarasabha~Ngasa~NgatakrodhabhAraparibhUtachetasA|
manthadaNDamupagRRihya pATitaM hanta deva dadhibhAjanaM tvayA ||3||
---------
sAmi-pIta-
half drunk, (so)
rasa-bha~Nga-sa~Ngata-
the joy being interrupted, as a result
krodha-bhAra-
angered greatly
paribhUta-chetasA
with the mind overcome
mantha-daNDam-
the churning rod
upagRRihya pATitaM
taking up, was broken
hanta deva
Oh! O Lord!
dadhi-bhAjanam tvayA
the curd pot by Thee

O Lord! Having drunk half way, and as a result the joy being interrupted, Thy mind was overcome with great rage. Oh! Then taking up the churning rod, the curd pot was broken by Thee.
---------
uchchaladdhvanitamuchchakaistadA sannishamya jananI samAdrutA |
tvadyashovisaravaddadarsha sA sadya eva dadhi vistRRitaM kShitau ||4||

uchchalat-dhvanitam-
by the loud sound
uchchakai:-tadA
rising high then
sannishamya
hearing
jananI samAdrutA
Thy mother hastily came running
tvat-yasha:-visara:-
Thy fame spreading
vat-dadarsha sA
as though, she saw
sadya eva dadhi
right then the curd
vistRRitaM kShitau
spreading on the floor
---------
Thy mother came running when she heard the loud sound rising of the pot being broken. Right then she saw the curd spreading on the floor,even like Thy pure unblemished fame spreading in the universe.

vedamArgaparimArgitaM ruShA tvamavIkShya parimArgayantyasau |
sandadarsha sukRRitinyulUkhale dIyamAnanavanItamotave ||5||
---------
vedamArga-parimArgitaM
through the path of the Vedas, sought after
ruShA tvAm-avIkShya
the angered (Yashodaa), Thee not seeing
parimArgayantI-
searching (Thee)
asau sandadarsha
she saw
sukRRitinI-
the fortunate one (Yashodaa)
ulUkhale
(Thee) on the mortar
dIyamAna-navanItam-
giving butter
otave
to the cat

Thou who are sought after through the path of the Vedas, were not seen anywhere by Thy angered mother. She, the fortunate one searched everywhere and saw Thee sitting on the mortar feeding butter to the cat.
---------
tvAM pragRRihya bata bhItibhAvanAbhAsurAnanasarojamAshu sA |
roSharUShitamukhI sakhIpuro bandhanAya rashanAmupAdade ||6||

tvAM pragRRihya bata
Thee getting hold of, Oh!
bhIti-bhAvanA-
by the expression of fear
bhAsura-Anana-sarojam-
the shining face which was lotus like
Ashu sA
hastily she
roSha-rUShita-mukhI
quivering with anger faced (she)
sakhI-pura:
in front of her friends
bandhanAya
to tie up Thee
rashanAm-upAdade
a rope took
---------
Oh! Yashodaa with her face quivering due to anger, hastily caught hold of Thee whose lotus like face was looking very sweet with pretended fear. As her friends watched, she took a rope to tie Thee up.

bandhumichChati yameva sajjanastaM bhavantamayi bandhumichChatI |
sA niyujya rashanAguNAn bahUn dvya~NgulonamakhilaM kilaikShata ||7||
---------
bandhum-ichChati
as a friend,(who is) desired
yam-eva sajjana:-
him alone , good people
taM bhavantam-ayi
That Thee O Lord!
bandhum-ichChatI
to tie desiring
sA niyujya
she using (tying together)
rashanA-guNAn bahUn
pieces of rope, many
dvya~Ngula-Unam-
by two fingers (long), short
akhilaM
the whole length
kila-aikShata
indeed found

All good men want to bind themselves to Thee alone in devotion. That Thou O Lord! Yashodaa desiring to tie, found the length of the rope short by two fingers, even though she attached many pieces of ropes to lengthen it.
---------
vismitotsmitasakhIjanekShitAM svinnasannavapuShaM nirIkShya tAm |
nityamuktavapurapyaho hare bandhameva kRRipayA.anvamanyathA: ||8||

vismit-utsmita-
wonderstruck and smiling
sakhIjana-IkShitAM
the friends (Gopis) watching
svinna-sanna-vapuShaM
(she, with) perspiring and exhausted body
nirIkShya tAm
seeing her (Yashodaa)
nitya-mukta-vapu:-
forever free bodied
api-aho hare
though O Hari! (Thou)
bandham-eva
bondage alone
kRRipayA-anvamanyathA:
compassionately accepted
---------
As Thy mother's friends were smilingly watching with wonder, Thou saw her body perspiring and exhausted due to the effort. O Hari! Thou who are the ever-free Being, out of compassion accepted the bondage.

sthIyatAM chiramulUkhale khaletyAgatA bhavanameva sA yadA|
prAgulUkhalabilAntare tadA sarpirarpitamadannavAsthithA: ||9||
---------
sthIyatAM
(may you) stay here
chiram-ulUkhale
for long at the mortar
khala-iti-
O rouge, thus (saying)
AgatA bhavanam-eva
(when she) returned to the house only
sA yadA prAk-
she when, earlier
ulUkhala-bilAntare
in the mortar's cavity
tadA sarpi:-arpitam-
then, the butter which was placed
adan-avAsthithA:
eating Thou stayed

As Yashodaa went back into the house, she said 'O Rogue! stay tied like this to the mortar for long.' Thou stayed there eating the butter which Thou had earlier placed in the cavity of the mortar.
---------
yadyapAshasugamo vibho bhavAn saMyata: kimu sapAshayA.anayA |
evamAdi divijairabhiShTuto vAtanAtha paripAhi mAM gadAt ||10||

yadi-apAsha-sugama:
if (Thou are) to the desire less easily attainable
vibho bhavAn
O All pervading Being! Thou
saMyata: kimu
were tied down, how come
sapAshayA-anayA
(who was) having a rope, by her (Yashodaa)
evam-Adi
thus and so forth
divijai:-abhiShTuta:
by the gods in heaven praised
vAtanAtha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
paripAhi mAM gadAt
save me from my ailments.
---------
O All Pervading Being! If Thou are easily attainable to the desire less (a-paash) people, who are not bound by desire, how was it that Yashodaa was able to secure Thee with a (paash) rope for binding. Thou whose glories were thus sung by the gods in the heaven, O Lord of Guruvaayur! May Thou save me from my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D048

Dashaka 48
---------
mudA suraughaistvamudArasammadai-
rudIrya dAmodara ityabhiShTuta: |
mRRidudara: svairamulUkhale laga-
nnadUrato dvau kakubhAvudaikShathA: ||1||
---------
mudA suraughai:-
joyfully by the group of gods
tvam-udAra-sammadai:-
Thou (was called) with great happiness
udIrya dAmodara
was called Daamodara
iti-abhiShTuta:
(and) thus were praised/ glorified
mRRidu-udara:
tender bellied
svairam-ulUkhale
Thyself at the mortar
lagan-adUrata:
attached, not far away
dvau kakubhau-udaikShathA:
two Kakubha (Arjuna) tree, saw

Thou were joyfully named Daamodara by the group of sages who were watching Thee with great happiness, and they praised and glorified Thee. Thou who with a tender belly were attached to the mortar, saw two Kakubha (Arjuna) trees not far away.
---------
kuberasUnurnalakUbarAbhidha:
paro maNigrIva iti prathAM gata: |
maheshasevAdhigatashriyonmadau
chiraM kila tvadvimukhAvakhelatAm ||2||

kubera-sUnu:-
Kuber's sons
nalakUbara-abhidha:
named Nalakubara
para: maNigrIva iti
another one Manigreeva thus
prathAM gata:
became well known
mahesha-sevA-
by worshipping Shiva
adhigata-shriya-
attained prosperity
unmadau chiraM kila
(both) became haughty, for long, indeed
tvat-vimukhau-
indifferent to Thee
avakhelatAm
(and) became wayward
---------
The two sons of Kuber, (the god of wealth) one known as Nalakubara and the other one known as Manigreeva became very well known. By worshipping Shiva they also attained great prosperity and because of the pride of wealth they became very haughty and indifferent to Thee. For a very long time they led a very wayward life.

surApagAyAM kila tau madotkaTau
surApagAyadbahuyauvatAvRRitau |
vivAsasau keliparau sa nArado
bhavatpadaikapravaNo niraikShata ||3||
---------
sura-ApagAyAm
in the sacred river of the gods (Ganges)
kila tau madotkaTau
indeed, the two of them, intoxicated
surA-Apa-gAyat-
wine having drunk and singing
bahu-yauvata-AvRRitau
by many (such drunk) damsels surrounded
vivAsisau keliparau
without clothes sporting
sa nArada:
that (sage) Naarada (who)
bhavat-pada-eka-pravaNa:
to Thy feet alone is devoted
niraikShata
saw

Naarada who is devoted to Thee alone, once saw these two sporting in the Ganges which is the river of the gods. They were in an intoxicated state having drunk wine and were surrounded by young intoxicated damsels, stark naked, singing and sporting in the Ganges waters.
---------
bhiyA priyAlokamupAttavAsasaM
puro nirIkShyApi madAndhachetasau |
imau bhavadbhaktyupashAntisiddhaye
munirjagau shAntimRRite kuta: sukham ||4||

bhiyA priyA-lokam-
in fear, the dear women
upAtta-vAsasaM
put on the clothes
pura: nirIkShya-api
in front seeing, even then
mada-andha-chetasau
by intoxication blind minded
imau
(to) these two
bhavat-bhakti-
devotion to Thee
upashAnti-siddhaye
and mental peace, to achieve
muni:-jagau
the Muni said
shAntim-RRite
without calmness of mind
kuta: sukham
where is happiness
---------
At the sight of sage Naarada, the dear women hastily put on their clothes. Even then, with the mind blinded by intoxication, these two, continued to sport in nakedness. The Muni then pronounced thus (in the next shloka) in order for them to achieve devotion to Thee and mental peace. For without calmness of mind where is happiness?

yuvAmavAptau kakubhAtmatAM chiraM
hariM nirIkShyAtha padaM svamApnutam |
itIretau tau bhavadIkShaNaspRRihAM
gatau vrajAnte kakubhau babhUvatu: ||5||
---------
yuvAm-avAptau
you two getting
kakubha-AtmatAM chiraM
the personification of Kakubh trees for long
hariM nirIkShya-atha
Hari seeing then
padaM svam-Apnutam
to your own state you two will get
iti-Iritau tau
thus being told the two of them
bhavat-IkShaNa-spRRihAM
the vision of Thee desiring
gatau vraja-ante
going to the outskirts of Gokul
kakubhau babhUvatu:
became Kakubha (Arjuna) trees

You two will become Kakubha trees for long. Then when you see Hari, you two will get to your own state.' Being thus told by the sage, desiring to get Thy vision, they went to the outskirts of Vraja and became Kakubha trees.
---------
atandramindradruyugaM tathAvidhaM
sameyuShA mantharagAminA tvayA |
tirAyitolUkhalarodhanirdhutau
chirAya jIrNau paripAtitau tarU ||6||

atandram-
without pausing (Thee)
indra-dru-yugam
the two Arjuna trees
tathA-vidham
which were such
sameyuShA
were approached (by Thee)
manthara-gAminA tvayA
moving in slow pace by Thee
tirAyuta-ulUkhala-
the crosswise mortar
rodha-nirdhutau
obstructed and so uprooted
chirAya jIrNau
for long decayed
paripAtitau tarU
and felled the trees
---------
Those two such Arjuna trees Thou approached in a slow pace without a pause, as Thou pulled along the crosswise mortar, which obstructed the aged and long decayed trees and felled them.

abhAji shAkhidvitayaM yadA tvayA
tadaiva tadgarbhatalAnnireyuShA |
mahAtviShA yakShayugena tatkShaNA-
dabhAji govinda bhavAnapi stavai: ||7||
---------
abhAji shAkhidvitayaM
felled the two trees
yadA tvayA tadA-eva
when by Thee, just then
tat-garbha-talAt-nireyuShA
from their core emerged
mahAtviShA
the radiant
yakShayugena
pair of Yakshas(sons of Kuber) by whom
tat-kShaNAt-abhAji
immediately were worshipped
govinda
O Govind!
bhavAn-api stavai:
Thou also with hymns

When the two trees were felled by Thee, just then from their root cores emerged a pair of radiant Yakshas. O Govinda! They immediately worshipped Thee with hymns.
---------
ihAnyabhakto.api sameShyati kramAt
bhavantametau khalu rudrasevakau |
muniprasAdAdbhavda~NghrimAgatau
gatau vRRiNAnau khalu bhaktimuttamAm ||8||

iha-anya-bhakta:-api
here (in this world), devotees of other gods also
sameShyati
will certainly come
kramAt bhavantam-
in due course to Thee
etau khalu rudra-sevakau
these two, indeed, devotees of Rudra
muni-prasAdAt-
by Muni Naarada's grace
bhavat-a~Nghrim-
Thy feet
Agatau gatau
reached, and went away
vRRiNAnau khalu
praying for, indeed
bhaktim-uttamAm
the highest devotion (to Thee)
---------
Here in this world, in due course, the devotees of other gods also certainly come to Thee only. These two devotees of Rudra, by the grace of Naarada, reached Thy feet. They prayed to Thee and beseeched for the highest devotion and went away.

tatastarUddAraNadAruNArava-
prakampisampAtini gopamaNDale |
vilajjitatvajjananImukhekShiNA
vyamokShi nandena bhavAn vimokShada: ||9||
---------
tata:-tarU-ddAraNa-
then by the falling of the trees
dAruNa-Arava-
the frightening sound (hearing)
prakampi-sampAtini
trembling and rushing
gopa-maNDale
the group of Gopas
vilajjita-tvat-jananI-
ashamed Thy mother
mukha-ikShiNA
her face being glanced at
vyamokShi nandena
releasing Thee (glanced) by Nanda (meaningfully)
bhavAn vimokShada:
Thee, who releases all

Then by the falling of the trees, which caused the frightening sound, the group of Gopas were frightened and rushed to the spot trembling. As Nanda glanced at Thy mother meaningfully, she felt very ashamed. He then released Thee from the mortar, who releases everyone from the bonds of Samsaara (the cycle of repeated life and death and the illusion of Maayaa).
---------
mahIruhormadhyagato batArbhako
hare: prabhAvAdaparikShato.adhunA |
iti bruvANairgamito gRRihaM bhavAn
marutpurAdhIshvara pAhi mAM gadAt ||10||

mahIruho:-madhya-gata:
of the two trees, having entered their interspace (middle)
bata-arbhaka:
O what a wonder the child
hare: prabhAvAt-
by God's grace
aparikShata:-adhunA
is safe (unhurt), today
iti bruvANai:-
thus by them who were saying
gamita: gRRihaM
(Thou) were taken to the house
bhavAn marutpurAdhIshvara
Thou O Lord of Guruvaayur!
pAhi mAM gadAt
save me from ailments
---------
Having entered the interspace of the two trees and the trees having fallen, it is only God's grace that the child is safe and unhurt today.' As they said so they carried Thee to the house. O Thou Lord of Guruvaayur! Save me from my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D049

Dashaka 49
---------
bhavatprabhAvAvidurA hi gopAstaruprapAtAdikamatra goShThe |
ahetumutpAtagaNaM visha~Nkya prayAtumanyatra mano vitenu: ||1||
---------
bhavat-prabhAva-
Thy glory
avidurA: hi gopA:-
not knowing, so indeed, the Gopas
taru-prapAta-Adikam-
the trees' falling and other such (incidents)
atra goShThe
here in Gokula
ahetum-utpAta-gaNam
unreasonable ill-omens
visha~Nkya
suspecting
prayAtum-anyatra
to move, somewhere else
mana: vitenu:
minds made up (decided)

The Gopas who were not aware of Thy glory and greatness, interpreted the falling of the trees and such other occurrences as unaccountable ill-omens. So they made up their minds and decided to migrate to some other place.
---------
tatropanandAbhidhagopavaryo jagau bhavatpreraNayaiva nUnam |
ita: pratIchyAM vipinaM manoj~naM vRRindAvanaM nAma virAjatIti ||2||

tatra-upananda-abhidha-
there, by the name of Upananda
gopavarya: jagau
the leading Gopa said
bhavat-preraNayA-eva
by Thy prompting alone
nUnam
certainly
ita: pratIchyAm
from here to the West
vipinaM manoj~naM
a pleasant forest land
vRRindAvanaM nAma
Vrindaavana by name
virAjati-iti
is situated, thus (he said)
---------
Indeed by Thy prompting alone, a leading Gopa named Upananda brought to their notice the beautiful forest country side called Vrindaavana, situated to the west of Gokula, as a proper location for their settlement.

bRRihadvanaM tat khalu nandamukhyA vidhAya gauShThInamatha kShaNena |
tvadanvitatvajjananIniviShTagariShThayAnAnugatA vichelu: ||3||
---------
bRRihadvanam tat khalu
Vrihadvana, that indeed
nanda-mukhyA vidhAya
Nanda and others making
gauShThInam-atha
a cowshed then
kShaNena
in no time
tvat-anvita-
carrying Thee
tvat-jananI-niviShTa-
(and) Thy mother sitting
gariShTha-yAna-anugatA
in the imposing vehicle, following
vichelu:
proceeded

Nanda and the others soon abandoned the Vrihadvana settlement and made it as a cowshed. They proceeded following the imposing vehicle which was carrying Thee and in which Thy mother was sitting.
---------
anomanoj~nadhvanidhenupAlIkhurapraNAdAntarato vadhUbhi: |
bhavadvinodAlapitAkSharANi prapIya nAj~nAyata mArgadairghyam ||4||

ana:-manoj~na-dhvani-
of the cart, the pleasant sound
dhenu-pAlI-
of the rows of the cows
khura-praNAda-antarata:
trampling of the hooves, interspersed,
vadhUbhi:
by the ladies
bhavat-vinoda-
Thy playfully
Alapita-akSharANi
spoken words
prapIya na-aj~nAyata
drinking in, did not feel
mArga-dairghyam
the path's distance
---------
The Gopikaas did not feel the distance of the path covered, as they were fully engrossed in Thy playful prattle. The pleasant sound of the cart was interspersed by the trampling sound of the hooves of the rows of the cows.

nirIkShya vRRindAvanamIsha nandatprasUnakundapramukhadrumaugham |
amodathA: shAdvalasAndralakShmyA harinmaNIkuTTimapuShTashobham ||5||
---------
nirIkShya vRRindAvanam-
on seeing Vrindaavana
Isha
O Lord!
nandat-prasUna-
with flowers blossoming
kunda-pramukha-druma-augham
mainly Kunda and clusters of trees
amodathA:
(Thou were) delighted
shAdvala-sAndra-lakShmyA
the thick grass with its intense beauty
harin-maNI-kuTTima-
(as though) green emerald inlaid
puShTa-shobham
(hence) adding to the beauty

O Lord! Thou were delighted to see Vrindaavana. The Kunda flowers were in full bloom and there were clusters of trees all around. Its expansive grass lands had the intense beauty as though green emerald was inlaid.
---------
navAkanirvyUDhanivAsabhedeShvasheShagopeShu sukhAsiteShu |
vanashriyaM gopakishorapAlIvimishrita: paryagalokathAstvam ||6||

navAka-nirvyUDha-
in the form of a half moon (semi circle), having built
nivAsa-bhedeShu-
the houses differently
asheSha-gopeShu
when all the Gopas
sukha-AsiteShu
were sitting comfortably
vanashriyaM
the beauty of the forest
gopa-kishora-pAlI-
with the group of the young boys of the Gopas
vimishrita:
(Thou) mingling with them
paryak-alokathA:-tvam
all around admiringly saw Thou
---------
The Gopas built their new houses forming a semi-circle, and settled down there and were sitting peacefully and comfortably. Along with the young boys of the Gopas, Thou went about the whole place looking around admiringly, and enjoying the beauty of the forest.

arAlamArgAgatanirmalApAM marAlakUjAkRRitanarmalApAm |
nirantarasmerasarojavaktrAM kalindakanyAM samalokayastvam ||7||
---------
arAla-mArga-
in winding ways
Agat-nirmala-ApAM
flowing with clear waters
marAla-kUja-
by the swans' cooings
AkRRita-narma-lApAm
making the river sound sweet
nirantara-smera-
ever smiling
saroja-vaktrAm
lotus faced
kalinda-kanyAm
the daughter of Kalinda
samalokaya:-tvam
Thou saw

Thou saw the daughter of Kalinda, Kaalindi or Yamunaa river which was flowing with clear waters through winding ways. The echoes of the cooing of the swans enhanced the sweet sound of the river. The thick growth of the full blown lotuses was like her ever smiling face.
---------
mayUrakekAshatalobhanIyaM mayUkhamAlAshabalaM maNInAm |
viri~nchalokaspRRishamuchchashRRi~NgairgiriM cha govardhanamaikShathAstvam ||8||

mayUra-kekA-shata-
with the peacocks' many calls
lobhanIyaM
(which was) resonant
mayUkha-mAlA-shabalam
by the rays of light's multi colored radiance
maNInAm
of the gems
viri~ncha-loka-
Brahma's abode
spRRisham-uchcha-shRRi~Ngai:
as though touching with its high peaks
girim cha govardhanam-
and such a mountain Govardhana
aikShathA:-tvam
saw Thou
---------
Thou also saw the majestic Govardhana mountain. It was attractive by the resonant sound of the calls of the peacocks. It was radiant by the multi colored rays of the gems it contained. Its high peaks were as though touching the abode of Brahmaa.

samaM tato gopakumArakaistvaM samantato yatra vanAntamAgA: |
tatastatastAM kuTilAmapashya: kalindajAM rAgavatImivaikAm ||9||
---------
samaM tata:
with, then,
gopakumArakai:-
the Gopa boys
tvaM samantata: yatra
Thou all around where ever
vanAntam-AgA:
to the end of the forest went
tata:-tata:-
there, there
tAm kuTilAm-
her winding
apashya: kalindajAm
Thou saw the river Yamunaa
rAgavatIm-iva-aikAm
love-lorn like, in solitude

Then with the Gopa boys where ever Thou went, even to the end of the forest, Thou came across the winding course of the Yamunaa river, as though she was a love-lorn damsel, waiting to meet Thee in solitude.
---------
tathAvidhe.asmin vipine pashavye samutsuko vatsagaNaprachAre |
charan sarAmo.atha kumArakaistvaM samIragehAdhipa pAhi rogAt ||10||

tathA-vidhe-
in that kind of
asmin vipine
this forest
pashavye
suited for the cattle
samutsuka:
very excited
vatsagaNa-prachAre
in the calves's tending
charan-sarAma:-atha
moving about with Balaraama, then
kumArakai:-tvaM
and with the young boys, Thou
samIragehAdhipa
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
pAhi rogAt
protect me from illness
---------
Thou then with Balaraam and the other young boys with great excitement tended the calves in this forest which was well suited for the cattle. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Protect me from illness.

Narayaneeyam D050

Dashaka 50
---------
taralamadhukRRit vRRinde vRRindAvane.atha manohare
pashupashishubhi: sAkaM vatsAnupAlanalolupa: |
haladharasakho deva shrIman vicheritha dhArayan
gavalamuralIvetraM netrAbhirAmatanudyuti: ||1||
---------
tarala-madhukRRit-vRRinde
with fleeting honey bee swarms
vRRindAvane-atha
in Vrindaavana, then
manohare
the beautiful one
pashupa-shishubhi: sAkaM
with the cowherd boys
vatsa-anupAlana-lolupa:
in tending the calves engrossed
haladhara-sakha:
accompanied by Haladhara
deva shrIman
O Lord! Consort of Laxmi!
vicheritha dhArayan
(Thou) moved about carrying
gavala-muralI-vetraM
a horn flute and cane
netra-abhirAma-tanu-dyuti:
pleasing to the eyes (with Thy) radiant form

In the beautiful Vrindaavana swarms of honey bees would fleet around. There, O Auspicious Lord! Consort of Laxmi! Accompanied by Haladhara and other cowherd boys, Thou moved about with Thy radiant form pleasing to the eyes. Keen on tending the cows, Thou carried a horn, flute and a cane.
---------
vihitajagatIrakShaM lakShmIkarAmbujalAlitaM
dadati charaNadvandvaM vRRindAvane tvayi pAvane |
kimiva na babhau sampatsampUritaM taruvallarI-
saliladharaNIgotrakShetrAdikaM kamalApate ||2||

vihita-jagatI-rakShaM
infused with the protection of the world
lakShmI-kara-ambuja-lAlitaM
by Laxmi's lotus like hands caressed
dadati charaNa-dvandvam
(when Thou) places (Thy) two feet
vRRindAvane tvayi pAvane
in Vrindaavana, by Thee, in the holy (Vrindaavana)
kim-iva na babhau
what all did not take place
sampat-sampUritaM
with prosperity full of
taru-vallarI-salila-
the trees, creepers, waters
dharaNI-gotra-kShetra-AdikaM
land, hills, and fields etc
kamalApate
O Consort of Laxmi!
---------
O Consort of Laxmi! Thou set Thy two feet, which are caressed by Laxmi's lotus hands and which are infused with the protection of the world, in Vrindaavana. When Thou did so, the trees, creepers, waters, lands, hills and fields and what all was not full of prosperity!

vilasadulape kAntArAnte samIraNashItale
vipulayamunAtIre govardhanAchalamUrdhasu |
lalitamuralInAda: sa~nchArayan khalu vAtsakaM
kvachana divase daityaM vatsAkRRitiM tvamudaikShathA: ||3||
---------
vilasat-ulape
in the lavish grass meadows
kAntAra-ante
at the forests' end
samIraNa-shItale
with cool breeze (blowing)
vipula-yamunA-tIre
on the vast banks of Yamunaa
govardhana-achala-mUrdhasu
on the Govardhana mountain peaks
lalita-muralI-nAda:
with the gentle flute sound
sa~nchArayan khalu vAtsakaM
(leading) to graze the calves, indeed
kvachana divase
one day
daityaM vatsa-AkRRitim
an Asura in the form of a calf
tvam-udaikShathA:
Thou saw

In the lavish grass meadows at the end of the forests, the cool breeze was blowing on the vast banks of the Yamunaa river, on the peaks of the Govardhana mountain, Thou were playing the flute softly as Thou lead the calves to graze. One day, Thou saw an Asura in the form of a calf.
---------
rabhasavilasatpuchChaM vichChAyato.asya vilokayan
kimapi valitaskandhaM randhrapratIkShamudIkShitam |
tamatha charaNe bibhradvibhrAmayan muhuruchchakai:
kuhachana mahAvRRikShe chikShepitha kShatajIvitam ||4||

rabhasa-vilasat-puchChaM
with force wagging the tail
vichChAyata:-
while walking
asya vilokayan
his (calf's) gaze
kim-api valita-skandhaM
with somewhat turning his neck
randhra-pratIkSham-udIkShitam
for a loop hole waiting to see
tam-atha charaNe
him, then with two legs
vibhrat-vibhrAmayan
catching hold of and swirling
muhu:-uchchakai:
again and again very fast
kuhachana mahAvRRikShe
on a big tree
chikShepitha kShata-jIvitam
(Thou) threw, as he lost his life
---------
As the Asura walked about, wagging its tail briskly and forcefully, it turned its head in a strange way looking for a loop hole (an opportunity) to strike. Thou caught him by his two legs and swirling him very fast again and again, threw him on a big tree just as he lost his life.

nipatati mahAdaitye jAtyA durAtmani tatkShaNaM
nipatanajavakShuNNakShoNIruhakShatakAnane |
divi parimilat vRRindA vRRindArakA: kusumotkarai:
shirasi bhavato harShAdvarShanti nAma tadA hare ||5||
---------
nipatati mahA-daitye
(when) killed was the mighty Asura
jAtyA durAtmani
(who) by birth was evil minded
tat-kShaNam
then at that time
nipatana-java-
(because of) the falling force
kShuNNa-kShoNI:-
by breaking of the top of
uha-kShata-kAnane
the trees (and so) destroyed the forests
divi parimilat vRRindA
in the skies, the assembled groups
vRRindArakA:
of gods
kusuma-utkarai:
with flowers' heaps
shirasi bhavata:
on Thy head
harShAt-varShanti
with joy, showering
nAma tadA hare
indeed, then, O God!

By the impact of the fall of the Asura who was evil minded by birth, the tops of the trees were broken and the forests were destroyed. O God! The gods then assembling in the skies showered heaps of flowers on Thy head, in joy.
---------
surabhilatamA mUrdhanyUrdhvaM kuta: kusumAvalI
nipatati tavetyukto bAlai: sahelamudairaya: |
jhaTiti danujakShepeNordhvaM gatastarumaNDalAt
kusumanikara: so.ayaM nUnaM sameti shanairiti ||6||

surabhilatamA
most fragrant
mUrdhani-UrdhvaM
on top of (Thy) head
kuta: kusumAvalI
from where cluster of flowers
nipatati tava-
is falling (on) Thy (head)
iti-ukta: bAlai:
thus was said by the children
sahelam-udairaya:
jokingly (Thou) said
jhaTiti
suddenly
danuja-kShepeNa-
by the Asura's throwing
UrdhvaM gata:-
rising upward
taru-maNDalAt
from the clusters of the trees
kusuma-nikara:
the heaps of flowers
sa:-ayaM nUnaM
that this indeed
sameti shanai:-iti
is coming down slowly, thus
---------
The cowherd children asked Thee as to from where the extremely fragrant heap of flowers were falling on the top of Thy head. Thou jokingly told them that when the Asura was thrown , the flowers blooming on the clusters of the trees rose up and indeed those flowers were coming down slowly now.

kvachana divase bhUyo bhUyastare paruShAtape
tapanatanayApAtha: pAtuM gatA bhavadAdaya: |
chalitagarutaM prekShAmAsurbakaM khalu vismrRRitaM
kShitidharagaruchChede kailAsashailamivAparam ||7||
---------
kvachana divase
on another day
bhUya: bhUyastare
again, again very much
paruSha-Atape
(when) it was very hot
tapana-tanayA-pAtha:
the sun daughter's waters (waters of Yamunaa)
pAtuM gatA
to drink went
bhavat-Adaya:
Thou and others
chalita-garutam
moving very quickly (the wings)
prekShAmAsu:-bakaM
(Thou) saw a crane
khalu vismRRitaM
indeed forgotten
kShitidhara-garut-Chede
(when) the mountains' wings were cut (by Indra)
kailAsa-shailam-iva-aparam
Kailaash mountain like another

Again on another day, when it was extremely hot, Thou and the others went to drink the water of river Yamunaa who is the daughter of the Sun. Thou saw a crane flapping its wings very quickly, which looked like the mountain Kailaash whose wings Indra forgot to cut when he was cutting off the wings of the mountains.
---------
pibati salilaM gopavrAte bhavantamabhidruta:
sa kila nigilannagniprakhyaM punardrutamudvaman |
dalayitumagAttroTyA: koTyA tadA.a.ashu bhavAn vibho
khalajanabhidAchu~nchushcha~nchU pragRRihya dadAra tam ||8||

pibati salilaM
drinking the water (when)
gopavrAte
the cowherd boys were,
bhavantam-abhidruta:
towards Thee charging
sa kila nigilan-
he indeed swallowing Thee
agni-prakhyam
fire-like (Thee)
puna:-drutam-udvaman
again hastily spitting out
dalayitum-agAt-
to tear (Thee) came
troTyA: koTyA
by the beaks point
tadA-Ashu
then quickly
bhavAn vibho
Thou O Lord!
khala-jana-bhidA-chu~nchu:-
in the evil people destroying expert
cha~nchU pragRRihya
(his Asura's) beak, catching hold of
dadAra tam
tore him apart
---------
When the cowherd boys were drinking water, he charged towards Thee and swallowed Thee and again hastily spit Thee out like a ball of fire. He then came to tear Thee by the point of its beak. O Lord! Thou who are adapt at destroying the evil people, catching hold of his beak, tore him apart.

sapadi sahajAM sandraShTuM vA mRRitAM khalu pUtanA-
manujamaghamapyagre gatvA pratIkShitumeva vA |
shamananilayaM yAte tasmin bake sumanogaNe
kirati sumanovRRindaM vRRindAvanAt gRRihamaiyathA: ||9||
---------
sapadi sahajAM
hastily, (his) sister
sandraShTuM vA mRRitAM
to see or the dead
khalu pUtanAm-
indeed Pootanaa
anujam-agham-api-
(Or) the younger brother Agha also
agre gatvA
ahead going
pratIkShitum-eva vA
or awaiting him only
shamana-nilayaM
to the abode of death
yAte tasmin bake
his having gone, the crane's
sumanogaNe
(when) the host of gods
kirati sumana-vRRindaM
was showering heaps of flowers
vRRindAvanAt
from Vrindaavana
gRRiham-aiyathA:
to home (Thou) went

In no time the crane demon reached the abode of death as if to see his dead sister Pootanaa or as if to welcome his younger brother Aghaasura who was to follow him. As the host of gods were showering heaps of flowers, Thou went home from the woods of Vrindaavana.
---------
lalitamuralInAdaM dUrAnnishamya vadhUjanai-
stvaritamupagamyArAdArUDhamodamudIkShita: |
janitajananInandAnanda: samIraNamandira-
prathitavasate shaure dUrIkuruShva mamAmayAn ||10||

lalita-muralI-nAdaM
the sweet sound of the flute
dUrAt-nishamya
from far hearing
vadhUjanai:-
by the Gopikas
tvaritam-upagamya-ArAt-
hastily approaching near
ArUDha-modam-udIkShita:
in extreme joy (they) saw (Thee)
janita-jananI-nanda-Ananda:
causing joy to (Thy) mother and Nanda
samIraNa-mandira-prathita-vasate
in the Guruvaayur temple, famous, living
shaure
O Shauri! (Vaasudeva)
dUrI kuruShva
expel
mama-AmayAn
my ailments
---------
The Gopikaas heard the sweet sound of Thy flute and rushed with great joy to have a glimpse of Thee. Thy parents Yashoda and Nanda were also very delighted to see Thee. O Thou Shauri! (Vaasudeva) Who are well known to be residing in the famous temple of Guruvaayur, be pleased to expel my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D051

Dashaka 51
---------
kadAchana vrajashishubhi: samaM bhavAn
vanAshane vihitamati: pragetarAm |
samAvRRito bahutaravatsamaNDalai:
satemanairniragamadIsha jemanai: ||1||
---------
kadAchana
once
vrajashishubhi: samaM
along with the children of Gokul
bhavAn vana-ashane
Thou, eating in the woods (picnic)
vihita-mati:
making up the mind
pragetarAm samAvRRita:
early in the morning surrounded by
bahutara-vatsa-maNDalai:
many herds of calves
satemanai:-niragamat-
with eatables set out
Isha jemanai:
O Lord! (also taking along) cooked rice

Once Thou decided to have a picnic in the woods. Along with the children of Gokul and surrounded by a large herd of calves, Thou set out early in the morning. O Lord Thou also took along eatables, cooked rice and other delicacies.
---------
viniryatastava charaNAmbujadvayA-
duda~nchitaM tribhuvanapAvanaM raja: |
maharShaya: pulakadharai: kalebarai-
rudUhire dhRRitabhavadIkShaNotsavA: ||2||

viniryata: tava
Thy having set out
charaNa-ambuja-dvayAt-
from Thy two lotus like feet
uda~nchitaM
risen up
tribhuvana-pAvanaM raja:
(that which) sanctifies the three worlds, dust
maharShaya: pulakadharai:
the great sages with horripilation
kalebarai:-udUhire
on their bodies received
dhRRita-bhavat-IkShaNa-
holding Thy sight
utsavA:
as celebration
---------
When Thou set out for the woods, from Thy lotus like two feet the dust arose which sanctifies the three worlds. The great sages received that dust on their bodies with great joy and horripilation as they feasted their eyes on Thy sight.

prachArayatyaviralashAdvale tale
pashUn vibho bhavati samaM kumArakai: |
aghAsuro nyaruNadaghAya vartanI
bhayAnaka: sapadi shayAnakAkRRiti: ||3||
---------
prachArayati-
grazing
avirala-shAdvale tale
on the thick grass land
pashUn vibho
the cattle, O Lord!
bhavati samaM kumArakai:
Thee with the lads
aghAsura: nyaruNat-
Aghaasura blocked
aghAya vartanI
for an evil deed the path
bhayAnaka: sapadi
most terrifying, suddenly
shayAnaka-AkRRiti:
in a python form

Thou and the lads were grazing the cattle on the thick grass lands. Suddenly the most terrifying demon Aghaasura, in the form of a formidable python, with an evil intention blocked the way.
---------
mahAchalapratimatanorguhAnibha-
