prasAritaprathitamukhasya kAnane |
mukhodaraM viharaNakautukAdgatA:
kumArakA: kimapi vidUrage tvayi ||4||

mahAchala-pratima-tano:-
with a mountain like body
guhA-nibha-prasArita-
cave like spread out
prathita-mukhasya
extended mouth
kAnane
in the forest
mukha-udaraM
in the mouth cavity
viharaNa-kautukAt-
to explore in eagerness
gatA: kumArakA:
entered the lads
kim-api
(when) somewhat
vidUrage tvayi
ahead had gone, Thee
---------
Thou had gone a little ahead. The lads mistook the huge body of the Asura for a mountain and its large spread out mouth for a cave. In their eagerness to explore the woods, they entered the python's open mouth.

pramAdata: pravishati pannagodaraM
kvathattanau pashupakule savAtsake |
vidannidaM tvamapi viveshitha prabho
suhRRijjanaM visharaNamAshu rakShitum ||5||
---------
pramAdata: pravishati
by mistake, had entered
pannaga-udaraM
the snake's belly
kvathat-tanau
(they) felt heat on their bodies
pashupakule savAtsake
the Gopa boys along with the calves
vidan-idam tvam-api
knowing this, Thou also
viveshitha prabho
entered O Lord!
suhRRit-janaM
the friend folk
visharaNam-
who were helpless
Ashu rakShitum
immediately to save

The Gopa boys along with the calves had entered the belly of the snake by mistake and started to feel the heat therein. O Lord! Apprehending the situation, Thou also entered immediately to save the helpless friends.
---------
galodare vipulitavarShmaNA tvayA
mahorage luThati niruddhamArute |
drutaM bhavAn vidalitakaNThamaNDalo
vimochayan pashupapashUn viniryayau ||6||

gala-udare
in the throat's cavity
vipulita-varShmaNA
with (Thy) increased body
tvayA
by Thee
mahorage luThati
(when) the python was wreathing
niruddha-mArute
because of the obstruction of the breath
drutaM bhavAn
quickly Thou
vidalita-kaNTha-maNDala:
tearing asunder the neck portion
vimochayan pashupa-pashUn
released the Gopa boys and the calves
viniryayau
and came out
---------
In the cavity of the throat of the python, Thou increased Thy size of Thy body, thus obstructing its breath. It began to wreath in agony, then Thou tore open its neck portion and releasing the Gopa boys and the calves, Thou also came out.

kShaNaM divi tvadupagamArthamAsthitaM
mahAsuraprabhavamaho maho mahat |
vinirgate tvayi tu nilInama~njasA
nabha:sthale nanRRituratho jagu: surA: ||7||
---------
kShaNaM divi
for an instant, in the sky
tvat-upagama-artham-AsthitaM
Thy emergence awaiting
mahA-asura-prabhavam-
from the great Asura emerging
aho maha: mahat
Oh! A brilliance great
vinirgate tvayi tu
came out as Thou
nilInam-a~njasA
merged immediately (into Thee only)
nabha:-sthale
in the skies
nanRRitu:-atha:
danced and then
jagu: surA:
sang the gods

A great brilliance emerged from the Asura and rose, in the sky and awaited Thy emerging from the body of the python. Oh! What a wonder, as soon as Thou came out the brilliance merged into Thee, while the gods danced and sang.
---------
savismayai: kamalabhavAdibhi: surai-
ranudrutastadanu gata: kumArakai: |
dine punastaruNadashAmupeyuShi
svakairbhavAnatanuta bhojanotsavam ||8||

savismayai:
wonderstruck
kamalabhava-Adibhi:
Brahamaa and other
surai:-anudruta:
gods (watching and) following (Thee)
tadanu gata:
after that (Thou) went
kumArakai: dine puna:-
with the Gopa boys (when) the day again
taruNa-dashAm-upeyuShi
youthful state attained (it became noon)
svakai: bhavAn-
with (Thy) own people Thou
atanuta bhojana-utsavam
carried out the food celebration (picnic lunch)
---------
Brahmaa and other gods were wonderstruck and watched Thee and followed Thee in the skies. After that Thou went with the Gopa boys when the day had reached noontime and with Thy own people Thou celebrated the food festival, the picnic lunch.

viShANikAmapi muralIM nitambake
niveshayan kabaladhara: karAmbuje |
prahAsayan kalavachanai: kumArakAn
bubhojitha tridashagaNairmudA nuta: ||9||
---------
viShANikAm-api
the horn and also
muralIM nitambake
the flute, in the waist band
niveshayan
tucking
kabaladhara: karAmbuje
a ball of rice holding in the lotus like hand
prahAsayan
making (them) laugh
kalavachanai:
by humorous talks
kumArakAn bubhojitha
the boys, (Thou) ate
tridashagaNai:
by the gods
mudA nuta:
joyfully praised

The horn and the flute were tucked in Thy waist band. Thou were holding a ball of rice in Thy lotus like hand and provoked peals of laughter among the boys by Thy humorous talks. As Thou took Thy meal the gods joyfully sang Thy praises.
---------
sukhAshanaM tviha tava gopamaNDale
makhAshanAt priyamiva devamaNDale |
iti stutastridashavarairjagatpate
marutpurInilaya gadAt prapAhi mAm ||10||

sukha-ashanam tu -iha
the happy meal indeed here
tava gopa-maNDale
to Thee amidst the Gopas
makha-ashanAt
than the offerings of the sacrifices
priyam-iva
is more pleasing
deva-maNDale
amidst the gods
iti stuta:-tridashavarai:-
thus praised by the great gods
jagatpate
O Lord of the universe!
marutpurInilaya
residing in Guruvaayur
gadAt prapAhi mAm
from ailments save me
---------
O Lord of the Universe! The great gods praised Thee saying that the meal taken happily with the Gopa boys gave Thee more pleasure than the sacrificial offerings which Thou had received with the gods. O Thou Residing in Guruvaayur! Save me from my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D052

Dashaka 52
---------
anyAvatAranikareShvanirIkShitaM te
bhUmAtirekamabhivIkShya tadAghamokShe |
brahmA parIkShitumanA: sa parokShabhAvaM
ninye.atha vatsakagaNAn pravitatya mAyAm ||1||
---------
anya-avatAra-nikareShu-
in the other lot of incarnations
anirIkShitaM te
not having seen Thy
bhUmAtirekam-abhivIkShya
divine majesties (now) seeing
tadA-agha-mokShe
then (that) in Aghaasura's salvation
brahmA parIkShitu-manA:
Brahmaa to test (Thee) deciding
sa parokShabhAvaM
he (to) invisibleness
ninye-atha
took then
vatsaka-gaNAn
the herds of calves
pravitatya mAyAm
extending (his power) of Maayaa

In all the other incarnations of Thee put together, not having seen such majesties as in the salvation of Aghaasura, Brahmaa decided to test Thy powers. He extended his power of Maayaa, illusion, and took the herds of calves into invisibleness, and hid them.
---------
vatsAnavIkShya vivashe pashupotkare tA-
nAnetukAma iva dhAtRRimatAnuvartI |
tvaM sAmibhuktakabalo gatavAMstadAnIM
bhuktAMstiro.adhita sarojabhava: kumArAn ||2||

vatsAn-anavIkShya
the calves not seeing
vivashe pashupa-utkare
worried, when the group of gopa boys were
tAn-AnetukAma iva
them trying to bring back as though
dhAtRRi-mata-anuvartI
(but in reality) Brahmaa's intention following
tvaM sAmibhukta-kabala:
Thou having a half eaten ball of rice
gatavAn-tadAnIm
went ,then
bhuktAn-tiro.adhita
while they were eating, made (them) to disappear
sarojabhava: kumArAn
the lotus -born Brahmaa, the boys
---------
The Gopa boys were worried by the disappearance of the calves. As though trying to bring them back, Thou went away from there with a half eaten ball of rice in hand. In reality, Thou made it convenient for Brahmaa to carry out his intention, who then made the boys also disappear while they were eating food.

vatsAyitastadanu gopagaNAyitastvaM
shikyAdibhANDamuralIgavalAdirUpa: |
prAgvadvihRRitya vipineShu chirAya sAyaM
tvaM mAyayA.atha bahudhA vrajamAyayAtha ||3||
---------
vatsAyita:-tadanu
assuming the form of the calves, thereupon
gopagaNAyita:-tvaM
assuming the form of the gopa boys, Thou
shikya-Adi-
sling etc.,
bhANDa-muralI-
vessels, flutes,
gavala-Adi-rUpa:
horns etc., forms taking
prAk-vat-vihRRitya
like before playing around
vipineShu chirAya
in the woods for long
sAyaM tvaM
in the evening Thou
mAyayA-atha bahudhA
by Thy power, then, in many forms
vrajam-AyayAtha
to Gokula returned

There upon by Maayaa Thou assumed the form of the calves and the boys adorned with slings, vessels, flutes horns etc., and played around in the woods for long. In the evening in those many forms Thou returned to Gokul.
---------
tvAmeva shikyagavalAdimayaM dadhAno
bhUyastvameva pashuvatsakabAlarUpa: |
gorUpiNIbhirapi gopavadhUmayIbhi-
rAsAdito.asi jananIbhiratipraharShAt ||4||

tvAm-eva
Thee alone
shikya-gavala-Adi-mayaM
in the form of slings and horns
dadhAna:
holding (carrying)
bhUya:-tvam-eva
again Thee alone
pashu-vatsaka-bAla-rUpa:
in the form of the calves and boys
go-rUpiNIbhi:-api
and also (by Thee) in the form of cows
gopa-vadhUmayIbhi:
and (by Thee) in the form of Gopikas
AsAdita:-asi
were received (welcomed)
jananIbhi:-
by the mothers
ati-praharShAt
with great joy
---------
Thou alone were in the form of the slings and horns held by the gopaa boys who were also Thou alone in their form. The cows and calves were also Thy form alone. The mothers, that is, the Gopikas and cows received the gopa boys and the calves with great joy and love.

jIvaM hi ka~nchidabhimAnavashAtsvakIyaM
matvA tanUja iti rAgabharaM vahantya: |
AtmAnameva tu bhavantamavApya sUnuM
prItiM yayurna kiyatIM vanitAshcha gAva: ||5||
---------
jIvaM hi ki~nchit-
some 'jeevas' alone
abhimAna-vashAt-
by the sense of 'I'ness
svakIyaM matvA
ones own taking
tanUja iti
as son, thus,
rAgabharaM vahantya:
attachment enduring
AtmAnam-eva tu
the self alone indeed
bhavantam-avApya
Thyself getting
sUnuM prItim
(as) son affection
yayu:-na kiyatIM
attained not to what extent
vanitA:-cha gAva:
the Gopikas and the cows

The Gopikas and the cows were greatly attached to the jeevas born as their issues, because of the sense of 'I'ness and 'mine'ness. This is a universal notion. By getting Thee as their off-springs, sons and calves, what extreme happiness and thrill of joy did they not get!
---------
evaM pratikShaNavijRRimbhitaharShabhAra-
nishsheShagopagaNalAlitabhUrimUrtim |
tvAmagrajo.api bubudhe kila vatsarAnte
brahmAtmanorapi mahAn yuvayorvisheSha: ||6||

evaM pratikShaNa-
in this manner every moment
vijRRimbhita-harShabhAra-
increased intense joy
nishsheSha-gopagaNa-
by all the Gopas
lAlita-bhUrimUrtim
served (Thee, in) the multifarious forms
tvAm-agraja:-api
Thee, (Thy) elder brother (Balaraam) also
bubudhe kila
realised indeed
vatsara-ante
at the end of a year
brahmAtmana:-api
(the two of Thou) even being of the nature of Brahman
mahAn yuvayo:
great, in the two of Thou
visheSha:
(Thou) are different, special
---------
In this manner, day by day, every moment the Gopas served Thee in Thy many forms with ever increasing joy. Even Thy elder brother Balaraam could not realize that it was Thou in the various forms till the end of one year. Though Thou two are in reality of the nature of Brahman, there is a vast difference. Thou are special.

varShAvadhau navapurAtanavatsapAlAn
dRRiShTvA vivekamasRRiNe druhiNe vimUDhe |
prAdIdRRisha: pratinavAn makuTA~NgadAdi
bhUShAMshchaturbhujayuja: sajalAmbudAbhAn ||7||
---------
varSha-avadhau
at the end of one year
nava-purAtana-
new and old
vatsapAlAn
the calves and cowherds
dRRiShTvA vivekam-asRRiNe
seeing and being unable to distinguish
druhiNe vimUDhe
Brahmaa was stupefied
prAdIdRRisha: pratinavAn
(Thou) revealed each of the new ones
makuTa-a~Ngada-Adi bhUShAn-
with diadems, shoulder ornaments and other adornments
chaturbhuja-yuja:
with four arms
sajala-ambuda-AbhAn
and of water bearing cloud's hue

At the end of one year, Brahmaa was stupefied as he could not distinguish which set of cowherds and calves were the old ones and which were the new ones. Thou revealed to him each of the new ones by making him see them with diadems, shoulder ornaments and other adornments.They even had four arms and the hue of water bearing clouds, like Thee.
---------
pratyekameva kamalAparilAlitA~NgAn
bhogIndrabhogashayanAn nayanAbhirAmAn |
lIlAnimIlitadRRisha: sanakAdiyogi-
vyAsevitAn kamalabhUrbhavato dadarsha ||8||

pratyekam-eva
each one of them, (he saw) as
kamalA-parilAlita-a~NgAn
by Lakshmi were caressed (whose) limbs
bhogIndra-bhoga-shayanAn
on Aadishesha's hoods who were reclining
nayana-abhirAmAn
the delightful sights
lIlA-nimIlita-dRRisha:
sportingly closing the eyes
sanaka-Adi-yogi-
by Sanaka and other sages
vyAsevitAn
attended upon
kamalabhU:-
the lotus born Brahmaa
bhavata: dadarsha
as Thee saw
---------
The lotus born Brahmaa saw each one of them as Thee alone. As Him whose limbs were caressed by Goddess Lakshmi, who was reclining on Aadishesha's hoods, a delightful sight to the eyes, as His eyes were sportingly closed as though in Yoga Nidraa. The Sanaka and other sages were attending on Him.

nArAyaNAkRRitimasaMkhyatamAM nirIkShya
sarvatra sevakamapi svamavekShya dhAtA |
mAyAnimagnahRRidayo vimumoha yAva-
deko babhUvitha tadA kabalArdhapANi: ||9||
---------
nArAyaNa-AkRRitim-
the form of Naaraayana
asaMkhyatamAM
innumerable
nirIkShya sarvatra
seeing every where
sevakam-api
as an attendant also
svam-avekShya dhAtA
himself seeing Brahmaa
mAyA-nimagna-hRRidaya:
in Maayaa submerged mind
vimumoha yAvat-
(by Maayaa) totally overpowered, by then
eka: babhUvitha tadA
one (Thou) became then
kabala-ardha-pANi:
with a half eaten ball of rice in hand

Brahmaa saw the innumerable forms of Naaraayana everywhere. He saw himself as an attendant. His mind was totally overpowered by Maayaa and he was completely confused. Then Thou became one, holding a half eaten ball of rice in hand.
---------
nashyanmade tadanu vishvapatiM muhustvAM
natvA cha nUtavati dhAtari dhAma yAte |
potai: samaM pramuditai: pravishan niketaM
vAtAlayAdhipa vibho paripAhi rogAt ||10||

nashyan-made tadanu
with humbled pride, thereafter
vishvapatiM muhu:-
to the Lord of the universe, again and again
tvAm natvA
to Thee prostrating
cha nUtavati dhAtari
and praising, Brahmaa
dhAma yAte
having gone home
potai: samaM pramuditai:
with the boys rejoicing
pravishan niketaM
(Thou) entered the house
vAtAlayAdhipa vibho
O Dweller of Guruvaayur and Lord of the Universe
paripAhi rogAt
save me from ailments
---------
Brahmaa, whose pride was humbled, prostrated to Thee, the Lord of the Universe, again and again. He praised Thee and went home. Then Thou also entered the house joyfully and rejoicing with the boys. O Thou the Dweller of Guruvaayur! And the Lord of the Universe! save me from my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D053

Dashaka 53
---------
atItya bAlyaM jagatAM pate tvamupetya paugaNDavayo manoj~naM |
upekShya vatsAvanamutsavena prAvartathA gogaNapAlanAyAm ||1||
---------
atItya bAlyam
passing childhood
jagatAM pate
O Lord of the universe
tvam-upetya
Thou attained
paugaNDa-vaya: manoj~nam
the boyhood age (which was very) charming
upekShya vatsAvanam-
giving up tending the calves
utsavena prAvartathA
enthusiastically got into
go-gaNa-pAlanAyAm
the looking after of the herd of cows

O Lord of the universe! Having passed childhood Thou attained the charming age of boyhood (6 to 10 years). Then Thou gave up the tending of the calves and enthusiastically promoted to herding cows and cattle.
---------
upakramasyAnuguNaiva seyaM marutpurAdhIsha tava pravRRitti: |
gotrAparitrANakRRite.avatIrNastadeva devA.a.arabhathAstadA yat ||2||

upakramasya-
for the beginning
anuguNa-eva
it was proper indeed
sA-iyaM
that this
marutpurAdhIsha
O Lord of Guruvaayur
tava pravRRitti:
Thy occupation (because)
gotrA-paritrANa-
(for) the earth's protection
kRRite-avatIrNa:-
as the purpose, was Thy incarnation
tat-eva
that itself
deva-ArabhathA:-
O Lord Thou started
tadA yat
then because
---------
O Lord! This occupation that Thou took up was the fit and proper beginning for the work which lay ahead. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Thy incarnation was for the protection of 'Gotra', the earth, and tending 'Gotras', the cows, was a first step towards that end.

kadApi rAmeNa samaM vanAnte vanashriyaM vIkShya charan sukhena |
shrIdAmanAmna: svasakhasya vAchA modAdagA dhenukakAnanaM tvam ||3||
---------
kadApi rAmeNa samaM
once along with Balaraam
vanAnte
in the end of the woods
vanashriyaM vIkShya
the beauty of the woods admiring
charan sukhena
and roaming about happily
shrIdAma-nAmna:
by the name of Shreedaamaa
svasakhasya vAchA
Thy friend's suggestion
modAt-agA:
with joy went
dhenuka-kAnanaM
to the Dhenuka forest
tvam
Thou

Once, with Balaraam, as Thou were happily roaming about in the woods and admiring the beauty of the woods, on Thy friend Sudaamaa's suggestion, Thou enthusiastically entered the Dhenuka forest.
---------
uttAlatAlInivahe tvaduktyA balena dhUte.atha balena dorbhyAm |
mRRidu: kharashchAbhyapatatpurastAt phalotkaro dhenukadAnavo.api ||4||

uttAla-tAlI-nivahe
(when) the tall palm tree clusters
tvat-uktyA
at Thy words
balena dhUte-atha
by Balaraam was shaken, then,
balena dorbhyAm
with the force of both the hands
mRRidu: khara:-cha-
soft/ripe and hard/unripe
abhyapatat-purastAt
fell down in front
phala-utkara:
a bunch of fruits
dhenuka-dAnava:-api
the Dhenuka demon also
(khara:-cha abhyapatat)
(as a donkey appeared)
---------
At Thy words, Balaraam shook the cluster of tall palm trees with the force of both his strong arms. A bunch of soft and ripe and hard and unripe fruits fell in front of Thee. Just then, the demon Dhenukaasura, in the form of a donkey also appeared.

samudyato dhainukapAlane.ahaM kathaM vadhaM dhainukamadya kurve |
itIva matvA dhruvamagrajena suraughayoddhAramajIghanastvam ||5||
---------
samudyata:
engaged in
dhainuka-pAlane-ahaM
the cows' protection, I
kathaM
how
vadhaM dhainukam-adya
(can I) kill Dhenuka (even though just a namesake) now
kurve iti-iva
do so , thus like that
matvA
thinking
dhruvam-agrajena
certainly by Thy elder brother
suraugha-yoddhAram-
the enemy of the gods
ajIghana:-tvam
caused to be killed Thou

I am engaged in protecting the cows (Dhenuka), how can I now kill the Dhenuka (cow) asura?' Thus interpreting, as it were, Thou made Balaraam Thy elder brother kill Dhenukaasura who was an enemy of the gods.
---------
tadIyabhRRityAnapi jambukatvenopAgatAnagrajasaMyutastvam |
jambUphalAnIva tadA nirAsthastAleShu khelan bhagavan nirAstha: ||6||

tadIya-bhRRityAn-api
his (Dhenukaasura's) servants also
jambukatvena-upAgatAn-
(who were) as jackals and had come
agraja-saMyuta:-tvam
along with Thy elder brother Thou
jambu-phalAni-iva
like black-berries
tadA nirAstha:-
then smashed
tAleShu khelan
on the palm trees as mere play
bhagavan
O Lord
nirAstha:
effortlessly
---------
Dhenukaasura's servants had also come in the form of jackals. O Lord! Thou and Thy elder brother, as if in mere play, smashed them effortlessly against the palm trees as though they were mere black-berries.

vinighnati tvayyatha jambukaughaM sanAmakatvAdvaruNastadAnIm |
bhayAkulo jambukanAmadheyaM shrutiprasiddhaM vyadhiteti manye ||7||
---------
vinighnati
when killing
tvayi atha
Thou (were) then
jambuka-aughaM
the pack of jackals
sanAmakatvAt-
because of having the same name
varuNa:-tadAnIm
Varuna, then
bhayAkula:
out of fear
jambuka-nAma-dheyaM
his name 'Jambuka'
shruti-prasiddhaM vyadhita-
famous in the Vedas, hid it (in the Vedas only)
iti manye
this I believe

Then when Thou were killing the pack of jackals, Jambukas, Varuna, the water god, whose name is famous in the Vedas as Jambuka, hid it in the Vedas only, for the fear of being killed. I believe that it is for this reason that Varuna's name as 'Jambuka' is not known.
---------
tavAvatArasya phalaM murAre sa~njAtamadyeti surairnutastvam |
satyaM phalaM jAtamiheti hAsI bAlai: samaM tAlaphalAnyabhu~NkthA: ||8||

tava-avatArasya phalaM
Thy incarnation's results
murAre
O Slayer of Mura!
sa~njatam-adya-
has appeared now
iti surai:-nuta: tvam
thus by the gods, being praised, Thou
satyaM phalaM
truly fruit
jAtam-iha-iti
is born here thus
hAsI bAlai: samaM
laughingly (saying) with the boys
tAla phalAni-
the palm fruits
abhu~NkthA:
ate
---------
O Slayer of Mura! The gods praised Thee saying that the fruit of Thy incarnation has now appeared. Thou laughingly said that 'indeed the fruits of the palm tree have been got now', and saying so, ate the fruits with the boys.

madhudravasrunti bRRihanti tAni phalAni medobharabhRRinti bhuktvA |
tRRiptaishcha dRRiptairbhavanaM phalaughaM vahadbhirAgA: khalu bAlakaistvam ||9||
---------
madhudrava-srunti
with honey like juice dripping
bRRihanti tAni phalAni
those large fruits
medobhara-bhRRinti
full of flesh
bhuktvA tRRiptai:-cha
having eaten and satisfied
dRRiptai:-bhavanaM
and triumphant, to the house
phalaughaM vahadbhi:-
loads of fruit carrying
AgA: khalu
returned indeed
bAlakai:-tvam
with the boys, Thou

Thou ate the nectar like juice dripping luscious and fleshy fruits with the boys to Thy heart's content. Fully satisfied and triumphant Thou returned to the house carrying along loads of such fruits.
---------
hato hato dhenuka ityupetya phalAnyadadbhirmadhurANi lokai: |
jayeti jIveti nuto vibho tvaM marutpurAdhIshvara pAhi rogAt ||10||

hata: hata: dhenuka:
killed killed is Dhenuka
iti-upetya
thus (saying and) approaching
phalAni-adadbhi:-
the fruits eating
madhurANi
(which were) sweet
lokai: jaya-iti
by the people, 'Victory to Thee'
jIva-iti
long live' thus
nuta: vibho tvaM
praised O Lord Thou
marutpurAdhIshvara
O Lord of Guruvaayur
pAhi rogAt
save from ailments
---------
O Omnipresent and Omnipotent Lord! The people approached Thee cheering that Dhenukaasura was killed. They praised Thee saying, 'Victory to Thee', 'May Thou live long', as they ate the sweet fruits. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Do save me from my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D054

Dashaka 54
---------
tvatsevotkassaubharirnAma pUrvaM
kAlindyantardvAdashAbdam tapasyan |
mInavrAte snehavAn bhogalole
tArkShyaM sAkShAdaikShatAgre kadAchit ||1||
---------
tvat-seva-utka:-
in serving Thee (who was) eager
saubhari:-nAma
Saubhari named (sage)
pUrvaM kAlindi-anta:-
long ago, in the Kaalindi (Yamuna)
dvAdasha-Abdam
for twelve years
tapasyan
performing austerities
mInavrAte
to the fish
snehavAn bhogalole
became attached (who were) sporting
tArkShyam
Garuda
sAkShAt-aikShata-agre
with his own eyes saw right in front
kadAchit
once

Long ago, the sage named Saubhari who was eager to serve Thee, remained submerged in the waters of Kaalindi, for twelve years, performing austerities. He became attached to the fish who kept sporting there. Once he saw Garuda right in front of his eyes.
---------
tvadvAhaM taM sakShudhaM tRRikShasUnuM
mInaM ka~nchijjakShataM lakShayan sa: |
taptashchitte shaptavAnatra chettvaM
jantUn bhoktA jIvitaM chApi moktA ||2||

tvat-vAhaM
Thy mount
taM sakShudhaM tRRikShasUnuM
him (who was) hungry (that) Garuda
mInaM ka~nchit-
a fish
jakShataM lakShayan
eating having seen
sa tapta:- chitte
that (Saubhari) with agitated mind
shaptavAn-
cursed
atra chet-tvaM
here if you
jantUn bhoktA
creatures eat
jIvitaM cha-api
life and also
moktA
(will) lose
---------
Thy mount that Garuda who was hungry and was eating a fish. Seeing that, Saubhari was mentally very agitated and cursed Garuda saying that he would lose his life if he ate any creatures there.

tasmin kAle kAliya: kShveladarpAt
sarpArAte: kalpitaM bhAgamashnan |
tena krodhAttvatpadAmbhojabhAjA
pakShakShiptastaddurApaM payo.agAt ||3||
---------
tasmin kAle
at that time
kAliya: kShvela-darpAt
Kaaliya (the serpent) for his powerful venom's pride
sarpa-ArAte: kalpitaM
for the enemy of the serpents (Garuda) set apart
bhAgam-ashnan
portion, eating
tena krodhAt-
by him in anger
tvat-pada-ambhoja-bhAjA
to Thy lotus feet devoted
pakSha-kShipta:-
smitten by the wings
tat-durApam
to him (inexcessible)
paya:-agAt
waters of Yamuna entered

At that time, Kaaliya the serpent was full of pride due to the power of his poison. He ate away the offerings set apart for Garuda, the enemy of serpents. Angered at this Garuda who is devoted to Thy lotus feet, smote Kaaliya with his wings. Kaaliya took refuge in the waters of Yamuna (Kaalindi), which had become prohibited for Garuda because of a curse of a sage.
---------
ghore tasmin sUrajAnIravAse
tIre vRRikShA vikShatA: kShvelavegAt |
pakShivrAtA: peturabhre patanta:
kAruNyArdraM tvanmanastena jAtam ||4||

ghore tasmin
(when) that cruel one
sUrajA-nIra-vAse
in the Yamuna waters was living
tIre vRRikShA
on the banks, the trees
vikShatA: kShvela-vegAt
dried up due to the power of the poison
pakShivrAtA: petu:-
the birds fell
abhre patanta:
(when) in the skies flying
kAruNya-Ardram
melted in compassion
tvat-mana:-
Thy heart
tena jAtam
by this became
---------
As the cruel one was living in the waters of Yamuna, the daughter of the sun, the trees on the banks of the river dried up due to the power of the poison. The birds who flew in the sky above, dropped down dead. Thy heart melted in compassion and was moved with pity seeing the plight of the creatures.

kAle tasminnekadA sIrapANiM
muktvA yAte yAmunaM kAnanAntam |
tvayyuddAmagrIShmabhIShmoShmataptA
gogopAlA vyApiban kShvelatoyam ||5||
---------
kAle tasmin-
at that time
ekadA
once
saripANiM muktvA
Balaraam leaving behind
yAte yAmunaM
(Thou) had gone to Yamuna
kAnana-antam tvayi-
at the forest's end Thou (had gone)
uddAma-grIShma-
intense summer (causing)
bhIShma-UShma-taptA
great heat (by which) parched
go-gopAlA
cows and cowherds
vyApiban
drank
kShvela-toyam
the poisoned water

At that time, once Thou had gone to the wood's end near the Yamuna , unaccompanied by Balaraam. In the intense summer heat, the throats of the cattle and the cowherds were parched. So they happened to drink the water of the river which was poisoned.
---------
nashyajjIvAn vichyutAn kShmAtale tAn
vishvAn pashyannachyuta tvaM dayArdra: |
prApyopAntaM jIvayAmAsitha drAk
pIyUShAmbhovarShibhi: shrIkaTakShai: ||6||

nashyat-jIvAn
with lost lives
vichyutAn kShmAtale
fallen on the ground
tAn vishvAn pashyan-
them all seeing
achyuta tvaM dayArdra:
O Changeless One! Thou overcome with pity
prApya-upAntaM
going near
jIvayAmAsitha
revived them
drAk
soon
pIyUSha-ambho-varShibhi:
nectar like water showering
shrIkaTAkShai:
(with Thy) auspicious glances
---------
They had all lost their lives and had fallen on the ground. O Changeless One! Thou were overcome with pity and approached them. Thou shed Thy auspicious glances on them which were like showering nectar, which soon revived them.

kiM kiM jAto harShavarShAtireka:
sarvA~NgeShvityutthitA gopasa~NghA: |
dRRiShTvA.agre tvAM tvatkRRitaM tadvidanta-
stvAmAli~Ngan dRRiShTanAnAprabhAvA: ||7||
---------
kiM kiM jAta:
what, what happened
harSha-varShA-atireka:
bliss showering profusely
sarva-a~NgeShu-
in all the limbs
iti-utthitA
thus being revived (and saying)
gopasa~NghA:
the group of Gopas
dRRiShTvA-agre tvAM
seeing in front Thee
tvat-kRRitaM
Thy accomplishments
tat-vidanta:-
that realising
tvAm-Ali~Ngan
embracing Thee
dRRiShTa-nAnA-prabhAvA:
(who) had seen various glories of Thee

The Gopas were revived and experienced a profuse showering of bliss in all their limbs, and exclaimed saying 'O what, what has happened?' Then seeing Thee in front they realised that this strange bliss was Thy doing, because they had seen Thy glorious deeds before.
---------
gAvashchaivaM labdhajIvA: kShaNena
sphItAnandAstvAM cha dRRiShTvA purastAt |
drAgAvavru: sarvato harShabAShpaM
vyAmu~nchantyo mandamudyanninAdA: ||8||

gAva:-cha-evaM
and cows also
labdha-jIvA:
revived
kShaNena
in an instant
sphIta-AnandA:-
very joyfully
tvAM cha dRRiShTvA
and Thee seeing
purastAt drAk
in front quickly
Avavru: sarvata:
surrounded Thee every where
harSha-vAShpaM
joyful tears
vyAmu~nchantya:
shedding
mandam-udyan-ninAdA:
softly raising a sound (lowing)
---------
In the same manner the cows also were revived very quickly. Seeing Thee in front they gathered around Thee affectionately and shed joyful tears as they were also lowing.

romA~ncho.ayaM sarvato na: sharIre
bhUyasyanta: kAchidAnandamUrChA |
Ashcharyo.ayaM kShvelavego mukunde-
tyukto gopairnandito vandito.abhU: ||9||
---------
romA~ncha:-ayaM
horripilation this
sarvata: na: sharIre
all over our bodies
bhUyasI-anta:
intense inside
kadAchit-Ananda-mUrChA
in some wonderful bliss intoxication
Ashcharya:-ayaM
this is wonderful
kShvelavega:
the poison action
mukunda-
O Mukund
iti-ukta:
thus (Thou being) told
gopai:-nandita:
by the Gopas (Thou were) congratulated
vandita:-abhU:
(and) Thou were praised

O Mukunda! We have horripilation all over our bodies. There is intense intoxication of bliss inside. The action of this poison is wonderful!' As they said so, the Gopas congratulated Thee and worshipped Thee.
---------
evaM bhaktAn muktajIvAnapi tvaM
mugdhApA~NgairastarogAMstanoShi |
tAdRRigbhUtasphItakAruNyabhUmA
rogAt pAyA vAyugehAdhivAsa ||10||

evaM bhaktAn
in this manner (Thy) devotees
mukta-jIvAn-api
even though they had lost their lives
tvaM
Thou
mugdha-apA~Ngai:-
by (Thy) charming glances
astarogAn-
were (made) devoid of diseases
tanoShi
made
tAdRRik-bhUta-
such becoming
sphIta-kAruNya-bhUmA
O Thou full of merciful greatness!
rogAt pAyA
from disease release (me)
vAyugehAdhivAsa
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
---------
In this manner, by Thy charming glances, the devotees who had lost their lives were revived and were rendered devoid of diseases. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Who are full of such merciful greatness, release me from disease.

Narayaneeyam D055

Dashaka 55
---------
atha vAriNi ghorataraM phaNinaM
prativArayituM kRRitadhIrbhagavan |
drutamAritha tIraganIpataruM
viShamArutashoShitaparNachayam ||1||
---------
atha vAriNi
then in the water
ghorataraM phaNinaM
very fierce that serpent
prativArayituM
to drive away
kRRitadhI:
having decided
bhagavan
O Lord
drutam-Aritha
quickly (Thou) approached
tIraga-nIpa-taruM
the bank situated Kadamba tree
viSha-mAruta-shoShita-
the poisoned breeze had dried up
parNa-chayam
the cluster of leaves

O Lord! Thou then made up Thy mind to drive away the fierce serpent from the waters. Thou quickly approached and got up on a Kadamba tree standing on the bank of the river, with its leaves withered due to the poisonous breeze.
---------
adhiruhya padAmburuheNa cha taM
navapallavatulyamanoj~naruchA |
hradavAriNi dUrataraM nyapata:
parighUrNitaghoratara~NggaNe ||2||

adhiruhya
climbing with
pada-ambu-ruheNa
feet tender lotus like
cha taM
and that (tree)
nava-pallava-tulya-
like tender new leaves
manoj~na-ruchA
charming and splendorous
hrada-vAriNi
into the deep water
dUrataraM nyapata:
far out (Thou) jumped
parighUrNita-
with swirling
ghora-tara~Nga-gaNe
fierce waves of water
---------
Thou climbed that tree with Thy lotus like splendorous charming feet resembling tender leaves, and with a long leap jumped far out into the deep waters with swirling fierce waves.

bhuvanatrayabhArabhRRito bhavato
gurubhAravikampivijRRimbhijalA |
parimajjayati sma dhanushshatakaM
taTinI jhaTiti sphuTaghoShavatI ||3||
---------
bhuvana-traya-bhAra-bhRRita:
of the three worlds the weight bearing
bhavata: guru-bhAra-
of Thee the immense weight (causing)
vikampi-vijRRimbhi-jalA
swirling and swelling with its waters
parimajjayati sma
started to submerge
dhanu:-shatakaM
the area of a hundred bows (in measurement)
taTinI jhaTiti
on the river bed, and suddenly
sphuTa-ghoShavatI
(the river) made an intense roar

When, Thou the bearer of the weight of the three worlds, jumped, Thy immense weight caused the waters to swirl and swell. On the river bed an area of a hundred bows (yards) submerged, as a sudden roar arose from the river.
---------
atha dikShu vidikShu parikShubhita-
bhramitodaravArininAdabharai: |
udakAdudagAduragAdhipati-
stvadupAntamashAntaruShA.andhamanA: ||4||

atha dikShu vidikShu
then, in all the directions and the intermediary directions
parikShubhita-bhramita-
turbulent swirling
udara-vAri-ninAda-bharai:
from the middle of the waters roaring aloud
udakAt-udagAt-
from (that) water came out
uragAdhipati:-
the king of serpents
tvat-upAntam-
near Thee
ashAnta-ruShA-
disturbed and angered
andhamanA:
and so blinded (with rage)
---------
The loud roar from the middle of the waters which extended to all the directions and the intermediary directions, disturbed and angered the serpent king Kaaliya. He came out of the water and rushed up to Thee in a fit of blinded anger.

phaNashRRi~NgasahasravinissRRimara-
jvaladagnikaNograviShAmbudharam |
purata: phaNinaM samalokayathA
bahushRRi~NgiNama~njanashailamiva ||5||
---------
phaNa-shRRi~Nga-
(with) hoods , peak (like)
sahasra-vini:sRRimara-
thousands of them emitting
jvalat-agni-kaNa-
burning like fire flakes
ugra-viSha-ambudharam
fierce poison fluid bearing
purata: phaNinaM
in front the serpent
samalokayathA:
(Thou) saw
bahu-shRRi~Ngi-gaNam-
many peaked
a~njana-shailam-iva
black mountain, as if

Thou saw the serpent in front with his thousands of peak like hoods emitting burning fire flakes and fierce poison fluid, looking like a many peaked black mountain.
---------
jvaladakShi parikSharadugraviSha-
shvasanoShmabhara: sa mahAbhujaga: |
paridashya bhavantamanantabalaM
samaveShTayadasphuTacheShTamaho ||6||

jvalat-akShi
with flaming eyes
parikSharat-ugra-viSha-
emitting deadly poison
shvasan-UShmabhara:
breathing out intense heat
sa mahAbhujaga:
that huge serpent
paridashya
biting
bhavantam-anantabalaM
Thee of limitless strength
samaveShTayat-
coiled (around Thee)
asphuTa-cheShTam-
making invisible Thy movements
aho
Alas
---------
Alas! That huge serpent emitting deadly poison and breathing out intense heat, bit Thee of limitless strength, all over Thy body. Then it coiled around Thee making Thy body and Thy movements invisible.

avilokya bhavantamathAkulite
taTagAmini bAlakadhenugaNe |
vrajagehatale.apyanimittashataM
samudIkShya gatA yamunAM pashupA: ||7||
---------
avilokya bhavantam-
not seeing Thee
atha-Akulite
then distressed
taTa-gAmini
(who) to the bank (of river Yamunaa) had come
bAlaka-dhenu-gaNe
the children and the cows all
vraja-geha-tale-api-
in Gokula houses also
animitta-shataM
evil omens innumerable
samudIkShya gatA
seeing went
yamunAM pashupA:
towards Yamunaa the Gopas

The Gopa boys and the cows were distressed when they did not see Thee, and went to the bank of the river Yamunaa. In the houses in Gokula also the Gopas saw hundreds of evil omens and they also rushed towards Yamunaa.
---------
akhileShu vibho bhavadIya dashA-
mavalokya jihAsuShu jIvabharam |
phaNibandhanamAshu vimuchya javA-
dudagamyata hAsajuShA bhavatA ||8||

akhileShu
(as) all of them
vibho
O Lord
bhavadIya-dashAm
Thy plight
avalokya
seeing
jihAsuShu
ready to give up their
jIvabharam
lives
phaNi-bandhanam-
the coils of the snake
Ashu vimuchya
quickly shedding
javAt-udagamyata
hastily emerged
hAsajuShA bhavatA
with a smile, Thou
---------
O Lord! All of them were overwhelmed with grief on seeing Thy plight and were ready to give up their lives in order to save Thee. Just then, Thou quickly shed the coils of the snake and hastily emerged with a smile.

adhiruhya tata: phaNirAjaphaNAn
nanRRite bhavatA mRRidupAdaruchA |
kalashi~njitanUpurama~njumila-
tkaraka~NkaNasa~Nkulasa~NkvaNitam ||9||
---------
adhiruhya tata:
climbing upon then
phaNi-rAja-phaNAn
the serpent king,s hoods
nanRRite bhavatA
dance was performed by Thee
mRRidu-pAda-ruchA
with delicate feet beautiful
kalashi~njita-nUpura-
the gentle sound of the anklets
ma~nju-milat-
beautifully mingling with
kara-ka~NkaNa-sa~Nkula-
the bangles on the wrists'
sa~NkvaNitam
tinkling

Then Thou mounted on the hoods of the serpent king and danced with Thy delicate beautiful feet. The gentle sound of the anklets mingled beautifully and rhythmically with the tinkling of the bangles on Thy wrists.
---------
jahRRiShu: pashupAstutuShurmunayo
vavRRiShu: kusumAni surendragaNA: |
tvayi nRRityati mArutagehapate
paripAhi sa mAM tvamadAntagadAt ||10||

jahRRiShu: pashupA:-
rejoiced the Gopas
tutuShu:-munaya:
sang hymns the sages
vavRRiShu: kusumAni
showered flowers
surendra-gaNA:
the gods' groups
tvayi nRRityati
when Thou danced
mArutagehapate
O Lord of Guruvaayur
paripAhi
save
sa
That (Thou)
mAM
me
tvam-
Thou
adAnta-gadAt
(from) severe illness
---------
As Thou performed the dance, the Gopas rejoiced, the sages sang hymns, and the gods showered flowers. O Lord of the Guruvaayur temple! Such that Thou are, save me from the severe illness.

Narayaneeyam D056

Dashaka 56
---------
ruchirakampitakuNDalamaNDala: suchiramIsha nanartitha pannage |
amaratADitadundubhisundaraM viyati gAyati daivatayauvate ||1||
---------
ruchira-kampita-
beautifully quivering
kuNDala-maNDala:
the ear ornaments
suchiram-Isha
for long O Lord!
nanartitha pannage
(Thou) danced on the serpent's (hoods)
amara-tADita-
the gods beat
dundubhi:-sundaram
the drums sweetly
viyati gAyati
in the skies sang
daivata-yauvate
the celestial damsels

O Lord! With Thy ear ornaments quivering rhythmically, Thou danced for long on the hoods of the serpent. As the gods in the sky beat the drums, the heavenly damsels sang in accompaniment.
---------
namati yadyadamuShya shiro hare parivihAya tadunnatamunnatam |
parimathan padapa~NkaruhA chiraM vyaharathA: karatAlamanoharam ||2||

namati yat-yat-
drops down that which
amuShya shira:
his (Kaaliya's) head (hoods)
hare
O Hari!
parivihAya tat-
leaving that
unnatam-unnatam
the raised raised one
parimathan pad-pa~NkaruhA
trampling by Thy feet lotus like
chiraM vyaharathA:
for long (Thou) played around
karatAla-manoharam
clapping beautifully
---------
O Hari! Thou played around for long, leaving the drooped down head and jumping on the raised ones. Thus Thou trampled hood after hood with Thy lotus feet. Thou danced around in this manner keeping time with the clapping of hands beautifully.

tvadavabhagnavibhugnaphaNAgaNe galitashoNitashoNitapAthasi |
phaNipatAvavasIdati sannatAstadabalAstava mAdhava pAdayo: ||3||
---------
tvat-avabhagna-
(when) by Thee crushed
vibhugna-phaNAgaNe
and so drooping were the many hoods
galita-shoNita-
(when) the flowing blood
shoNita-pAthasi
made red the waters
phaNipatau-avasIdati
the serpent king got exhausted,
sannatA:-tat-abalA:-
prostrated his wives
tava mAdhava pAdayo:
(at) Thy, O Maadhava, two feet

The group of hoods were crushed by Thee and were drooping. The blood flowing from them rendered the waters of Yamunaa red. The serpent king was totally exhausted. Thereupon, O Maadhava! His wives prostrated at Thy two feet in all humility.
---------
ayi puraiva chirAya parishrutatvadanubhAvavilInahRRido hi tA: |
munibhirapyanavApyapathai: stavairnunuvurIsha bhavantamayantritam ||4||

ayi purA-eva
O Lord! Even long ago
chirAya parishruta-
for a long time, having well heard of
tvat-anubhAva-
Thy greatness
vilIna-hRRida: hi
with their immersed hearts, indeed,
tA: munibhi:-api-
they, by the sages even
anavApya-pathai:
unattained ways
stavai:-nunuvu:-
with (such) hymns praised
Isha
O Lord
bhavantam-ayantritam
Thee, unrestricted
---------
O Lord! Long ago, and for a long time the serpent wives had well heard of Thy majestic greatness. And so their minds were absorbed in Thee. Without any restrain, they hailed Thee with hymns of praises of a kind which are beyond the powers of even great sages.

phaNivadhUgaNabhaktivilokanapravikasatkaruNAkulachetasA |
phaNipatirbhavatA.achyuta jIvitastvayi samarpitamUrtiravAnamat ||5||
---------
phaNi-vadhU-gaNa-
the serpent wives'
bhakti-vilokana-
devotion seeing
pravikasat-karuNA-
with overflowing compassion
Akula-chetasA
filling Thy mind
phaNipati:-bhavatA-
the serpent king by Thee
achyuta
O Achyuta!
jIvita:-tvayi
let to live, unto Thee
samarpita-mUrti:-
surrendering himself
avAnamat
prostrated

O Achyuta! Thy heart was overflowing with compassion on seeing the devotion of the serpent wives. With Thy mind welled with such compassion Thou let the serpent king live, who then surrendering himself unto Thee, prostrated before Thee.
---------
ramaNakaM vraja vAridhimadhyagaM phaNiripurna karoti virodhitAm |
iti bhavadvachanAnyatimAnayan phaNipatirniragAduragai: samam ||6||

ramaNakaM vraja
to Ramanaka (island) go
vAridhi-madhyagaM
(situated) in the ocean's centre
phaNi-ripu:-na karoti
the enemy of the snakes (Garuda) will not do
virodhitAm iti
enmity', thus
bhavat-vachanAni-
Thy words
atimAnayan-
respectfully obeying
phaNapati:-niragAt-
the serpent king departed
uragai: samam
the other serpents along with
---------
Thou then told him to go to the Ramanaka island situated in the centre of the ocean. There the enemy of the snakes, Garuda would not do him any harm. Respectfully obeying these words of Thine, the serpent king departed along with the other snakes.

phaNivadhUjanadattamaNivrajajvalitahAradukUlavibhUShita: |
taTagatai: pramadAshruvimishritai: samagathA: svajanairdivasAvadhau ||7||
---------
phaNivadhUjana-
the serpent wives
datta-maNivraja-
gave (Thee) many gems
jvalita-hAra-
making resplendent the necklaces
dukUla-vibhUShita:
and by silk garments adorned
taTa-gatai:
on the banks who were (waiting)
pramadAshru-vimishritai:
with joyful tears mingling (sight)
samagathA: svajanai:-
Thou went with Thy folk
divasa-avadhau
at the day's end (evening)

The serpent wives gifted Thee many gems, resplendent necklaces and silk garments. Adorned with these, towards evening, Thou joined Thy folk, who were waiting for Thee on the banks with their sights mingled with joyful tears, and went with them.
---------
nishi punastamasA vrajamandiraM vrajitumakShama eva janotkare |
svapati tatra bhavachcharaNAshraye davakRRishAnurarundha samantata: ||8||

nishi puna:-tamasA
(when) in the night, again because of darkness
vraja-mandiraM
to the Vraja houses
vrajitum-akShama
to go were unable
eva janotkare
certainly, the group of people
svapati tatra
(they) were sleeping there
bhavat-charaNa-Ashraye
in Thy feets' shelter
davakRRishAnu:-
a forest fire
arundha samantata:
surrounded all around
---------
In the darkness of the night the group of people were unable to go back to their houses in Vraja. So they were sleeping there on the banks in the shelter of Thy feet. Just then they were engulfed by a forest fire.

prabudhitAnatha pAlaya pAlayetyudayadArtaravAn pashupAlakAn |
avitumAshu papAtha mahAnalaM kimiha chitramayaM khalu te mukham ||9||
---------
prabudhitAn-atha
who were awakened then
pAlaya pAlaya-iti-
save, save us thus
udayat-Arta-ravAn
raising piteous tones
pashupAlakAn
the cowherds
avitum-Ashu
to protect, quickly
papAtha mahAnalam
(Thou) drank the great fire
kim-iha chitram-
what here is surprising
ayam khalu
this (fire) is indeed
te mukham
Thy mouth

The Gopas were awakened and raised piteous tones of 'save us, save us', in alarm. To quickly protect them, Thou drank in that great fire. What is so surprising in this? Thy mouth, indeed, is fire itself.
---------
shikhini varNata eva hi pItatA parilasatyadhunA kriyayA.apyasau |
iti nuta: pashupairmuditairvibho hara hare duritai:saha me gadAn ||10||

shikhini varNata: eva
in the fire by colour only
hi pItatA
indeed is yellowness (Peetataa)
parilasati-adhunA
it exists now
kriyayA-api-asau
as an action (Peetataa) also in this (fire)
iti nuta:
thus praised
pashupai:-muditai:-
by the cowherds (who were) delighted
vibho
O All pervading Lord!
hara hare
eradicate, O Hari!
duritai: saha
along with the sins
me gadAn
my ailments
---------
The yellowness 'Peetataa' was only an adjective of fire. By Thy having drunk it, it has also acquired the verb adjective of Peetataa, to be drunk. O All pervading Lord! The delighted cowherds thus praised Thee. O Hari! Deign to eradicate my ailments along with my sins.

Narayaneeyam D057

Dashaka 57
---------
rAmasakha: kvApi dine kAmada bhagavan gato bhavAn vipinam |
sUnubhirapi gopAnAM dhenubhirabhisaMvRRito lasadveSha: ||1||
---------
rAmasakha:
in Balaraama's company
kvApi dine
one day
kAmada bhagavan
Thou the fulfiller of wishes, O Lord!
gata: bhavAn
went Thee
vipinam
to the forest
sUnubhi:-api
with the sons,also
gopAnAm
of the Gopas
dhenubhi:-abhisaMvRRita:
(and) by the cows surrounded
lasat-veSha:
in a bedecked attire

O Lord! Thou the fulfiller of wishes, one day in a bedecked attire, with Balaraama, went to the forest. The sons of the Gopas and the cows also surrounded and followed Thee.
---------
sandarshayan balAya svairaM vRRindAvanashriyaM vimalAm |
kANDIrai: saha bAlairbhANDIrakamAgamo vaTaM krIDan ||2||

sandarshayan
showing around
balAya svairaM
to Balaraama joyfully
vRRindAvana-shriyaM
the beauty of Vrindaavana
vimalAm
(which was so) pure
kANDIrai: saha
with sticks (carrying)
bAlai:-
(with) the children (Thou reached)
bhANDIrakam-
(the tree named) Bhaandeeraka
Agama:
reached
vaTaM krIDan
the tree, playing
---------
Joyfully showing around the unspoilt pure beauty of Vrindaavana to Balaraama, accompanied by the cowherd boys, carrying a staff in a playful mood, Thou reached the banyan tree called Bhaandeeraka.

tAvattAvakanidhanaspRRihayAlurgopamUrtiradayAlu: |
daitya: pralambanAmA pralambabAhuM bhavantamApede ||3||
---------
tAvat-
then
tAvaka-nidhana-
Thy death
spRRihayAlu:-gopamUrti:
desiring, in the disguise of a Gopa
adayAlu: daitya:
a pitiless demon
pralamba-nAmA
Pralamba named
pralamba-bAhuM bhavantam-
the long armed Thee
Apede
approached

Then, the pitiless demon, approached Thee in the disguise of a Gopa, desiring to kill Thee, who are with long arms.
---------
jAnannapyavijAnanniva tena samaM nibaddhasauhArda: |
vaTanikaTe paTupashupavyAbaddhaM dvandvayuddhamArabdhA: ||4||

jAnan-api
knowing though
avijAnan-iva
not knowing as though
tena samaM
with him
nibaddha-sauhArda:
cultivating friendship
vaTa-nikaTe
near the banyan tree
paTu-pashupa-
by skilled cowherd boys
vyAbaddhaM
formed
dvandva-yuddham-
wrestling
ArabdhA:
started (Thee)
---------
In spite of knowing fully well of his intention, seemingly unaware of his designs, Thou cultivated friendship with him. Then near the banyan tree, arranging the game of wrestling with the cowherd boys who were skilled in that art, Thou started a duel.

gopAn vibhajya tanvan sa~NghaM balabhadrakaM bhavatkamapi |
tvadbalabhIruM daityaM tvadbalagatamanvamanyathA bhagavan ||5||
---------
gopAn vibhajya
the cowherd boys dividing
tanvan sa~NghaM
into two teams
balabhadrakaM
of Balaraama
bhavatkam-api
and of Thee also
tvat-bala-bhIruM
Thy strength afraid of
daityaM
the demon
tvad-bala-gatam-
in Thy team joining
anvamanyathA
(Thou) agreed
bhagavan
O Lord!

O Lord! Thou divided the cowherd boys into two teams led by Balaraama and Thyself. The Asura was aware of Thy strength and being afraid wanted to join Thy team, to which Thou agreed.
---------
kalpitavijetRRivahane samare parayUthagaM svadayitataram |
shrIdAmAnamadhatthA: parAjito bhaktadAsatAM prathayan ||6||

kalpita-
as per rules (arranged)
vijetRRi-vahane
the victorious be carried
samare parayUthagaM
in the fight, by one of the other team
svadayitataram
very dear to Thee
shrIdAmAnam-
Shridaamaa
adhatthA: parAjita:
Thou carried, (Thou) being defeated
bhakta-dAsatAM
(Thou) as a servant of Thy devotees
prathayan
establishing /demonstrating
---------
As per the rules of the game, as was arranged, the victor is to be carried by the vanquished. Thou being defeated, Thou carried the very dear friend Shreedaamaa, there by demonstrating to the world that Thou are at the service of Thy devotees.

evaM bahuShu vibhUman bAleShu vahatsu vAhyamAneShu |
rAmavijita: pralambo jahAra taM dUrato bhavadbhItyA ||7||
---------
evaM bahuShu
thus in many
vibhUman
O Infinite One!
bAleShu vahatsu
when the children were carrying
vAhyamAneShu
and were being carried
rAma-vijita:
by Balaraama defeated
pralamba: jahAra taM
Pralamba (the demon), took him
dUrata: bhavat-bhItyA
far away for Thy fear

Thus the many cowherd boys were carrying and were being carried. In the course, Pralamba was defeated by Balaraama and so he carried Balaraama far away from Thy sight out of fear of Thee.
---------
tvaddUraM gamayantaM taM dRRiShTvA halini vihitagarimabhare |
daitya: svarUpamAgAdyadrUpAt sa hi balo.api chakito.abhUt ||8||

tvat-dUraM gamayantam
from Thee far going
taM dRRiShTvA halini
seeing him when Balaraama
vihita-garima-bhare
took on increased weight
daitya: svarUpam-
the demon to his own form
AgAt-yat-rUpAt
went to by which form
sa hi bala:-api
he indeed Balaraama also
chakita:-abhUt
wonderstruck became
---------
Balaraama saw that he was being carried far away, so he increased his weight by his divine power. The demon then took to his own real form, seeing which even Balaraam was wonderstruck.

uchchatayA daityatanostvanmukhamAlokya dUrato rAma: |
vigatabhayo dRRiDhamuShTyA bhRRishaduShTaM sapadi piShTavAnenam ||9||
---------
uchchatayA daitya-tano:-
because of the height of the Asura's body
tvat-mukham-
Thy face
Alokya
seeing
dUrata: rAma:
from a distance, Balaraam
vigata-bhaya:
overcoming the fear
dRRiDha-muShTyA
by a fierce fist
bhRRisha-duShTam sapadi
the extremely wicked (him), quickly
piShTvAn enam
crushed him

The Asura's height was great and so being carried on his shoulder, Balaraam could see Thee from a distance. At Thy sight Balaraam shunned all fear and with a firm fist struck the demon and quickly crushed him to a pulp.
---------
hatvA dAnavavIraM prAptaM balamAlili~Ngitha premNA |
tAvanmilatoryuvayo: shirasi kRRitA puShpavRRiShTiramaragaNai: ||10||

hatvA dAnava-vIraM
killing the clever Asura
prAptaM balam-
returned Balaraam
Alili~Ngitha
(Thou) embraced
premNA tAvata-
lovingly, at that time
milato:-yuvayo:
when Thou two were meeting
shirasi kRRitA
on Thy heads was done
puShpavRRiShTi:-
flower showering
amara-gaNai:
by the gods/ devas
---------
Balaraama returned after killing the clever Asura and Thou embraced him lovingly. As Thou two were meeting the gods and devas showered flowers on Thy heads.

Alambo bhuvanAnAM prAlambaM nidhanamevamArachayan |
kAlaM vihAya sadyo lolambaruche hare hare: kleshAn ||11||
---------
Alamba: bhuvanAnAM
the support of the worlds
prAlambaM nidhanam-
Pralambaasura's killing
evam-Arachayan
carrying out
kAlaM vihAya
without delay
sadya:
quickly
lolambaruche
a black bee like splendorous
hare
O Hari
hare:
eradicate
kleshAn
my sufferings

O Hari! Thou who has the splendour of a black bee, who are the support of the worlds, Thou who carried out the destruction of Pralambaasura, without delay, quickly eradicate my sufferings.

Narayaneeyam D058

Dashaka 58
---------
tvayi viharaNalole bAlajAlai: pralamba-
pramathanasavilambe dhenava: svairachArA: |
tRRiNakutukaniviShTA dUradUraM charantya:
kimapi vipinamaiShIkAkhyamIShAMbabhUvu: ||1||
---------
tvayi viharaNa-lole
(when) Thou (were) engaged in playing
bAla-jAlai:
with the boys' group
pralamba-pramathana-
in the Pralambaasura killing
savilambe
(and) were delayed
dhenava: svaira-chArA:
the cows of their own will
tRRiNa-kutuka-niviShTA
eager to eat grass
dUra-dUraM charantya:
far and far moving
kimapi vipinam-
(to) some forest
aiShIka-Akhyam-
Aishika (also a grass) named
IShAM babhUvu:
came near

As Thou were engaged in playing with the group of boys and were held up in the destruction of Pralambaasura, the cows moved far ahead in their eagerness to eat grass. They reached a nearby forest named Aishika.
---------
anadhigatanidAghakrauryavRRindAvanAntAt
bahiridamupayAtA: kAnanaM dhenavastA: |
tava virahaviShaNNA UShmalagrIShmatApa-
prasaravisaradambhasyAkulA: stambhamApu: ||2||

anadhigata
(which was) not felt
nidAgha-krauryaM-
the summer heat cruel (intensity)
vRRindAvana-antAt
at Vrindaavana's outer end
bahi:-idam-upayAtA:
outside this (who had) reached
kAnanaM dhenava:-tA:
the forest, those cows
tava viraha-viShaNNA
(by) Thy separation tormented
UShmala-grIShma-tApa-
(and) the intensely hot the summer heat
prasara-visarat-
increasing and spreading
ambhasya-AkulA:
for want of water suffering
stambham-Apu:
motionless became
---------
The cruel summer heat was not felt in the Vrindaavana forest. But when the cows reached the outskirts of the forest, they were tormented by the intensely hot summer heat which was increasing and spreading. Exhausted by the heat and for the want of water and also out of grief at the separation from Thee, they stood stunned and motionless.

tadanu saha sahAyairdUramanviShya shaure
galitasaraNimu~njAraNyasa~njAtakhedam |
pashukulamabhivIkShya kShipramAnetumArA-
ttvayi gatavati hI hI sarvato.agnirjajRRimbhe ||3||
---------
tadanu saha sahAyai:-
then with Thy helpers
dUram-anviShya
till far searching
shaure
O Krishna
galita-saraNi-
loosing the way
mu~nja-araNya-
(reaching) the Munja forest
sa~nAta-khedam
overcome by exhaustion
pashukulam-abhivIkShya
the cattle seeing
kShipram-Anetum-
quickly to bring
ArAt-tvayi gatavati
near (when) Thou went
hI hI sarvata:-
alas, alas, all around
agni;-jajRRimbhe
a fire broke out

O Krishna! Along with Thy mates, Thou ventured far in search of the cattle and having lost the way, Thou reached the Munja forest. There Thou discovered the cows standing in distress and as Thou were nearing them to bring them back, alas a wild fire broke out and spread.
---------
sakalahariti dIpte ghorabhA~NkArabhIme
shikhini vihatamArgA ardhadagdhA ivArtA: |
ahaha bhuvanabandho pAhi pAhIti sarve
sharaNamupagatAstvAM tApahartAramekam ||4||

sakala-hariti dIpte
(when) all the directions were blazing
ghora-bhA~NkAra-bhIme
(with) terrific roars frightening
shikhini
the fire
vihata-mArgA
obstructed the ways
ardha-dagdhA:
half burnt
iva-ArtA:
like tormented
ahaha bhuvanabandho
O Friend of all!
pAhi pAhi-iti
save, save us, thus
sarve sharaNam-upagatA:-
all of them took refuge
tvAM tApa-hartAram-ekam
in Thee, from all sorrows the saviour, the Only One
---------
All the directions were blazing with the outrageous fire and its terrific frightening roars. All the escape routes were obstructed and all the boys and cows were so tormented as if they were half burnt. They all took refuge in Thee who are a friend of all and called Thee saying, ' O The Only One saviour from all sorrows , save us, save us.'

alamalamatibhItyA sarvato mIlayadhvaM
dRRishamiti tava vAchA mIlitAkSheShu teShu |
kva nu davadahano.asau kutra mu~njATavI sA
sapadi vavRRitire te hanta bhANDIradeshe ||5||
---------
alam-alam-
enough enough
ati-bhItyA
of so much fright
sarvata: mIlayadhvaM
all of you close
dRRisham-iti
the eyes, thus
tava vAchA
by Thy words
mIlita-akSheShu
(when they) had closed the eyes
teShu kva nu
when they, where indeed (was)
dava-dahana:-asau
forest fire that
kutra mu~njA-aTavI sA
where (was) Munja forest that
sapadi vavRRitire te
at once found themselves they
hanta bhANDIra-deshe
how wonderful, in Bhaandeera land

Enough, enough of so much fright. Let all completely close their eyes.' Thus on Thy instruction when they had all closed their eyes, where indeed was the forest fire and where was the Munja forest? They instantly found themselves in the Bhaandeera area inside Vrindaavana. How wonderful!
---------
jaya jaya tava mAyA keyamIsheti teShAM
nutibhiruditahAso baddhanAnAvilAsa: |
punarapi vipinAnte prAchara: pATalAdi-
prasavanikaramAtragrAhyagharmAnubhAve ||6||

jaya jaya
hail hail
tava mAyA
Thy mysterious ways
kA-iyam
what is it
Isha-
O Lord
iti teShAM
thus by them (the cowherds)
nutibhi:-uditahAsa:
being praised, smilingly
baddha-nAnA-vilAsa:
in various ways sporting
puna:-api
again also
vipina-ante
in the forest's end
prAchara: pATalAdi-
Thou roamed about, (where) the Paatala etc
prasava-nikara-
(flowers) blooming in bunches
mAtra-grAhya-
(were the) only indication
gharma-anubhAve
summer season's presence
---------
Hail, hail, Thy mysterious ways, unfathomable, O Lord!' Thus Thou were smilingly praised by them. Thou continued to roam about and sport in various ways, where the Paatala flowers blooming in bunches, were the only indication of the presence of the summer season.

tvayi vimukhamivochchaistApabhAraM vahantaM
tava bhajanavadanta: pa~NkamuchChoShayantam |
tava bhujavaduda~nchadbhUriteja:pravAhaM
tapasamayamanaiShIryAmuneShu sthaleShu ||7||
---------
tvayi vimukham-
(when) unto Thee, (one is) indifferent
iva-uchchai:-
like that, very intense
tApabhAraM vahantam
the weight of heat, carrying
tava bhajana-vadanta:
Thy praises speaking (worshipping)
pa~Nkam-
the mud/slush
uchChoShayantam
drying up
tava bhuja-vat-
Thy two arms like
uda~nchat-
emitting
bhUri-teja-pravAhaM
a great brilliance flow
tapa-samayam-
the summer time
anaiShI:
Thou spend
yAmuneShu sthaleShu
on the Yamunaa banks

The intense heat of the summer time was like the weight of the heat of passion that people carry in their minds who are indifferent to Thee. It was like the heat which is created by worshipping Thee, which dries up all the mud and slush of Thy devotees. It was like the brilliance flowing from Thy two arms. Such a summer time Thou spent on the banks of the river Yamunaa.
---------
tadanu jaladajAlaistvadvapustulyabhAbhi-
rvikasadamalavidyutpItavAsovilAsai: |
sakalabhuvanabhAjAM harShadAM varShavelAM
kShitidharakuhareShu svairavAsI vyanaiShI: ||8||

tadanu jalada-jAlai:-
then with the cloud clusters
tvat-vapu:-
Thy body
tulya-bhAbhi:-
like splendorous
vikasat-amala-
shining pure
vidyut-pItavAsa:-
lightening (like Thy) yellow garment
vilAsai:
beautifully
sakala-bhuvana-bhAjAM
(to) all the world's inhabitants
harShadAM varShavelAM
joy giving, the rainy season
kShitidhara-kuhareShu
(in) the mountain caves
svairavAsI vyanaiShI:
at will residing Thou spend
---------
Then, the clusters of clouds in the rainy season were like the hue of Thy splendorous body, the lightening shining was like the luster of Thy beautiful yellow garment. It gave joy to all the inhabitants of the world. Such a rainy season Thou spent, sporting at will, in the caves of the mountain (Govardhana).

kuharatalaniviShTaM tvAM gariShThaM girIndra:
shikhikulanavakekAkAkubhi: stotrakArI |
sphuTakuTajakadambastomapuShpA~njaliM cha
pravidadhadanubheje deva govardhano.asau ||9||
---------
kuharatala-niviShTaM
in the caves residing
tvAM gariShThaM
to Thee, the highly honoured
girIndra:
the mountain
shikhi-kula-
the peacocks'
nava-kekA-
pleasant cooings
kAkubhi: stotrakArI
as hymns praising
sphuTa-kuTaja-kadamba-
blooming Kutaja and Kadamba
stoma-puShpA~njaliM cha
heaps and as flower offerings
pravidadhat-anubheje
performing worship
deva
O Lord! (To Thee)
govardhana:-asau
Govardhana this, (the mountain)

O Lord! To Thee, the highly honoured One, living in its caves, the mountain king (Govardhana) extended its hospitality. It sang hymns of Thy praise in the form of the pleasant cooings of the peacocks. It worshipped Thee in the form of offering heaps of fully bloomed Kutaja and Kadamba flowers falling from the branches at Thy feet.
---------
atha sharadamupetAM tAM bhavadbhaktacheto-
vimalasalilapUrAM mAnayan kAnaneShu |
tRRiNamamalavanAnte chAru sa~nchArayan gA:
pavanapurapate tvaM dehi me dehasaukhyam ||10||

atha sharadam-upetAM
then spring season approaching
tAM bhavat-bhakta-cheta:-
that (season) (like) Thy devotees' mind
vimala-salila-pUrAM
with pure water full
mAnayan kAnaneShu
enjoying in the forests
tRRiNam-amala-vanAnte
grass in the pleasant forest
chAru sa~nchArayan gA:
happily grazing the cows
pavanapurapate
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
tvaM dehi
Thou bestow
me deha-saukhyam
unto me good health
---------
Then the spring season approached. In that season the streams were full of pure water, like the pure minds of Thy devotees. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Thou spent such a season enjoying in the forests and happily grazing grass to the cattle in the pleasant forests. O Thou! bestow unto me good health.

Narayaneeyam D059

Dashaka 59
---------
tvadvapurnavakalAyakomalaM premadohanamasheShamohanam |
brahma tattvaparachinmudAtmakaM vIkShya sammumuhuranvahaM striya: ||1||
---------
tvat-vapu:-
Thy form
nava-kalAya-komalaM
fresh Kalaaya flower like soft
prema-dohanam-
evoking love
asheSha-mohanam
(and) to everyone charming
brahma tattva-
Brahman in essence
parachit-mud-AtmakaM
Supreme Consciousness, Bliss personifying
vIkShya sammumuhu:-
seeing, were captivated
anvahaM striya:
day by day, the Gopikas

Day after day the Gopikas saw Thy form and were captivated. Thy form beautiful and fresh and soft like the Kalaaya flower, evoking the sentiment of love. Thy form charmingly enchanting everyone. Thy form, Brahman indeed, the personification of Existence, Reality, Supreme Consciousness and Bliss (Sat-Chit-Aananda).
---------
manmathonmathitamAnasA: kramAttvadvilokanaratAstatastata: |
gopikAstava na sehire hare kAnanopagatimapyaharmukhe ||2||

manmatha-unmathita-
(by) Cupid churned
mAnasA: kramAt-
minds, by and by
tvat-vilokana-ratA:-
Thee to see eager
tata:-tata:
again and again
gopikA:-
the Gopikaas
tava
Thy
na sehire
did not bear
hare
O Lord
kAnana-upagatim-
the proceeding to the forest
api-aha:-mukhe
also at the beginning of the day
---------
O Lord! The minds of these Gopikaas were oppressed by Cupid and because of their love for Thee, they were always eager to see Thee. O Hari! By and by they were unable to bear the separation caused by Thy going to the forest early in the morning to tend the cows.

nirgate bhavati dattadRRiShTayastvadgatena manasA mRRigekShaNA: |
veNunAdamupakarNya dUratastvadvilAsakathayA.abhiremire ||3||
---------
nirgate bhavati
(when) Thou had set out
datta-dRRiShTaya:-
with fixed gaze (on Thee)
tvat-gatena
Thou unto
manasA
with (such) minds
mRRigekShaNA:
the gazelle-eyed (women)
veNu-nAdam-
the flute sound
upakarNya dUrata:-
hearing from far
tvat-
Thy
vilAsa-kathayA-
sportive activities (narrating)
abhiremire
experienced great joy

When Thou set out, the gazelle-eyed Gopikaas had their eyes fixed on Thee with their minds centred on Thee. They would listen to the sound of Thy flute from afar and revel in narrating and recounting Thy various sportive activities.
---------
kAnanAntamitavAn bhavAnapi snigdhapAdapatale manorame |
vyatyayAkalitapAdamAsthita: pratyapUrayata veNunAlikAm ||4||

kAnana-antam-
into the forest
itavAn bhavAn-api
having gone, Thou also
snigdha-pAdapa-tale
under the cool tree
manorame
(which was also) beautiful
vyatyaya-Akalita-
by crossing placed
pAdam-Asthita:
legs standing
pratyapUrayata
kept filling
veNunAlikAm
the flute pipe
---------
Having gone to the forest, Thou would stand cross-legged under a shady beautiful tree and kept playing the flute and filling its pipe with life-breath.

mArabANadhutakhecharIkulaM nirvikArapashupakShimaNDalam |
drAvaNaM cha dRRiShadAmapi prabho tAvakaM vyajani veNukUjitam ||5||
---------
mAra-bANa-dhuta-
by Cupid's arrows shaken
khecharI-kulaM
the celestial damsels
nirvikAra-
motionless,
pashu-pakShi-maNDalam
animals and birds multitudes
drAvaNaM cha
melting and
dRRiShadAm-api
stones even
prabho tAvakaM
O Lord! Thy
vyajani
was born
veNu-kUjitam
flute music

O Lord! The music born out of Thy flute shook the celestial damsels with Cupid's arrows. It made the multitudes of animals and birds motionless, and even melted the stones and rocks.
---------
veNurandhrataralA~NgulIdalaM tAlasa~nchalitapAdapallavam |
tat sthitaM tava parokShamapyaho saMvichintya mumuhurvrajA~NganA: ||6||

veNu-randhra-
(on) the stops of the flute
tarala-a~NgulI-dalaM
moving of the tender finger (tips)
tAla-sa~nchalita-
to keep time tapping
pAda-pallavam
the tender feet
tat sthitaM tava
that pose of Thee
parokSham-api-
not directly seen, even though
aho
what a wonder
saMvichintya
thinking about again and again
mumuhu:-
fell into a state of ecstasy
vrajA~NganA:
the women of Vraja
---------
Thy tender finger tips moved deftly on the stops of the flute, as Thou kept time tapping Thy tender feet. This pose of Thine the Vraja women visualised in their minds again and again and got into a state of ecstasy. Oh how wonderful!

nirvisha~Nkabhavada~NgadarshinI: khecharI: khagamRRigAn pashUnapi |
tvatpadapraNayi kAnanaM cha tA: dhanyadhanyamiti nanvamAnayan ||7||
---------
nirvisha~Nka-
without any restrictions
bhavat-a~Nga-
Thy form
darshinI: khecharI:
being able to see, the celestial damsels
khaga-mRRigAn
birds
pashUn-api
and animals also
tvat-pada-praNayi
(with) Thy feet having contact
kAnanaM cha tA:
and the forest, they (the Gopikaas)
dhanya-dhanyam-iti
blessed blessed (they are) thus
nanu-amAnayan
indeed regarded (them to be)

The celestial damsels were able to see Thy form without restrictions or hindrance. The birds and animals and cows also could see Thy form directly. Even the forest/earth was always having contact with Thy feet and saw Thy form as Thou roamed about. The Gopikaas of Vraja regarded all of them very fortunate and blessed.
---------
ApibeyamadharAmRRitaM kadA veNubhuktarasasheShamekadA |
dUrato bata kRRitaM durAshayetyAkulA muhurimA: samAmuhan ||8||

Apibeyam-
(will) imbibe
adhara-amRRitaM kadA
the nectar of the lips, when
veNu-mukta-
by the flute left over
rasa-sheSham-
the last of the nectar
ekadA
even once
dUrata: bata
far fetched indeed
kRRitaM durAshaya-
is made this greed
iti-AkulA
thus lamenting
muhu:-imA:
again and again, these (Gopikaas)
samAmuhan
were in great distress
---------
O when for once, we will imbibe the nectar of Thy lips, the last of it left over by the flute? Far fetched indeed is this greed.' Thus the Gopikaas lamented again and again and were in great distress and despair.

pratyahaM cha punaritthama~NganAshchittayonijanitAdanugrahAt |
baddharAgavivashAstvayi prabho nityamApuriha kRRityamUDhatAm ||9||
---------
pratyahaM cha puna:-
every day and again
ittham-a~NganA:-
thus the women
chittayoni-janitAt-
the Cupid's caused
anugrahAt
blessings
baddha-rAga-vivashA:-
bonding into attachment and so helpless
tvayi prabho
towards Thee O Lord!
nityam-Apu:-
always attained
iha kRRitya-mUDhatAm
here (in the worldly) concerns, indifference

Day after day and again and again, in this manner, the Cupid caused promptings to the Gopikaas. This was, in a way, a blessing to them. As it made them so bonded in attachment towards Thee, that they became helpless and so always attained indifference in the worldly concerns.
---------
rAgastAvajjAyate hi svabhAvA-
nmokShopAyo yatnata: syAnna vA syAt |
tAsAM tvekaM taddvayaM labdhamAsIt
bhAgyaM bhAgyaM pAhi mAM mArutesha ||10||

rAga:-tAvat-
attachment indeed
jAyate hi
comes
svabhAvAt-
in the natural course
mokSha-upAya:
the means of liberation
yatnata: syAt-
even with effort may be
na vA syAt
or may not be
tAsAM tu-
for them (the Gopikaas) indeed
ekaM tat-dvayaM
one that (served as) both
labdham-AsIt
were attained
bhAgyam bhAgyam
fortunate, fortunate, indeed
pAhi mAM
save me
mArutesha
O Lord of Guruvaayur
---------
Indeed, attachment comes in the natural course. In spite of much effort the means of liberation may or may not be achieved. For the Gopikaas attachment to Thee served as both, as they attained liberation as a result. Oh fortunate indeed they were. O Lord of Guruvaayur! save me.

Narayaneeyam D060

Dashaka 60
---------
madanAturachetaso.anvahaM bhavada~NghridvayadAsyakAmyayA |
yamunAtaTasImni saikatIM taralAkShyo girijAM samArchichan ||1||
---------
madana-Atura-chetasa:-
with minds overcome by the god of love
anvahaM
everyday
bhavat-a~Nghri-dvaya-
Thy two feet
dAsya-kAmyayA
to serve desiring
yamunA-taTa-sImni
on the Yamunaa banks nearby
saikatIM
made of sand (an image)
tarala-AkShya:
the beautiful eyed ones (girls)
girijAM
the goddess Kaatyaayini
samArchichan
worshipped

The beautiful eyed girls of Vraja, overcome by Cupid and love for Thee were desirous of serving Thy two lotus feet. To achieve this, everyday, on the banks of Yamunaa, they made an image of sand of goddess Girijaa and worshipped it.
---------
tava nAmakathAratA: samaM sudRRisha: prAtarupAgatA nadIm |
upahArashatairapUjayan dayito nandasuto bhavediti ||2||

tava
Thy
nAma-kathA-ratA:
name and deeds always immersed in
samaM sudRRisha:
(they) all beautiful eyed (girls)
prAta:-upAgatA
in the morning reaching
nadIm
the river
upahAr-shatai:-
with hundreds of offerings
apUjayan
worshipping (prayed)
dayita: nandasuta:
(that) husband, the son of Nanda
bhavet-iti
may become, thus
---------
All the beautiful girls were always immersed in chanting Thy name and narrating Thy deeds. In the morning they would go to the river and worship goddess Girijaa with hundreds of offerings and pray to her that Nanda's son, Krishna, may become their husband.

iti mAsamupAhitavratAstaralAkShIrabhivIkShya tA bhavAn |
karuNAmRRidulo nadItaTaM samayAsIttadanugrahechChayA ||3||
---------
iti mAsam-
thus for one month
upAhita-vratA:-
having performed the vows
taralAkShI:-
the beautiful eyed (girls)
abhivIkShya tA:
seeing them
bhavAn
Thou
karuNA-mRRidula:
by compassion moved
nadItaTaM samayAsIt-
to the river bank went
tat-anugraha-
to bless them
ichChayA
desiring

Thou were moved by compassion when Thou saw that the beautiful eyed girls had performed the vows for a month. With a desire to bless them Thou went to the river bank.
---------
niyamAvasitau nijAmbaraM taTasImanyavamuchya tAstadA |
yamunAjalakhelanAkulA: puratastvAmavalokya lajjitA: ||4||

niyama-avasitau
vows/observances being completed
nija-ambaraM
their clothes
taTa-sImani-
on the river bank
avamuchya tA:-
leaving they
tadA yamunA-jala-
then in the Yamunaa waters
khelana-AkulA:
to sport eager
purata:-tvAm-
in front Thee
avalokya
seeing
lajjitA:
felt ashamed
---------
The observances of the vows being completed, they eagerly went to sport in the Yamunaa waters, leaving their robes behind, on the bank. Seeing Thee in front, they felt very ashamed.

trapayA namitAnanAsvatho vanitAsvambarajAlamantike |
nihitaM parigRRihya bhUruho viTapaM tvaM tarasA.adhirUDhavAn ||5||
---------
trapayA
out of shame
namita-AnanAsu-
with hung heads
atha: vanitAsu-
then (when) the girls
ambara-jAlam-
the heap of clothes
antike nihitaM
near by kept
parigRRihya
taking away
bhUruha: viTapam
a tree's branch
tvaM tarasA-
Thou quickly
adhirUDhavAn
climbed up

The girls stood with their heads hung in shame. Thou took away the heap of their clothes lying near by and quickly climbed up the branch of a tree.
---------
iha tAvadupetya nIyatAM vasanaM va: sudRRisho yathAyatham |
iti narmamRRidusmite tvayi bruvati vyAmumuhe vadhUjanai: ||6||

iha tAvat-
here then
upetya nIyatAM
coming take
vasanaM va:
clothes you people
sudRRisha:
O beautiful eyed ones
yathAyatham iti
each her own, thus
narma-mRRidu-smite
(with) a soft sweet smile
tvayi bruvati
(when) Thou said
vyamumuhe
they were confused
vadhUjanai:
the girls
---------
Come here, O beautiful eyed ones! Take each one of you your clothes,' Thou said with a soft sweet smile. The girls were confused when they were asked to do so.

ayi jIva chiraM kishora nastava dAsIravashIkaroShi kim |
pradishAmbaramambujekShaNetyuditastvaM smitameva dattavAn ||7||
---------
ayi jIva chiraM
O may you live long
kishora
dear boy
na:-tava dAsI:-
we (are) Thy servants
avashI-karoShi kim
teasing us why
pradisha-ambaram-
give the clothes
ambujekShaNa-
O Lotus eyed one!
iti-udita:-
thus being told
tvaM smitam-eva
Thou smile only
dattavAn
gave

O dear boy! May you live long. We are your hand maids. Why do you tease us thus? O Lotus eyed one! Give us our clothes.' Thus being told, Thou merely gave a smile.
---------
adhiruhya taTaM kRRitA~njalI: parishuddhA: svagatIrnirIkShya tA: |
vasanAnyakhilAnyanugrahaM punarevaM giramapyadA mudA ||8||

adhiruhya taTaM
climbing up the bank
kRRitA~njalI:
with joined palms
parishuddhA:
purified (at heart)
svagatI:-
(in Thee) as the sole resort
nirIkShya tA:
seeing, them (as such)
vasanAni-
clothes
akhilAni-
all
anugrahaM
blessings
puna:-evaM
again also
giram-api-
words (promise) also
adA mudA
gave (to them) with joy
---------
Thou saw that the girls had come up the bank with joined palms, that they were purified at heart and that they had surrendered to Thee as their sole resort.Thou with joy gave them back all their clothes and also words of promise as blessings.

viditaM nanu vo manIShitaM vaditArastviha yogyamuttaram |
yamunApuline sachandrikA: kShaNadA ityabalAstvamUchivAn ||9||
---------
viditaM nanu
known indeed
va: manIShitaM
(is) your desire
vaditAra:-
(I) will respond
tu-iha
surely here
yogyam-uttaram
proper (befitting) answer
yamunA-puline
on the Yamunaa banks
sachandrikA:
(in) moon lit
kShaNadA: iti-
nights, thus
abalA:-
to the girls
tvam-UchivAn
Thou said

Known indeed is your desire to me. I will surely give a proper response, in the moon lit nights on the sand banks of Yamunaa.' Thus Thou said to the girls.
---------
upakarNya bhavanmukhachyutaM madhuniShyandi vacho mRRigIdRRisha: |
praNayAdayi vIkShya vIkShya te vadanAbjaM shanakairgRRihaM gatA: ||10||

upakarNya
hearing
bhavat-mukha-chyutaM
from Thy mouth flowing
madhu-niShyandi vacha:
honey dripping words
mRRigIdRRisha:
the doe-eyed (girls)
praNayAt-ayi
with love, O Lord!
vIkShya vIkShya
seeing again and again
te vadan-AbjaM
Thy lotus face
shanakai:-gRRihaM gatA:
slowly home went
---------
O Lord! The doe eyed girls heard Thy honey dripping words flowing from Thy mouth. Looking with love at Thy lotus face again and again they slowly went home.

iti nanvanugRRihya vallavIrvipinAnteShu pureva sa~ncharan |
karuNAshishiro hare hara tvarayA me sakalAmayAvalim ||11||
---------
iti nanu-
thus indeed
anugRRihya
blessing
vallavI:-
the Gopikaas
vipina-anteShu
in the forests
purA-iva sa~ncharan
before like moving about
karuNAshishira:
O Compassionate and cool
hare
O Hari!
hara tvarayA
put an end to, soon
me sakala-
my all
AmayAvalim
host of ailments

Thus Thou blessed the Gopikaas and continued to roam the woods as before. O Hari! With Thy such cooling compassion, quickly put an end to all my hosts of ailments.

Narayaneeyam D061

Dashaka 61
---------
tatashcha vRRindAvanato.atidUrato
vanaM gatastvaM khalu gopagokulai: |
hRRidantare bhaktataradvijA~NganA-
kadambakAnugrahaNAgrahaM vahan ||1||
---------
tata:-cha
and then
vRRindAvanata:-
from Vrindaavana
atidUrata:
far away
vanaM gata:-tvaM
(when) to the forest went Thou
khalu gopa-gokulai:
indeed (with) the cowherds and cows
hRRidantare
in (Thy) heart
bhaktatara-
(to) the very devoted
dvijA~NganA:-
Braahmin women
kadambaka-
group
anugrahaNa-
blessing
AgrahaM vahan
desire carrying

Once Thou went into the forest far away from Vrindaavana, with the cows and the cowherds. In Thy heart Thou carried the desire of blessing the large group of the very devout Braahmin women.
---------
tato nirIkShyAsharaNe vanAntare
kishoralokaM kShudhitaM tRRiShAkulam |
adUrato yaj~naparAn dvijAn prati
vyasarjayo dIdiviyAchanAya tAn ||2||

tata: nirIkShya-
then seeing
asharaNe vanAntare
without shelter, inside the forest
kishora-lokaM
the boys
kShudhitaM tRRiShA-AkulaM
hungry (and) with thirst tormented
adUrata:
not very far away
yaj~naparAn
performing yagya
dvijAn prati
Braahmins towards
vyasarjaya:
sent
dIdivi-yAchanAya
boiled rice to beg
tAn
of them
---------
Then Thou saw that the boys were hungry and were tormented by thirst and the forest was without any dwellings where some food could be got. Not very far away some Braahmins were performing Yagya. Thou sent the boys to them to beg for some boiled rice (food).

gateShvatho teShvabhidhAya te.abhidhAM
kumArakeShvodanayAchiShu prabho |
shrutisthirA apyabhininyurashrutiM
na ki~nchidUchushcha mahIsurottamA: ||3||
---------
gateShu-atha: teShu-
they had gone ,then they
abhidhAya
mentioning
te-abhidhAM
Thy name
kumArakeShu-
the boys
odana-yAchiShu
for food had asked
prabho
O Lord!
shruti-sthirA api-
(they) in Srutis firmly established even (though)
abhininyu:-ashrutiM
took to not hearing
na ki~nchit-
anything
Uchu:-cha
said and
mahIsura-uttamA:
(they known to be) the Braahmins great

O Lord! The boys then went to the Braahmins and they mentioned Thy name and asked for food. But the great Braahmins who were known to be well versed in Vedas (Shrutis) acted as if they had not heard anything and did not respond in any manner.
---------
anAdarAt khinnadhiyo hi bAlakA: |
samAyayuryuktamidaM hi yajvasu |
chirAdabhaktA: khalu te mahIsurA:
kathaM hi bhaktaM tvayi tai: samarpyate ||4||

anAdarAt
ignored
khinnadhiya:
sad at heart
hi bAlakA:
indeed the boys
samAyayu:-
came back
yuktam-idaM hi
befitting this (behaviour) indeed
yajvasu
for ritualists
chirAt-abhaktA:
for long being undevoted
khalu te mahIsurA:
indeed they the Braahmins
kathaM hi
how indeed
bhaktaM tvayi
food to Thee
tai: samarpyate
by them be offered
---------
The boys came back, saddened at heart at being ignored thus. But such an indifferent behaviour was quite expected of such ritualistic Braahmins. Indeed for long they were not devoted to Thee so how was it possible that they would offer food to Thee?

nivedayadhvaM gRRihiNIjanAya mAM
disheyurannaM karuNAkulA imA: |
iti smitArdraM bhavateritA gatA-
ste dArakA dArajanaM yayAchire ||5||
---------
nivedayadhvaM
announce
gRRihiNIjanAya
to the housewives
mAm
me
disheyu:-annaM
will give food
karuNAkulA:-imA:
compassion driven these (women)
iti smita-Ardram
thus smiling softly
bhavatA-IritA:
by Thee being said
gatA:-te dArakA:
went they (those) boys
dArajanaM yayAchire
the wives requested

Thou told the boys to go and announce Thy arrival to the housewives. Thou smilingly told them that those women were full of compassion and that they would give food. Thus being told the boys went to the housewives and requested them.
---------
gRRihItanAmni tvayi sambhramAkulA-
shchaturvidhaM bhojyarasaM pragRRihya tA: |
chiraMdhRRitatvatpravilokanAgrahA:
svakairniruddhA api tUrNamAyayu: ||6||

gRRihIta-nAmni tvayi
(when) Thy name was taken
sambhrama-AkulA:-
in great excitement (and) who were eager (to see Thee)
chaturvidhaM bhojya-rasaM
four types of food
pragRRihya-tA:
taking they
chiraM-dhRRita-tvat-
for long holding Thy
pravilokana-AgrahA:
sight's desire
svakai:-niruddhA: api
by kith and kin being prevented even
tUrNam-Ayayu:
quickly came
---------
As Thy name was mentioned by the boys, the women who were eager to see Thee were very excited. They quickly came to Thee carrying with them four types food. For long they were holding a desire to see Thee, so in spite of being forbidden by their kith and kin, they came quickly.

vilolapi~nChaM chikure kapolayo:
samullasatkuNDalamArdramIkShite |
nidhAya bAhuM suhRRidaMsasImani
sthitaM bhavantaM samalokayanta tA: ||7||
---------
vilola-pi~nChaM
quivering peacock feather
chikure kapolayo:
in the hair, on the two cheeks
samullasat-
glowing
kuNDalam-
earrings
Ardram-IkShite
kindly glance
nidhAya bAhuM
placing hand
suhRRit-aMsa-sImani
on friend's shoulder
sthitaM bhavantaM
standing (thus) Thee
samalokayanta tA:
joyfully saw they (the women)

The peacock feather was quivering in the locks of Thy hair. Thy two cheeks were glowing with the reflection of the earrings. Thy hand was placed on the shoulder of Thy friend. The women joyfully saw Thee standing in this manner in front of them.
---------
tadA cha kAchittvadupAgamodyatA
gRRihItahastA dayitena yajvanA |
tadaiva sa~nchintya bhavantama~njasA
vivesha kaivalyamaho kRRitinyasau ||8||

tadA cha kAchit-
and then one of them
tvat-upAgama-
Thee coming near to
udyatA gRRihIta-hastA
eager, caught by the hand
dayitena yajvanA
by (her) husband (who was) a ritualistic Braahmin
tadA-eva
then only
sa~nchintya
meditated deeply
bhavantam-a~njasA
on Thee, easily
vivesha kaivalyam-
entered oneness (with Thee)
aho
what a wonder
kRRitinI-asau
very fortunate (was) this one
---------
And then, one of them who was eager to come near Thee, was held back by hand by her ritualistic husband. Thus being deterred, she meditated deeply on Thee. O What a wonder! This fortunate one easily entered oneness with Thee, there and then.

AdAya bhojyAnyanugRRihya tA: puna-
stvada~Ngasa~NgaspRRihayojjhatIrgRRiham |
vilokya yaj~nAya visarjayannimA-
shchakartha bhartRRinapi tAsvagarhaNAn ||9||
---------
AdAya bhojyAni-
taking food offerings
anugRRihya tA:
blessing them (the women)
puna:
again
tvat-a~Nga-
Thy physical
sa~Nga-spRRihayA-
contact desiring
ujjhatI: gRRiham
(and so) abandoning the house
vilokya yaj~nAya
seeing, for the rituals
visarjayan-
sending back
imA:-chakartha
these women, Thou did
bhartRRina-api
the husbands also
tAsu-agarhaNAn
in them (for their wives) had no hard feelings

Accepting their offerings for food, Thou blessed them. They were always desirous of having physical contact with Thee and so abandoned their houses. Seeing this, Thou sent them back to conduct the Yagya rituals properly. Thou also rendered their husbands free from any ill feelings towards them.
---------
nirUpya doShaM nijama~NganAjane
vilokya bhaktiM cha punarvichAribhi:
prabuddhatattvaistvamabhiShTuto dvijai-
rmarutpurAdhIsha nirundhi me gadAn ||10||

nirUpya
realising
doShaM nijam-
mistake (their) own
a~NganAjane
(and) in the women folk
vilokya bhaktiM
seeing devotion
cha puna:-
and again
vichAribhi:
by the thinking ones
prabuddha-tattvai:-
who had understood the reality
tvam-abhiShTuta:
Thou were praised
dvijai:-
by the Braahmins
marutpurAdhIsha
