O Lord of Guruvaayur!
nirundhi me gadAn
eradicate my sufferings
---------
The Braahmins realized their own mistake. They also recognized the great devotion of their wives. Those of them who reflected thus and then understood the Reality sang Thy praises. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Eradicate my sufferings.

Narayaneeyam D062

Dashaka 62
---------
kadAchidgopAlAn vihitamakhasambhAravibhavAn
nirIkShya tvaM shaure maghavamadamuddhvaMsitumanA: |
vijAnannapyetAn vinayamRRidu nandAdipashupA-
napRRichCha: ko vA.ayaM janaka bhavatAmudyama iti ||1||
---------
kadAchit-
once
gopAlAn
(when) the cowherds
vihita-makha-
(had) collected for the Yagya
sambhAra-vibhavAn
the requisite materials many (of them)
nirIkShya tvaM
seeing this, Thou
shaure
O Shauri!
maghava-madam-
Indra's pride
uddhvaMsitu-manA:
to humble, desiring
vijAnana-api-etAn
knowing though these (preparations)
vinaya-mRRidu
politely and softly
nanda-Adi-pashupAn-
to Nanda and other cowherds
apRRichCha:
asked
ka: vA-ayaM
(for) what or this
janaka bhavatAm-
O Father! (is) your
udyama iti
effort thus

O Shauri! Once the cowherds were collecting the requisite material to perform a Yagya to appease Indra. Thou wanted to humble the pride of Indra. In spite of knowing what the preparations were for, Thou, in full humility and politeness asked Nanda and the other cowherds, 'O Father what is this your effort for?'
---------
babhAShe nandastvAM suta nanu vidheyo maghavato
makho varShe varShe sukhayati sa varSheNa pRRithivIm |
nRRiNAM varShAyattaM nikhilamupajIvyaM mahitale
visheShAdasmAkaM tRRiNasalilajIvA hi pashava: ||2||

babhAShe nanda:-tvAm
said Nanda to Thee
suta nanu
O son! Indeed
vidheya: maghavata:
has to be performed for Indra
makha: varShe varShe
Yagya every year
sukhayati sa
gives happiness he
varSheNa pRRithivIm
by rain to the earth
nRRiNAm varShAyattam
of human beings, on rain depends
nikhilam-upajIvyam
all livelihood
mahitale
on the earth
visheShAt-asmAkam
particularly for us
tRRiNa-salila-jIvA
(on) grass (and) water live
hi pashava:
indeed the cows
---------
Nanda told Thee, 'O son! A yagya has to be performed for Indra every year. He gives happiness to the earth by rain. The livelihood of all human beings on earth depends on rain. Especially so for us, because our cattle live on grass and water alone.'

iti shrutvA vAchaM piturayi bhavAnAha sarasaM
dhigetanno satyaM maghavajanitA vRRiShTiriti yat |
adRRiShTaM jIvAnAM sRRijati khalu vRRiShTiM samuchitAM
mahAraNye vRRikShA: kimiva balimindrAya dadate ||3||
---------
iti shrutvA
this hearing
vAchaM pitu:-
words of father
ayi bhavAn-Aha
O Thou said
sarasaM
(with) reasoning
dhik-etat-no satyaM
oh this is not true
maghava-janitA
by Indra (is) generated
vRRiShTi:-iti yat
rain, to say so
adRRiShTaM jIvAnAM
unseen (past actions) of the living beings
sRRijati khalu
generates indeed
vRRiShTiM samuchitAM
the rain required
mahA-araNye
in the big forest
vRRikShA: kim-iva
the trees what like
balim-indrAya
offerings for Indra
dadate
(do) give?

O Lord! Hearing this, Thou said with sweet reasoning, 'Oh no, this is not true, to say that the rain is generated by Indra. Rain is generated by the unseen past actions of the living beings, as required. In this big forest, what kind of offerings do the trees give to Indra?'
---------
idaM tAvat satyaM yadiha pashavo na: kuladhanaM
tadAjIvyAyAsau balirachalabhartre samuchita: |
surebhyo.apyutkRRiShTA nanu dharaNidevA: kShititale
tataste.apyArAdhyA iti jagaditha tvaM nijajanAn ||4||

idaM tAvat satyaM
this then is true
yat-iha pashava:
that here the cows
na: kula-dhanaM
(are our) tribe's wealth
tat-AjIvyAya-
so for their livelihood
asau-bali:
this offering
achala-bhartre
to the great mountain
samuchita:
is appropriate
surebhya:-api-
than the gods also
utkRRiShTA nanu
greater are indeed
dharaNi-devA:
holy men
kShititale tata:-
on the earth, therefore
te-api-ArAdhyA
they also deserve to be worshipped
iti jagaditha tvam
thus said Thou
nija-janAn
to Thy people
---------
Thou said to Thy people,'this is true that the cows are the wealth of our tribe. This mountain (Govardhana) provides them with their requisite grass and water. So the offerings should be made to the mountain. The holy men on the earth are indeed more great than the gods, so they also deserve to be worshipped.'

bhavadvAchaM shrutvA bahumatiyutAste.api pashupA:
dvijendrAnarchanto balimadaduruchchai: kShitibhRRite |
vyadhu: prAdakShiNyaM subhRRishamanamannAdarayutA-
stvamAdashshailAtmA balimakhilamAbhIrapurata: ||5||
---------
bhavat-vAchaM shrutvA
Thy words hearing
bahu-mati-yutA:-
with high regards
te-api pashupA:
they also, the cowherds
dvijendrAn-archanta:
holy men worshipping
balim-adadu:-
offerings gave
uchchai: kShitibhRRite
richly / plentifully to the mountain
vyadhu: prAdakShiNyaM
performed circumambulation
subhRRisham-anaman-
again and again prostrated
AdarayutA:-
with great reverence
tvam-Ada:
Thou ate
shaila-AtmA
(becoming) the mountain's soul
balim-akhilam-
the offerings entire
AbhIra-purata:
in the cowherds' front

Hearing Thy words the cowherds also worshipped the holy men with high regards. They made rich and plentiful offerings to the mountain. They performed circumambulation and prostrated again and again with great reverence. Thou becoming the soul of the mountain ate all the entire offerings in front of the cowherds.
---------
avochashchaivaM tAn kimiha vitathaM me nigaditaM
girIndro nanveSha svabalimupabhu~Nkte svavapuShA |
ayaM gotro gotradviShi cha kupite rakShitumalaM
samastAnityuktA jahRRiShurakhilA gokulajuSha: ||6||

avocha:-cha-evaM tAn
said and thus to them
kim-iha vitathaM me
what there false by me
nigaditaM
was said
girIndra: nanu eSha
the mountain indeed this
sva-balim-upabhu~Nkte
his offerings (given to him) is eating
sva-vapuShA
by his own body
ayaM gotra:
this mountain
gotradviShi cha
(when) the enemy of the mountains (Indra)
kupite
gets angry
rakShitum-alaM
to protect is enough
samastAn-
everybody
iti-uktA
thus being said to
jahRRiShu:-akhilA
were happy all of them
gokula-juSha:
Gokula's inhabitants
---------
Thou told them 'Was I wrong? This mountain has physically consumed all our offerings. Even if the enemy of mountains, Indra is angry, this mountain is capable of protecting everyone.' All the inhabitants of Gokula were happy on hearing this.

pariprItA yAtA: khalu bhavadupetA vrajajuSho
vrajaM yAvattAvannijamakhavibha~NgaM nishamayan |
bhavantaM jAnannapyadhikarajasA.a.akrAntahRRidayo
na sehe devendrastvaduparachitAtmonnatirapi ||7||
---------
pariprItA
in jubilation
yAtA: khalu
went indeed
bhavat-upetA
you accompanying
vrajajuSha: vrajaM
the inhabitants of Vraja to Vraja
yAvat-tAvat-
when then
nija-makha-vibha~NgaM
(his) own Yagya stoppage
nishamayan
hearing
bhavantaM jAnan-api-
Thee knowing also
adhika-rajasA-
(because of) preponderance of Rajoguna
AkrAnta-hRRidaya:
with an overcome mind
na sehe devendra:-
did not tolerate Indra
tvat-uparachita-
by Thee ordained
Atma-unnati:-api
his own exhaultation also

The inhabitants of Vraja, in a jubilant mood returned to Vraja with Thee. Then, when Indra heard of his yagya being stopped he did not tolerate it because his mind was overcome by the preponderance of Rajo Guna. Indra knew Thee well and was also aware that his own high position was ordained by Thee, yet he was enraged.
---------
manuShyatvaM yAto madhubhidapi deveShvavinayaM
vidhatte chennaShTastridashasadasAM ko.api mahimA |
tatashcha dhvaMsiShye pashupahatakasya shriyamiti
pravRRittastvAM jetuM sa kila maghavA durmadanidhi: ||8||

manuShyatvaM yAta:
human form taking
madhubhit-api
the destroyer of the demon Madhu (MahaaVishnu) also
deveShu-avinayaM
towards the gods disrespect
vidhatte chet-
shows if
naShTa:-tridashasadasAM
is lost of all the gods
ka:-api mahimA
what ever prestige
tata:-cha dhvaMsiShye
and so will destroy
pashupa-hatakasya
(this) lowly cowherd's
shriyam-iti
all prosperity, thus
pravRRitta:-tvAM jetuM
setting out, Thou to win
sa kila maghavA
he indeed Indra
durmada-nidhi:
false pride full of
---------
Indra was full of false pride and set out to win Thee. He reasoned that even if it was Vishnu himself, the slayer of Madhu, in human form, if he shows disrespect to the gods, what ever their prestige, would be lost. So he made up his mind to destroy the lowly cowherd (Krishna) and all his prosperity, and to win Thee.

tvadAvAsaM hantuM pralayajaladAnambarabhuvi
prahiNvan bibhrANa; kulishamayamabhrebhagamana: |
pratasthe.anyairantardahanamarudAdyaiviMhasito
bhavanmAyA naiva tribhuvanapate mohayati kam ||9||
---------
tvat-AvAsaM hantuM
Thy residence (Vraja) to destroy
pralaya-jaladAn-
deluge causing clouds
ambara-bhuvi
in the skies' surface
prahiNvan
releasing
bibhrANa: kulisham-
taking thunderbolt
ayam-abhrebha-gamana:
this (Indra) Airaavat riding
pratasthe-anyai:-anta:-
set out with others, inside (in their minds)
dahana-maruta-Adyai:-
(like) fire (Agni), wind (Vaayu) etc.,
vihaMsita:
being scorned
bhavat-mAyA
Thy Maayaa
na-eva
does not indeed
tribhuvanapate
O Lord of three worlds
mohayati kam
delude whom

To destroy Thy residence Vraja, Indra released deluge causing clouds in the skies. He took along thunderbolt and set out riding on his white elephant Airaavata. He was accompanied by other gods, fire(Agni), wind(Vaayu),etc., who slyly scorned him. O Lord of three worlds! whom does not Thy Maayaa afflict?
---------
surendra: kruddhashchet dvijakaruNayA shailakRRipayA.a-
pyanAta~Nko.asmAkaM niyata iti vishvAsya pashupAn |
aho kinnAyAto giribhiditi sa~nchintya nivasan
marudgehAdhIsha praNuda muravairin mama gadAn ||10||

surendra: kruddha:-chet
Indra gets angry, in case
dvija-karuNayA
by the holy men's grace
shaila-kRRipayA-api-
by the mountain's grace also
anAta~Nka:-
fearlessness
asmAkam
is ours
niyata iti
certainly thus
vishvAsya pashupAn
convincing the cowherds
aho
O Alas!
kim-na-AyAta:
what, he has not come (yet)
giribhid-iti
Indra thus
sa~nchintya nivasan
thinking ,waiting
marudgehAdhIsha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
praNuda muravairin
eradicate, O Slayer of Mura
mama gadAn
my ailments
---------
Even if Indra is angry, we are fearless by the grace of the holy men and by the grace of the mountain,' saying so Thou certainly convinced the cowherds. Then Thou stood waiting and wondering why Indra had not yet come. O Lord of Guruvaayur! O Slayer of Mura! do eradicate my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D063

Dashaka 63
---------
dadRRishire kila tatkShaNamakShata-
stanitajRRimbhitakampitadiktaTA: |
suShamayA bhavada~NgatulAM gatA
vrajapadopari vAridharAstvayA ||1||
---------
dadRRishire kila
were seen indeed
tat-kShaNam-
(at) that moment
akShata-stanita-
continuously roaring
jRRimbhita-kampita-
(and) spreading (and) causing to tremble
dik-taTA:
the quarters to their ends
suShamayA
in their brilliance
bhavat-a~Nga-tulAM
Thy form in resemblance
gatA:
attaining
vrajapada-upari
above the land of Vraja
vAridharA:-tvayA
rain clouds by Thee (were seen)

At that moment, indeed, above the land of Vraja, were seen by Thee massive rain clouds continuously roaring and spreading. They caused all the quarters to tremble and they resembled Thy form in their brilliance.
---------
vipulakarakamishraistoyadhArAnipAtai-
rdishidishi pashupAnAM maNDale daNDyamAne |
kupitaharikRRitAnna: pAhi pAhIti teShAM
vachanamajita shrRRiNvan mA bibhItetyabhANI: ||2||

vipula-karak-mishrai:-
huge hail stones accompanied by
toya-dhArA-nipAtai:-
torrential rain fall
dishi-dishi
in all directions
pashupAnAM maNDale
(when) the cowherds' groups
daNDYamAne
were being tormented
kupita-
(from) angered
hari-kRRitAt-
Indra's actions
na: pAhi pAhi-
save, save us
iti teShAM vachanam-
thus their words
ajita shrRRiNavan
O Invincible One! Hearing
mA vibhIta-
do not be afraid
iti-abhANI:
thus (Thou) said
---------
There was torrential rain in all directions accompanied by huge enormous hail stones. The group of cowherds were tormented by the wrathful action of Indra. They all cried and prayed to be protected. O Invincible One! Hearing their laments , Thou asked them not to fear.

kula iha khalu gotro daivataM gotrashatro-
rvihatimiha sa rundhyAt ko nu va: saMshayo.asmin |
iti sahasitavAdI deva govarddhanAdriM
tvaritamudamumUlo mUlato bAladorbhyAm ||3||
---------
kula iha
(for) the clan here
khalu gotra: daivataM
indeed the mountain is the deity
gotra-shatro:-
the mountain enemy's
vihitam-ih
attack here
sa rundhyAt
he will resist
ka: nu va: saMshaya:-
what indeed is your doubt
asmin iti
in this, thus
sahasita-vAdI
with a smile saying
deva
O Lord!
govarddhana-adrim
the Govardhana mountain
tvaritam-
quickly
udamumUla: mUlata:
uprooted from the roots
bAla-dorbhyAm
with (Thy) two tender hands

Here, for our clan, the mountain is the deity. Indra is the enemy of mountains. This mountain, Govardhan, will resist Indra's attack. Indeed what is your doubt in this?' Thou said so with a smile. O Lord! Assuring them, Thou quickly uprooted the Govardhana mountain with Thy two tender arms.
---------
tadanu girivarasya proddhRRitasyAsya tAvat
sikatilamRRidudeshe dUrato vAritApe |
parikaraparimishrAn dhenugopAnadhastA-
dupanidadhadadhatthA hastapadmena shailam ||4||

tadanu girivarasya
thereafter of (this) mountain
proddhRRitasya-
(which) was lifted up
asya tAvat
this then
sikatila-mRRidu-deshe
on the soft sand bed
dUrata: vArita-Ape
which till far away was protected from water
parikara-parimishrAn
household articles, along with
dhenu-gopAn-
cows and cowherds
adhastAt-
underneath
upanidadhat-
keeping
adhatthA:
(Thou) held aloft
hasta-padmena
with one lotus like arm
shailam
the mountain
---------
Then Thou held aloft the lifted up mountain with Thy lotus like arm. The soft sand bed of the mountain was well protected from the rain water. The cows and cowherds all gathered under the uplifted mountain along with their belongings and were also well protected.

bhavati vidhRRitashaile bAlikAbhirvayasyai-
rapi vihitavilAsaM kelilApAdilole |
savidhamilitadhenUrekahastena kaNDU-
yati sati pashupAlAstoShamaiShanta sarve ||5||
---------
bhavati
(when) Thou
vidhRRita-shaile
were holding the mountain
bAlikAbhi:
with the girls and
vayasyai:-api
with the boys of Thy age group also
vihita-vilAsaM
with enthusiasm
keli-lApa-Adi-lole
in playful conversation etc engaging
savidha-milita-dhenU:-
near Thee gathered cows
eka-hastena
with one hand
kaNDUyati sati
caressing
pashupAlA:-
the cowherds
toSham-aiShanta
satisfaction achieved
sarve
all of them

As Thou were holding the mountain, Thou enthusiastically engaged the girls and boys of Thy age group in playful conversation. The cows gathered around Thee and Thou caressed them with one hand. The cowherds were all very satisfied and delighted.
---------
atimahAn girireSha tu vAmake
karasaroruhi taM dharate chiram |
kimidamadbhutamadribalaM nviti
tvadavalokibhirAkathi gopakai: ||6||

atimahAn
very big
giri:-eSha
mountain this (is)
tu vAmake
however in the left
kara-saroruhi
hand, lotus like
taM dharate chiram
this (mountain) (he) is holding for long
kim-idam-
what this
adbhutam-
wonder
adri-balaM
(or) mountain's power
nu-iti
indeed (is it) thus
tvat-avalokibhi:-
by Thy onlookers
Akathi gopakai:
was said by the cowherds
---------
This mountain is so huge. Yet he is holding it in his left hand which is tender like a lotus stalk, for long. What a marvel! Is it that it is the power of the mountain to have lifted itself up?' The Gopas who were Thy onlookers commented thus.

ahaha dhArShTyamamuShya vaTorgiriM
vyathitabAhurasAvavaropayet |
iti haristvayi baddhavigarhaNo
divasasaptakamugramavarShayat ||7||
---------
ahaha dhArShTyam-
Oh! Arrogance
amuShya vaTo:-
of this small boy
girim vyathita-bAhu:-
the mountain (with) pained hands
asau-avaropayet
this (mountain) will place back
iti hari:-tvayi
thus Indra in Thee
baddha-vigarhaNa:
full of contempt
divasa-saptakam-
for seven days
ugram-avarShayat
heavily rained

Oh! The arrogance of this small boy! When his hands pain by the weight of the mountain, he will put it back in place.' Saying so Indra who was full of contempt for Thee poured rain heavily for seven days.
---------
achalati tvayi deva padAt padaM
galitasarvajale cha ghanotkare |
apahRRite marutA marutAM pati-
stvadabhisha~NkitadhI: samupAdravat ||8||

achalati tvayi
(when) did not move Thou
deva
O Lord!
padAt padaM
from Thy place, (even) one step
galita-sarva-jale
(and when) were exhausted all the waters
cha ghanotkare
and the clouds
apahRRite marutA
(and when they) were dispersed by the winds
marutAM pati:
the head of the gods Indra
tvat-abhisha~Nkita-dhI:
(about) Thee (having) a doubtful mind
samupAdravat
fled
---------
Thou had not stirred one step from Thy place. All the clouds were drained and exhausted of their waters. They were drifted away and scattered by the winds. Noticing all this, the head of the gods, Indra was scared of Thy might and fled.

shamamupeyuShi varShabhare tadA
pashupadhenukule cha vinirgate |
bhuvi vibho samupAhitabhUdhara:
pramuditai: pashupai: parirebhiShe ||9||
---------
shamam-upeyuShi
subsiding (having) reached
varShabhare tadA
the heavy rain then
pashupa-dhenu-kule
the cowherds and the cows
cha vinirgate
had come out (from under the mountain)
bhuvi vibho
on the ground O Lord!
samupAhita-bhUdhara:
(Thee who) had placed the mountain
pramuditai: pashupai:
by the overjoyed cowherds
parirebhiShe
were embraced

The heavy rain had then subsided and the cows and cowherds had come out from under the mountain. O Lord! Thou then replaced the mountain on the earth and were embraced by the overjoyed cowherds.
---------
dharaNimeva purA dhRRitavAnasi
kShitidharoddharaNe tava ka: shrama: |
iti nutastridashai: kamalApate
gurupurAlaya pAlaya mAM gadAt ||10||

dharaNim-eva purA
earth also itself, long ago
dhRRitavAnasi
had lifted up (Thou)
kShitidhara-uddharaNe
in mountain lifting up
tava ka: shrama:
Thy what effort
iti nuta:-tridashai:
thus praised by the gods
kamalApate
O Consort of Laxmi!
gurupurAlaya
O Resident of Guruvaayur!
pAlaya mAM gadAt
save me from ailments
---------
O Consort of Laxmi! The gods praised Thee saying that long ago (in the incarnation of a Boar) Thou had lifted up the whole earth itself. Lifting up the mountain was not much of an effort for Thee. O Resident of Guruvaayur! Save me from ailments.

Narayaneeyam D064

Dashaka 64
---------
Alokya shailoddharaNAdirUpaM prabhAvamuchchaistava gopalokA: |
vishveshvaraM tvAmabhimatya vishve nandaM bhavajjAtakamanvapRRichChan ||1||
---------
Alokya
seeing
shaila-uddharaNa-
the lifting of the mountain
Adi-rUpaM
and other feats (of Thee)
prabhAvam-uchchai:-
the great powers
tava
of Thee
gopa-lokA:
the cowherds,
vishveshvaraM
the Lord of the Universe
tvAm-abhimatya
Thee considering
vishve nandaM
all of them to Nanda
bhavat-jAtakam-
Thy horoscope
anvapRRichChan
asked again and again

The Gopaalakas witnessed Thy tremendous feats such as the lifting of the mountain and Thy great powers. They considered Thee to be the Lord of the Universe. All of them asked Nanda again and again about Thy horoscope.
---------
gargodito nirgadito nijAya vargAya tAtena tava prabhAva: |
pUrvAdhikastvayyanurAga eShAmaidhiShTa tAvat bahumAnabhAra: ||2||

garga-udita:
as Garg Muni had said
nirgadita:
was told
nijAya vargAya
for his own clansmen
tAtena tava prabhAva:
by Thy father, Thy greatness
pUrvAdhika:
more than before
tvayi-anurAga
in Thee love
eShAm-aidhiShTa
for these (people) increased
tAvat bahumAnabhAra:
thereafter, also great respect
---------
Thy father told his clansmen of what sage Garg had prophesied about Thy greatness. Thence forward their love and also great respect for Thee increased much more than before.

tato.avamAnoditatattvabodha: surAdhirAja: saha divyagavyA|
upetya tuShTAva sa naShTagarva: spRRiShTvA padAbjaM maNimaulinA te ||3||
---------
tata:-avamAna-udita-
then by disgrace caused
tattva-bodha:
truth realising
surAdhirAja:
the lord of the gods, Indra
saha divya-gavyA
with the celestial cow (Kaamadhenu)
upetya tuShTAva
coming (to Thee) praised
sa naShTagarva:
he whose pride was shattered
spRRiShTvA padAbjaM
touching Thy lotus feet
maNimaulinA
(by his) bejewelled crown
te
Thy (feet)

Then as a result of being disgraced his pride was shattered and the lord of the gods, Indra realised the truth about Thee. He came to Thee with the divine cow Kaamadhenu, and sang Thy praises. He touched Thy lotus feet with his bejewelled crowned head.
---------
snehasnutaistvAM surabhi: payobhirgovindanAmA~NkitamabhyaShi~nchat |
airAvatopAhRRitadivyaga~NgApAthobhirindro.api cha jAtaharSha: ||4||

sneha-snutai:-
with love overflowing (as milk)
tvAM surabhi: payobhi:-
Thee, Surabhi (Kaamadhenu) with milk
govinda-nAma-
(Thee) with the name Govind
a~Nkitam-abhyaShi~nchat
marked and anointed
airAvata-upAhRRita-
(and) by Airaavata brought
divya-ga~NgA-
with the celestial Ganges
pAthobhi:-indra:-api
waters Indra also
cha (abhiShi~nchat)
and (anointed) (Thee)
jAta-harSha:
delightfully
---------
The divine cow Kaamadhenu anointed Thee with her milk overflowing with love for Thee and so Thou were named 'Govinda', the Lord of cows. Airaavata the elephant of Indra brought the waters of the celestial Ganges and Indra also anointed Thee with it delightfully.

jagattrayeshe tvayi gokuleshe tathA.abhiShikte sati gopavATa: |
nAke.api vaikuNThapade.apyalabhyAM shriyaM prapede bhavata: prabhAvAt ||5||
---------
jagattraya-Ishe
O Lord of the three Worlds
tvayi gokuleshe
(when) Thou as the Lord of Gokula
tathA-abhiShikte sati
thus were anointed
gopavATa:
Gokula,
nAke-api
in heaven also
vaikuNThapade-api-
in Vaikuntha also
alabhyAM shriyaM
unattainable, (such) prosperity
prapede bhavata: prabhAvAt
attained by Thy grace

O Lord of the three worlds! Thou were anointed as the Lord of Gokula. By Thy grace and glory, Gokula attained a prosperity unknown and unheard of in either the heavens or even in Vaikuntha.
---------
kadAchidantaryamunaM prabhAte snAyan pitA vAruNapUruSheNa |
nItastamAnetumagA: purIM tvaM tAM vAruNIM kAraNamartyarUpa: ||6||

kadAchit-
once
antar-yamunaM
in the river Yamunaa
prabhAte snAyan pitA
very early in the morning bathing, (Thy) father
vAruNa-pUruSheNa
by Varuna's emissary
nIta:-tam-Anetum-
was taken away, him to bring back
agA: purIM
(Thou) went to the city
tvaM tAM vAruNIM
Thou ,of Varuna
kAraNa-martya-rUpa:
(to fulfill the) purpose of human form
---------
Once very early in the morning, Thy father was bathing in the river Yamunaa. He was taken away by the emissary of Varuna. To bring him back and also to fulfill the purpose of Thy taking human form, Thou went to the city of Varuna .

sasambhramaM tena jalAdhipena prapUjitastvaM pratigRRihya tAtam |
upAgatastatkShaNamAtmagehaM pitA.avadattachcharitaM nijebhya: ||7||
---------
sasambhramaM
with great surprise
tena jalAdhipena
by him, the Lord of the waters
prapUjita:-tvaM
was well worshipped Thou
pratigRRihya tAtam
taking (Thy) father
upAgata:-
returned
tat-kShaNam-
at once
Atma-gehaM
to Thy own house
pitA-avadat-
father said
tat-charitaM
that incident
nijebhya:
to his clansmen

The Lord of the waters, Varuna, was taken by surprise at Thy unexpected appearance. Thou were well worshipped by him. Thou immediately returned home with Thy father. Thy father, Nanda, later narrated this incident to his clansmen.
---------
hariM vinishchitya bhavantametAn bhavatpadAlokanabaddhatRRiShNAn ||
nirIkShya viShNo paramaM padaM taddurApamanyaistvamadIdRRishastAn ||8||

hariM vinishchitya
as Hari knowing with certainty
bhavantam-etAn
Thee, to them
bhavat-pada-Alokana-
Thy state (of bliss) to see
baddha-tRRiShNAn
tied by (such a) thirst
nirIkShya viShNo
seeing, O All pervading Lord!
paramaM padaM tat-
supreme state that
durApam-anyai:-
not easily attainable by others
tvam-adIdRRisha:-tAn
Thou showed to them
---------
The Gopas were convinced that Thou were definitely Hari Himself. O All pervading Lord! They were tied with the intense thirst of having a direct experience of Thy Supreme State. Thou showed them that state which is not attainable to men without devotion.

sphuratparAnandarasapravAhaprapUrNakaivalyamahApayodhau |
chiraM nimagnA: khalu gopasa~NghAstvayaiva bhUman punaruddhRRitAste ||9||
---------
sphurat-
shining
parAnandarasa-
(with) supreme bliss nectar
pravAha-prapUrNa-
flow, full of it
kaivalya-mahApayodhau
(in the) liberation's great ocean
chiraM nimagnA:
for long immersed
khalu gopasa~NghA:-
indeed the Gopas
tvayA-eva bhUman
by Thee only, O Infinite One!
puna:-uddhRRitA:-te
again were taken out, they

The great ocean of liberation was full and overflowing and lustrous with the supreme blissful nectar. The groups of Gopas were indeed immersed in it for long. O Infinite One! By Thee alone they were drawn back to their worldly state of consciousness.
---------
karabadaravadevaM deva kutrAvatAre
nijapadamanavApyaM darshitaM bhaktibhAjAm |
tadiha pashuparUpI tvaM hi sAkShAt parAtmA
pavanapuranivAsin pAhi mAmAmayebhya: ||10||

kara-badara-vat-evaM
in hand a berry like thus
deva kutra-avatAre
O Lord! In which incarnation
nija-padam-anavApyam
Thy own abode (which is) unattainable
darshitaM bhaktibhAjAm
is shown to the devotees
tat-iha pashuparUpI
so here, in the cowherd form
tvaM hi sAkShAt
Thou indeed, in reality are
parAtmA
Supreme Lord!
pavanapuranivAsin
O Dweller of Guruvaayura!
pAhi mAm-
save me
Amayebhya:
from ailments
---------
O Lord! Thy unattainable abode was revealed to the devotees with such ease and clearly as a berry in one's palm. In which other incarnation of Thee has such a thing happened? So, it is certain that here in the form of a cowherd, Thou are the Supreme Self. O Dweller of Guruvaayur! save me from ailments.

Narayaneeyam D065

Dashaka 65
---------
gopIjanAya kathitaM niyamAvasAne
mArotsavaM tvamatha sAdhayituM pravRRitta: |
sAndreNa chAndramahasA shishirIkRRitAshe
prApUrayo muralikAM yamunAvanAnte ||1||
---------
gopIjanAya
for the Gopikaas
kathitaM
said (promised)
niyama-avasAne
(when their) vows had ended
mAra-utsavaM
the love-god festival
tvam-atha
Thou then
sAdhayituM pravRRitta:
to carry out (fulfill) decided
sAndreNa chAndramahasA
with bright light of the full moon
shishirI-kRRita-Ashe
and cooled all the directions
prApUraya: muralikAM
(Thou) filled well (played) the flute
yamunA-vana-ante
in the forests on the banks of Yamunaa

Thou then decided to carry out the festival of the love god, which Thou had promised to the Gopikaas when their vows had ended. One night, with the bright light of the full moon, when all the directions were cool, in the forest on the banks of the river Yamunaa, Thou resoundingly played the flute.
---------
sammUrChanAbhiruditasvaramaNDalAbhi:
sammUrChayantamakhilaM bhuvanAntarAlam |
tvadveNunAdamupakarNya vibho taruNya-
stattAdRRishaM kamapi chittavimohamApu: ||2||

sammUrChanAbhi:-
by the seven (ascending and descending) notes
udita-
emerging
svaramaNDalAbhi:
in a musical strain
sammUrChayantam-
enchanting
akhilaM
everything
bhuvana-antarAlam
in the world space
tvat-veNu-nAdam-
Thy flute resounding
upakarNya vibho
hearing (which) O All pervading Lord!
taruNya:-tat-tAdRRishaM
the damsels, that compared to that (incomparable)
kam-api
some (sort of)
chitta-vimoham-Apu:
mind captivation attained to
---------
O All pervading Lord! In the resounding sound of Thy flute the seven ascending and descending notes emerged in a musical strain and enchanted everything in the world space. Hearing which the damsels attained an unparalleled and incomparable captivating state of their mind.

tA gehakRRityaniratAstanayaprasaktA:
kAntopasevanaparAshcha saroruhAkShya: |
sarvaM visRRijya muralIravamohitAste
kAntAradeshamayi kAntatano sametA: ||3||
---------
tA:
they
geha-kRRitya-niratA:-
who were in household duties engaged
tanaya-prasaktA:
(or) were their children tending
kAnta-upasevana-parA:-cha
and in the husband's service eager
saroruha-AkShya:
(they) the lotus eyed damsels
sarvaM visRRijya
everything abandoning
muralI-rava-
(by) the flute sound
mohitA:-te
captivated they (the damsels)
kAntAra-desham-
to the forest place
ayi kAnta-tano
O Resplendent One!
sametA:
came

O Resplendent One! The lotus eyed damsels were captivated by the sound of Thy flute. They, who were engaged in the household duties, or were taking care of their children, or were engaged in serving their husbands, abandoned everything and came rushing to the forest place.
---------
kAshchinnijA~NgaparibhUShaNamAdadhAnA
veNupraNAdamupakarNya kRRitArdhabhUShA: |
tvAmAgatA nanu tathaiva vibhUShitAbhya-
stA eva saMruruchire tava lochanAya ||4||

kAshchit-
some (damsels)
nija-a~Nga-
their own bodies
paribhUShaNam-
(with) dress and jewels
AdadhAnA
adorning
veNu-praNAdam-
the resounding flute sound
upakarNya
hearing
kRRita-ardha-bhUShA:
having adorned half way only
tvAm-AgatA:
to Thee came
nanu tathA-eva
indeed thus only
vibhUShitAbhya:
than those who were fully adorned
tA eva
they only
saMruruchire
were more pleasing
tava lochanAya
for Thy eyes
---------
Some of the damsels were dressing up and adorning their bodies with jewels. As they heard the resounding sound of the flute, they came to Thee having adorned themselves halfway. For Thy eyes they were far more pleasing indeed than those who were fully adorned.

hAraM nitambabhuvi kAchana dhArayantI
kA~nchIM cha kaNThabhuvi deva samAgatA tvAm |
hAritvamAtmajaghanasya mukunda tubhyaM
vyaktaM babhASha iva mugdhamukhI visheShAt ||5||
---------
hAraM nitamba-bhuvi
necklace on the hip area
kAchana dhArayantI
someone wearing
kA~nchIM cha
and the waist band
kaNTha-bhuvi
in the neck area
deva
O Lord!
samAgatA tvAm
came to Thee
hAritvam-
the attractiveness
Atma-jaghanasya
of her own hips
mukunda tubhyaM
O Mukund for Thee
vyaktaM babhASha iva
clearly declared as if
mugdhamukhI
the charming faced one
visheShAt
in particular

O Lord! One woman, in her haste, came to Thee wearing a necklace on the hips and the waist band in the neck area. O Mukund! It was as if the charming faced one clearly indicated to Thee in particular the attractiveness of her own hips.
---------
kAchit kuche punarasajjitaka~nchulIkA
vyAmohata: paravadhUbhiralakShyamANA |
tvAmAyayau nirupamapraNayAtibhAra-
rAjyAbhiShekavidhaye kalashIdhareva ||6||

kAchit kuche
some one ,on her breasts
puna:-asajjita-
again not wearing
ka~nchulIkA
the upper garment
vyAmohata:
because of excitement
paravadhUbhi:-
by other women
alakShyamANA
also not noticed
tvAm-Ayayau
to Thee came
nirupama-praNaya-
(as if) unparalleled (intense) love
atibhAra-
intense (weighed down by)
rAjya-abhiSheka-vidhaye
kingdom coronation celebration
kalashIdhara-iva
water pitchers as if
---------
Some another woman, in her excitement came to Thee not wearing any upper garment on her breasts. She was not noticed in such a state by the other women, who were as excited. It was as if she was weighed down by the unparalleled intense love she carried as water pitchers as breasts for the celebration of Thy coronation in the kingdom of love.

kAshchit gRRihAt kila niretumapArayantya-
stvAmeva deva hRRidaye sudRRiDhaM vibhAvya |
dehaM vidhUya parachitsukharUpamekaM
tvAmAvishan paramimA nanu dhanyadhanyA: ||7||
---------
kAshchit gRRihAt
some one from home
kila niretum-
indeed to come out
apArayantya:
being unable
tvAm-eva deva
Thee alone O Lord!
hRRidaye sudRRiDhaM vibhAvya
in heart firmly meditating
dehaM vidhUya
body giving up
para-chit-sukha-
the Supreme conscious bliss
rUpam-ekaM tvAm-
form of non-dual, in Thee
Avishan
merging
param-imA:-nanu
very much these (women) indeed
dhanya-dhanyA:
(were) most fortunate

Some of them were indeed unable to come out from home. O Lord! They meditated on Thee firmly in their hearts. With the result, they gave up their bodies and merged with Thy non dual form and attained the Supreme consciousness bliss. These indeed were the most fortunate ones.
---------
jArAtmanA na paramAtmatayA smarantyo
nAryo gatA: paramahaMsagatiM kShaNena |
taM tvAM prakAshaparamAtmatanuM katha~nchi-
chchitte vahannamRRitamashramamashnuvIya ||8||

jArAtmanA
by the feeling of paramour
na paramAtmatayA
not by the feeling of godliness
smarantya:
thinking of Thee
nArya: gatA:
the women attained
paramahaMsagatiM
to the state of liberation
kShaNena taM tvAM
in a moment, that Thou
prakAsha-paramAtma-tanuM
resplendent supreme form
katha~nchit-
in any manner
chitte vahan-
in the mind holding (meditating)
amRRitam-
the state of immortality
ashramam-ashnuvIya
effortlessly may I attain
---------
These women thought of Thee and remembered Thee not with the feeling of godliness, Paramaatmaa, but with the feeling of paramour. In a moment, they attained the state of liberation with Thee. O Supreme Resplendent form! Meditating in the mind in some or the other manner may I attain the state of immortality effortlessly.

abhyAgatAbhirabhito vrajasundarIbhi-
rmugdhasmitArdravadana: karuNAvalokI |
nissImakAntijaladhistvamavekShyamANo
vishvaikahRRidya hara me pavanesha rogAn ||9||
---------
abhyAgatAbhi:-
by those who had come
abhita:
all around
vrajasundarIbhi:-
(by) the beautiful women fo Vraja
mugdha-smita-Ardra-vadana:
(with) a captivating smile lit on the face
karuNA-avalokI
(Thou) glancing with compassion
nissIma-kAnti-
unbound splendorous
jaladhi:-tvam-
ocean Thou
avekShyamANa:
were looked at (by the women)
vishvaikahRRidya
O Stealer of the world's heart!
hara me
rid me of my
pavanesha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
rogAn
ailments

The beautiful women of Vraja, who had come and gathered all around Thee, were looking at Thee. Thou had a captivating smile lighting Thy face, glancing with compassion, and Thou who are like an unbound ocean of splendour, O Hari! The stealer of the world's heart! rid me, O Lord of Guruvaayur! of my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D066

Dashaka 66
---------
upayAtAnAM sudRRishAM kusumAyudhabANapAtavivashAnAm |
abhivA~nChitaM vidhAtuM kRRitamatirapi tA jagAtha vAmamiva ||1||
---------
upayAtAnAM
who had come
sudRRishAM
the beautiful women
kusumAyudha-
(whom) Cupid's
bANa-pAta-
arrows strike
vivashAnAm
(had made) helpless
abhivA~nChitaM
desire
vidhAtuM
to fulfil
kRRitamati:-api
having decided though
tA: jagAtha
to them spoke
vAmam-iva
unfavourable like

Thou had decided to fulfil the desire of the beautiful women who had come to Thee. They were helpless as they were struck by Cupid's arrow for Thee. Yet Thou first spoke to them in an unfavourable manner.
---------
gaganagataM muninivahaM shrAvayituM jagitha kulavadhUdharmam |
dharmyaM khalu te vachanaM karma tu no nirmalasya vishvAsyam ||2||

gagana-gataM
waiting in the skies
muni-nivahaM
the host of sages
shrAvayituM
to make them hear
jagitha
(Thou) stated
kula-vadhU-dharmam
the housewives' duties
dharmyam khalu
in accordance of Dharma indeed
te vachanaM
Thy words
karma tu no
actions but not
nirmalasya
of Thee who are pure
vishvAsyam
(are) to be followed
---------
To the hearing of the sages assembled in the skies, Thou stated the duties of the housewives, for the benefit of the world. Indeed, Thy words are to be followed for they are in accordance with the Dharma. But the actions of Thee who are ever pure, should not be practiced by others, because Thy actions do not always conform to the good and bad standards of the world.

AkarNya te pratIpAM vANImeNIdRRisha: paraM dInA: |
mA mA karuNAsindho parityajetyatichiraM vilepustA: ||3||
---------
AkarNya te
hearing Thy
pratIpAM vANIm-
unfavourable speech
eNIdRRisha:
the doe eyed damsels
paraM dInA:
very much grief stricken
mA mA
do not O do not
karuNAsindho
O Thou ocean of compassion
parityaja-iti-
forsake thus
achiraM
for long
vilepu:-tA:
pleaded they

On hearing Thy unfavourable speech, those doe eyed women were very much grief stricken. For long did they plead saying 'O Thou ocean of compassion, do not, O do not forsake us.'
---------
tAsAM ruditairlapitai: karuNAkulamAnaso murAre tvam |
tAbhissamaM pravRRitto yamunApulineShu kAmamabhirantum ||4||

tAsAM ruditai:-
by their weeping
lapitai:
(and) pleading
karuNA-Akula-
with pity moved
mAnasa:
Thy mind
murAre tvam
O Slayer of Mur! Thou
tAbhi:-samam
with them
pravRRitta:
set out
yamunA-pulineShu
on the Yamunaa sand banks
kAmam-abhirantum
desiring to sport freely
---------
O Thou! Slayer of Mura! Moved with pity by their weeping and pleading, Thou set out to sport freely with them on the sand banks of Yamunaa river.

chandrakarasyandalasatsundarayamunAtaTAntavIthIShu |
gopIjanottarIyairApAditasaMstaro nyaShIdastvam ||5||
---------
chandrakara-
the moon light
syanda-lasat-
flowing and shining
sundara-
beautifully
yamunA-taTAnta-
on the Yamunaa banks
vIthIShu
and the sand banks
gopIjana-
the Gopikaas
uttarIyai:-
(by their) upper garment
ApAdita-saMstara:
spread out bed
nyaShIda:-tvam
sat down Thou

The sand banks of Yamunaa was lit by beautifully flowing and shining moon light. There Thou sat down on the bed which was made by the Gopikaas by spreading out their upper garment.
---------
sumadhuranarmAlapanai: karasaMgrahaNaishcha chumbanollAsai: |
gADhAli~Nganasa~Ngaistvama~NganAlokamAkulIchakRRiShe ||6||

sumadhur-
(with) sweet
narma-Alapanai:
playful talks
kara-saMgrahaNai:-cha
and by hands holding
chumbana-ullAsai:
and by the joy of kisses
gADha-Ali~Ngana-sa~Ngai:-
and by close hearty embraces
tvam-
Thou
a~NganA-lokam-
the women folk
AkulI-chakRRiShe
delighted immensely
---------
By Thy sweet and playful talks, by holding of hands, by the joy of kisses, and by close hearty embraces, Thou delighted the women folk immensely.

vAsoharaNadine yadvAsoharaNaM pratishrutaM tAsAm |
tadapi vibho rasavivashasvAntAnAM kAnta subhruvAmadadhA: ||7||
---------
vAso-haraNa-dine
on the day when the clothes were stolen
yat-vAso-haraNam
that stealing of clothes
pratishrutaM tAsAm
was promised to them (to the gopis)
tat-api vibho
that also O Lord!
rasa-vivasha-svAntAnAM
to bliss overcome minds
kAnta
O Charming One!
subhruvAm-
(to them) the beautiful eyed ones
adadhA:
Thou gave (the promise)

On the day of the stealing of clothes, O Lord! Thou had promised to them the stealing of clothes (the removal of the sense of ego). That also, O charming One! Thou gave to the beautiful eyed women, whose minds were overcome with bliss.
---------
kandalitagharmaleshaM kundamRRidusmeravaktrapAthojam |
nandasuta tvAM trijagatsundaramupagUhya nanditA bAlA: ||8||

kandalita-
sprouting of
gharma-leshaM
perspiration drops(and with)
kunda-mRRidu-smera-
jasmine like soft smile
vaktra-pAthojam
and face like a lotus
nandasuta tvAM
O Thee the son of Nanda
trijagat-sundaram-
the most resplendent one in the worlds
upagUhya
embracing
nanditA: bAlA:
were very delighted, the damsels
---------
O Son of Nanda! The most resplendent one in the three worlds! Perspiration drops sprouted on Thy body. Thy lotus face was soft with a jasmine like smile. The damsels embracing Thee were very delighted.

viraheShva~NgAramaya: shRRi~NgAramayashcha sa~Ngame hi tvam nitarAma~NgAramayastatra punassa~Ngame.api chitramidam ||9||
---------
viraheShu-
in separation
a~NgAramaya:
(Thou) are like burning charcoal
shRRi~NgAramaya:-cha
(and) love embodied
sa~Ngame
in union
hi tvam
indeed are Thou
nitarAm-
absolutely
a~Nga-aramaya:
O Dear One! (Thou) gave delight
tatra puna:-
there again
sa~Ngame-api
in union also
chitram-idam
wonderful it is

In separation with Thee, Thou are unbearable as a burning charcoal. In union indeed Thou are an absolute embodiment of love. O Dear One! Wonderful it indeed is that in union also, here again the women were delighted.
---------
rAdhAtu~NgapayodharasAdhuparIrambhalolupAtmAnam |
ArAdhaye bhavantaM pavanapurAdhIsha shamaya sakalagadAn ||10||

rAdhA-tu~Nga-payodhara-
Raadhaa's bulging breasts
sAdhu-parIrambha-
nicely (to) embrace
lolupa-AtmAnam
eager with a mind
ArAdhaye bhavantaM
(I) worship Thee
pavanapurAdhIsha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
shamaya sakala-gadAn
eradicate all the ailments.
---------
O Lord of Guruvaayur! I worship Thee who are eager in mind to nicely embrace the bulging breasts of Raadhaa. I pray to Thee to eradicate all the ailments.

Narayaneeyam D067

Dashaka 67
---------
sphuratparAnandarasAtmakena tvayA samAsAditabhogalIlA: |
asImamAnandabharaM prapannA mahAntamApurmadamambujAkShya: ||1||
---------
sphurat-parAnanda-
resplendent of the supreme bliss
rasAtmakena
and the pure Essence embodied
tvayA
with Thee (who were)
samAsAdita-
made to participate
bhogalIlA:
in the pleasant sport
asImam-
(in) boundless
AnandabharaM
bliss (being)
prapannA mahAntam-
immersed (they), great
Apu:-madam-
acquired pride
ambuja-AkShya:
the lotus eyed (damsels)

The lotus eyed damsels were allowed to participate in the pleasant sport with Thee, the very pure embodied essence of the resplendent supreme bliss. They were immersed in boundless bliss and so they fell victim to great pride and self importance.
---------
nilIyate.asau mayi mayyamAyaM ramApatirvishvamanobhirAma: |
iti sma sarvA: kalitAbhimAnA nirIkShya govind tirohito.abhU: ||2||

nilIyate-
is engrossed
asau mayi
this (Krishna) in me
mayi-amAyaM
in me, without doubt
ramApati:-
the Consort of Laxmi,
vishva-manobhirAma:
the captivator of the entire universe's mind
iti sma sarvA:
thus indeed all of them
kalitA-abhimAnA:
full of pride
nirIkShya
seeing (them thus)
govind
O Govind!
tirohita:-abhU:
(Thou) disappeared
---------
This Krishna the Consort of Laxmi and the captivator of the minds of the whole world, is engrossed in me.' Full of pride, all of them indeed thought thus. O Govinda! Being aware of this, Thou disappeared from their midst.

rAdhAbhidhAM tAvadajAtagarvAmatipriyAM gopavadhUM murAre |
bhavAnupAdAya gato vidUraM tayA saha svairavihArakArI ||3||
---------
rAdhA-abhidhAM
Raadhaa named
tAvat
till then
ajAta-garvAm-
(who) did not rear pride
ati-priyAM
very dear
gopavadhUm
the Gopikaa
murAre
O Slayer of Mura!
bhavAn-upAdAya
Thou taking her along
gata: vidUraM
went far away
tayA saha
with her
svaira-vihAra-kArI
at will sporting (with her)

O Slayer of Mura! One of the Gopikaas, Raadhaa by name, till then had reared no pride. Thou took her along with Thee far away and sported with her at will.
---------
tirohite.atha tvayi jAtatApA: samaM sametA: kamalAyatAkShya: |
vane vane tvAM parimArgayantyo viShAdamApurbhagavannapAram ||4||

tirohite-
disappeared
atha tvayi
then (when) Thou
jAta-tApA:
full of suffering
samaM sametA:
together coming
kamalAyata-AkShya:
the lotus eyed ones
vane vane tvAM
in the various forests, Thee
parimArgayantya:
looking for
viShAdam-Apu:-
great grief felt
bhagavan-
O Lord!
apAram
intense
---------
O Lord! When Thou disappeared, the lotus eyed damsels, full of suffering the pangs of separation gathered together, looking around for Thee in the various forests from place to place in intense and utmost grief.

hA chUta hA champaka karNikAra hA mallike mAlati bAlavalya: |
kiM vIkShito no hRRidayaikachora: ityAdi tAstvatpravaNA vilepu: ||5||
---------
hA chUta
O mango
hA champaka
O champaka
karNikAra
Karnikaara
hA mallike
O Mallika
mAlati
Maalati
bAlavalya:
O tender creepers
kiM vIkShita:
what has been seen (by you all)
na:-hRRidaya-eka-chora:
our hearts' the one stealer
iti-Adi tA:-
thus etc they
tvat-pravaNA:
to Thee totally devoted
vilepu:
lamented

" O mango, O champaka, O Karnikaar, O Mallika, O maalati, O tender creepers! Did you see the one who has stolen our hearts?' Thus the totally devoted ones asked the fruit and flower trees and lamented.
---------
nirIkShito.ayaM sakhi pa~NkajAkSha: puro mametyAkulamAlapantI |
tvAM bhAvanAchakShuShi vIkShya kAchittApaM sakhInAM dviguNIchakAra ||6||

nirIkShita:-
is seen
ayaM sakhi
this, O friend
pa~NkajAkSha:
lotus eyed one (Krishna)
pura: mama-iti-
in front of me, thus
Akulam-
excitedly
AlapantI
saying
tvAM
Thee
bhAvanA-chakShuShi
(in) imaginative vision (eyes)
vIkShya kAchit
seeing, some (women)
tApaM sakhInAM
sufferings of the friends
dviguNI-chakAra
double made
---------
O Friend! This lotus eyed Krishna, I see before me,' excitedly declared one of the Gopikas, seeing Thee with her imaginative vision. This only doubled the sufferings of her friends.

tvadAtmikAstA yamunAtaTAnte tavAnuchakru: kila cheShTitAni |
vichitya bhUyo.api tathaiva mAnAttvayA vimuktAM dadRRishushcha rAdhAm ||7||
---------
tvat-AtmikA:-tA
with Thee identified, they
yamunA-taTa-ante
on the banks of the Yamunaa
tava-anuchakru:
Thy imitated
kila cheShTitAni
indeed (Thy) deeds
vichitya
searching
bhUya:-api
all over again
tathA-eva mAnAt-
and also because of pride
tvayA vimuktAM
from Thee separated
dadRRishu:-cha
(they) saw and
rAdhAm
Raadhaa

They had completely identified themselves with Thee. So, on the banks of the Yamunaa river they enacted and imitated Thy deeds. They went about searching for Thee all over again and they saw Raadhaa who was also separated from Thee because of pride.
---------
tata: samaM tA vipine samantAttamovatArAvadhi mArgayantya: |
punarvimishrA yamunAtaTAnte bhRRishaM vilepushcha jagurguNAMste ||8||

tata: samaM tA:
then together all of them
vipine samantAt-
in the forest from end to end
tamovatAra-avadhi
till the darkness descending
mArgayantya:
searching
puna:-vimishrA
again coming together
yamunA-taTa-ante
on the banks of the Yamunaa
bhRRishaM vilepu:-
intensely lamented
cha jagu:-
and sang
guNAn-te
Thy glories
---------
Together all of them went searching for Thee from end to end in the forest till it was dark. Again coming together on the banks of Yamunaa, they intensely lamented and spoke to each other about Thy glories and excellences.

tathA vyathAsa~NkulamAnasAnAM vrajA~NganAnAM karuNaikasindho |
jagattrayImohanamohanAtmA tvaM prAdurAsIrayi mandahAsI ||9||
---------
tathA vyathA-sa~Nkula-
thus pain overcome
mAnasAnAm
minded
vrajA~NganAnAm
of the Vraja women
karuNaikasindho
O Thou the ocean of mercy!
jagat-trayI-mohana-
the infatuator of the three world's Cupid
mohana-AtmA
(Thee) his captivator
tvaM
Thee
prAdu:-AsI:-
appeared in front
ayi
O Thou
mandahAsI
smiling softly

O ocean of mercy! O charmer of Cupid who charms the three worlds! Thou then appeared smiling softly in front of the Vraja women whose minds were overcome by grief and pain.
---------
sandigdhasandarshanamAtmakAntaM tvAM vIkShya tanvya: sahasA tadAnIm |
kiM kiM na chakru: pramadAtibhArAt sa tvaM gadAt pAlaya mArutesha ||10||

sandigdha-
doubtful of
sandarshanam-
seeing (meeting) Thee
Atma-kAntam
their own beloved
tvAM vIkShya
Thee seeing
tanvya: sahasA
the damsels suddenly
tadAnIm
then
kim kim
what what
na chakru:
not did
pramada-ati-bhArAt
by intense joyful state
sa tvam
that such Thou
gadAt pAlaya
from misery save me
mArutesha
O Lord of Guruvaayur
---------
The beautiful women who were doubtful of seeing Thee, when they suddenly saw their own beloved in front, in what all ways did they not show their intensity of joy? That Thou O Lord of Guruvaayur! Save me from misery.

Narayaneeyam D068

Dashaka 68
---------
tava vilokanAdgopikAjanA: pramadasa~NkulA: pa~NkajekShaNa |
amRRitadhArayA saMplutA iva stimitatAM dadhustvatpurogatA: ||1||
---------
tava vilokanAt-
( with) Thy vision (by seeing)
gopikA-janA:
the Gopikaas
pramada-sa~NkulA:
with joy overcome
pa~NkajekShaNa
O Lotus eyed One!
amRRita-dhArayA
by the immortal bliss downpour
saMplutA iva
drenched as if
stimitatAM
motionless
dadhu:-
attained
tvat-puro-gatA:
by Thy in front coming

O Lotus eyed One! As the Gopikaas saw Thee and approached Thee, they were overcome with joy. They stood stupefied and motionless as if drenched in a downpour of Immortal Bliss, seeing Thee in front of them.
---------
tadanu kAchana tvatkarAmbujaM sapadi gRRihNatI nirvisha~Nkitam |
ghanapayodhare sannidhAya sA pulakasaMvRRitA tasthuShI chiram ||2||

tadanu kAchana
after that, one woman
tvat-karAmbujam
Thy lotus hand
sapadi gRRihNatI
suddenly holding
nirvisha~Nkitam
without hesitation
ghana-payodhare
on (her) heavy breasts
sannidhAya sA
placing she
pulaka-saMvRRitA
with horripilation all around
tasthuShI chiram
stood for long
---------
After that, one woman, suddenly took hold of Thy lotus hand and without hesitation placed it on her heavy breasts. She stood like that for a long time with all her hair standing on end.

tava vibho.aparA komalaM bhujaM nijagalAntare paryaveShTayat |
galasamudgataM prANamArutaM pratinirundhatIvAtiharShulA ||3||
---------
tava vibho-
Thy O Lord!
aparA
another woman
komalaM bhujaM
Thy tender arms
nija-gala-antare
her own neck around
paryaveShTayat
wound
gala-samudgataM
coming out of the throat
prANa-mArutaM
the vital breath
pratinirundhati-
stopping
iva-ati-harShulA
as if, extremely overjoyed

Another woman extremely overjoyed, O Lord! Wound Thy tender arms around her own neck, as if stopping the vital breath coming out of her throat.
---------
apagatatrapA kApi kAminI tava mukhAmbujAt pUgacharvitam |
pratigRRihayya tadvaktrapa~Nkaje nidadhatI gatA pUrNakAmatAm ||4||

apagata-trapA
devoid of shame
kApi kAminI
some one woman
tava
Thy
mukha-ambujAt
from the lotus like mouth
pUga-charvitam
betel chewed
pratigRRihayya
taking
tat-vaktra-pa~Nkaje
(in) her lotus like mouth
nidadhatI gatA
putting, attained
pUrNa-kAmatAm
fulfillment of all desires
---------
One woman, devoid of all shame, from Thy lotus like mouth, taking the chewed betel, put it into her lotus like mouth. Doing so she attained the summit of fulfillment of all desires.

vikaruNo vane saMvihAya mAmapagato.asi kA tvAmiha spRRishet |
iti saroShayA tAvadekayA sajalalochanaM vIkShito bhavAn ||5||
---------
vikaruNa:
without any pity
vane saMvihAya mAm-
in the forest leaving me
apagata:-asi
having gone away
kA tvAm-iha
which one (of us), Thee here
spRRishet iti
will touch, thus (saying)
saroShayA tAvat-
resentfully then
ekayA
by one (woman)
sajala-lochanam
with tearful eyes
vIkShita: bhavAn
were seen Thou

Who ever of us, here, will ever touch Thee who mercilessly abandoned me in the forest.' One of them resentfully said as she looked at Thee with tearful eyes.
---------
iti mudA.a.akulairvallavIjanai: samamupAgato yAmune taTe |
mRRidukuchAmbarai: kalpitAsane ghusRRiNabhAsure paryashobhathA: ||6||

iti mudAkulai:-
thus with them who were overwhelmed with joy
vallavIjanai:
the Gopikaas
samam-upAgata:
with them went to
yAmune taTe
the Yamunaa banks
mRRidu-kucha-ambarai:
with the soft upper garments (scarfs)
kalpita-Asane
prepared seat (on that)
ghusRRiNa-bhAsure
(which was) with saffron tainted
paryashobhathA:
Thou shone
---------
In this manner, Thou went to the banks of the river Yamunaa with the Gopikaas who were overwhelmed with joy. The Gopikaas prepared a seat with their saffron tainted upper clothes, on which Thou sat with all splendour and shining with glory.

katividhA kRRipA ke.api sarvato dhRRitadayodayA: kechidAshrite |
katichidIdRRishA mAdRRisheShvapItyabhihito bhavAn vallavIjanai: ||7||
---------
katividhA kRRipA
of how many varieties is kindness
ke-api sarvata:
some (people have) for all
dhRRita-dayodayA:
having compassion
kechit-Ashrite
some people for (their) dependents
katichit-IdRRishA
some (people) are such (like Thee who)
mA-dRRisheShu-api-
on people like me even (do not have pity)
iti-abhihita:
thus were told
bhavAn
Thou
vallavIjanai:
by the Gopikaas

The Gopikaas told Thee 'There are so many varieties of compassion. Some people have compassion for everyone. Some have compassion for their dependents. Yet, some are such that they do not have compassion even towards those who have given up everything and fully surrendered, like me.'
---------
ayi kumArikA naiva sha~NkyatAM kaThinatA mayi premakAtare |
mayi tu chetaso vo.anuvRRittaye kRRitamidaM mayetyUchivAn bhavAn ||8||

ayi kumArikA
O dear girls!
na-eva sha~NkyatAM
do not certainly doubt
kaThinatA mayi
hard heartedness in me
prema-kAtare
(who is) afraid of losing your love
mayi tu
in me indeed
chetasa: va:-
your minds
anuvRRittaye
may continuously be fixed
kRRitam-idam
this was done
mayA-iti-
by me thus
uchivAn
said
bhavAn
Thou
---------
Thou told them, 'O dear girls! Do not at all suspect me to be hard hearted. I am afraid of losing your love. I did this (the disappearing) so that your minds may be continuously fixed in me.'

ayi nishamyatAM jIvavallabhA: priyatamo jano nedRRisho mama |
tadiha ramyatAM ramyayAminIShvanuparodhamityAlapo vibho ||9||
---------
ayi nishamyatAM
Oh please listen
jIvavallabhA:
most dear ones
priyatama: jana:
more dear person
na-IdRRisha: mama
is not than this (you) mine (for me)
tat-iha ramyatAM
therefore here sport
ramya-yAminIShu-
in the beautiful nights
anuparodham-
without hindrance
iti-Alapa:
thus said Thou
vibho
O Lord!

O most dear Ones! Please listen to me. Take it from me that there is none as dear to me as you. Therefore here on the banks of Yamunaa in the beautiful nights sport with me without any hindrance.' Thus, O Lord! Thou told them.
---------
iti girAdhikaM modamedurairvrajavadhUjanai: sAkamAraman |
kalitakautuko rAsakhelane gurupurIpate pAhi mAM gadAt ||10||

iti girA-
thus by such declaration
adhikaM
even more
moda-medurai:-
filled with intense joy
vraja-vadhUjanai:
the Gopikaas of Vraja
sAkam-Araman
with them sporting
kalita-kautuka:
full of enthusiasm
rAsa-khelane
engaged in Raasa-leelaa
gurupurIpate
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
pAhi mAM gadAt
save me from ailments
---------
Thus with such declaration the Gopikaas were even more full of intense joy. Thou then, sporting with them, full of enthusiasm engaged in Raasaleelaa. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Save me from ailments.

Narayaneeyam D069

Dashaka 69
---------
keshapAshadhRRitapi~nChikAvitatisa~nchalanmakarakuNDalaM
hArajAlavanamAlikAlalitama~NgarAgaghanasaurabham |
pItacheladhRRitakA~nchikA~nchitamuda~nchadaMshumaNinUpuraM
rAsakeliparibhUShitaM tava hi rUpamIsha kalayAmahe ||1||
---------
kesha-pAsha-dhRRita-
the beautiful lock of hair fixed
pi~nChikA-vitati-
by a bunch of peacock feathers
sa~nchalan-
dangling
makara-kuNDalam
fish shaped earrings
hAra-jAla-
many beautiful necklaces and garlands
vana-mAlikA-lalitam-
of flowers adorning (the neck)
a~Nga-rAga-ghana-saurabham
the body smeared with sandal paste and other unguents emitting strong fragrance
pIta-chela
the yellow silk garment
dhRRita-kA~nchikA-a~nchitam-
fastened by the golden girdle adorning (the waist)
uda~nchat-aMshu-
flashing forth rays
maNi-nUpuram
gem studded anklets
rAsa-keli-
the Raas Dance
paribhUShitam
adornments
tava hi
Thy indeed
rUpam-Isha
the lustrous form, O Lord!
kalayAmahe
(we) meditate upon

A bunch of peacock feathers adorning the beautiful locks of hair; a pair of fish shaped earrings dangling from the ears; many necklaces intermingled with flower garlands adorning the neck; a golden girdle fastened to the yellow silk garment adorning the waist; sandal paste and other unguents smeared on the body emitting strong fragrance; gem studded anklets flashing forth a glow; on such a radiant form of Thee, with decorations appropriate for the Raasa, we meditate on.
---------
tAvadeva kRRitamaNDane kalitaka~nchulIkakuchamaNDale
gaNDalolamaNikuNDale yuvatimaNDale.atha parimaNDale |
antarA sakalasundarIyugalamindirAramaNa sa~ncharan
ma~njulAM tadanu rAsakelimayi ka~njanAbha samupAdadhA: ||2||

tAvat-eva
then only
kRRita-maNDane
having done the makeup
kalita-ka~nchulIka-
and put on the bodice
kucha-maNDale
on the breasts
gaNDa-lola
dangling on the cheeks
maNi-kuNDale
the begemmed earrings
yuvati-maNDale-
the group of young women
atha parimaNDale
then forming a circle
antarA
in between
sakala-sundarI-
all the beautiful women
yugalam-
every two of them
indirA-ramaNa
O Thou Consort of Laxmi!
sa~ncharan
moving about
ma~njulAM tadanu
the beautiful, then
rAsakelim-ayi
the Raas Dance O Thou
ka~njanAbha
Padmanaabha
samupAdadhA:
performed
---------
Then only, having done the make up and putting on the bodice on the breasts, and begemmed earrings dangling on the cheeks, the group of young women formed a circle surrounding Thee. O Consort of Laxmi! O Padmanaabha! Thou moved about in between every two of the beautiful women and performed the very beautiful Raas Dance.

vAsudeva tava bhAsamAnamiha rAsakelirasasaurabhaM
dUrato.api khalu nAradAgaditamAkalayya kutukAkulA |
veShabhUShaNavilAsapeshalavilAsinIshatasamAvRRitA
nAkato yugapadAgatA viyati vegato.atha suramaNDalI ||3||
---------
vAsudeva tava
O Vaasudeva Thy
bhAsamAnam-iha
resplendent here
rAsa-keli-rasasaurabham
Raasa Leelaa's resplendent and fragrant beauty
dUrata:-api khalu
from far also indeed
nArada-Agaditam-
as Naarada described
Akalayya
having heard
kutuka-AkulA
(and so) filled with eagerness
veSha-bhUShaNa-vilAsa-peshala-
in dressing up with jewellery and in amorous display, experts
vilAsinI-shata-samAvRRitA
beautiful women in hundreds surrounded
nAkata:
from the heaven
yugapat-AgatA
all together came
viyati vegata:-
to the sky very fast
atha sura-maNDalI
then the gods in groups

O Vaasudeva! Naarada described Thy resplendent, fragrant and beautiful Raas Leelaa. Hearing about it from far, groups of gods, full of eagerness came from the heaven and quickly gathered in the sky. They were accompanied by hundreds of beautiful women who were experts in dressing up and in adorning themselves with jewellery and also in amorous display.
---------
veNunAdakRRitatAnadAnakalagAnarAgagatiyojanA-
lobhanIyamRRidupAdapAtakRRitatAlamelanamanoharam |
pANisaMkvaNitaka~NkaNaM cha muhuraMsalambitakarAmbujaM
shroNibimbachaladambaraM bhajata rAsakelirasaDambaram ||4||

veNu-nAda-
the flute's key note
kRRita-tAna-
setting the tune
dAna-kala-
giving the sweet
gAna-rAga-
song (and) raagas
gati-yojanA-
flow and rhythm
lobhanIya-
the enchanting
mRRidu-pAda-pAta-kRRita-
soft foot beat making
tAla-melana-
(the keeping of) the beats
manoharam
very pleasant
pANi-saMkvaNita-
hands clapping
ka~NkaNam cha
and (mingled with the) sound of bangles
muhu:-aMsa-lambita-
again and again on the shoulders (of the Gopikaas) placed
kara-ambujaM
hands like lotuses
shroNi-bimba-
on the waist
chalat-ambaram
fluttering of clothing
bhajata rAsakeli-
meditate on the Raas Dance
rasa-Dambaram
(with its) enthralling majesty
---------
The key notes of the flute set the tune giving the sweet song and the raagas a flow and rhythm. The soft beat of the feet of the dancers kept time with the very pleasant beats of the music. The clapping of the hands mingled with the tingling sound of the bangles. During the dance, time and again Thou placed Thy lotus hands on the shoulders of the Gopikaas. As they danced about, the clothings on their waists fluttered. On such enthralling majesty of the Raas Dance let us meditate.

spardhayA virachitAnugAnakRRitatAratAramadhurasvare
nartane.atha lalitA~NgahAralulitA~NgahAramaNibhUShaNe |
sammadena kRRitapuShpavarShamalamunmiShaddiviShadAM kulaM
chinmaye tvayi nilIyamAnamiva sammumoha savadhUkulam ||5||
---------
spardhayA virachita-
(as if )in competition performing
anugAna-kRRita-
the singing one after the other (and) producing
tAra-tAra-
very loud
madhura-svare
beautiful strains
nartane-atha
(and) while dancing, then
lalita-a~Nga-hAra-
the beautiful limbs captivatingly (moving)
lulita-a~Nga-hAra-
displacing on the neck and body the necklaces
maNi-bhUShaNe
and begemmed ornaments
sammadena
with extreme joy
kRRita-puShpa-varSham-
doing flower showering
alam-unmiShat-
not batting the eyes
diviShadAM kulaM
the gods in groups
chinmaye tvayi
in the Pure Consciousness, i.e., in Thee
nilIyamAnam-iva
completely submerged as if
sammumoha
and were entranced
savadhUkulam
along with their women-folk

As though in competition, the singers raised their voices in successive strains as the musical notes reached higher in pitch. The beautiful limbs of the dancers moved delightfully displacing their necklaces and the begemmed ornaments on their body. The groups of gods watched with extreme joy and showered rains of flowers. Along with their women-folk they watched entranced completely submerged in the Pure Consciousness i.e. in Thee.
---------
svinnasannatanuvallarI tadanu kApi nAma pashupA~NganA
kAntamaMsamavalambate sma tava tAntibhAramukulekShaNA ||
kAchidAchalitakuntalA navapaTIrasAraghanasaurabhaM
va~nchanena tava sa~nchuchumba bhujama~nchitorupulakA~NkurA ||6||

svinna-sanna-
sweating (and) tired
tanu-vallarI
with a body like a creeper
tadanu kApi nAma
there after some(one) indeed
pashupA~NganA
Gopikaa
kAntam-aMsam-
on the beautiful shoulders (of Thee)
avalambate sma
supported herself
tava tAnti-bhAra-
of Thee, (because of) the exhaustion weight
mukula-IkShaNA
(making) half closed (her) eyes
kAchit-
another woman
Achalita-kuntalA
with dishevelled hair
nava-paTIra-sAra-ghana-saurabham
the fresh sandal paste's intense fragrance
va~nchanena tava
slyly ( to smell) on Thy (arm)
sa~nchuchumba bhujam-
kissed the arm
a~nchita-uru-
sprouting big
pulaka-a~NkurA
ecstatic horripilation
---------
One Gopikaa, slender and delicate like a creeper, tired and sweating, with drooping eyes out of fatigue, supported herself on Thy beautiful shoulder. Another woman with dishevelled hair, to smell the fragrance of the fresh sandal paste on Thy arm, slyly kissed Thy arm, having horripilation over her body in the process.

kApi gaNDabhuvi sannidhAya nijagaNDamAkulitakuNDalaM
puNyapUranidhiranvavApa tava pUgacharvitarasAmRRitam |
indirAvihRRitimandiraM bhuvanasundaraM hi naTanAntare
tvAmavApya dadhura~NganA: kimu na sammadonmadadashAntaram ||7||
---------
kApi gaNDabhuvi
another one on the cheek area (of Thee)
sannidhAya nija gaNDam-
placing her own cheek
Akulita-kuNDalam-
(with) dangling earrings
puNya-pUra nidhi:-
(she who was) of merits a full repository
anvavApa
intook
tava-pUga-charvita-
Thy betel chewed
rasa-amRRitam
juice nectar like
indirA-vihRRiti-mandiram
Laxmi's sporting field
bhuvana-sundaram
the most beautiful in all the worlds
hi naTana-antare
indeed during the dance
tvAm-avApya
Thee achieving
dadhu:-a~NganA:
attained the Gopikaas
kimu na sammada-
what not joyous
unmada-dashAntaram
intoxication states

Another one, who was a repository of merits, placed her own cheek on Thy cheek, with earrings dangling on them. She enjoyed the thrill as she intook the nectar like juice from the betel chewed by Thee. The Gopikaas, during the dance, having achieved Laxmi's sport field, Thee, the most beautiful in all the worlds, what states of joyous intoxication did they not attain?
---------
gAnamIsha virataM krameNa kila vAdyamelanamupArataM
brahmasammadarasAkulA: sadasi kevalaM nanRRitura~NganA: |
nAvidannapi cha nIvikAM kimapi kuntalImapi cha ka~nchulIM
jyotiShAmapi kadambakaM divi vilambitaM kimaparaM bruve ||8||

gAnam-Isha
the song O Lord
virataM krameNa
stopped gradually
kila vAdya-melanam-
indeed the musical instruments
upArataM
ceased
brahma-sammada-
(in) the Brahmic bliss
rasa-AkulA:
(and) joy deeply immersed
sadasi kevalaM
in a circle only
nanRRitu:-a~NganA:
kept dancing the women
na-avidan-api cha
and not knowing also
nIvikAM kimapi
of the knot of the string (loosening) anything also
kuntalIm-api
of the hair (dishevelled)
cha ka~nchulIm
and of the bodice
jyotiShAm-api
of the stars also
kadambakaM
in their courses
divi vilambitaM
in the sky stood still
kim-aparaM bruve
what more than this should I say
---------
O Lord! The singing stopped gradually and the musical instruments also ceased. But immersed deeply in the joy of Brahmic Bliss the women kept dancing in a circle. They were not even aware of the knot of clothing strings loosening or of their bodice having slipped or of their hair being dishevelled. The stars in the sky stood still in their courses, to enjoy all this. What more can I say?

modasImni bhuvanaM vilApya vihRRitiM samApya cha tato vibho
kelisammRRiditanirmalA~NganavagharmaleshasubhagAtmanAm |
manmathAsahanachetasAM pashupayoShitAM sukRRitachodita-
stAvadAkalitamUrtirAdadhitha mAravIraparamotsavAn ||9||
---------
modasImni
in the highest bliss
bhuvanaM vilApya
the world engulfing
vihRRitiM samApya cha
and the sport (dance) ending
tata: vibho
then O Lord!
keli-sammRRidita-
the sport pressing (exerting)
nirmala-a~Nga-
the clean limbs
nava-gharma-lesha-
fresh perspiration drops
subhaga-AtmanAm
on the beautiful bodied women
manmatha-asahana-
the Cupid's shafts not being able to bear
chetasAM
(with) such minds
paShupa-yoShitAM
of the cowherd women
sukRRita-chodita:-
prompted by their meritorious deeds
tAvat-Akalita-mUrti:-
then assuming forms
adadhitha
(Thou) performed
mAravIra-parama-
an amorously great
utsavAn
festivity

The world was engulfed in the highest bliss as the Raas Dance ended. The pure bodies of these women glowed with fresh perspiration drops caused by the dance, and who were unable to bear the shafts of Cupid any longer. O Lord! Prompted by the meritorious deeds of the Gopikaas, Thou assumed as many forms as they were in number and performed an amorously great festivity.
---------
kelibhedaparilolitAbhiratilAlitAbhirabalAlibhi:
svairamIsha nanu sUrajApayasi chArunAma vihRRitiM vyadhA: |
kAnane.api cha visArishItalakishoramArutamanohare
sUnasaurabhamaye vilesitha vilAsinIshatavimohanam ||10||

keli-bheda-
by sports varied
parilolitAbhi:-
(who were) exhausted
ati-lAlitAbhi:-
(and were) fondly caressed
abalAlibhi:
with those women
svairam-Isha
at will O Lord!
nanu sUrajA-payasi
indeed (Thou) in the Yamunaa waters
chAru-nAm
beautifully indeed
vihRRitiM vyadhA:
sports performed
kAnane-api cha
(and) in the forests also and
visAri-shItala-
(where) spreading cool,
kishora-mAruta-
gentle breeze
manohare
(was) enchanting
sUna-saurabhamaye
(filled with) the flower fragrance
vilesitha
(Thou) went around
vilAsinI-shata-
(with) the women in large numbers
vimohanam
dazing them
---------
O Lord! The women were exhausted by the varied sports and were fondly caressed. Thou performed sports with them at will in the waters of Yamunaa.Thou also went around in the forests where a cool gentle breeze was blowing filled with the fragrance of flowers, which dazed the large number of women with ecstatic joy.

kAminIriti hi yAminIShu khalu kAmanIyakanidhe bhavAn
pUrNasammadarasArNavaM kamapi yogigamyamanubhAvayan |
brahmasha~NkaramukhAnapIha pashupA~NganAsu bahumAnayan
bhaktalokagamanIyarUpa kamanIya kRRiShNa paripAhi mAm ||11||
---------
kAminI:-iti hi
the women in this manner
yAminIShu khalu
in the nights indeed
kAmanIyakanidhe
O repository of all virtues!
bhavAn
Thou
pUrNa-sammada-
the immense bliss
rasa-arNavaM
nectar ocean
kamapi
who so ever
yogi-gamyam-
yogi (may) attain
anubhAvayan
making (them, the women) experience
brahma-sha~Nkara-mukhAn-
in Brahmaa Shiva and other gods
api-ih
even, here
pashupa-a~NganAsu
in (these) Gopikaas
bahumAnayan
placing respect
bhakta-loka-
to the devout people
gamanIya-rUpa
attainable, of such nature
kamanIya kRRiShNa
O Attractive One! O Krishna!
paripAhi mAm
protect me

O Repository of all virtues! In this manner, Thou made the women experience the immense bliss of the nectar ocean in the nights. Such an experience only yogis may attain. This created in Brahma Shiva and other gods a feeling of respect for the Gopikaas. O Thou attainable to the devout people, of such a nature, O Attractive One! O Krishna! protect me.

Narayaneeyam D070

Dashaka 70
---------
iti tvayi rasAkulaM ramitavallabhe vallavA:
kadApi puramambikAmiturambikAkAnane |
sametya bhavatA samaM nishi niShevya divyotsavaM
sukhaM suShupuragrasIdvrajapamugranAgastadA ||1||
---------
iti tvayi
in this manner (when) Thou
rasa-AkulaM
in bliss immersed
ramita-vallabhe
were entertaining the Gopikaas
vallavA: kadApi
(at that time) the Gopas once
puram-ambikA-kamitu:-
(to) the temple of Ambikaa's husband (Shiva)
ambikA-kAnane
in the Ambika (named) forest
sametya bhavatA samaM
going along with Thee
nishi niShevya
in the night having performed
divya-utsavaM
the divine festival
sukhaM suShupu:-
happily slept
agrasIt-vrajapam-
swallowed Nanda Gopa
ugranAga:-tadA
a fierce snake then

In this manner, as Thou were entertaining the Gopikaas and they were immersed in bliss, the Gopas went to the temple of Lord Shiva, Ambikaa's (Paarvati's) husband. Thou went along with them to the temple which was in the forest named Ambikaa. After the divine festival had been performed, they all slept happily in the night. Then a fierce snake swallowed Nanda Gopa.
---------
samunmukhamatholmukairabhihate.api tasmin balA-
damu~nchati bhavatpade nyapati pAhi pAhIti tai: |
tadA khalu padA bhavAn samupagamya pasparsha taM
babhau sa cha nijAM tanuM samupasAdya vaidyadharIm ||2||

samunmukham-
who was looking up
atha-ulmukai:-
then with burning logs of wood
abhihate-api-tasmin
being thrashed even, he
balAt-amu~nchati
from his hold did not release
bhavat-pade nyapati
on Thy feet fell (the Gopas)
pAhi pAhi-iti tai:
save save, thus by them (was said)
tadA khalu
then indeed
padA bhavAn
by foot Thou
samupagamya
going near
pasparsha taM
touched him
babhau sa cha
became he and
nijAM tanuM
his own body
samupasAdya
attaining
vaidyadharIm
Vidyaadharee (form)
---------
The fierce snake was looking up. In spite of being thrashed with burning logs of wood, it did not loose hold of his prey. The Gopas fell on Thy feet and prayed for protection. Then indeed Thou went near and touched him with Thy foot, and he became his own body and attained the former form of Vidyaadharee.

sudarshanadhara prabho nanu sudarshanAkhyo.asmyahaM
munIn kvachidapAhasaM ta iha mAM vyadhurvAhasam |
bhavatpadasamarpaNAdamalatAM gato.asmItyasau
stuvan nijapadaM yayau vrajapadaM cha gopA mudA ||3||
---------
sudarshanadhara prabho
Wielder of Sudarshana, O Lord!
nanu sudarshana-Akhya:-
indeed Sudarshana named
asmi-ahaM
am I
munIn kvachit-
the sages once
apAhasaM
(I) ridiculed
te-iha mAM
they here me
vyadhu:-vAhasam
made a python
bhavat-pada-
Thy feet
samarpaNAt-
by contact
amalatAM gata:-asmi
purification reached (have) I
iti-asau stuvan
thus he praising
nijapadaM yayau
(to) his own abode went
vrajapadaM cha
and to Vraja
gopA mudA
the Gopas (went) happily

O Lord! Wielder of Sudarshana! I am Sudarshana by name. Having sinned the sages for ridiculing them, they cursed me to remain here as a python. I have reached purification by the touch of Thy feet.' Thus praising Thee, he went back to his abode, while the Gopas also happily returned to Vraja.
---------
kadApi khalu sIriNA viharati tvayi strIjanai-
rjahAra dhanadAnuga: sa kila sha~NkhachUDo.abalA: |
atidrutamanudrutastamatha muktanArIjanaM
rurojitha shiromaNiM halabhRRite cha tasyAdadA: ||4||

kadApi khalu
once indeed
sIriNA viharati
with Balaraam strolling about
tvayi strIjanai:-
when Thou were (and) with the women folk
jahAra dhanada-anuga:
kidnapped, Kuber's emissary
sa kila
he indeed
sha~NkhachUDa:-
Shankhachooda
abalA:
the women
atidrutam-
very hastily
anudruta:-tam-atha
(Thou) pursuing him, then
mukta-nArI-janam
releasing the women folk
rurojitha
(Thou) killed him
shiromaNim
(and) the crest pearl
halabhRRite cha
to Balaraam and
tasya-adadA:
his (Shankhacooda's) gave
---------
Once indeed in Balaraam's company and with the women folk Thou were strolling about. Shankhachooda, an emissary of Kubera, kidnapped the women. Thou hastily pursued him and killed him and liberated the women. Thou gave the crest pearl of Shankhachooda to Thy brother Balaraam.

dineShu cha suhRRijjanaissaha vaneShu lIlAparaM
manobhavamanoharaM rasitaveNunAdAmRRitam |
bhavantamamarIdRRishAmamRRitapAraNAdAyinaM
vichintya kimu nAlapan virahatApitA gopikA: ||5||
---------
dineShu cha
and all during the day
suhRRit-janai:-saha
with the friends
vaneShu lIlAparaM
in the forest engaged in play
manobhava-manoharaM
enchanting Cupid
rasita-veNu-
lusciously, the flute's
nAda-amRRitam
notes flowing like nectar
bhavantam-
Thee
amarI-dRRishAm-
to the celestial damsels' sight
amRRita-pAraNA-dAyinaM
nectar drink giving
vichintya
thinking about (all this)
kimu na-Alapan
what all did not lament
viraha-tApitA
separation pangs suffering
gopikA:
the Gopikaas

During the day Thou were engaged in play with friends in the forest. Enchanting even Cupid, Thou played the flute with luscious notes flowing like nectar. Thy sight was like a drink of nectar to the eyes of the celestial damsels. Thinking about all this the Gopikaas suffered pangs of separation and what all lamentations did they not give in to.
---------
bhojarAjabhRRitakastvatha kashchit kaShTaduShTapathadRRiShTirariShTa: |
niShThurAkRRitirapaShThuninAdastiShThate sma bhavate vRRiSharUpI ||6||

bhojarAja-bhRRitaka:-
Kamsaa's emissary
tu-atha kashchit
then some one
kaShTa-duShTa-
cruel and evil
patha-dRRiShTi:-ariShTa:
ways looking for, (named) Arishta
niShThura-AkRRiti:-
terrific in appearance
apaShThu-ninAda:-
(and) horrible bellowings
tiShThate sma bhavate
stood before Thee
vRRiSharUpI
in the form of a bull
---------
Once, some emissary of Kansa, always looking for ways to do cruel and evil deeds, Arishta by name, terrific in appearance, bellowing horribly, in the form of a bull stood before Thee.

shAkvaro.atha jagatIdhRRitihArI mUrtimeSha bRRihatIM pradadhAna: |
pa~NktimAshu parighUrNya pashUnAM ChandasAM nidhimavApa bhavantam ||7||
---------
shAkvara:-atha
(this) bull then
jagatI-dhRRiti-hArI
(who was) the world's peace plunderer
mUrtim-eSha
in a form, he
bRRihatIM pradadhAna:
(which was) huge assumed
pa~Nktim-Ashu
the herd soon
parighUrNya
driving away
pashUnAM
of the cows
ChandasAm nidhim-
of the Veda's repository (Thee)
avApa bhavantam
approached Thee

Then this bull who was the plunderer of the peace of the world, he assumed a form which was huge and driving away the herds of cows, soon approached Thee who are repository of Vedas.
---------
tu~NgashRRi~NgamukhamAshvabhiyantaM saMgRRihayya rabhasAdabhiyaM tam |
bhadrarUpamapi daityamabhadraM mardayannamadaya: suralokam ||8||

tu~Nga-shRRi~Nga-mukham-
raising the horns and head
Ashu-abhiyantaM
hastily rushing
saMgRRihayya rabhasAt-
catching swiftly
abhiyaM tam
fearlessly, him
bhadra-rUpam-api
(who was) in an auspicious form, though
daityam-abhadram
(he was) an Asura inauspicious
mardayan-amadaya:
killing, (Thou) delighted
suralokam
the gods
---------
Raising his horns and head he was rushing hastily towards Thee. Thou caught hold of him swiftly and fearlessly who was an inauspicious Asura, though he was in an auspicious form of a bull. Thou then crushed him to death and so delighted the gods.

chitramadya bhagavan vRRiShaghAtAt susthirA.ajani vRRiShasthitirurvyAm |
vardhate cha vRRiShachetasi bhUyAn moda ityabhinuto.asi suraistvam ||9||
---------
chitram-adya
surprisingly now (today)
bhagavan
O Lord!
vRRiSha-ghAtAt
by the bull's killing
susthirA-ajani
very firm has become
vRRiSha-sthiti:-
the righteousness (Dharma's) status
urvyAm
on the earth
vardhate cha
and is increasing
vRRiSha-chetasi
in Indra's mind
bhUyAn moda
great joy
iti-abhinuta:-asi
thus praised were
surai:-tvam
by the gods Thou

"O Lord! It is amazing that today by the killing of the bull, the status of righteousness (Dharma) is strengthened on the earth. The great joy in Indra's mind is also enhanced." Thus Thou were praised by the gods.
---------
aukShakANi paridhAvata dUraM vIkShyatAmayamihokShavibhedI |
itthamAttahasitai: saha gopairgehagastvamava vAtapuresha ||10||

aukShakANi
O bulls
paridhAvata dUraM
run away far
vIkShyatAm-
see
ayam-iha-
this here
ukShavibhedI
the bull slayer
ittham-Atta-hasitai:
thus making jokes
saha gopai:-
with the Gopas
gehaga:-tvam-
went home Thou
ava vAtapuresha
save me O Lord of Guruvaayur
---------
O bulls! Run far away. See here is this slayer of bulls.' Thou went home with the Gopas who were joking in this manner. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Save me.

Narayaneeyam D071

Dashaka 71
---------
yatneShu sarveShvapi nAvakeshI keshI sa bhojeshituriShTabandhu: |
tvAM sindhujAvApya itIva matvA samprAptavAn sindhujavAjirUpa: ||1||
---------
yatneShu
in (even all his) attempts
sarveShu-api
all even
na-avakeshI
not unsuccessful
keshI sa
that Keshi
bhoja-Ishitu:-
of the Bhoja king (Kansa's)
iShTa-bandhu:
a close friend
tvAm
Thee
sindhujA-avApya
by the ocean born Laxmi attainable
iti-iva matvA
thus as if thinking
samprAptavAn
approached (Thee)
sindhuja-
(as) born of the Sindhu land
vAji-rUpa:
in horse form

A close friend of the Bhoja king Kansa, Keshi was never unsuccessful in any of his attempts. He took the form of a horse from the land of Sindhu, thinking that Thou were easily accessible to those born off Sindhu (ocean) as Thou are to Laxmi Devi.
---------
gandharvatAmeSha gato.api rUkShairnAdai: samudvejitasarvaloka: |
bhavadvilokAvadhi gopavATIM pramardya pApa: punarApatattvAm ||2||

gandharvatAm-
(though) the form of a Gandharva (celestial singer)
eSha gata:-api
this (wicked one) assuming even
rUkShai:-nAdai:
by fierce noises (voices)
samudvejita-sarva-loka:
frightening all the worlds
bhavat-viloka-avadhi
Thee sighting until
gopavATIM pramardya
Gokula destructing
pApa:
the wicked one
puna:-Apatat-tvAm
then attacked Thee
---------
This wicked Asura, even though he had assumed the form of a Gandharva frightened all the worlds with his fierce voices. Until he set sight on Thee, the evil one destructed Gokula and then rushed to attack Thee.

tArkShyArpitA~Nghrestava tArkShya eSha chikShepa vakShobhuvi nAma pAdam |
bhRRigo: padAghAtakathAM nishamya svenApi shakyaM taditIva mohAt ||3||
---------
tArkShya-arpita-
on Garuda placed
a~Nghre:-tava
feet of Thee
tArkShya eSha chikShepa
horse this, threw (kicked)
vakShobhuvi
on the chest area
nAma pAdam
indeed his foot
bhRRigo: pada-AghAta-
of (sage) Bhrigu, with feet hitting
kathAM nishamya
story having heard
svena-api
by himself also
shakyaM tat-
could be done that
iti-iva mohAt
thus as if deludedly

Thou, whose feet are placed on Garuda, Thy vehicle, was kicked on the chest by this horse demon by his foot. Perhaps he had heard the story of sage Bhrigu having hit Thee with the foot, he deludedly thought that he too could do so.
---------
prava~nchayannasya khurA~nchalaM drAgamu~ncha chikShepitha dUradUram
sammUrchChito.api hyatimUrchChitena krodhoShmaNA khAditumAdrutastvAm ||4||

prava~nchayan-asya
dodging his
khurA~nchalaM
raised hoofs
drAk-amuM-cha
quickly,and him
chikShepitha
(Thou) flung
dUra-dUram
far far away
sammUrchChita:-api
fainting also
hi-atimUrchChitena
indeed in much great
krodha-uShmaNA
rage burning
khAditum-adruta:-
to consume (Thee) rushed
tvAm
Thee
---------
Dodging his raised hoofs Thou quickly caught him and flung him far far away. Though he fainted for sometime, with an increased rage as though set afire, he rushed to consume Thee.

tvaM vAhadaNDe kRRitadhIshcha vAhAdaNDaM nyadhAstasya mukhe tadAnIm |
tad vRRiddhiruddhashvasano gatAsu: saptIbhavannapyayamaikyamAgAt ||5||
---------
tvaM
Thou
vAha-daNDe
the horse punishing
kRRitadhI:-cha
and deciding
vAhA-daNDaM
(Thy) arm, club (like)
nyadhA:-tasya
placed into his
mukhe tadAnIm
mouth at that time
tad-vRRiddhi-
(by) its increasing (in size)
ruddha-shvasana:
(by) choking of breath
gatAsu:
(he) having died
saptIbhavan-api-
in a horse form though
ayam-
this (Asura)
aikyam-AgAt
oneness (with Thee) attained

Thou decided to punish the horse, and placed Thy strong club like arm into his mouth. At that time the arm increased in size and choked the horse to death. Even though the Asura was in the form of a horse, he attained oneness with Thee.
---------
AlambhamAtreNa pasho: surANAM prasAdake nUtna ivAshvamedhe |
kRRite tvayA harShavashAt surendrAstvAM tuShTuvu: keshavanAmadheyam ||6||

Alambha-
by killing
mAtreNa pasho:
merely, of the animal
surANAm prasAdake
to the god's pleasure (joy)
nUtna iva-
new as if
ashvamedhe
in the Ashvamedha sacrifice
kRRite tvayA
done by Thee
harShavashAt
inspired by joy
surendrA:-tvAM
the gods Thee
tuShTuvu:
hailed
keshava-nAma-dheyam
Keshava name giving (to Thee)
---------
Merely by the killing of the animal the gods were full of joy. This was as if it were a new Ashvamedha sacrifice done by Thee. Delighted, the gods hailed Thee giving Thee the name Keshava, the killer of Keshi.

kaMsAya te shaurisutatvamuktvA taM tadvadhotkaM pratirudhya vAchA|
prAptena keshikShapaNAvasAne shrInAradena tvamabhiShTuto.abhU: ||7||
---------
kaMsAya te
to Kansa Thy
shauri-sutatvam-uktvA
Vasudeva"s son having said
taM tat-
him (Kansa), his (Vasudeva's)
vadha-utkaM
killing eagerness
pratirudhya vAchA
dissuading verbally
prAptena
who had come
keshi-kShapaNa-avasAne
at the end of Keshi's destruction
shrI-nAradena tvam-
by Shri Naarada, Thou
abhiShTuta:-abhU:
were praised
