Then the enthralling beauty Rukmini bewitched the entire assembly of kings gathered there. Thou also, O Lord! Were somewhat enchanted by her as she cast her sidelong glances.

kvanu gamiShyasi chandramukhIti tAM sarasametya kareNa haran kShaNAt |
samadhiropya rathaM tvamapAhRRithA bhuvi tato vitato ninado dviShAm ||7||
---------
kvanu gamiShyasi
where indeed are you going
chandramukhI-iti
O Moon faced one! Thus
tAM sarasam-etya
her quickly reaching
kareNa haran kShaNAt
by hand leading away instantly
samadhiropya rathaM
helping her in the chariot
tvam-apAhRRithA
Thou carried away
bhuvi tata: vitata:
all over the earth then spreading
ninada: dviShAm
loud protest among the enemies

Addressing her admiringly, Thou asked her, 'O moon-faced one! where indeed are you going?' Thou hastily reached her and holding her by her arm Thou led her to the chariot and helping her in it, Thou carried her away. Whereupon there spread a loud protest among Thy rivals.
---------
kva nu gata: pashupAla iti krudhA kRRitaraNA yadubhishcha jitA nRRipA: |
na tu bhavAnudachAlyata tairaho pishunakai: shunakairiva kesarI ||8||

kva nu gata:
where indeed has he gone
pashupAla iti
the cowherd, thus
krudhA kRRitaraNA
enraged (and) fighting
yadubhi:-cha
by the Yadus, and
jitA:-nRRipA:
won over, the kings
na tu bhavAn-
not indeed Thou
udachAlyata
were to be swayed
tai:-aho
by them, O what a wonder!
pishunakai:
the wicked ones
shunakai:-iva kesarI
by dogs, just as, the lion
---------
Where indeed has he gone, the cowherd?' Thus the enraged kings shouted and put up a fight. They were defeated by the Yaadavas. O what a wonder! Thou were not swayed in the least by the wicked ones, just as the lion is not swayed by the barking of the dogs.

tadanu rukmiNamAgatamAhave vadhamupekShya nibadhya virUpayan |
hRRitamadaM parimuchya baloktibhi: puramayA ramayA saha kAntayA ||9||
---------
tadanu rukmiNam-
thereafter Rukmi
Agatam-Ahave
(who had) come for battle
vadham-upekShya
to kill refraining
nibadhya virUpayan
binding and disfiguring (him)
hRRita-madam
humbling (his) pride
parimuchya
(then) releasing (him)
bala-uktibhi:
by Balaraam's direction
puram-ayA:
came to town
ramayA saha kAntayA
with Ramaa (Thy) wife (Rukmini)

Rukmi then came to battle with Thee. Refraining to kill him, Thou bound him and disfigured him and thus humbled his pride. At the instance of Balaraama Thou released him of his bondage and returned to Thy city Dwaarkaa with Thy wife Rukmini who was Ramaa (Laxmi) herself.
---------
navasamAgamalajjitamAnasAM praNayakautukajRRimbhitamanmathAm |
aramaya: khalu nAtha yathAsukhaM rahasi tAM hasitAMshulasanmukhIm ||10||

nava-samAgama
newness of being with her husband
lajjita-mAnasAm
with a shy mind
praNaya-kautuka-
love and joy
jRRimbhita-manmathAm
increasing the passion
aramaya: khalu
sported (Thou) indeed
nAtha
O Lord!
yathA-sukhaM
so as to (make her) happy
rahasi tAM
in private, her
hasita-aMshula-sanmukhIm
smile rays brightening her face
---------
Rukmini was shyly caught between the new experience of being with her husband and the increased passion caused by the joy of experiencing love. O Lord! Thou sported with her in privacy so as to delight her whose face was beaming with the rays of her smile.

vividhanarmabhirevamaharnishaM pramadamAkalayan punarekadA |
RRijumate: kila vakragirA bhavAn varatanoratanodatilolatAm ||11||
---------
vividha-narmabhi:-
by various jokes
evam-aha:-nisham
thus day and night
pramadam-Akalayan
delight creating
puna:-ekadA
again one day
RRiju-mate:
simple minded (her)
kila vakra-girA
certainly with doubtful words
bhavAn
Thou
vara-tano:-atanot-
for the beautiful one created
ati-lolatAm
severe agitation

Day and night Thou delighted the beautiful Rukmini by various jokes and pleasant talks. Then one day, by Thy doubtful words the simple minded one was very much agitated.
---------
tadadhikairatha lAlanakaushalai: praNayinImadhikaM sukhayannimAm |
ayi mukunda bhavachcharitAni na: pragadatAM gadatAntimapAkuru ||12||

tat-adhikai:-atha
then more than before
lAlana-kaushalai:
by affection expertises
praNayinIm-adhikaM
the beloved, evermore
sukhayan-imAm
delighting her
ayi mukunda
O Bestower of liberation!
bhavat-charitAni
Thy excellences
na: pragadatAM
we narrating
gada-tAntim-apAkuru
(our) disease causing sufferings do remove
---------
More than ever before by Thy affectionate expertises Thou delighted this Thy beloved even more. O Bestower of Liberation! Liberate me from the sufferings caused by the disease, who is always narrating Thy excellences.

Narayaneeyam D080

Dashaka 80
---------
satrAjitastvamatha lubdhavadarkalabdhaM
divyaM syamantakamaNiM bhagavannayAchI: |
tatkAraNaM bahuvidhaM mama bhAti nUnaM
tasyAtmajAM tvayi ratAM Chalato vivoDhum ||1||
---------
satrAjita:-
from Satraajit
tvam-atha
Thou then
lubdha-vat-
greedy man like
arka-labdhaM
from the sun attained
divyaM syamantaka-maNiM
divine Syamantaka jewel
bhagavan-ayAchI:
O Lord Thou asked for
tat-kAraNaM
the reason
bahu-vidhaM
many fold
mama bhAti nUnaM
to me appeals indeed
tasya-AtmajAM
his daughter
tvayi ratAM
in Thee infatuated
Chalata: vivoDhum
by strategy to marry

Thou then like a greedy man asked for the divine Syamantaka jewel from Satraajit who had got it from the Sun god. O Lord! The reasons for this may be many. What appeals to me indeed is that this was a strategy by which Thou wanted to marry his daughter (Satyabhaamaa) who was in love with Thee.
---------
adattaM taM tubhyaM maNivaramanenAlpamanasA
prasenastadbhrAtA galabhuvi vahan prApa mRRigayAm |
ahannenaM siMho maNimahasi mAMsabhramavashAt
kapIndrastaM hatvA maNimapi cha bAlAya dadivAn ||2||

adattaM taM
not giving that
tubhyaM maNivaram-
to Thee the precious jewel
anena-alpa-manasA
by him the narrow minded
prasena:-tat-bhrAtA
Prasena, his brother
gala-bhuvi vahan
in the neck wearing
prApa mRRigayAm
went hunting
ahan-enam siMha:
killed him the lion
maNi-mahasi
in the jewel brilliance
mAMsa-bhrama-vashAt
for flesh mistaking,
kapIndra:-taM hatvA
the great monkey him (the lion) killing
maNim-api cha
the jewel also and
bAlAya dadivAn
to (his) child gave
---------
The narrow minded one (Satraajit) did not give the precious jewel to Thee. His brother Prasena wore it round his neck and went away hunting. A lion mistook the jewel because of its brilliance to be a lump of flesh and so he killed Prasena. The great monkey (Jaambavaana) killed the lion and gave the jewel to his child.

shashaMsu: satrAjidgiramanu janAstvAM maNiharaM
janAnAM pIyUShaM bhavati guNinAM doShakaNikA |
tata: sarvaj~no.api svajanasahito mArgaNapara:
prasenaM taM dRRiShTvA harimapi gato.abhU: kapiguhAm ||3||
---------
shashaMsu:
talked about
satrAjit-giram-anu
Satraajit's words following
janA:-tvAM maNi-haraM
the people, Thou jewel thief
janAnAM pIyUShaM
for the people nectar like
bhavati guNinAM
it is of the virtuous
doSha-kaNikA
fault slightest
tata: sarvaj~na:-api
therefore knowing everything also
sva-jana-sahita:
Thy people along with
mArgaNa-para:
to search intent
prasenaM taM
that Prasen
dRRiShTvA harim-api
seeing the lion also
gata:-abhU:
went
kapi-guhAm
(into) the monkey's cave

Influenced by the allegations of Satraajit, people suspected that Thou had stolen the jewel. Even a slight fault in the conduct of the virtuous person is like nectar for people in general, for it gives them a chance to slight that person. In spite of the fact that Thou knew everything about the jewel, Thou went in search for it with Thy men. Thou saw Prasena and the lion lying dead and thus were led to the monkey (Jaambavaan's) cave.
---------
bhavantamavitarkayannativayA: svayaM jAmbavAn
mukundasharaNaM hi mAM ka iha roddhumityAlapan |
vibho raghupate hare jaya jayetyalaM muShTibhi-
shchiraM tava samarchanaM vyadhita bhaktachUDAmaNi: ||4||

bhavantam-avitarkayan-
Thee not identifying
ati-vayA:
due to age
svayaM jAmbavAn
himself Jaambavaan
mukunda-sharaNaM
to Mukunda surrendered
hi mAm ka:-iha
indeed me, who here
roddhum-iti-Alapan
is to obstruct, thus saying
vibho raghupate
O Lord Raama!
hare jaya jaya-iti-alaM
O Hari! Victory to Thee! Thus
muShTibhi:-chiraM
with fists for long
tava samarchanam vyadhita
Thy worship performed
bhaktachUDAmaNi:
the crest jewel of the devotees
---------
The aged Jaambavaan did not know Thy identity and so exclaimed, 'who has come to obstruct me who has Mukund as his only resort?' As, the crest jewel of the devotees, he was invoking Thee with "O Lord Raam! O Hari! Victory be to Thee!, he worshipped Thee with blows of his fists.

budhvA.atha tena dattAM navaramaNIM varamaNiM cha parigRRihNan |
anugRRihNannamumAgA: sapadi cha satrAjite maNiM prAdA: ||5||
---------
budhvA-atha
recognizing (Thee) then
tena dattAM
by him was given
nava-ramaNIM
to the young girl (his daughter)
vara-maNiM cha
the precious jewel and
parigRRihNan
accepting
anugRRihNan-amum-
blessing him
AgA: sapadi
returning immediately
cha satrAjite
and to Satraajit
maNiM prAdA:
the jewel gave back

Finally when Jaambavaan recognized Thee, he gave to Thee his young daughter and the jewel. Thou accepted them and blessed him, and immediately returned and gave back the jewel, the Syamantaka Mani, to Satraajit.
---------
tadanu sa khalu brIlAlolo vilolavilochanAM
duhitaramaho dhImAn bhAmAM giraiva parArpitAm |
adita maNinA tubhyaM labhyaM sametya bhavAnapi
pramuditamanAstasyaivAdAnmaNiM gahanAshaya: ||6||

tadanu sa khalu
thereafter he indeed
brIlA-lola:
shame filled with
vilola-lochanAM
with loving eyes
duhitaram-aho
the daughter Oh!
dhImAn
the intelligent one (Satraajit)
bhAmAn
Satyabhaamaa
girA-eva
by words only
para-arpitAm
given to another
adita maNinA
gave (along with) the jewel
tubhyam labhyam
to Thee, the worth getting
sametya bhavAn-api
having got, Thou also
pramudita-manA:-
with a happy mind
tasya-eva-AdAt-
to him only gave back
maNim
the jewel
gahana-Ashaya:
deep thinking (Thou)
---------
Satraajit, the intelligent one, was then filled with shame for his conduct with Thee. He had given away his roving eyed daughter Satyabhaamaa to someone verbally only. He gave her to Thee along with the jewel. Thou, happily, with Thy deep and unfathomable reasoning gave back the jewel, having got what was worth getting (Satyabhaamaa).

vrIlAkulAM ramayati tvayi satyabhAmAM
kaunteyadAhakathayAtha kurUn prayAte |
hI gAndineyakRRitavarmagirA nipAtya
satrAjitaM shatadhanurmaNimAjahAra ||7||
---------
vrIlA-AkulAM
by shyness overcome
ramayati tvayi
(her) delighting (when) Thou were
satyabhAmAm
her Satyabhaamaa
kaunteya-dAha-
the son's of Kunti's burning
kathayA-atha
news, then
kurUn prayAte
Thou to Kurukshetra went away
hI
how shameful
gAndineya-kRRitavarma-girA
by Akrura and Kritavarmaa's words
nipAtya satrAjitaM
killing Satraajit
shatadhanu:-maNim-AjahAra
Shatadhanu the jewel took away

When Thou were delighting the shy Satyabhaamaa, there was the news of Kunti's sons being burnt in the wax palace. So Thou went away to the land of the Kurus. Under the promptings of Akrura and Kritvermaa, Shatadhanu killed Satraajit and took away the jewel.
---------
shokAt kurUnupagatAmavalokya kAntAM
hatvA drutaM shatadhanuM samaharShayastAm |
ratne sasha~Nka iva maithilagehametya
rAmo gadAM samashishikShata dhArtarAShTram ||8||

shokAt
due to grief
kurUn-upagatAm-
to the country of Kuru's having come
avalokya kAntAM
seeing (Thy) wife
hatvA drutaM shatadhanuM
killing quickly Shatadhanu
samaharShaya:-tAm
appeased her
ratne sasha~Nka iva
about the jewel doubting, as though
maithila-geham-etya
to the king of Mithila's abode reaching
rAmo gadAM
Balaraam the mace wielding
samashishikShata
taught well
dhArtarAShTram
to Duryodhana
---------
Satyabhaama was overcome with grief and went to Kurukshetra. Seeing her, Thou quickly killed Shatadhanu and made her happy. As though doubting the whereabouts of the jewel, Balaraam went to the abode of the king of Mithilaa. There he very well trained Duryodhana in the art of wielding the mace.

akrUra eSha bhagavan bhavadichChayaiva
satrAjita: kucharitasya yuyoja hiMsAm |
akrUrato maNimanAhRRitavAn punastvaM
tasyaiva bhUtimupadhAtumiti bruvanti ||9||
---------
akrUra eSha
Akrura, this
bhagavan
O Lord!
bhavat-ichChayA-eva
by Thy will alone
satrAjita: kucharitasya
of Satraajit, the notorious
yuyoja hiMsAm
caused the death
akrUrata: maNim-
from Akrura the jewel
anAhRRitavAn puna:-tvaM
did not take back again Thou
tasya eva bhUtim-
his alone prosperity
upadhAtum-
to bring about
iti bruvanti
so it is said

This, Akrura, O Lord! By Thy will alone caused the death of the notorious Satraajit. It is said that with a mind to bring about his prosperity, Thou did not take back the jewel from Akrura.
---------
bhaktastvayi sthiratara: sa hi gAndineya-
stasyaiva kApathamati: kathamIsha jAtA |
vij~nAnavAn prashamavAnahamityudIrNaM
garvaM dhruvaM shamayituM bhavatA kRRitaiva ||10||

bhakta:-tvayi
devoted to Thee
sthiratara:
very firmly
sa hi gAndineya:
that indeed Akrura
tasya-eva
his also
kApatha-mati:
evil mind
katham-Isha jAtA
how O Lord! was produced
vij~nAnavAn
all knowing
prashamavAn-aham-
well self controlled am I
iti-udIrNaM garvaM
thus bloated vanity
dhruvaM shamayitum
certainly to curb
bhavatA kRRitA-eva
by Thee was brought about only
---------
Akrura was very firmly devoted to Thee. O Lord! How could there be an evil thought in his mind (of killing Satraajit and getting the jewel)? He was bloated with the vanity of having self knowledge and self control. Certainly to curb that, Thou brought this about.

yAtaM bhayena kRRitavarmayutaM punasta-
mAhUya tadvinihitaM cha maNiM prakAshya |
tatraiva suvratadhare vinidhAya tuShyan
bhAmAkuchAntashayana: pavanesha pAyA: ||11||
---------
yAtaM bhayena
having fled in fear
kRRitavarmayutaM
Kritvarma along with
puna:-tam-AhUya
again calling him
tat-vinihitam cha
with him hidden and
maNim prakAshya
the jewel bringing out
tatra-eva suvrata-dhare
there only (him) with good deeds, endowed
vinidhAya tuShyan
retaining and satisfying him
bhAmA-kuchAnta-shayana:
(on) Satyabhaamaa's bosom reclined
pavanesha pAyA:
O Lord of Guruvaayur! Save me

Akrura with Kritvarma fled in fear. Thou called him again and brought out the jewel hidden with him. Thou then let him retain the jewel who was of good conduct, and satisfied him. Thou then lived happily with Satyabhaamaa reclining on her bosom. O Lord of Guruvaayur! save me.

Narayaneeyam D081

Dashaka 81
---------
snigdhAM mugdhAM satatamapi tAM lAlayan satyabhAmAM
yAto bhUya: saha khalu tayA yAj~nasenIvivAham |
pArthaprItyai punarapi manAgAsthito hastipuryAM
sashakraprasthaM puramapi vibho saMvidhAyAgato.abhU: ||1||
---------
snigdhAM mugdhAM
loving and very beautiful
statam-api
for some time also
tAM lAlayan
her endearing
satyabhAmAM
Satyabhaamaa
yAta: bhUya:
(Thou) went, thereafter
saha khalu tayA
with indeed her
yAj~nasenI-vivAham
to Paanchaali's marriage
pArtha-prItyai
for the Pandavaa's pleasure
puna:-api
again also
manAk-Asthita:
for sometime stayed
hastipuryAm
in Hastinaapur
shakraprastham puram-api
Indraprastha city also
vibho saMvidhAya-
O Lord! Founding
Agata:-abhU:
returned

Thou always endeared the loving and very beautiful Satyabhaamaa. Thereafter Thou went with her to attend the wedding of Paanchaali. To please the Paandavaas, Thou stayed in Hastinaapur for sometime. O Lord! Thou then founded the city of Indraprastha and then returned to Dwaarikaa.
---------
bhadrAM bhadrAM bhavadavarajAM kauraveNArthyamAnAM
tvadvAchA tAmahRRita kuhanAmaskarI shakrasUnu: |
tatra kruddhaM balamanunayan pratyagAstena sArdhaM
shakraprasthaM priyasakhamude satyabhAmAsahAya: ||2||

bhadrAM bhadrAM
the virtuous Subhadraa
bhavat-avarajAM
Thy younger sister
kauraveNa-arthyamAnAm
by the Kaurava (Duryodhana) sought (in marriage)
tvat-vAchA
by Thy words
tAm-ahRRita
her carried away
kuhanA-maskarI
as a false sanyaasi
shakrasUnu:
Indra's son Arjun
tatra kruddham balam-
there, enraged Balaraama
anunayan pratyagA:-
pacifying (Thou) went
tena sArdham
with him
shakraprastham
to Indraprastha
priya-sakha-mude
for dear friend's pleasure
satyabhAmA-sahAya:
along with Satyabhaamaa
---------
Thy younger sister, the virtuous Subhadraa was sought in marriage by the Kuru prince Duryodhana. She was carried away by Indra's son Arjuna in the guise of an ascetic at Thy behest. Balaraama was enraged at this but was later pacified by Thee. Thou then went with him and Satyabhaamaa to Indraprastha to the great delight of Thy dear friend Arjuna.

tatra krIDannapi cha yamunAkUladRRiShTAM gRRihItvA
tAM kAlindIM nagaramagama: khANDavaprINitAgni: |
bhrAtRRitrastAM praNayavivashAM deva paitRRiShvaseyIM
rAj~nAM madhye sapadi jahRRiShe mitravindAmavantIm ||3||
---------
tatra krIDan-api cha
there sporting even and
yamunA-kUla-dRRiShTAM
on Yamuna's bank seen
gRRihItvA tAM kAlindIm
taking that Kaalindi
nagaram-agama:
to the city (Thou) went
khANDava-prINita-agni:
by the khandava forest pleasing the fire god
bhrAtRRi-trastAm
of her brother afraid
praNaya-vivashAm
in love (for Thee) helpless
deva paitRRiShvaseyIM
O Lord! Thy father's sisters's daughter
rAj~nAM madhye
from among the kings
sapadi jahRRiShe
quickly took away
mitravindAm-avantIm
Mitravindaa, the princess of Avanti

Even as Thou sported there, Thou saw Kaalindi on the banks of the river Yamuna and took her as Thy wife. Thou pleased the god of fire, Agni by letting him consume the Khaandava forest, and then returned to the city of Dwaarika. The princess of Avanti, Mitravindaa was the daughter of Thy father's sister and was greatly in love with Thee. She was afraid of her brother and was helpless. Thou took her away suddenly in the presence of many kings.
---------
satyAM gatvA punarudavaho nagnajinnandanAM tAM
badhvA saptApi cha vRRiShavarAn saptamUrtirnimeShAt |
bhadrAM nAma pradaduratha te deva santardanAdyA-
statsodaryA varada bhavata: sA.api paitRRiShvaseyI ||4||

satyAM gatvA
Satya, going to
puna:-udavaha:
again Thou married (Satya)
nagnajit-nandanAM tAM
Nagnajit's daughter her
badhvA sapta-api
harnessing seven even
cha vRRiSha-varAn
and bull's powerful
sapta-mUrti:-nimeShAt
by seven forms assuming
bhadrAM nAma
Bhadraa by name
pradadu:-atha
gave then
te deva
to Thee O Lord!
santardana-AdyA:-
by Santardana and other
tat-sodryA:
of her brothers
varada bhavata:
O Bestower of Boons! To Thee
sA-api paitRRiShvaseyI
she also was Thy father's sister's daughter
---------
Thou then went to Kausala and married the king Nagnajit's daughter after demonstrating Thy strength by harnessing seven powerful bulls simultaneously assuming seven forms. O Lord! Bhadraa's brothers Santardana and others gave her to Thee in marriage. O Bestower of Boons! she was also the daughter of Thy father's sister.

pArthAdyairapyakRRitalavanaM toyamAtrAbhilakShyaM
lakShaM ChitvA shapharamavRRithA lakShmaNAM madrakanyAm |
aShTAvevaM tava samabhavan vallabhAstatra madhye
shushrotha tvaM surapatigirA bhaumadushcheShTitAni ||5||
---------
pArtha-Adyai:-api
by Arjuna and others also
akRRita-lavanaM
not pierced through
toya-mAtra-abhilakShyaM
in water alone reflected
lakShaM ChitvA
the target, piercing
shapharam-avRRithA
of a fish, married
lakShmaNAM mandrakanyAm
Lakshmanaa, the daughter of the king of Madra
aShTau-evam
eight, in this manner
tava samabhavan
Thy became
vallabhA:-tatra
wives, there also
madhye shushrutha
between all this, (Thou) heard
tvaM surapati-girA
Thou by Indra's words
bhauma-duShTacheShTitAni
Bhauma's evil deeds

The target which was just a reflection of a fish in the water was not hit at even by Arjuna and the others. Striking which Thou married Lakshmanaa who was the daughter of the king of Madra. In this manner Thou had eight wives. Thou then came to know about the misdeeds of Bhauma from Indra's words.
---------
smRRitAyAtaM pakShipravaramadhirUDhastvamagamo
vahanna~Nke bhAmAmupavanamivArAtibhavanam |
vibhindan durgANi truTitapRRitanAshoNitarasai:
puraM tAvat prAgjyotiShamakuruthA: shoNitapuram ||6||

smRRita-AyAtaM
(as and when) remembered, coming
pakShipravaram-
the divine bird (Garuda)
adhirUDha:-tvam-agama:
riding on him Thou went
vahan-a~Nke
carrying on Thy lap
bhAmAm-upavanam-iva-
Satyabhaamaa, in a garden as if
arAti-bhavanam
in the enemy's residence
vibhindan durgANi
destroying its fortification
truTita-pRRitanA-
slaughtering the army
shoNita-rasai:
(with its) blood liquid
puraM tAvat
that city then
prAgjyotiSham-
Praagjyotisha
akuruthA:
made into
shoNitapuram
Shonitpura
---------
Thou rode with Satyabhaamaa on Thy lap riding the divine bird Garuda, who came to Thee as and when required and remembered. Thou went to the residence of the enemy as if Thou were going to a garden. After destroying the fortification of the city of Praagjyotish, Thou killed the army and made the blood run all over the city. Thou soon converted the city of Praagjyotish into Shonitpura (the city of blood).

murastvAM pa~nchAsyo jaladhivanamadhyAdudapatat
sa chakre chakreNa pradalitashirA ma~NkShu bhavatA |
chaturdantairdantAvalapatibhirindhAnasamaraM
rathA~Ngena ChitvA narakamakarostIrNanarakam ||7||
---------
mura:-tvAM
(the Asura) Mura (to) Thee
pa~ncha-Asya:
the five faced one
jaladhi-vana-madhyAt-
from the middle of the ocean like forest
udapatat
rushed
sa chakre chakreNa
he was made by the discus
pradalita-shirA
cut off heads
ma~NkShu bhavatA
at once by Thee
chatu:-dantai:-
by the four tusked
dantAvalapatibhi:-
mighty elephants
indhAna-samaraM
giving tough and protracted fight
rathA~Ngena ChitvA
with Thy discus severing
narakam-akaro:-
to Narakaasur made
tIrNa-narakam
pass over hell

The Asura Mura having five faces rushed towards Thee from the middle of the forest which was like an ocean. He was at once made headless by Thy discus cutting off his five heads. Then Narakaasura with his regiment of mighty four tusked elephants gave a prolonged tough fight. Thou cut off his head also and made him pass over hell (and saved him from the suffering of hell).
---------
stuto bhUmyA rAjyaM sapadi bhagadatte.asya tanaye
gaja~nchaikaM datvA prajighayitha nAgAnnijapurIm |
khalenAbaddhAnAM svagatamanasAM ShoDasha puna:
sahasrANi strINAmapi cha dhanarAshiM cha vipulaM ||8||

stuta: bhUmyA
hymns sung (to Thee) by Bhoomi Devi
rAjyaM sapadi
the kingdom at once
bhagadatte-asya tanaye
to Bhagadatta his son
gajam-cha-ekaM
and elephant one
datvA prajaghayitha
gave and sent away
nAgAn-nija-purIm
the elephants to Thy city
khalena-AbaddhAnAm
by the wicked (Narakaasura) imprisoned
svagata-manasAM
whose minds were devoted to Thee
ShoDasha puna: sahasrANi
sixteen again thousand (16000)
strINAm-api cha
women also and
dhana-rAshiM cha vipulaM
wealth of great amount
---------
Bhumi Devi sang hymns in Thy praise. Thou at once gave the kingdom and an elephant to Narakaasur's son Bhagadatta. The rest of the elephants Thou sent away to Dwaarikaa along with a good amount of wealth. Thou also sent the 16000 women who nourished love for Thee, and were imprisoned by the wicked Narakaasura.

bhaumApAhRRitakuNDalaM tadaditerdAtuM prayAto divaM
shakrAdyairmahita: samaM dayitayA dyustrIShu dattahriyA |
hRRitvA kalpataruM ruShAbhipatitaM jitvendramabhyAgama-
stattu shrImadadoSha IdRRisha iti vyAkhyAtumevAkRRithA: ||9||
---------
bhauma-apAhRRita-kuNDalaM
by Bhauma taken away the earrings
tat-adite:-dAtuM
that to Aditi to give
prayAta: divam
went to the heaven
shakra-Adyai:-mahita:
by Indra and others honoured
samaM dayitayA
with (Thy) wife
dyu-strIShu
the women of the heaven
dtta-hriyA
putting to shame
hRRitvA kalpatarum
taking away the Kalpataru
ruShA-abhipatitaM
in anger having attacked
jitvA-indram-
winning over Indra
abhyAgama:-
returned
tat-tu shrI-mada-doSha
that indeed is prosperity caused arrogance
IdRRisha iti
comes to this
vyAkhyAtum-eva-akRRithA:
demonstrate only (Thou) did

To give back to Aditi the ear ornaments which were taken away by Narakaasura, Thou went to the heaven. Satyabhaamaa had accompanied Thee who put to shame the women there, with her beauty. Thou were received with honour by Indra and others. Thou took away the Kalpataru, at which, the angered Indra put up a fight. Thou won over him and returned to Thy city. Thou did this to demonstrate to the world the evil which is generated from prosperity.
---------
kalpadruM satyabhAmAbhavanabhuvi sRRijan dvyaShTasAhasrayoShA:
svIkRRitya pratyagAraM vihitabahuvapurlAlayan kelibhedai: |
AshcharyAnnAradAlokitavividhagatistatra tatrApi gehe
bhUya: sarvAsu kurvan dasha dasha tanayAn pAhi vAtAlayesha ||10||

kalpadruM
the Kalpa tree
satyabhAmA-bhavana-bhuvi
in Satyabhaamaa's palace courtyard
sRRijan
planting
dvya-aShTa-sAhasra-
twice eight thousand
yoShA: svIkRRitya
women accepting
prati-AgAraM
in every house
vihita-bahu-vapu:-
taking on many forms
lAlayan kelibhedai:
nurturing with various activities
AshcharyAt-nArada-
surprisingly by Naarada
Alokita-vividha-gati:-
seen (in) different activities engaged
tatra tatra-api gehe
in each of those houses
bhUya: sarvAsu kurvan
again to all of them giving
dsha dasha tanayAn
ten sons each
pAhi vAtAlayesha
save O Lord of Guruvaayur!
---------
Thou planted the Kalpa tree in the courtyard of Satyabhaamaa's palace. The 16000 women were accepted by Thee as wives. Thou took on as many forms and engaged Thyself in each of those houses of these wives in various activities and lovingly nurtured them. Naarada was surprised to see Thee sporting in this manner. Thou then gave each of them ten sons. O Lord of Guruvaayur save me.

Narayaneeyam D082

Dashaka 82
---------
pradyumno raukmiNeya: sa khalu tava kalA shambareNAhRRitastaM
hatvA ratyA sahApto nijapuramaharadrukmikanyAM cha dhanyAm |
tatputro.athAniruddho guNanidhiravahadrochanAM rukmipautrIM
tatrodvAhe gatastvaM nyavadhi musalinA rukmyapi dyUtavairAt ||1||
---------
pradyumna: raukmiNeya:
Pradyumna, Rukmini's son
sa khalu tava kalA
he indeed Thy part incarnation
shambareNa-AhRRita:-
by Shambara was kidnapped
taM hatvA
him killing
ratyA saha-Apta:
with Rati returned
nijapuram-
to his own city
aharat-rukmi-kanyAM
took away Rukmi's daughter
cha dhanyAM
and she the fortunate one
tat-putra:-atha-
his son then
aniruddha: guNanidhi:-
Aniruddha, very virtuous
avahat-rochanAm
married Rochanaa
rukmi pautrIm
Rukmi's grand daughter
tatra-udvAhe gata:-tvaM
there, in that wedding Thou went
nyavadhi musalinA
was killed by Balaraam
rukmi-api
Rukmi also
dyUta-vairAt
in the game of dice animosity

Pradyumna, Rukmini's son was an aspect of Thy essence and was kidnapped by Shambara at birth. Later Pradyumna killed Shambara and returned to his city of Dwaarikaa with his wife Rati. He also carried away the fortunate daughter of Rukmi and married her. His virtuous son Aniruddha married Rochanaa, the grand daughter of Rukmi. Thou had gone to that wedding. During a game of dice, when a quarrel arose, Rukmi was killed by Balaraam.
---------
bANasya sA balisutasya sahasrabAho-
rmAheshvarasya mahitA duhitA kiloShA |
tvatpautramenamaniruddhamadRRiShTapUrvaM
svapne.anubhUya bhagavan virahAturA.abhUt ||2||

bANasya sA
of Baana, she
bali-sutasya
of Bali's son (Baan)
sahasra-bAho:-
of a thousand arms
mAheshvarasya
devotee of Shiva
mahitA duhitA
the esteemed daughter
kila-uShA
indeed Ushaa
tvat-pautram-enam-
Thy grandson this
aniruddham-adRRiShTa-pUrvam
Aniruddha not seen before
svapne-anubhUya
in the dream meeting
bhagavan
O Lord!
viraha-AturA-abhUt
separation pangs suffered
---------
Bali's son Baana was a devotee of Shiva and had a thousand arms. His esteemed daughter Ushaa had not seen Thy grandson Aniruddha before. She met him in her dreams and suffered pangs of separation from him.

yoginyatIva kushalA khalu chitralekhA
tasyA: sakhI vilikhatI taruNAnasheShAn |
tatrAniruddhamuShayA viditaM nishAyA-
mAneShTa yogabalato bhavato niketAt ||3||
---------
yoginI-
a woman with yogic powers
atIva kushalA
and very skilled
khalu chitralekhA
indeed Chitralekhaa
tasyA: sakhi
her (Ushaa's) friend
vilikhatI
draws (pictures)
taruNAn-asheShAn
of young men all
tatra-aniruddham-
from there, Aniruddha
uShayA viditaM
by Ushaa was recognized
nishAyAm-AneShTa
during the night, brought (Chitralekhaa)
yoga-balata:
by yogic powers
bhavata: niketAt
from Thy palace

Ushaa's friend Chitralekhaa had yogic powers and was very skilled in making drawings. She drew portraits of all the young men. Ushaa picked up Aniruddha's portrait whom she recognized. Chitralekhaa with her yogic powers then brought Aniruddha from Thy palace during the night.
---------
kanyApure dayitayA sukhamAramantaM
chainaM katha~nchana babandhuShi sharvabandhau |
shrInAradoktatadudantadurantaroShai-
stvaM tasya shoNitapuraM yadubhirnyarundhA: ||4||

kanyA-pure
in the virgin's chambers
dayitayA
with his beloved (Ushaa)
sukham-AramantaM
happily sporting
cha-enam katha~nchana
and him somehow
babandhuShi
tied up
sharvabandhau
Shiva's devotee
shrI-nArada-ukta-
by Shree Naarada told
tat-udanta-
that news
duranta:-roShai:-tvaM
(in) unbounded anger Thou
tasya shoNitapuraM
his (city) Shonitpura
yadubhi:-nyarundhA:
with Yadus besieged
---------
In the virgin's chamber, Aniruddha sported happily with his beloved Ushaa. Baana, Shivaa's devotee came to know this and tied him up. This news was given to Thee by Shree Naarad. In a fit of unbounded anger, Thou besieged Baana's city Shonitpura with the help of the Yaadavas.

purIpAlashshailapriyaduhitRRinAtho.asya bhagavAn
samaM bhUtavrAtairyadubalamasha~NkaM nirurudhe |
mahAprANo bANo jhaTiti yuyudhAnenayuyudhe
guha: pradyumnena tvamapi purahantrA jaghaTiShe ||5||
---------
purIpAla:-
the protector of the city
shaila-priya-duhitRRi-nAtha:-asya
the mountain's dear daughter's consort, his
bhagavAn
Lord Shiva
samaM bhUtavrAtai:-
with the Bhoota army
yadu-balam-asha~NkaM
the Yaadava army fearlessly
nirurudhe
blocked
mahAprANa: bANa:
the mighty Baana
jhaTiti
quickly
yuyudhAnena yuyudhe
with Yuyudhaana fought
guha: pradyumnena
Guha with Pradyumna
tvam-api
Thou too
purahantrA jaghaTiShe
(with) Tripura destroyer Shiva

The consort of the mountain's dear daughter, Shiva, being the protector of the city, with his army of the Bhootas blocked the army of the Yadavas, fearlessly. The mighty Baana quickly gave fight to Yuyudhaana, Guha to Pradyumna and Thou to Shiva, the destroyer of the Puras.
---------
niruddhAsheShAstre mumuhuShi tavAstreNa girishe
drutA bhUtA bhItA: pramathakulavIrA: pramathitA: |
parAskandt skanda: kusumasharabANaishcha sachiva:
sa kumbhANDo bhANDaM navamiva balenAshu bibhide ||6||

niruddha-asheSha-astre
resisted were all the weapons
mumuhuShi
became unconscious
tava-astreNa girishe
by Thy weapon, Shiva
drutA:-bhUtA:-bhItA:
fled the Bhootas in fear
pramatha-kula-vIrA:
of the Pramatha dynasty, the leader
pramathitA:
were crushed
parAskandat skanda:
was defeated Skanda (guha)
kusuma-shara-bANai:-cha
by the flower bows's arrows of Pradyumna and
sachiva: sa kumbhANDa:
the minister of Baana, that Kumbhaanda
bhANDaM navam-iva
a pot new as though
balena-Ashu bibhide
by Balaram was soon smashed
---------
All Shiva's weapons were resisted and he was rendered unconscious by Thy weapon (Mohanaastra). All the army of the Bhootas fled in fear and the leaders of the Pramathas were crushed. Skanda was defeated, by the flower arrows of Pradyumna's bow. The minister of Baana, Kumbhaanda was soon smashed by Balaraam like a new pot.

chApAnAM pa~nchashatyA prasabhamupagate ChinnachApe.atha bANe
vyarthe yAte sameto jvarapatirashanairajvari tvajjvareNa |
j~nAnI stutvA.atha datvA tava charitajuShAM vijvaraM sa jvaro.agAt
prAyo.antarj~nAnavanto.api cha bahutamasA raudracheShTA hi raudrA: ||7||
---------
chApAnAM pa~nchashatyA
by bows five hundred
prasabham-upagate
fiercely attacking
Chinna-chApe-atha bANe
breaking of the bows then of Baana
vyarthe yAta:
fruitlessly returning
sameta: jvarapati:-
came the head of all fevers the Shaiva fever
ashanai:-ajvari
immediately tormented
tvat-jvareNa
by Thy (the Vaishnava fever)
j~nAnI stutvA-atha
the enlightened (Shaiva fever) praising then
datvA tava charitajuShAM
giving to the (devotees) admirers of Thy excellences
vijvaraM sa jvara:-agAt
freedom, that (Shaiva) fever went away
prAya:-anta:-j~nAnvanta:-api
often inner knowledge having even
cha bahu-tamasA
and by much of Tamas
raudra-cheShTA hi raudrA:
ferociously act indeed the Rudras

Baana came attacking ferociously with 500 bows and arrows, but his weapons being severed he had to retreat. Thereupon, the head of all the obsession, the Shaiva obsession came to the forefront but was immediately put out by the Vaishnava obsession. The enlightened Shaivas gave freedom to all those that sung Thy excellences and went away praising Thee. Often the enlightened Rudras also act ferociously, being predominated by Tamas.
---------
bANaM nAnAyudhograM punarabhipatitaM darpadoShAdvitanvan
nirlUnAsheShadoShaM sapadi bubudhuShA sha~NkareNopagIta: |
tadvAchA shiShTabAhudvitayamubhayato nirbhayaM tatpriyaM taM
muktvA taddattamAno nijapuramagama: sAniruddha: sahoSha: ||8||

bANaM nAnA-Ayudha-ugram
Baana with various weapons more ferocious
puna:-abhipatitaM
again having attacked
darpa-doShAt-vitanvan
due to the vice of arrogance, made him
nirlUna-asheSha-doShaM
by cutting off all his vices (arms)
sapadi bubudhuShA
soon (a) realized (person)
sha~NkareNa-upagIta:
by Shankara and praised (Thee)
tat-vAchA
by his request
shiShTa-bAhu-dvitayam-ubhayata:
left with arms two on both sides
nirbhayaM tat-priyaM taM
unafraid his devotee him
muktvA
letting off
tat-datta-mAna:
by him giving honour
nija-puram-agama:
to Thy own city returned
sAniruddha sahoSha:
with Aniruddha (and) with Ushaa
---------
Baana again attacked ferociously full of arrogance with his many various weapons. Thou made him devoid of all vice and his many arms by cutting them off. Shankara soon realised Thy greatness and praised Thee and on his request Thou let off Baana with his two arms on both sides. Baana who was then spared from the fear of death honoured Thee. Thou then returned to Thy city Dwaarikaa with Aniruddha and Ushaa.

muhustAvachChakraM varuNamajayo nandaharaNe
yamaM bAlAnItau davadahanapAne.anilasakham |
vidhiM vatsasteye girishamiha bANasya samare
vibho vishvotkarShI tadayamavatAro jayati te ||9||
---------
muhu:-tAvat-shakraM
again and again then Indra
varuNam-ajaya:
Varuna defeated
nanda-haraNe
when he had kidnapped Nanda Gopa
yamaM bAla-AnItau
Yama when he had taken away the (Guru's) children
dava-dahana-pAne-
the forest fire by drinking
anila-sakham
wind's friend Agni
vidhiM vatsa-steye
Brahmaa when the calves were stolen
girisham-ih
Shiva here
bANasya samare
in Baana's battle
vibho
O Lord!
vishva-utkarShI
all excelling
tat-ayam-avatAra:
therefore this incarnation (of Thee) (as Krishna)
jayati te
excels Thine

Thou indeed defeated Indra again and again, Varuna was defeated when he kidnapped Nandagopa and Yama was defeated by Thee when he took away the children of Thy Guru. Agni, Vayu's friend was overcome when Thou drank it during the forest fire and Brahmaa was defeated when he stole away the calves. Shiva was defeated here in Baana's battle. Therefore, O Lord! this incarnation of Thee excels and wins over all other of Thy incarnations.
---------
dvijaruShA kRRikalAsavapurdharaM nRRiganRRipaM tridivAlayamApayan |
nijajane dvijabhaktimanuttamAmupadishan pavaneshvar pAhi mAm ||10||

dvija-ruShA
by a holy Braahmin's anger
kRRikalAsa:-vapu:-dharaM
in a chameleon's body form
nRRiga-nRRipaM
Nriga king
tridiva-Alayam-
to the god's abode (heaven)
Apayan
sending
nija-jane
in Thy people (devotees)
dvija-bhaktim-anuttamAm-
for Braahminas respect supreme
upadishan
instructing
pavaneshvara pAhi mAm
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
---------
King Nriga who was reduced to the body of a chameleon by a holy Braahmin's curse, was purified and sent to heaven by Thee. By this Thou instructed Thy devotees to have supreme respect for holy Braahmins. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Save me.

Narayaneeyam D083

Dashaka 83
---------
rAme.atha gokulagate pramadAprasakte
hUtAnupetayamunAdamane madAndhe |
svairaM samAramati sevakavAdamUDho
dUtaM nyayu~Nkta tava pauNDrakavAsudeva: ||1||
---------
rAme-atha
Thou (when) Balaraam
gokula-gate
had gone to Gokul
pramadA-prasakte
with the damsels sporting
hUta-anupeta-
when called , not coming
yamunA-damane
Yamunaa to subdue
madAndhe
intoxicated (Balaraam)
svairaM samAramati
at will sporting around
sevaka-vAd-mUDha:
subordinate's advice misled by
dUtaM nyayu~Nkta
messenger sent
tava
to Thee
pauNDraka-vAsudeva
Paundraka Vaasudeva

Then when intoxicated Balaraam was sporting happily and at will with the damsels, he called over Yamuna to him. When Yamuna did not comply to his wishes he subdued her by turning her course. At that time Paundraka Vaasudeva misled by the ill advice of his subordinates, sent a messenger to Thee.
---------
nArAyaNo.ahamavatIrNa ihAsmi bhUmau
dhatse kila tvamapi mAmakalakShaNAni |
utsRRijya tAni sharaNaM vraja mAmiti tvAM
dUto jagAda sakalairhasita: sabhAyAm ||2||

nArAyaNa:-aham-
Naaraayana am I
avatIrNa iha-asmi bhUmau
descended here have I on earth
dhatse kila tvam-api
bear indeed you also
mAmaka-lakShaNAni
my emblems
utsRRijya tAni
abandon them
sharaNaM vraja mAm-iti
surrender take unto me, thus
tvAM dUta: jagAda
to Thee the messenger said
sakalai:-hasita:
while every one laughed
sabhAyAm
in the assembly
---------
I am Naaraayana and have descended here on this earth. It seems you too bear my emblems. Abandon them and surrender unto me.' Thus the messenger said to Thee to the amusement of all in the assembly.

dUte.atha yAtavati yAdavasainikaistvaM
yAto dadarshitha vapu: kila pauNDrakIyam |
tApena vakShasi kRRitA~NkamanalpamUlya-
shrIkaustubhaM makarakuNDalapItachelam ||3||
---------
dUte-atha yAtavati
the messenger, when had departed
yAvada-sainikai:-tvaM
with the Yaadava army Thou
yAta: dadarshitha
went and saw
vapu: kila pauNDrakIyam
the body indeed of Poundraka
tApena vakShasi
by heat on the chest
kRRita-a~Nkam-
was made a mark
analpa-mUlya-
not of little cost
shrI kaustubhaM
Shri Kaustubha
makara-kuNDala
fish shaped ear ornaments
pIta-chelam
(and) yellow silk garment

After the messenger had departed, Thou went with the Yaadava army to the capital of Paundraka. There Thou saw the ridiculous form of Paundraka's body marked by a burnt sign (representing Srivatsa) an invaluable gem round his neck (representing the Kaustubha) and wearing also fish shaped ear ornaments and a yellow silk garment.
---------
kAlAyasaM nijasudarshanamasyato.asya
kAlAnalotkarakireNa sudarshanena |
shIrShaM chakartitha mamarditha chAsya senAM
tanmitrakAshipashiro.api chakartha kAshyAm ||4||

kAla-AyAsaM
of black iron
nija-sudarshanam-
his own Sudarshana
asyata:-asya
throwing, his
kAla-anala-utkara-
cosmic fire sparks
kireNa sudarshanen
emitted by the Sudarshana
shIrSham chakartitha
(his) head cut off
mamarditha cha asya senAM
and crushed his army
tat-mitra-kAshipa-
his friend Kaashi's
shira:-api chakartha
head also cut off
kAshyAm
(and sent) into Kaashi
---------
Paundraka threw his own Sudershana made of black iron at Thee. Thou then cut off his head by Thy Sudarshana which was emitting sparks of cosmic fire, and crushed his army. Thou also cur off the head of his friend Kaashi and hurled it into Kaashi itself.

jAlyena bAlakagirA.api kilAhameva
shrIvAsudeva iti rUDhamatishchiraM sa: |
sAyujyameva bhavadaikyadhiyA gato.abhUt
ko nAma kasya sukRRitaM kathamityaveyAt ||5||
---------
jAlyen
due to stupidity
bAlaka-girA-api
by immature words even
kila-aham-eva
indeed I only (am)
shrI-vAsudeva iti
Shree Vaasudeva, thus
rUDhamati:-chiraM sa:
firmly believing for long he
sAyujyam-eva
union (with Thee) only
bhavat-aikya-dhiyA
with Thee oneness by thinking
gata:-abhot
attained
ka: nAma
who indeed (knows)
kasya sukRRitaM
whose good deeds
katham-iti-aveyAt
in which way (come about), knows

It may be due to stupidity or due to believing the immature words of young people that Paundraka for long firmly believed in his mind that he himself was indeed Vaasudeva. This thought made him constantly be in oneness with Thee and so he attained Saayujya (union with Thee). Who knows whose good deeds lead him where and to what credit?
---------
kAshIshvarasya tanayo.atha sudakShiNAkhya:
sharvaM prapUjya bhavate vihitAbhichAra: |
kRRityAnalaM kamapi bANraraNAtibhItai-
rbhUtai: katha~nchana vRRitai: samamabhyamu~nchat ||6||

kAshI-Ishvarasya
Kaashi king's
tanaya:-atha
son then
sudakShiNa-Akhya:
Sudakshina by name
sharvaM prapUjya
Shankara worshipping well
bhavate vihita-
in The performed
abhichAra:
black magic
kRRityA-analaM
Krityaa fire
kam-api
some (fierce and evil)
bANa-raNa-ati-bhItai:-
in Baana's battle very frightened
bhUtai: katha~nchana vRRitai:
by those Bhootas somehow followed by
samam-abhyamu~nchat
with them released
---------
Then the son of the king of Kaashi, called Sudakshina fervently worshipped Shankara. He performed black magic on Thee and released an evil fierce fire named Krityaa. He also somehow mobilised the Bhootas who were frightened during the battle Thou fought with Baana.

tAlapramANacharaNAmakhilaM dahantIM
kRRityAM vilokya chakitai: kathito.api paurai: |
dyUtotsave kimapi no chalito vibho tvaM
pArshvasthamAshu visasarjitha kAlachakram ||7||
---------
tAla-pramANa-charaNAm-
palm trees like long legged
akhilaM dahantIM
everything burning
kRRityAM vilokya
Krityaa seeing
chakitai:
by the frightened
kathita:-api paurai:
Thou being informed even by citizens
dyUta-utsave
in the dice game
kim-api no chalita:
in the least not moving
vibho tvaM
O Lord Thou!
pArshvastham-Ashu
placed near by immediately
visasarjitha
deployed
kAla-chakram
Sudarshana discus

The frightened citizens saw the Krityaa fire with long legs like palm trees burning everything and they informed Thee of this. Thou without stirring from Thy seat at the game of dice in which Thou were engrossed, deployed O Lord! Thy Sudarshana discus which was ready at hand.
---------
abhyApatatyamitadhAmni bhavanmahAstre
hA heti vidrutavatI khalu ghorakRRityA|
roShAt sudakShiNamadakShiNacheShTitaM taM
puploSha chakramapi kAshipurImadhAkShIt ||8||

abhyApatati-
dashing
amita-dhAmni
the ever brilliant
bhavat-mahA-astre
Thy great weapon
hA hA-iti
oh oh thus shouting
vidrutavatI
running away
khalu ghora-kRRityA
indeed the terrible Krityaa
roShAt sudakShiNam-
in anger Sudakshina
adakShiNa-cheShTitaM taM
the impious actioned, him
puploSha chakram-api
burnt down discus also
kAshi-purIm-adhAkShIt
the Kaashi city burnt down
---------
Thy ever brilliant great weapon dashed towards Krityaa. The terrible Krityaa ran away shouting in distress and in anger burnt down the impious actioned Sudakshina himself. Thy Sudarshana discus in turn burnt down the city of Kaashi.

sa khalu vivido rakShoghAte kRRitopakRRiti: purA
tava tu kalayA mRRityuM prAptuM tadA khalatAM gata: |
narakasachivo deshakleshaM sRRijan nagarAntike
jhaTiti halinA yudhyannaddhA papAta talAhata: ||9||
---------
sa khalu vivida:
he indeed Vividha
rakShoghAte
in the Raakshasa's killing
kRRita-upakRRiti: purA
had given help long ago
tava tu kalayA
by Thy part incarnation
mRRityuM prAptuM
death to get
tadA khalatAM gata:
then to wickedness took
naraka-sachiva:
Narakaasura's minister
desha-kleshaM sRRijan
to public suffering causing
nagara-antike
near the town of Dwaarika
jhaTiti halinA
immediately with Balaraama
yudhyan-addhA
fighting with ease
papAta-tala-Ahata:
fell down hit by the palm

Long ago Vividha, the monkey who had helped Thee in killing the Raakshasas (during Thy incarnation as Raama) nursed the desire to be killed by Thy part incarnation. As a minister of Narakaasura, he took to evil ways and started creating sufferings for the people in the vicinity of Dwaarika. In a fight with Balaraama, he was killed with ease by a blow of Balaraam's hand in no time.
---------
sAmbaM kauravyaputrIharaNaniyamitaM sAntvanArthI kurUNAM
yAtastadvAkyaroShoddhRRitakarinagaro mochayAmAsa rAma: |
te ghAtyA: pANDaveyairiti yadupRRitanAM nAmuchastvaM tadAnIM
taM tvAM durbodhalIlaM pavanapurapate tApashAntyai niSheve ||10||

sAmbaM
Saamba (who was)
kauravya-putrI-haraNa-
(due to) Kuru's daughter's abducting
niyamitaM
in captivity
sAntvanA-arthI
to pacify
kurUNAM yAta:-
the Kurus went
tat-vAkya-roSha-
by their talks enraged
uddhRRita-karinagara:
lifted up Hastinaapur
mochayAmAsa rAma:
(and) released (Saamba) Balaraam
te ghAtyA:
they, the Kurus should be killed
pANDaveyai:-iti
by the Paandavas, thus
yadu-pRRitanAM
the Yadu army
na-amucha:-tvaM tadAnIM
did not send Thee, then
taM tvAM durbodhalIlaM
that Thou of unfathomable sportings
pavanapurapate
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
tApa-shAntyai niSheve
for the sufferings to be removed (I) worship
---------
Saamba was a captive of the Kurus because he had abducted their daughter. Balaraam went to the Kurus to pacify them but was enraged by their talks and lifted up Hastinaapur and released Saamba. Thou did not send the Yaadava army to confront them, because Thou wanted that the Kurus be killed by the Paandavas. Thou whose sporting ways are unfathomable, O Lord of Guruvaayur! I worship Thee so as to remove my sufferings.

Narayaneeyam D084

Dashaka 84
---------
kvachidatha tapanoparAgakAle puri nidadhat kRRitavarmakAmasUnU |
yadukulamahilAvRRita: sutIrthaM samupagato.asi samantapa~nchakAkhyam ||1||
---------
kvachit-atha
once then
tapana-uparAga-kAle
in the solar eclipse time
puri nidadhat
in the city leaving
kRRitavarma-kAmasUnU
Kritavarma and Aniruddha
yadukul-mahilA-AvRRita:
the Yadus and their women folk along with
sutIrthaM samupagata:-asi
to the holy spot (Thou) went
samantapa~nchaka-Akhyam
Samantapanchaka known as

Once then during the time of Solar eclipse, leaving behind Kritvarma and Anirudhdha in charge of Dwaarika, Thou went to the holy spot known as Samantapanchaka, along with the Yaadava clan and their womenfolk.
---------
bahutarajanatAhitAya tatra tvamapi punan vinimajya tIrthatoyam |
dvijagaNaparimuktavittarAshi: samamilathA: kurupANDavAdimitrai: ||2||

bahutara-janatA-hitAya
for the large number of peoples benefit
tatra tvam-api
there Thou also
punan
sanctifying
vinimajya tIrtha-toyam
dipping into the holy waters
dvija-gaNa-parimukta-
for the Braahmin groups giving away
vitta-rAshi:
money in large quantity
samamilathA:
(Thou) interacted
kuru-pANDava-Adi-mitrai:
with the Kauravas and Pandavas and other friends
---------
Thou also took a dip in the holy waters and thereby sanctified the waters for the benefit of the large number of people. Thou also gave away money in good amount to the group of the Braahmins. Then Thou interacted with Thy friends the Kauravas and the Paandavas and others.

tava khalu dayitAjanai: sametA drupadasutA tvayi gADhabhaktibhArA |
taduditabhavadAhRRitiprakArai: atimumude samamanyabhAminIbhi: ||3||
---------
tava khalu dayitA-janai:
Thy indeed with the wives
sametA
mixing
drupadasutA tvayi
Draupadi in Thee
gADha-bhakti-bhArA
deep devotion carrying
tat-udita-
by them said
bhavat-AhRRiti-prakArai:
Thy carrying (them) away methods
ati-mumude
was very delighted
samam-anya-bhAminIbhi:
with other women

Draupadi who was deeply devoted to Thee, freely mixed with Thy wives. She was very much delighted when they narrated the various methods by which they were abducted and married by Thee. The other women also enjoyed the narrations.
---------
tadanu cha bhagavan nirIkShya gopAnatikutukAdupagamya mAnayitvA|
chirataravirahAturA~NgarekhA: pashupavadhU: sarasaM tvamanvayAsI: ||4||

tadanu cha bhagavan
and after that O Lord!
nirIkShya gopAn-
seeing the gopas
ati-kutukAt-
with great joy
upagamya mAnayitvA
approaching and honoring them
chiratara-viraha-Atura-
for very long separation (from Thee) suffering
a~Nga-rekhA:
body frailed
pashupa-vadhU:
the gopikas
sarasaM tvam-anvayAsI:
joyfully Thee approached
---------
After that O Lord! Seeing the gopas Thou approached and honoured them with great joy. The gopikas had become frail in body due to the sorrow of separation from Thee for a very long time. Thou joyfully went to them also.

sapadi cha bhavadIkShaNotsavena pramuShitamAnahRRidAM nitambinInAm |
atirasaparimuktaka~nchulIke parichayahRRidyatare kuche nyalaiShI: ||5||
---------
sapadi cha
and soon
bhavat-IkShaNa-utsavena
Thee seeing celebration
pramuShita-mAna-hRRidAm
wiped away the complaints from their hearts
nitambinInAm
of the beautiful women
ati-rasa-parimukta-
intense love giving away
ka~nchulIke
their bodices
parichaya-hRRidyatare
in the familiar and very dear
kuche nyalaiShI:
breasts (Thou) got absorbed

Instantly then, celebrating the joy of Thy sight all complaints from the hearts of the beautiful women were wiped away. With the intense love welled up, their bodices burst open revealing their very dear familiar breasts where Thou got absorbed.
---------
ripujanakalahai: puna: punarme samupagatairiyatI vilambanA.abhUt |
iti kRRitaparirambhaNetvayi drAk ativivashA khalu rAdhikA nililye ||6||

ripu-jana-kalahai:
enemies in conflict
puna: puna:-
again and again
me samupagatai:-
my, by happening
iyatI vilambanA-
so much delay
abhUt
became
iti kRRita-parirambhaNe-
thus making embrace
tvayi drAk
by Thee immediately
ativivashA
very overwhelmed
khalu rAdhikA
indeed Raadhika
nililye
became absorbed
---------
Raadhikaa was totally absorbed in Thee when Thou embraced her and told her that so much delay was caused in meeting her and the gopikas because of frequent clashes with the enemies.

apagatavirahavyathAstadA tA rahasi vidhAya dadAtha tattvabodham |
paramasukhachidAtmako.ahamAtmetyudayatu va: sphuTameva chetasIti ||7||
---------
apagata-viraha-vyathA:-
(who were) free of the separation pangs
tadA tA:
then they (the gopikas)
rahasi vidhAya
privately making
dadAtha tattva-bodham
gave the knowledge of Reality
parama-sukha-chit-
Supreme Bliss Consciousness
Atmaka:-aham-AtmA-
Brahamana am I, the self
iti-udayatu va:
thus may dawn in you
sphuTam-eva
very clearly only
chetasi-iti
in your hearts, thus

Then the gopikas were rendered free from the pangs of separation as Thou gave them the knowledge of Supreme self privately. Thou instilled into their hearts that Thou were the Supreme Bliss Consciousness and the Supreme Brahaman, their inner most self.
---------
sukharasaparimishrito viyoga: kimapi purA.abhavaduddhavopadeshai: |
samabhavadamuta: paraM tu tAsAM paramasukhaikyamayI bhavadvichintA ||8||

sukha-rasa-parimishrita:
with joy mixed
viyoga: kim-api
separation somehow
purA-abhavat-
formerly happened
uddhava-upadeshai:
by Uddhava's preachings
samabhavat-amuta:
(but) happened by this
paraM tu tAsAm
after (this) indeed to them
param-sukha-aikyamayI
Supreme Blissful Union
bhavat-vichintA
(with Thee by) Thy (mere) thought
---------
There remained a feeling of joy mixed with the sorrow of separation when long back the gopikas were advised by Uddhava. But after this instruction by Thee, they indeed were experiencing Supreme Blissful Union with Thee by a mere thought of Thee.

munivaranivahaistavAtha pitrA duritashamAya shubhAni pRRichChyamAnai: |
tvayi sati kimidaM shubhAntarai: rityuruhasitairapi yAjitastadA.asau ||9||
---------
muni-vara-nivahai:-
by the great sages groups
tava-atha pitrA
Thy then father
durita-shamAya
for son's atonement
shubhAni
auspicious rites
pRRichChyamAnai:
were being asked
tvayi sati
Thou being there
kim-idam-shubha-antarai:-
what this auspicious rite others
iti-uru-hasitai:-api
thus loudly laughing also
yAjita:-tadA-asau
made to perform sacrifices then he (Vasudeva)

Vasudeva asked the assembly of the great sages about the auspicious rites to be performed for the atonement for the sins. Even though the sages were very amused and laughed at such an enquiry, because having Thee as a son there was no need for any atonements. But they made him perform the required rites all the same.
---------
sumahati yajane vitAyamAne pramuditamitrajane sahaiva gopA: |
yadujanamahitAstrimAsamAtraM bhavadanuSha~NgarasaM pureva bheju : ||10||

sumahati yajane
during the very big sacrifice
vitAyamAne
which was being performed
pramudita-mitra-jane
with the delighted friends
saha-eva gopA:
also along with the gopas
yadu-jana-mahitA:
by the Yaadavas honoured
tri-mAsa-mAtraM
for three months
bhavat-anuSha~Nga-rasaM
Thy company's pleasure
purA-eva bheju:
like the olden times enjoyed
---------
The very big sacrifice was performed which lasted for three months. During that time Thy friends and the gopas were honoured by the Yaadavas and they enjoyed Thy company's pleasure like in the olden days.

vyapagamasamaye sametya rAdhAM dRRiDhamupagUhya nirIkShya vItakhedAm |
pramuditahRRidaya: puraM prayAta: pavanapureshvara pAhi mAM gadebhya: ||11||
---------
vyapagama-samaye
at the departing time
sametya rAdhAm
approaching Raadhaa
dRRiDham-upagUhya
tightly embracing
nirIkShya vIta-khedAm
seeing (her) free from sorrow
pramudita-hRRidaya:
with a happy heart
puram-prayAta:
Thou went back (to Dwaarika)
pavanapureshvara
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
pAhi mAM gadebhya:
save me from ailments

At the time of departing Thou approached Raadhaa. As Thou held her in a tight embrace Thou were happy to see her free from all sorrow of separation or otherwise. Thou returned to Dwaarikaa with a happy heart. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Save me from all ailments.

Narayaneeyam D085

Dashaka 85
---------
tato magadhabhUbhRRitA chiranirodhasaMkleshitaM
shatAShTakayutAyutadvitayamIsha bhUmIbhRRitAm |
anAthasharaNAya te kamapi pUruShaM prAhiNo-
dayAchata sa mAgadhakShapaNameva kiM bhUyasA ||1||
---------
tata: magadha-bhUbhRRitA
then by the Magadh king
chira-nirodha-saMkleshitaM
for long detained (and so) tormented
shata-aShTaka-yuta-ayuta-dvitayam-
hundred eights along with ten thousand twice (20800)
Isha
O Lord!
bhUmIbhRRitAm
of kings
anAtha-sharaNAya te
for the helpless the only refuge, Thee
kam-api pUruSham
some person
prAhiNot-ayAchata sa
sent prayed he
mAgadha-kShapaNam-eva
Maagadha's (king of Magadha's) killing only
kim bhUyasA
why say much

O Lord! The Magadha king Jaraasandh had 20800 kings as captives in his prison. The tormented kings sent a person as a messenger to Thee, the only refuge of the helpless. He prayed to Thee to kill the king of Magadha. What more can be said.
---------
yiyAsurabhimAgadhaM tadanu nAradodIritA-
dyudhiShThiramakhodyamAdubhayakAryaparyAkula: |
viruddhajayino.adhvarAdubhayasiddhirityuddhave
shashaMsuShi nijai: samaM puramiyetha yaudhiShThirIm ||2||

yiyAsu:-
desiring to attack
abhimAgadhaM
against the king of Magadha
tadanu nArada-udIritAt-
after that, by Naarada's saying
yudhiShThira-makha-udyamAt-
Yudhishthiraa's sacrifice preparations
ubhaya-kArya-paryAkula:
both the jobs priority (thinking)
viruddha-jayina:-adhvarAt-
enemies conquering and the sacrifice
ubhaya-siddhi:-iti-
both undertaken thus
uddhave shashaMsuShi
by Udhdhava being advised
nijai: samaM
with Thy people
puram-iyetha
to the city went
yaudhiShThirIm
of Yudhishthira
---------
Then eager to attack Jaraasandha, the king of Magadha, Thou were informed by Naarada that Yudhishthira was preparing to perform the Raajasooya Yagna. Thou were in a fix as to which of the two Thou should attend to. Udhdhava pointed that the sacrifice demanded that all the enemies be conquered, so by attending the sacrifice both the purposes will be fulfilled. With Thy followers Thou proceeded to attend the Raajsooya Yagna in Yudhishthiraa's city Indraprastha.

asheShadayitAyute tvayi samAgate dharmajo
vijitya sahajairmahIM bhavadapA~NgasaMvardhitai: |
shriyaM nirupamAM vahannahaha bhaktadAsAyitaM
bhavantamayi mAgadhe prahitavAn sabhImArjunam ||3||
---------
asheSha-dayitA-yute
all the wives along with
tvayi samAgate
Thou having reached
dharmaja: vijitya
Dharmaputra having conquered
sahajai:-mahIM
with the brothers the earth
bhavat-apA~Nga-saMvardhitai:
by Thy gracious glances (who had) grown in strength
shriyaM nirupamAM
wealth incomparable
vahan-ahaha
bearing, oh
bhakta-dAsAyitaM
of the devotees, services meeting
bhavantam-ayi
Thee Oh Thou
mAgadhe prahitavAn
to Jaraasandh sent
sabhIma-arjunam
along with Bheem and Arjuna

Thou reached Indraprastha along with all Thy wives. Enhanced in strength by Thy gracious glances, Dharmaputra with his brothers conquered all the opponents and amassed incomparable wealth. Oh Thou who are the servant of Thy devotees was then sent by Yudhishthira to Jaraasandha along with Bheem and Arjuna.
---------
girivrajapuraM gatAstadanu deva yUyaM trayo
yayAcha samarotsavaM dvijamiSheNa taM mAgadham |
apUrNasukRRitaM tvamuM pavanajena saMgrAmayan
nirIkShya saha jiShNunA tvamapi rAjayuddhvA sthita: ||4||

girivrajapuraM
to the city of Girivraja
gatA:-tadanu
went then
deva yUyaM traya:
O Lord Thou three
yayAcha samara-utsavaM
asked for a duel festival
dvija-miSheNa
in a Braahmina's guise
taM mAgadhaM
to that king of Magadha
apUrNa-sukRRitaM
short of good deeds
tu-amuM
indeed him
pavanajena saMgrAmayan
with Bheem making him fight
nirIkShya saha jiShNunA
seeing with Arjuna
tvam-api
Thou also
rAja-yuddhvA sthita:
as making two kings fight remained
---------
O Lord! Thou three then went to Girivraja the capital of Jaraasandha. In the guise of Braahmins Thou asked for a festival of dual. Thou made the king of Magadha, Jaraasandha, who was lacking in good deeds, fight with Bheem. Meanwhile, Thou and Arjuna remained as onlookers and 'Raajayudhva' i.e. who make kings fight.

ashAntasamaroddhataM biTapapATanAsaMj~nayA
nipAtya jararassutaM pavanajena niShpATitam |
vimuchya nRRipatIn mudA samanugRRihya bhaktiM parAM
dideshitha gataspRRihAnapi cha dharmaguptyai bhuva: ||5||
---------
ashAnt-samara-uddhataM
in the fierce fight (who had become) arrogant
viTapa-pATanA-saMj~nayA
twig splitting hinting at
nipAtya jarasa:-sutaM
felling down Jaraa's son (Jaraasandh)
pavanajena niShpATitam
by Bheem was split up
vimuchya nRRipatIn
releasing the kings
mudA samanugRRihya
happily blessing them
parAM bhaktiM dideshitha
supreme devotion gave
gata: spRRihAn-api
(who had) overcome all desires even
cha dharma-guptai bhuva:
and for ethically ruling the earth

Arrogant Jaraasandha was fighting ferociously in the battle. Thou gave a hint to Bheema (that Jaraa's son could be killed by splitting) by splitting a twig. Bheema then tore Jaraasandha apart and killed him. The captive kings were then released and Thou happily blessed them with supreme devotion. They were all devoid of all desire, yet Thou engaged them to rule the earth ethically and as per Dharma.
---------
prachakruShi yudhiShThire tadanu rAjasUyAdhvaraM
prasannabhRRitakIbhavatsakalarAjakavyAkulam |
tvamapyayi jagatpate dvijapadAvanejAdikaM
chakartha kimu kathyate nRRipavarasya bhAgyonnati: ||6||

prachakruShi
when performing
yudhiShThire
Yudhishthira
tadanu
then
rAjasUya-adhvaraM
the Raajasooya Yagna
prasanna-bhRRitakI-bhavat-
happily as servants becoming all the kings
sakala-rAjaka-vyAkulam
all the kings
vyakulam-tvam-api-
eagerly Thou also
ayi jagatpate
O Thou Lord of the world!
dvija-pada-avaneja-
Braahmina's feet washing
AdikaM chakartha
etc performed
kimu kathyate
what can be said
nRRipa-varasya
of the great king's
bhAgya-unnati:
fortune upliftment
---------
Yudhishthira was then performing the Raajsooya Yagna during which all the kings were joyfully performing the work allotted to them as servants. Thou O Lord of the Universe! Also were engaged in washing the feet of the holy men and the Braahmins etc. What can be said about the upliftment of the good fortune of the great king Yudhishthira?

tata: savanakarmaNi pravaramagryapUjAvidhiM
vichArya sahadevavAganugata: sa dharmAtmaja: |
vyadhatta bhavate mudA sadasi vishvabhUtAtmane
tadA sasuramAnuShaM bhuvanameva tRRiptiM dadhau ||7||
---------
tata: savana-karmaNi
then in the sacrificial rite
pravararm-agrya-pUjA-vidhiM
the important person's worship system
vichArya
foremost considering
sahadeva-vAk-anugata:
Sahadeva's advice following
sa dharmAtmaja:
that Dharmaputra Yudhishthira
vyadhatta bhavate
performed to Thee
mudA sadasi
in the delighted assembly
vishvabhUtAtmane
to Thee, the Soul of the whole Universe
tadA sa-sura-mAnuShaM
then along with the gods and humans
bhuvanam-eva
the entire universe
tRRiptim dadhau
satisfaction gave

According to the system of the sacrificial rite the most noteworthy of the guests assembled was honoured and worshipped foremost. While Yudhishthira was considering, he followed Sahadeva's advice and performed this worship to Thee, the Soul of the whole Universe. This gave great satisfaction to everyone, gods and humans alike.
---------
tata: sapadi chedipo muninRRipeShu tiShThatsvaho
sabhAjayati ko jaDa: pashupadurdurUTaM vaTum |
iti tvayi sa durvachovitatimudvamannAsanA-
dudApatadudAyudha: samapatannamuM pANDavA: ||8||

tata: sapadi chedipa:
then at once, the king of Chedi
muni-nRRipeShu
the sages and kings
tiShThatsu-aho
being present, strangely
sabhA-jayati
the assembly is honouring
ka: jaDa:
which fool
pashupa-durdurUTaM vaTum
a cowherd corrupt boy
iti tvayi sa
thus to Thee he
durvacha:-vitatam-
abusive words' string
udvaman-
spitting out
AsanAt-udApatat-
from his seat sprang up
udAyudha:
flourishing weapons
samapatan-amuM
confronted him
pANDavA:
the Pandavas
---------
Just then, at once, the king of Chedi, sprang up from his seat hurling a string of abusive words to Thee, 'In this assembly, in the presence of great sages and kings, which fool is honouring this corrupt cowherd boy?' he exclaimed. Saying so he flourished his weapons and was soon confronted by the Paandavas.

nivArya nijapakShagAnabhimukhasyavidveShiNa-
stvameva jahRRiShe shiro danujadAriNA svAriNA |
janustritayalabdhayA satatachintayA shuddhadhI-
stvayA sa paramekatAmadhRRita yoginAM durlabhAm ||9||
---------
nivArya nija-pakShagAn
deterring Thy allies
abhimukhasya vidveShiNa:-
confronting the adversary
tvam-eva jahRRiShe shira:
Thou alone cut off head
danuja-dAriNA sva-ariNA
the Asura's cutting Thy discus
janu:-tritaya-labdhayA
in births three gaining
satata-chintayA
constantly thinking (of Thee)
shuddha-dhI:-tvayA sa
purified minded with Thee he
para-ekatAm-adhRRita
supreme union attained
yoginAM durlabhAm
to Yogis difficult to attain

Thou deterred Thy allies, the Pandavas and Thyself cut off the head of the advancing adversary with Thy discus which cuts the Asuras. Chedi had gained a purified mind through his three births (as Hiranyakashipu, Raavana and Shishupa),where he was constantly thinking of Thee. Thus he attained the supreme union with Thee which is not easily attained by the Yogis.
---------
tata: sumahite tvayA kratuvare nirUDhe jano
yayau jayati dharmajo jayati kRRiShNa ityAlapan|
khala: sa tu suyodhano dhutamanAssapatnashriyA
mayArpitasabhAmukhe sthalajalabhramAdabhramIt ||10||

tata: sumahite
then the great
tvayA kratuvare
by Thee the highest sacrifice
nirUDhe jana:-yayau
being completed, people went away
jayati dharmaja:
victory to Dharmaputra
jayati kRRiShNa
victory to Krishna
iti-Alapan
thus proclaiming
khala: sa tu
wicked he indeed
suyodhana dhutamanA:-
Duryodhana, jealous minded
sapatna-shriyA
by the enemy's prosperity
maya-arpita-sabhA-mukhe
by Maya built the assembly hall in front (of that)
sthala-jala-bhramAt-
floor and water mistaking (for each other)
abhramIt
was confused
---------
Then the most holy and elaborate sacrifice, the Raajasooya Yagna being completed by Thee, the people returned loudly acclaiming Thee and Yudhishthira. The wicked Duryodhana's mind was full of jealousy at the sight of the enemy's prosperity. He was all the more confused when he mistook the floor for water and water for floor in front of the assembly hall which was built by the Asura's architect Maya, for the Pandavas.

tadA hasitamutthitaM drupadanandanAbhImayo-
rapA~NgakalayA vibho kimapi tAvadujjRRimbhayan |
dharAbharanirAkRRitau sapadi nAma bIjaM vapan
janArdana marutpurInilaya pAhi mAmAmayAt ||11||
---------
tadA hasitam-utthitaM
then the laughter which arose
drupadanandanA-bhImayo:-
of Draupadi and Bheema
apA~Nga-kalayA
by the corner of the eyes glancing
vibho kimapi tAvata-
O Lord! A little then
ujjRRimbhayan
encouraging
dadharA-bhara-nirAkRRitau
the earth's burden to remove
sapadi nAma
immediately indeed
bIjaM vapan
seed sowing
janArdana
O All pervading Lord!
marutpurInilaya
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
pAhi mAm-AmayAt
save me from ailments

O Lord! Then a loud laughter arose from Draupadi and Bheema instigated somewhat by Thy side long glances. O All pervading Lord! Immediately indeed the seed was sown by Thee to rid the earth of its burden. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Save me from my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D086

Dashaka 86
---------
sAlvo bhaiShmIvivAhe yadubalavijitashchandrachUDAdvimAnaM
vindan saubhaM sa mAyI tvayi vasati kuruMstvatpurImabhyabhA~NkShIt |
pradyumnastaM nirundhannikhilayadubhaTairnyagrahIdugravIryaM
tasyAmAtyaM dyumantaM vyajani cha samara: saptaviMshatyahAnta: ||1||
---------
sAlva: bhaiShmI-vivAhe
Saalva, in Rukmini's wedding
yadu-bala-vijita:-
by the Yaadava army conquered
chandrachUDAt-vimAnaM
from Shankara the aerial car
vindan saubhaM
getting the Saubha
sa mAyI tvayi
that elusive one, when Thou
vasati kurUn-
were in Kuru's city (Indraprastha)
tvat-purIm-abhyabhA~NkShIt
Thy city (Dwaarikaa) attacked
pradyumna:-taM
Pradyumna, him
nirundhan-
resisting
nikhila-yadu-bhaTai:-
with the entire Yadu army
nyagrahIt-ugra-vIryaM
killed very powerful
tasya-AmAtyaM dyumantaM
his minister Dyumanta
vyajani cha samara:
and the battle lasted
sapta-viMshati-ahAnta:
twenty seven days

Saalva of magical merits, who was defeated by the Yaadava army at the time of Rukmini's abduction, got Saubh the aerial car as a boon from Shivaa.When Thou were residing in the city of the Kurus, Indraprastha, Saalva attacked Thy city Dwaarika. Pradyumna resisted him heading the entire army of the Yaadavas, and killed his powerful minister Dyumanta. This battle lasted for 27 days.
---------
tAvattvaM rAmashAlI tvaritamupagata: khaNDitaprAyasainyaM
saubheshaM taM nyarundhA: sa cha kila gadayA shAr~NgamabhraMshayatte |
mAyAtAtaM vyahiMsIdapi tava puratastattvayApi kShaNArdhaM
nAj~nAyItyAhureke tadidamavamataM vyAsa eva nyaShedhIt ||2||

tAvat-tvam rAmashAlI
then Thou with Balaraam
tvaritam-upagata:
quickly reaching
khaNDita-prAya-sainyaM
almost destroying army
saubheshaM taM nyarundhA:
the owner of Saubh, him, confronted
sa cha kila gadayA
and he indeed with his mace
shAr~Ngam-abhraMshayat-te
Sharanga knocked down, Thine
mAyA-tAtaM
created by magic, father
vyahiMsIt-api
killed also
tava-purata:-tat-tvayA-api
in front of Thee, that by Thee also
kShaNArdhaM na-aj~nAyi-iti
for a second was not understood
Ahu:-eke tat-idam-avayataM
say some that, this difference of opinion
vyAsa eva nyaShedhIt
Vyaas himself refuted
---------
Along with Balaraam Thou quickly reached Dwaarika and confronted Saalva the owner of the aerial car Saubha whose army was almost destroyed. He knocked down Thy bow Shaaranga with a stroke of his mace. He even killed the likeness of Thy father which he had created by his magical abilities. Some say that even Thou were for a moment deceived by this illusion. But sage Vyaas has refuted this opinion.

kShiptvA saubhaM gadAchUrNitamudakanidhau ma~NkShu sAlve.api chakre-
NotkRRitte dantavaktra: prasabhamabhipatannabhyamu~nchadgadAM te |
kaumodakyA hato.asAvapi sukRRitanidhishchaidyavatprApadaikyaM
sarveShAmeSha pUrvaM tvayi dhRRitamanasAM mokShaNArtho.avatAra: ||3||
---------
kShiptvA saubhaM
throwing Saubha
gadA-chUrNitam-
by the mace smashed to powder
udakanidhau ma~NkShu
in the ocean, immediately
sAlve-api-chakreNa-
(when) Saalva also by (Sudarshana discus)
utkRRitte dantavaktra:
was cut off, Dantavaktra
prasabham-abhipatan-
violently attacking
abhyamu~nchat-gadAM te
hitting with the mace, Thee
kmodakyA
by Kaumudaki
hata:-asau-api
killed he also
sukRRiti-nidhi:-
the good deeds repository
chaidya-vat-prApat--aikyaM
like Chedi attained union
sarveShAm-eSha
for all, this
pUrvaM tvayi dhRRita-manasAM
from long in Thee had fixed their minds
mokShaNa-artha:-avatAra:
to liberate was the purpose of the incarnation.

The aerial car Saubha was smashed to pieces with a mace and thrown into the sea, Saalva's head was also cut off by Thy Sudershana discus. Dantavaktra then attacked Thee violently and hit Thee with his mace, thereupon Thou killed him, the repository of good deeds, with Thy mace Kaumodaki. He was fortunate like Shishupal (Chedi) and others who had attained union with Thee. The purpose of this incarnation of Thee was to give liberation to all those who had for long fixed their minds on Thee.
---------
tvayyAyAte.atha jAte kila kurusadasi dyUtake saMyatAyA:
krandantyA yAj~nasenyA: sakaruNamakRRithAshchelamAlAmanantAm |
annAntaprAptasharvAMshajamunichakitadraupadIchintito.atha
prApta: shAkAnnamashnan munigaNamakRRithAstRRiptimantaM vanAnte ||4||

tvayi-AyAte-atha
(when) Thou went back (to Dwaarika)
jAte kila kurusadasi
took place indeed (then) in the Kuru assembly
dyUtake saMyatAyA:
in the (fraudulent) game of dice was dragged
krandantyA yAj~nasenyA:
crying Draupadi
sakaruNam-akRRithA:-
piteously, Thou did
chela-mAlAm-anantAm
her clothing of length endless
anna-anta-prApta-
(after) the food was over, arriving
sharvAMshaja-muni-
by a part of Shankara (born), Muni (Durwaasaa)
chakit-draupadI-
by frightened Draupadi
chintita:-atha prApta:
being thought of Thee, then, reaching there
shAka-annam-ashnan
some leafy vegetable (left over) eating
munigaNam-akRRithA:-
the sage and his men made
tptim-antam vanAnte
satiated fully, in the end of the forest.
---------
After Thy return to Dwaarikaa, a fraudulent game of dice took place in the assembly of the Kurus. Draupadi was dragged there by her hair. Piteously and helplessly crying she prayed to Thee. With compassion Thou endowed her with endless length of clothing. Further, when living in the forest, Draupadi was very frightened because sage Durvaasaa had come there with his people when the food was over. Draupadi again thought of Thee and Thou came to her rescue and ate a bit of the left over leafy vegetable and thereby satiated fully the hunger of the sage and his retinue.

yuddhodyoge.atha mantre milati sati vRRita: phalgunena tvameka:
kauravye dattasainya: karipuramagamo dUtyakRRit pANDavArtham |
bhIShmadroNAdimAnye tava khalu vachane dhikkRRite kauraveNa
vyAvRRiNvan vishvarUpaM munisadasi purIM kShobhayitvAgato.abhU: ||5||
---------
yuddha-udyoge-atha
for the war preparations, then
mantre milati sati
strategies were being made
vRRita: phalgunena tvam-eka:
desired by Arjun Thou alone
kauravye datta-sainya:
to Duryodhana gave the army
karipuram-agama:
to Hastinaapur went
dUtya-kRRit pANDava-artham
in the role of a messenger for the Paandavas
bhIShma-droNa-Adi-mAnye
by Bhishma Drona and others (Thou) being honoured
tava khalu vachane
(by) Thy indeed by words
dhikkRRite kauraveNa
rejected by Duryodhana
vyAvRRiNvan vishvarUpaM
revealing the Cosmic form
muni-sadasi
in the sage's assembly
purIM kShobhayitvA-
the city shaking went away
gata:-abhU:
having, went away.

As the preparations of the war were on and strategies were decided, Arjuna asked Thee alone to be on his side. Agreeing to that, Thou gave Thy army to Duryodhana. Taking on the role of a messenger of the Pandavas, Thou went to Hastinaapur. Indeed Thy words were honoured by Bhishma, Drona and others but Duryodhana rejected them altogether. Revealing Thy Cosmic form in the assembly of the sages Thou shook up the entire Hastinaapur and returned to Dwaarikaa.
---------
jiShNostvaM kRRiShNa sUta: khalu samaramukhe bandhughAte dayAluM
khinnaM taM vIkShya vIraM kimidamayi sakhe nitya eko.ayamAtmA |
ko vadhya: ko.atra hantA tadiha vadhabhiyaM projjhya mayyarpitAtmA
dharmyaM yuddhaM chareti prakRRitimanayathA darshayan vishvarUpam ||6||

jiShNo:-tvaM
of Arjun Thou
kRRiShNa sUta: khalu
O Krishna! Charioteer indeed
samara-mukhe
in the face of the battle
bandhu-ghAte dayAluM
in the relations' killing pitiful
khinnaM taM vIkShya vIraM
saddened him, seeing that warrior
kim-idam-ayi sakhe
what is this O friend!
nitya:-eka:-ayam-AtmA
eternal and one this Aatmaa (self) is
ka: vadhya:
who is the slain
ka:-atra hantA
who here is the slayer
tat-iha
so here
vadha-bhiyaM projjhya
the killing fear giving up
mayi-arpita-AtmA
in me surrendering yourself
dharmyam yuddhaM chara-iti
the righteous war carry out
prakRRitim-anayathA:
to a balanced state of mind (thus) brought (him)
darshayan vishvarUpam
showing the cosmic form.
---------
In Thy role as Arjuna's charioteer, Thou saw the warrior sad and dejected in the face of the war, with the pitiful thought of having to kill his relations and his own people. Thou said to him 'O Friend! What is this? Aatman is eternal and only one. Who is the slain and who is the slayer here? Therefore giving up all fear of killing, surrender yourself to Me and carry out this righteous war.' By saying so and showing him Thy cosmic form, Thou brought Arjuna back to a balanced state of mind.

bhaktottaMse.atha bhIShme tava dharaNibharakShepakRRityaikasakte
nityaM nityaM vibhindatyayutasamadhikaM prAptasAde cha pArthe |
nishshastratvapratij~nAM vijahadarivaraM dhArayan krodhashAlI-
vAdhAvan prA~njaliM taM natashirasamatho vIkShya modAdapAgA: ||7||
---------
bhakta-uttaMse-atha bhIShme
the leading devotee, then, Bheeshma
tava dharaNi-bhara-kShepa-
Thy (purpose of) the earth's burden reducing
kRRitye-eka-sakte
in fulfilling alone engaged
nityaM nityaM vibhindati-
everyday destroying
ayuta-sama-adhikaM
ten thousand about or more
prApta-sAde cha pArthe
and coming to exhaustion of Arjuna,
nishshastratva-pratij~nAM
not taking up arms, the vow
vijahat-arivaraM
discarding, the great discus
dhArayan krodhashAlI-
holding, in anger
iva-adhAvan
as if running
prA~njaliM taM
with joined hands him
natashirasam-atha
(and) bowed head then
vIkShya modAt-apAgA:
seeing, with joy were full.

Bhishma, one of the leading devotees was intent on helping in fulfilling Thy purpose of reducing the burden of the earth, and was killing almost 10,000 warriors everyday. Arjuna had become very exhausted in resisting Bheeshma. Forgetting Thy vow of not taking up arms in the war, Thou rushed towards Bheeshma with Thy great discus in hand as though in great anger. Bheeshma stood with folded hands and bent down his head as Thou approached him. Seeing him thus Thou were full of joy and desisted from attacking him.
---------
yuddhe droNasya hastisthiraraNabhagadatteritaM vaiShNavAstraM
vakShasyAdhatta chakrasthagitaravimahA: prArdayatsindhurAjam |
nAgAstre karNamukte kShitimavanamayan kevalaM kRRittamauliM
tatre trApi pArthaM kimiva nahi bhavAn pANDavAnAmakArShIt ||8||

yuddhe droNasya
in the fight with Drona
hasti-sthira-
on an elephant firmly seated
raNa-bhagadatta-IritaM
the fighting Bhagadatta discharged
vaiShNava-astraM
the Vaishnava (Naaraayana) missile
vakShasi-Adhatta
on (Thy) chest took
chakra-sthagita-
in (Thy) Sudarshana discus hiding
ravi-mahA:
the sun's rays
prArdayat-sindhurAjaM
got killed Jayadratha
nAga-astre karNa-mukte
the Naaga missile discharged by Karna
kShitim-avanamayan
the earth, by lowering it down
kevalaM kRRitta-mauliM
only was cut off the crown
tatre tatra-api pArthaM
saved there also was Arjuna
kim-iva nahi bhavAn
what all did not Thou
pANDavAnAm-akArShIt
of the Pandavas, do good
---------
When the fight with Drona was going on Bhagadatta who was firmly seated on an elephant discharged the Vaishnava missile which Thou attracted towards Thy own chest and saved Arjuna. Arjuna was able to kill Jayadratha when Thy Sudarshana discus hid the rays of the sun. Again when Karna discharged the Naaga missile towards Arjuna, Thou lowered the earth by the pressure of Thy toe, so that only Arjun's crown got cut off and Arjuna was saved here also. What all did Thou not do for the benefit of the Paandavas.

yuddhAdau tIrthagAmI sa khalu haladharo naimishakShetramRRichCha-
nnapratyutthAyisUtakShayakRRidatha sutaM tatpade kalpayitvA |
yaj~naghnaM valkalaM parvaNi paridalayan snAtatIrtho raNAnte
samprApto bhImaduryodhanaraNamashamaM vIkShya yAta: purIM te ||9||
---------
yuddha-Adau tIrtha-gAmI
at the beginning of the battle, going for pilgrimage
sa khalu haladhara:
that indeed Balaraama
naimisha-kShetram-RRichChan-
the Naimishyaaranya area covering
apratyutthAyi-sUta-
who had not stood up in respect, that Suta
kShaya-kRRit-atha
killing then
sutaM tat-pade
his son on his seat
kalpayitvA
installing
yaj~naghnaM valkalaM
the destroyer of the Yangyas, Valkala (an Asura)
parvaNi paridalayan
during the full moon and new moon days, killing
snAta-tIrtha:
completing the pilgrimage
raNa-ante samprApta:
towards the end of the war returning
bhIma-duryodhana-raNam-
the Bheema and Duryodhana fight
ashamaM vIkShya yAta:
prolonged, seeing
purIM te
to city, Thine.

Just when the war was to begin Balaraama had gone away on a pilgrimage. He first covered the holy area of Naimishaaranya. Then he killed Suta for not having got up to honour him and installed his son in his place. Then he destroyed the Asura Valkala, who used to destroy the Yagnyas carried out on the full moon and new moon days. Completing his pilgrimage he returned to Kurukshetra. There when he saw the prolonged fight between Bheema and Duryodhana, he went away to Thy city of Dwaarika.
---------
saMsuptadraupadeyakShapaNahatadhiyaM drauNimetya tvaduktyA
tanmuktaM brAhmamastraM samahRRita vijayo mauliratnaM cha jahre |
uchChityai pANDavAnAM punarapi cha vishatyuttarAgarbhamastre
rakShanna~NguShThamAtra: kila jaTharamagAshchakrapANirvibho tvam ||10||

saMsupta-draupadeya
deep in sleep, the sons of Draupadi
kShapaNa-hata-dhiyaM
having killed, the evil minded
drauNim-etya
Drona's son (Ashwatthaamaa) approaching
tvat-uktyA
by Thy saying
tat-muktaM brAhmam-astraM
discharged by him the Brahamaastra
samahRRita vijaya:
retracted Arjuna
mauliratnam cha jahre
and clipped off his crest jewel
uchChitai pANDavAnAM
to cut off the line of Paandavas
puna;-api cha
and again also
vishati-uttarA-garbham-
entering Uttaaraa's womb
astre rakShan-
by the weapon protecting
a~NguShTha-mAtra: kila
thumb sized merely indeed
jaTharam-agA:-
in her womb Thou went
chakrapANi:-vibho tvam
discus in hand, All Mighty! Thou.
---------
Drona's son, the evil minded Ashwatthaamaa had killed the sons of Draupadi when they were fast asleep. On Thy command Arjuna approached him and retracted the Brahmaastra discharged by him and clipped off his crest jewel.To cut off the line of the Paandavas, Ashwatthaamaa again sent the weapon into Uttara's womb to kill the foetus in there. To protect the foetus Thou entered her womb in the size of a thumb with Thy Sudarshana discus in hand.

dharmaughaM dharmasUnorabhidadhadakhilaM ChandamRRityussa bhIShma-
stvAM pashyan bhaktibhUmnaiva hi sapadi yayau niShkalabrahmabhUyam |
saMyAjyAthAshvamedhaistribhiratimahitairdharmajaM pUrNakAmaM
smprApto dvarakAM tvaM pavanapurapate pAhi mAM sarvarogAt ||11||
---------
dharmaughaM dharmasUno:-
the great Dharmas to Yudhishthira
abhidadhat-akhilaM
teaching in totality
Chanda-mRRityu:-sa bhIShma:-
moment of death, who could decide, he BheeShma
tvAM pashyan
Thee seeing
bhakti-bhUmnA-eva hi
by the devotional intensity alone
sapadi yayau
soon attained
niShkala-brahma-bhUyam
to indivisible Brahma state
saMyAjya-atha-
accomplishing then
ashva-medhai:-tribhi:-
Ashwamedha three
ati-mahitai:-
very great Yangysa
dharmajaM pUrNakAmaM
Yudhishthira was fulfilled of aspirations
samprApta: dvArakAM tvaM
returned to Dwaarikaa Thou
pavanapurapate
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
pAhi mAM sarvarogAt
save me from all diseases

The entire great Dharmas were taught to Yudhishthira by Bheeshma who could decide the moment of his death. On seeing Thee, by his devotional intensity alone he attained the indivisible state of Brahman. Thou enabled Yudhishthira to perform three great Ashwamedha Yangyas by which all his aspirations were fulfilled. Then Thou returned to Dwaarikaa. O Lord of Guruvaayur! save me from all diseases.

Narayaneeyam D087

Dashaka 87
---------
kuchelanAmA bhavata: satIrthyatAM gata: sa sAndIpanimandire dvija: |
tvadekarAgeNa dhanAdinisspRRiho dinAni ninye prashamI gRRihAshramI ||1||
---------
kuchela-nAmA
Kuchela named
bhavata: satIrthyatAM
with Thee (who was) a fellow disciple
gata: sa
went to, he
sAndipani-mandire
at sage Saandipani's hermitage
dvija:
that Braahmana
tvat-eka-rAgeNa
with Thee steadily devoted
dhana-Adi-nisspRRiha:
in wealth etc., desireless
dinAni ninye
days spent
prashamI gRRihAshramI
(as a) calm minded householder
