The Brahmin by the name Kuchela (Sudaamaa) was Thy fellow disciple in the hermitage of sage Saandipini. He was totally devoted to Thee. A house holder with a controlled mind and senses, he spent his days calmly without any worldly desires of wealth etc.
---------
samAnashIlA.api tadIyavallabhA tathaiva no chittajayaM sameyuShI |
kadAchidUche bata vRRittilabdhaye ramApati: kiM na sakhA niShevyate ||2||

samAna-shIlA-api
(being) of same nature even
tadIya-vallabhA
his wife
tathA-eva no
in the same manner did not
chitta-jayaM sameyuShI
mind control achieve
kadAchit-Uche bata
once said O!
vRRitti-labdhaye
a livelihood to get
ramApati:
the Consort of Laxmi
kiM na sakhA
why do not your friend
niShevyate
approach
---------
His wife who equalled him in nature , had not achieved the same level of desirelessness as him. Once she asked him why should he not approach his friend Krishna, the Consort of Laxmi, for getting some means of livelihood.

itIrito.ayaM priyayA kShudhArtayA jugupsamAno.api dhane madAvahe |
tadA tvadAlokanakautukAdyayau vahan paTAnte pRRithukAnupAyanam ||3||
---------
iti-Iritam-ayaM
thus told he
priyayA kShudhArtayA
by (his wife) troubled by hunger
jugupsamAna:-api
with revulsion even
dhane mada-Avahe
in wealth due to its arrogance bearing
tadA tvat-Alokana-
then, Thee to meet
kautukAt-yayau
eagerness (he) went
vahan paTa-ante
carrying in one corner of his cloth
pRRithukAn-upAyanam
beaten rice as offering

Kuchela set off for Thy place more out of eagerness to meet Thee than for acquiring a means of livelihood, as prodded by his wife, troubled by hunger. He had a repulsiveness towards wealth because of its proneness to generate pride and arrogance. He carried in a corner of his cloth some beaten rice as an offering to Thee.
---------
gato.ayamAshcharyamayIM bhavatpurIM gRRiheShu shaibyAbhavanaM sameyivAn |
pravishya vaikuNThamivApa nirvRRitiM tavAtisambhAvanayA tu kiM puna: ||4||

gata:-ayam-
reaching he
AshchryamayIm
wondrous
bhavat-purIm
Thy city
gRRiheShu shaibyA-bhavana
among the houses, Mitravrinda's house
sameyivAn
entered
pravishya
entering
vaikuNTham-iva-
Vaikuntha only
Apa nivRRitiM
attained supreme peace
tava-ati-sambhAvanayA
by Thy lavish hospitality
tu kim puna:
indeed what else more
---------
Kuchela reached Thy wonderful city and among the many houses, entered the house of Mitravrindaa. As he did so he attained supreme peace as though he had entered Vaikuntha only, more so by Thy lavishing hospitality beyond description.

prapUjitaM taM priyayA cha vIjitaM kare gRRihItvA.akathaya: purAkRRitam |
yadindhanArthaM gurudArachoditairapartuvarSha tadamarShi kAnane ||5||
---------
prapUjitaM taM
well honoured (by Thee) he
priyayA cha vIjitaM
and by Thy consort fanned
kare gRRihItvA-
by hand taking
akathaya:
(Thou) narrated
purAkRRitam
the incidents
yat-indhana-artham
like (when) for fire wood
guru-dAra-choditai:-
on the teacher's wife's behest
apartu-varSham
in an unseasonal rain
tat-amarShi kAnane
which was borne in the forest

After a cordial reception by Thee as he was fanned by Thy consort, Thou held his hands and recalled the old incidents. Like when at the behest of the teacher's wife, Thou went together to gather fire wood and were caught in an unseasonal rain in the forest.
---------
trapAjuSho.asmAt pRRithukaM balAdatha pragRRihya muShTau sakRRidAshite tvayA |
kRRitaM kRRitaM nanviyateti saMbhramAdramA kilopetya karaM rurodha te ||6||

trapAjuSha:-asmAt
who was feeling shy, from him
pRRithukam balAt-atha
the flattened rice forcefully, then
pragRRihya
snatching
muShTau sakRRit-
a fistful once
Ashite tvayA
being eaten by Thee
kRRitaM kRRitaM
enough enough
nanu-iyata-iti
indeed this much thus
saMbhramAt-ramA
in consternation, Ramaa
kila-upetya
indeed approached
karaM rurodha te
and hand held back Thy
---------
Kuchela was feeling very shy and so Thou forcefully snatched the flattened rice from him and ate a fistful. Just then in great consternation Ramaa approached Thee and held back Thy hand saying that that much was indeed enough.

bhakteShu bhaktena sa mAnitastvayA purIM vasannekanishAM mahAsukham |
batAparedyurdraviNaM vinA yayau vichitrarUpastava khalvanugraha: ||7||
---------
bhakteShu bhaktena
in the devotees, devoted (by Thee)
sa mAnita:-
he was honoured
tvayA purIM vasan-
by Thee, in the city staying
eka nishAm
for one night
mahA-sukham
very happily
bata-aparedyu:-
alas! Next day
draviNaM vinA yayau
wealth without went away
vichitra-rUpa:-tava
of strange forms are Thy
khalu-anugraha:
indeed blessings

He was greatly honoured by Thee the devoted of the devotees, and very happily stayed in Thy city for one night. The next day he went away alas without any wealth. Strange indeed are Thy forms of blessings.
---------
yadi hyayAchiShyamadAsyadachyuto vadAmi bhAryAM kimiti vrajannasau |
tvaduktilIlAsmitamagnadhI: puna: kramAdapashyanmaNidIpramAlayam ||8||

yadi hi-ayAchiShyam-
if indeed I had asked
adAsyat-achyuta:
would have given Krishna
vadAmi bhAryAM kim-iti
will tell my wife what, thus
vrajan-asau
walking he
tvat-ukti-lIlA-smita-
Thy talks and playful smile
magna-dhI: puna:
with mind immersed in then
kramAt-apashyat-
gradually saw
maNi-dIpram-Alayam
with gems resplendent house
---------
Had I but asked for wealth Krishna would surely have given. What shall I tell my wife?' Thus telling himself he walked along immersed in the memories of Thy talks and Thy playful smile. By and by he reached a gem studded splendorous mansion.

kiM mArgavibhraMsha iti bhraMman kShaNaM gRRihaM praviShTa: sa dadarsha vallabhAm |
sakhIparItAM maNihemabhUShitAM bubodha cha tvatkaruNAM mahAdbhutAm ||9||
---------
kiM mArga-vibhraMsha
what is the way lost
iti bhraMman kShaNaM
thus wondering for a moment
gRRihaM praviShTa:
the house entering
sa dadarsha vallabhAm
he saw his wife
sakhI-parItAM
by ladies in waiting surrounded
maNi-hema-bhUShitAM
with gems and gold ornaments adorned
bubodha cha
realised also
tvat-karuNAM
Thy compassion
mahA-adbhutAm
most wonderful

What have I lost my way?' Thus wondering for a moment he entered the house. He saw his wife adorned in ornaments of gems and gold and surrounded by ladies in waiting. He then realised Thy grace and compassion and the most wonderful results of the same.
---------
sa ratnashAlAsu vasannapi svayaM samunnamadbhaktibharo.amRRitaM yayau |
tvamevamApUritabhaktavA~nChito marutpurAdhIsha harasva me gadAn ||10||

sa ratna-shAlAsu
he in the gem studded building
vasan-api svayaM
residing though, himself
samunnamad-bhakti-bhara:-
incessantly growing devotion, full of it
amRRitaM yayau
liberation attained
tvam-evam-ApUrita-
Thou in this manner fulfilled
bhakta-vA~nChita:
the devotees' desires
marutpurAdhIsha
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
harasva me gadAn
rid me of my ailments
---------
Residing in the begemmed mansion he himself was full of devotion for Thee which incessantly grew of its own. In the end he attained liberation. Thou in such a manner fulfilled the desire of Thy devotee. O Lord of Guruvaayur! Be pleased to rid me of my ailments.

Narayaneeyam D088

Dashaka 88
---------
prAgevAchAryaputrAhRRitinishamanayA svIyaShaTsUnuvIkShAM
kA~NkShantyA mAturuktyA sutalabhuvi baliM prApya tenArchitastvam |
dhAtu: shApAddhiraNyAnvitakashipubhavAn shaurijAn kaMsabhagnA-
nAnIyainAn pradarshya svapadamanayathA: pUrvaputrAn marIche: ||1||
---------
prAk-eva-
long back only
AchArya-putra-AhRRiti-
(thy) teacher's son bringing back
nishamanayA
hearing about
svIya-ShaT-sUnu-
(her) own six sons
vIkShAM kAMkShantyA
to see desiring
mAtu:-uktyA
at (Thy) mother's words
sutala-bhuvi baliM prApya
in the Sutala land going to Mahaabali
tena-archita:-tvam
by him were honoured Thou
dhAtu: shApAt-
by Brahmaa's curse
hiraNyAnvitakashipu
of Hiranyakashipu born
bhavAn shaurijAn
Thou (them) born of Vasudeva
kaMsa-bhagnAn-
by Kansa killed
AnIya-enAn pradarshya
bringing them and showing them
svapadam-anayathA:
to Thy abode took (them)
pUrva-putrAn-marIche:
(who were) formerly the sons of Marichi

Thy mother had long back heard of Thy having brought back Thy teacher Saandipini's son and she desired of Thee to be shown her six dead sons. By Thy mother's words Thou went to the Sutala land and met Mahaabali and were greatly honoured by him. From there Thou brought back the six sons who were originally Marichi's sons and were later born to Hiranyakashipu by a curse of Brahmaa. They later took birth as Vasudeva and Devaki's sons, who were killed by Kansa. Thou took them to Thy abode.
---------
shrutadeva iti shrutaM dvijendraM
bahulAshvaM nRRipatiM cha bhaktipUrNam |
yugapattvamanugrahItukAmo
mithilAM prApithaM tApasai: sameta: ||2||

shrutadeva
Shrutadeva
iti shrutaM
thus well known
dvijendram
the great Braahmina
bahulAshvam
(and) Bahulaashwa
nRRipatiM cha bhaktipUrNam
the king and full of devotion
yugapat-
at the same time
tvam-anugrahItu-kAma:
Thou, to bless, desiring
mithilAM prApitha
to Mithilaa went
tApasai: sameta:
ascetics with
---------
With the desire to bless both the great well known Braahmina Shrutadeva and the deeply devoted king Bahulaashwa, Thou went to Mithilaa along with many ascetics.

gachChan dvimUrtirubhayoryugapanniketa-
mekena bhUrivibhavairvihitopachAra: |
anyena taddinabhRRitaishcha phalaudanAdyai-
stulyaM praseditha dadatha cha muktimAbhyAm ||3||
---------
gachChan-dvimUrti:-
going in two (similar) forms
ubhayo:-yugapat-
to both at the same time
niketam-
the houses
ekena bhUrivibhavai:-
by one with plenty of rich offerings
vihita-upachAra:
performed (Thy) worship
anyena
by the other
tat-dina-bhRRitai:-cha
and with that day's alms
phala-odana-Adyai:-
fruits rice and others
tulyaM praseditha
equally pleased
dadAtha cha
and gave
muktim-Abhyam
liberation to both

Thou went to the house of both of them at the same time by assuming two identical forms. One, the king received and worshipped Thee with plenty of rich offerings. While the other, the Braahmina worshipped Thee and offered to Thee the fruits and rice and other things obtained as alms that day. Thou were equally pleased with both of them and bestowed Mukti (liberation) on them.
---------
bhUyo.atha dvAravatyAM dvijatanayamRRitiM tatpralApAnapi tvam
ko vA daivaM nirundhyAditi kila kathayan vishvavoDhApyasoDhA: |
jiShNorgarvaM vinetuM tvayi manujadhiyA kuNThitAM chAsya buddhiM
tattvArUDhAM vidhAtuM paramatamapadaprekShaNeneti manye ||4||

bhUya:-atha dvAravatyAM
again then in Dwaarikaa
dvija-tanaya-mRRitim
the Braahmin's son's death
tat-pralApAn-api tvam
his lamentation also Thou
ko vA daivaM nirundhyAt-
who indeed can resist fate
iti kila kathayan
indeed saying
vishva-voDhA-api-
the whole world's support even
asoDhA:
did not support
jiShNo:-garvam
Arjuna's pride
vinetumtvayi
to take away, in Thee
manuja-dhiyA
of a mere human being thinking
kuNThitAM cha-asya buddhim
and (his) blunted intellect
tattva-ArUDhAM vidhAtuM
to the Truth's higher level to bring
paramatama-pada-prekShaNena-
the Supreme abode by showing
iti manye
thus I believe
---------
Again then in Dwaarikaa, there was a Braahmin whose children died just when they were born. To the wails and lamentations of the father Thou had just to say that who could resist fate. May be, I believe, seeing this Arjuna's mind was blunted into thinking that Thou were merely a human being. To curb his pride and to take him to the high level of realizing the Truth, Thou showed him the Supreme abode, Vaikuntha.

naShTA aShTAsya putrA: punarapi tava tUpekShayA kaShTavAda:
spaShTo jAto janAnAmatha tadavasare dvArakAmApa pArtha: |
maitryA tatroShito.asau navamasutamRRitau vipravaryaprarodaM
shrutvA chakre pratij~nAmanupahRRitasuta: sannivekShye kRRishAnum ||5||
---------
naShTA:-aShTa-asya putrA:
are dead eight of his sons
puna:-api tava tu-
again also Thy indeed
upekShayA kaShTavAda:
indifference (because of which) disrepute
spaShTa: jAta:
clear it was made
janAnAm-atha
of the public (in general)then
tat-avasare
at that time
dvArakAm-Apa pArtha:
to Dwaarikaa reached Arjuna
maitryA tatra-
due to friendship there (in Dwaarikaa)
uShita:-asau
staying he
navama-suta-mRRitau
the ninth son having died
vipravarya-prarodaM
the great Braahmina's crying
shrutvA chakre pratij~nAm-
hearing, made a promise
anupahRRita-suta:
(in case of) not bringing back the son
sannivekShye kRRishAnum
(he) would enter fire

People began to speak ill of Thee at Thy indifference towards the Braahmina even after he had lost eight sons. At that time Arjuna came and stayed at Dwaarikaa on a friendly visit. When he heard the wailing and lamentations of the Braahminaa on having lost his ninth son, he was very much moved. He vowed to bring back the son failing which he would immolate himself in fire.
---------
mAnI sa tvAmapRRiShTvA dvijanilayagato bANajAlairmahAstrai
rundhAna: sUtigehaM punarapi sahasA dRRiShTanaShTe kumAre |
yAmyAmaindrIM tathA.anyA: suravaranagarIrvidyayA.a.asAdya sadyo
moghodyoga: patiShyan hutabhuji bhavatA sasmitaM vArito.abhUt ||6||

mAnI sa tvAm-apRRiShTvA
proud he, without asking Thee
dvija-nilaya-gata:
to the Braahmina's house went
bANa-jAlai:-mahA-astrai:
with arrows and divine missiles
rundhAna: sUtigehaM
blocked the labour room
puna:-api sahasA
again also suddenly
dRRiShTa-naShTe kumAre
vanished the child
yAmyAm-aindrIm
Yama's abode, Indra's abode
tathA-anyA:
and others'
suravara-nagarI:-
gods' houses
vidyayA-AsAdya
by Yogic powers reaching
sadya: mogha-udyoga:
immediately, (his) fruitless efforts
patiShyan hutabhuji
about to fall in fire
bhavatA sasmitam
by Thee smilingly
vArita:-abhUt
prevented was
---------
When the tenth child was to be born, the proud Arjun went to the Braahmin's house without telling Thee. He made a protective web with his arrows and divine missiles around the labour room. Again suddenly the child's body disappeared. Immediately Arjun with his yogic powers went in search for the infant to the houses of Yama , Indra and other gods. As all his efforts were in vain he was about to enter the fire when Thou smilingly prevented him from doing so.

sArdhaM tena pratIchIM dishamatijavinA syandanenAbhiyAto
lokAlokaM vyatItastimirabharamatho chakradhAmnA nirundhan |
chakrAMshukliShTadRRiShTiM sthitamatha vijayaM pashya pashyeti vArAM
pAre tvaM prAdadarsha: kimapi hi tamasAM dUradUraM padaM te ||7||
---------
sArdhaM tena
with him
pratIchIM disham-
to the westward direction
ati-javinA syandanena-
by a very fast chariot
abhiyAta:
going
lokAlokaM vyatIta:-
(the mountain of ) Lokaaloka crossing
timirabharam-atha
the darkness intense, then
chakradhAmnA nirundhan
by the splendorous discus expelling
chakra-aMshu-kliShTa-dRRiShTim
the discus rays dazzling the vision
sthitam-atha vijayaM
standing then Arjun
pashya pashya-iti
Look look' thus
vArAM pAre
the waters' beyond
tvaM prAdadarsha:
Thou showed
kimapi hi
indescribable indeed
tamasAM dUra dUraM
of the Tamas Guna beyond
padaM te
abode of Thee

Thou rode with Arjun on a very fast chariot and went past the mountain Lokaaloka towards the west. The intense darkness there, Thou removed by the splendor of the Sudarshana discus. Arjuna's eyes were dazzled as he stood there. Thou showed him Thy indescribable abode beyond the causal waters which was unaffected by the darkness of ignorance or the Tamas Guna.
---------
tatrAsInaM bhuja~NgAdhipashayanatale divyabhUShAyudhAdyai-
rAvItaM pItachelaM pratinavajaladashyAmalaM shrImada~Ngam |
mUrtInAmIshitAraM paramiha tisRRiNAmekamarthaM shrutInAM
tvAmeva tvaM parAtman priyasakhasahito nemitha kShemarUpam ||8||

tatra-AsInam
there sitting
bhuja~Nga-adhipa-shayana-tale
(on) the serpent king (as) bed' surface
divya-bhUShA-Ayudha-Adyai:-
with divine attire ,weapons etc
AvItaM pItachelaM
adorned and with a yellow (silk) garment
pratinava-jalada-shyAmalaM
fresh rain clouds like blue
shrImada~Ngam
adorned by (the presence of) Laxmi
(tisRRiNAm) mUrtinAm-
(of the Trinity) personified
IshitAraM param-
Ruler Supreme
iha tisRRiNAm-
here (in this universe) of the Trinity
ekam-artham-shrutInAM
the sole subject of the Vedas
tvAm-eva tvaM
to Thyself only Thou
paramAtman
O Supreme Being!
priya-sakha-sahita:
dear friend along with
nemitha kShemarUpam
prostrated to Moksha personified
---------
There seated was He on the bed constituted of the king serpent Aadishesha. He was adorned with ornaments and divine weapons and yellow silk garment. Goddess Laxmi was at his side and His form had the splendour of dark fresh rain bearing clouds. He is the Supreme Ruler over the Trinity of Brahmaa Vishnu and Mahesh and is the sole subject of all the Vedas and scriptures. To That Being, the embodiment of Moksha and identical to Thyself, Thou and Thy dear friend Arjun prostrated.

yuvAM mAmeva dvAvadhikavivRRitAntarhitatayA
vibhinnau sandraShTuM svayamahamahArShaM dvijasutAn |
nayetaM drAgetAniti khalu vitIrNAn punaramUn
dvijAyAdAyAdA: praNutamahimA pANDujanuShA ||9||
---------
yuvAM mAm-eva dvau-
you two are Myself alone, in two forms
adhika-vivRRita-antarhitatayA
by well manifested and by obstructed (divinity)
vibhinau
are different
sandraShTuM
to see (meet)
svayam-aham-ahArShaMm
Myself I took away
dvija-sutAn
the Braahmin's sons
nayetaM drAk-etAn-iti
take them soon, thus
khalu vitIrNAn puna:-amUn
indeed given again then
dvijAya-AdAya-
for the Braahmina taking
adA:
gave (them to the Braahmina)
praNuta-mahimA
was sung Thy glory
pANDujanuShA
by Arjun

The two of you are Myself alone. In one the divinity is potent and it is latent in the other, so you two seem different. To meet you I Myself took away the sons of the Braahmin. You may now take them away.' With such words the Supreme Lord gave away the children which Thou gave back to the Braahmina, while Arjun sang Thy glory.
---------
evaM nAnAvihArairjagadabhiramayan vRRiShNivaMshaM prapuShNa-
nnIjAno yaj~nabhedairatulavihRRitibhi: prINayanneNanetrA: |
bhUbhArakShepadambhAt padakamalajuShAM mokShaNAyAvatIrNa:
pUrNaM brahmaiva sAkShAdyaduShu manujatArUShitastvaM vyalAsI: ||10||

evaM nAnA-vihArai:-
in this manner, by various sportive activities
jagat-abhiramayan
the world delighting
vRRiShNi-vaMshaM prapuShNan-
the Vrishni clan nurturing
IjAna:-yaj~na-bhedai:-
performing sacrifices by different Yangyas
atula-vihRRitibhi:
by unparalleled sportive endearments
prINayan-eNa-netrA:
pleasing the gazelle eyed (wives)
bhUbhAra-kShepa-dambhAt
the earth's burden eliminating, in the pretext of
pada-kamala-juShAM
Thy lotus feet devoted to
mokShaNAya-avatIrNa:
to give (them) liberation, having incarnated
pUrNaM brahma-eva
In finite Brahman Itself
sAkShAt-yaduShu
in material form in the Yadu clan
manujatA-rUShita:-
in a human veil
tvaM vyalAsI:
Thou shone
---------
In this manner Thou delighted the world by various sportive activities nurtured the Vrishni clan and performed many sacrificial rites and Yagnyas. Thou pleased the gazelle eyed wives with unparalleled sportive endearments and on the pretext of unburdening the earth gave liberation to many dependents and devotees. Thou, the incarnate Infinite Brahman Itself appeared in a material form and shone through the veil of a human form amongst the Yaadavas.

prAyeNa dvAravatyAmavRRitadayi tadA nAradastvadrasArdra-
stasmAllebhe kadAchitkhalu sukRRitanidhistvatpitA tattvabodham |
bhaktAnAmagrayAyI sa cha khalu matimAnuddhavastvatta eva
prApto vij~nAnasAraM sa kila janahitAyAdhunA.a.aste badaryAm ||11||
---------
prAyeNa dvAravatyAm-
mostly in Dwaarika
avRRitat-ayi
stayed O Lord! Thou
tadA nArada:-
then Naarada
tvat-rasArdr:-
in Thy bliss immersed
tasmAt-lebhe
from him received
kadAchit-khalu
once indeed
sukRRita-nidhi:-tvat-pitA
merits repository, Thy father
tattva-bodham
spiritual insight
bhaktAnAm-agrayAyI
of the devotees the foremost
sa cha khalu
and he indeed
matimAn-uddhava:-
the wise Uddhava
tvatta eva
from Thee alone
prApta: vij~nAna sAraM
attained the essence of spiritual knowledge
sa kila jana-hitAya-
he indeed for peoples benefit
adhunA-Aste badaryAm
even now resides in Badrikaashram

O Lord! In those days Naarada who mostly stayed in Dwaarika was always engrossed in the bliss of Thy worship. Once Thy meritorious father attained insight and illumination from him who is the foremost among the devotees. The most distinguished among the intelligent, Uddhava attained enlightenment from instructions given by Thee directly. It is believed that he is still residing in Badrikaashrama for the benefit of the world.
---------
so.ayaM kRRiShNAvatAro jayati tava vibho yatra sauhArdabhIti-
snehadveShAnurAgaprabhRRitibhiratulairashramairyogabhedai: |
ArtiM tIrtvA samastAmamRRitapadamagussarvata: sarvalokA:
sa tvaM vishvArtishAntyai pavanapurapate bhaktipUrtyai cha bhUyA: ||12||

sa-ayaM kRRiShNa-avatAra:
that this, Krishna incarnation
jayati tava vibho
excels, of Thee, O Lord!
yatra sauhArda-bhIti-sneha-
where by friendship, fear, love
dveSha-anurAga-prabhRRitibhi:-
hatred, attachment and other
atulai:-ashramai:-yoga-bhedai:
unique effortless (spiritual) union methods
ArtiM tIrtvA samastAm-
sorrows overcoming all
amRRita-padam-agu:-
liberated state went to
sarvata: sarva-lokA:
everywhere all the people
sa tvaM vishva-Arti-shAntyai
that Thou, for the world's sorrows removal
pavanapurapate
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
bhakti-pUrtyai cha bhUyA:
and for the attainment of full devotion deign to be
---------
O Infinite Lord! Thy exalted incarnation as Krishna shines in all its uniqueness where all people everywhere effortlessly overcome all sorrows and attained spiritual union with various means of friendship, fear, love, hatred, attachment and other unique methods. May Thou O Lord of Guruvaayur! for the removal of world's sorrows having incarnated also deign to endow full devotion.

Narayaneeyam D089

Dashaka 89
---------
ramAjAne jAne yadiha tava bhakteShu vibhavo
na sadyassampadyastadiha madakRRittvAdashaminAm |
prashAntiM kRRitvaiva pradishasi tata: kAmamakhilaM
prashAnteShu kShipraM na khalu bhavadIye chyutikathA ||1||
---------
ramAjAne
O Consort of Laxmi (Ramaa)
jAne yat-iha
I know that here
tava bhakteShu vibhava:
to Thy devotees prosperity
na sadya:-sampadya:-
does not quickly come
tat-iha
that (prosperity) here
mada-kRRittvAt-
(because is) pride generating
ashaminAm
of the passionate
prashAntiM kRRitvA-eva
dispassionate making (them) only
pradishasi tata:
(Thou) give then
kAmam-akhilam
desires all
prashAnteShu kShipraM
to the dispassionate quickly
na khalu
not indeed
bhavadIye chyuti-kathA
to Thy devotee downfall does not come

O Consort of Ramaa! (Laxmi) Thy devotees are not easily blessed in this world. I know it to be so because prosperity generates pride in the passionate people. After making them dispassionate Thou do fulfill all their desires. Those who are already dispassionate, to them Thy blessings come quickly. There is no question of Thy devotee's downfall.
---------
sadya: prasAdaruShitAn vidhisha~NkarAdIn
kechidvibho nijaguNAnuguNaM bhajanta: |
bhraShTA bhavanti bata kaShTamadIrghadRRiShTyA
spaShTaM vRRikAsura udAharaNaM kilAsmin ||2||

sadya: prasAda-ruShitAn
quickly pleased and angered
vidhi-sha~Nkara-AdIn
Brahmaa Shiva and others
kechit-vibho
some people O Lord!
nija-guNa-anuguNam
in their own nature's accordance
bhajanta:
worshipping
bhraShTA:-bhavanti
disgrace attain to
bata kaShTam-
alas unfortunate (is this)
adIrgha-dRRiShTyA
due to shortsightedness
spaShTaM vRRikAsura
(It is) clear (by) Vrikaasura
udAharaNaM kila-asmin
example indeed in this (case)
---------
O Lord! Brahamaa, Shiva and others who are pleased and angered quickly, are worshipped by people in accordance with their own nature. Alas! They are led to disgrace by their shortsightedness. This is indeed clear by the example of Vrikaasura.

shakunija: sa tu nAradamekadA
tvaritatoShamapRRichChadadhIshvaram |
sa cha didesha girIshamupAsituM
na tu bhavantamabandhumasAdhuShu ||3||
---------
shakunija: sa
the son of Shakuni, he (Vrikaasura)
tu nAradam-ekadA
indeed to Naarada once
tvarita-toSham-apRRichChat-
soon pleased asked (about)
adhIshvaram
the Deity
sa cha didesha
and he indicated
girIsham-upAsituM
Shiva to worship
na tu bhavantam-
(and) not indeed Thee
abandhum-asAdhuShu
(who are) non supportive towards evil people

Vrikaasura, the son of Shakuni once asked Naarada as to which Deity was the easiest to please. Naarada instructed him to worship Shiva and not Thee who are not supportive towards evil minded people.
---------
tapastaptvA ghoraM sa khalu kupita: saptamadine
shira: ChitvA sadya: puraharamupasthApya purata: |
atikShudraM raudraM shirasi karadAnena nidhanaM
jagannAthAdvavre bhavati vimukhAnAM kva shubhadhI: ||4||

tapa:-taptvA ghoraM
penance practicing very severe
sa khalu kupita:
he indeed in great anger
saptama-dine
on the seventh day
shira: ChitvA
(his) head cutting off
sadya: puraharam-
immediately Shiva
upasthApya purata:
making to appear in front
atikShudraM raudraM
very mean and cruel
shirasi kara-dAnena
on head placing (his) hand
nidhanaM
death
jagannAthAt-vavre
from the Lord of the universe (Shiva) sought (as a boon)
bhavati vimukhAnAM
from Thee (those who are) indifferent
kva shubhadhI:
where is good sense
---------
He indeed practiced severe penance and on the seventh day greatly angered, threatened to cut off his head and thus made Shiva appear before him immediately. From the Lord of the universe, Shiva, he sought a very mean and cruel boon that on who-so-ever's head he placed his hand would die immediately. How can good sense prevail upon people who are indifferent to Thee?

moktAraM bandhamukto hariNapatiriva prAdravatso.atha rudraM
daityAt bhItyA sma devo dishi dishi valate pRRiShThato dattadRRiShTi: |
tUShNIke sarvaloke tava padamadhirokShyantamudvIkShya sharvaM
dUrAdevAgratastvaM paTuvaTuvapuShA tasthiShe dAnavAya ||5||
---------
moktAraM
the one who releases
bandha-mukta:
from bondage released
hariNapati:-iva
a lion as if
prAdravat-sa-atha rudraM
rushed he then towards Shiva
daityAt bhItyA sma
by the Asura afraid being
deva: dishi dishi
the Lord in all directions
valate
ran about
pRRiShThata:-datta-dRRiShTi:
towards the back looking
tUShNIke sarva-loke
as kept quiet all the world
tava padam-adhirokShyantam-
Thy abode climbing up to
udvIkShya sharvaM
seeing Shiva
dUrAt-eva-agrata:-tvaM
from far only, in front Thou
paTu-vaTu-vapuShA
(in) a clever Brahamachari's guise
tasthiShe dAnavAya
stood (waiting) for the Asura

Like a lion who rushes towards the rescuer, Vrikaasura rushed towards Shiva. Lord Shiva ran about in all directions in panic of the Asura, and kept looking backwards. Everyone in the whole world kept quiet. Then from far Thou saw Shiva as he was about to reach Thy abode. Then, in the guise of a clever Brahmachaari Thou stood waiting for the Asura.
---------
bhadraM te shAkuneya bhramasi kimadhunA tvaM pishAchasya vAchA
sandehashchenmaduktau tava kimu na karoShya~NgulIma~Ngamaulau |
itthaM tvadvAkyamUDha: shirasi kRRitakara: so.apatachChinnapAtaM
bhraMsho hyevaM paropAsiturapi cha gati: shUlino.api tvameva ||6||

bhadraM te shAkuneya
hail to you O son of Shakuni!
bhramasi kiM adhunA tvaM
(why are) running about now you
pishAchasya vAchA
on a ghost's words
sandeha:-chet-mat-uktau
doubt if there is in my words
tava kimu na karoShi-
on your, why not do you do
a~NgulIm-a~Nga-maulau
the finger, O dear One, on the head
itthaM tvat-vAkya-mUDha:
thus by Thy words fooled
shirasi kRRita-kara:
on head placing hand
sa:-apatat-Chinna-pAtaM
he fell (like) an uprooted tree
bhraMsha:- hi-evaM
destruction indeed such
para-upAsitu:api
other (deities) worshipping indeed
cha gati:
and are a last resort
shUlina:-api tvam-eva
to Shankara also Thou alone
---------
Hail to you O son of Shakuni! Why are you needlessly running about, placing your faith in this ghost? If you doubt my words, O dear One! Test for yourself by placing your fingers on your own head.' Befooled by these words of Thine, he placed his hand on his head and immediately fell down dead as an uprooted tree. Such is the fate of the people who worship other deities. What more, Thou are the ultimate refuge of even Shiva.

bhRRiguM kila sarasvatInikaTavAsinastApasA-
strimUrtiShu samAdishannadhikasattvatAM veditum |
ayaM punaranAdarAduditaruddharoShe vidhau
hare.api cha jihiMsiShau girijayA dhRRite tvAmagAt ||7||
---------
bhRRiguM kila
Bhrigu indeed
sarasvatI-nikaTa-vAsina:-
living near (the river) Saraswati
tApasA:-
the ascetics
tri-mUrtiShu
among the Trinity
samAdishan-
instructed (Bhrigu)
adhika-sattvatAM vedituM
to know who is more inclined towards Saatvic gunas
ayaM puna:-anAdarAt-
this (Bhrigu) again with non-respect
udita-ruddha-roShe
(which) arose, and was controlled, the anger
vidhau
in Brahmaa (when)
hare-api cha
and in Shiva also
jihiMsiShau
eager to kill (Bhrigu)
girijayA dhRRite
by Paarvati restricted
tvAm-agAt
to Thee went

Once the ascetics residing on the banks of the river Saraswati assigned sage Bhrigu to test who among the Trinity was more inclined towards Saatvic guna. Bhrigu went to Brahmaa who was enraged, but he controlled his anger, when Bhrigu showed his disrespect. Next he went to Shiva and behaved with him in the same manner. Shiva was eager to kill him but was restricted by Paarvati. Then Bhrigu went to Thee.
---------
suptaM ramA~Nkabhuvi pa~NkajalochanaM tvAM
vipre vinighnati padena mudotthitastvam |
sarvaM kShamasva munivarya bhavet sadA me
tvatpAdachinhamiha bhUShaNamityavAdI: ||8||

suptaM ramA-a~Nka-bhuvi
sleeping on Laxmi's lap
pa~NkajalochanaM tvAM
lotus eyed Thee
vipre vinighnati padena
when the sage hit by foot
mudA-utthita:-tvam
happily getting up Thou
sarvaM kShamasva munivarya
everything forgive O great sage
bhavet sadA me
will be always my
tvat-pAda-chinham-iha
your foot mark here
bhUShaNam-iti-avAdI:
decoration, thus Thou said
---------
When Bhrigu went to Thee, O Lotus eyed! Thou were sleeping on Laxmi's lap. He hit Thee on the chest with his foot. Thou got up in good humour and asked for pardon for everything and told him that the mark of his foot would always remain as a decoration on his chest.

nishchitya te cha sudRRiDhaM tvayi baddhabhAvA:
sArasvatA munivarA dadhire vimokSham |
tvAmevamachyuta punashchyutidoShahInaM
sattvochchayaikatanumeva vayaM bhajAma: ||9||
---------
nishchitya te cha
and having decided they
sudRRiDhaM tvayi
firmly in Thee
baddhabhAvA:
anchoring devotion
sArasvatA:-munivarA:-
residing near the river Saraswati, the great sages
dadhire vimokSham
attained liberation
tvAm-evam-achyuta
to Thee, thus, O Changeless One!
puna:-achyuti-doSha-hInaM
again from the decay defect free
sattva-uchchaya-eka-tanum-
of Saatvic and majestic one form
eva vayaM bhajAma:
alone I worship

The great ascetics residing near the Saraswati river decided that Thou were the most Saatvic of the Trinity. They firmly anchored their devotion into Thee and attained union with Thee. O Changeless One! Who are free from the shortcoming of decay, Thy exalted Saatvic form we worship.
---------
jagatsRRiShTyAdau tvAM nigamanivahairvandibhiriva
stutaM viShNo sachchitparamarasanirdvaitavapuSham |
parAtmAnaM bhUman pashupavanitAbhAgyanivahaM
paritApashrAntyai pavanapuravAsin paribhaje ||10||

jagat-sRRiShTi-Adau
the universe's creation in the beginning of
tvAM nigama-nivahai:-
to Thee by the Vedas altogether
vandibhi:-iva
as by the minstrels as (in a king's court)
stutaM viShNo
praised O Vishnu!
sat-chit-parama-rasa-
Pure Consciousness Highest Bliss
nirdvaita-vapuSham
undual embodiment
parAtmAnaM bhUman
the Supreme Being O Infinite One!
pashupa-vanitA-bhAgya-nivahaM
the cowherd women's merits' embodiment
paritApa-shrAntyai
the sorrows to be removed
pavanapuravAsin
O Resident of Guruvaayur!
paribhaje
I intensely worship
---------
O Vishnu! In the beginning of the creation of the universe, Thy praises were sung by the Vedas just as the minstrels in the king's court.O Infinite One! Thou are the Pure Consciousness Highest Bliss undual embodiment. Thou are also the personification of all the merits of the cowherd women put together. O Resident of Guruvaayur! I intensely worship Thee for the removal of all my sorrows.

Narayaneeyam D090

Dashaka 90
---------
vRRikabhRRigumunimohinyambarIShAdivRRitte-
Shvayi tava hi mahattvaM sarvasharvAdijaitram |
sthitamiha paramAtman niShkalArvAgabhinnaM
kimapi yadavabhAtaM taddhi rUpaM tavaiva ||1||
---------
vRRika-bhRRigumuni-
Vrikaasura, sage Bhrigu
mohinI-ambarISha-
(and Thy incarnation as) Mohini and Ambareesh
Adi-vRRitteShu-ayi
etc., (in these) episodes, O Thou!
tava hi mahattvaM
Thy majesty only
sarva-sharva-Adi-jaitram
(above) all others, including Shiva, supersedes
sthitam-iha
proved here
paramAtman
O Supreme Being!
niShkala-arvAka-abhinnaM
Nishkala, Sakala and non-different
kim-api yat-
indescribable which
avabhAtaM tat hi
shines that alone
rUpaM tava-eva
Thy form (is) Thine alone

O Supreme Being! The episodes of Vrikaasura, Sage Bhrigu, Thy Mohini Avataar and the Ambareesh episode only proves, here, that Thy majesty and superiority supersedes over all other deities like Shiva and others.Thou are non-different from Thy Nishkala (partless) form and Thy Sakala (part) forms like Shiva, Brahamaa, and shine in an indescribable manner as the essence of all.
---------
mUrtitrayeshvarasadAshivapa~nchakaM yat
prAhu: parAtmavapureva sadAshivo.asmin |
tatreshvarastu sa vikuNThapadastvameva
tritvaM punarbhajasi satyapade tribhAge ||2||

mUrti-traya-Ishvara-
the Trimurti Ishwara and
sadAshiva-pa~nchakaM
Sadaashiva (are the) five aspects
yat prAhu:
which is said (by the Shaivaas)
parAtma-vapu:-eva
the Supreme Being alone (Thou)
sadAshiva:-asmin
as Sadaashiva,here,
tatra-Ishvara:-tu sa
and there the Ishwara indeed he
vikuNThapada:-tvam-eva
(in) Vaikuntha residing Thou alone
tritvaM puna:-bhajasi
three forms again Thou assume
satyapade tribhAge
in the Satyaloka in three parts
---------
The Shaivaas speak of five aspects with Brahmaa Vishnu Shiva Ishwara and Sadaashiva. Here Sadaashiva is Thy own self the Supreme Being. Thou alone are Ishwara the Lord of Vaikuntha. The three forms of Trinity, Thou alone assume in the three parts of Satyaloka.

tatrApi sAttvikatanuM tava viShNumAhu-
rdhAtA tu sattvaviralo rajasaiva pUrNa: |
sattvotkaTatvamapi chAsti tamovikAra-
cheShTAdika~ncha tava sha~NkaranAmni mUrtau ||3||
---------
tatra-api
there also
sAttvika-tanuM tava
the Saatvic form of Thee
viShNum-Ahu:-
Vishnu is called
dhAtA tu
Brahmaa indeed
sattva-virala:-
(with) Sattva sparse
rajasA-eva pUrNa:
and Rajas only is full
sattva-utkaTatvam-api
Sattva in full measure, though
cha-asti
and is
tama:-vikAra-
by Tamasa's blemish
cheShTA-Adikam-cha
activities etc (are)
tava sha~Nkara-nAmni
in Thy Shankara named
mUrtau
form

The form of Vishnu, among the Trimurti, is a manifestation of pure Sattva. Brahmaa is the manifestation of abundance of Rajas with a trace of Sattva. Whereas, Thy form known as Shankara has an abundance of Sattva but Tamas expresses itself in its activities.
---------
taM cha trimUrtyatigataM parapUruShaM tvAM
sharvAtmanApi khalu sarvamayatvaheto: |
shaMsantyupAsanavidhau tadapi svatastu
tvadrUpamityatidRRiDhaM bahu na: pramANam ||4||

taM cha trimUrti-atigataM
and Him, the Trimurtis transcending
parapUruShaM tvAM
the Supreme Being Thee
sharva-AtmanA-api
in Shiva's form also
khalu
indeed
sarvamayatva-heto:
encompassing the essence of all, because of (this)
shaMsanti-upAsana-vidhau
describe in the worshipping codes/norms
tat-api svata:-tu
that too in reality indeed
tvat-rUpam-iti-
(are) Thy form, thus (there are)
ati-dRRiDhaM
many strong
bahu na: pramANam
our proofs
---------
Thou do transcend the Trinity and are the Supreme Being. Thou are the essence of all and Shaivas worship Thee alone as Shiva with worshipping norms, as described. That too is Thy form alone. We have many proofs in support of this truth.

shrIsha~Nkaro.api bhagavAn sakaleShu tAva-
ttvAmeva mAnayati yo na hi pakShapAtI |
tvanniShThameva sa hi nAmasahasrakAdi
vyAkhyAt bhavatstutiparashcha gatiM gato.ante ||5||
---------
shrI sha~Nkara:-api
The great Shakaraachaarya also
bhagavAn
the Bhagavatpaada,
sakaleShu tAvat-
among all the Sakala forms, then,
tvAm-eva mAnayati
to Thee alone gives honour
ya:-na hi pakShapAtI
who does not favour anyone
tvat-niShTham-eva
to Thee referring to, alone
sa hi nAma-sahasraka-Adi
he indeed , on Sahasranaam etc.,
vyAkhyAt
commented on
bhavat-stuti-para:-cha
and Thy praises singing, inclined to,
gatiM gata:-ante
samaadhi attained to, in the end

Bhagavatpaada Shree Shankaraachaarya also, among all the Sakala forms, honours Thy form alone. He who is not of the nature of favouring any one deity has commented on the Sahasranaama etc., referring to Thee alone. In the end he attained samaadhi singing Thy praises.
---------
mUrtitrayAtigamuvAcha cha mantrashAstra-
syAdau kalAyasuShamaM sakaleshvaraM tvAm |
dhyAnaM cha niShkalamasau praNave khalUktvA
tvAmeva tatra sakalaM nijagAda nAnyam ||6||

mUrti-traya-atigam-
the Trinity transcending
uvAcha cha mantra-shAstrasya-Adau
and (he) said, in the beginning of the Mantra Shastra
kalAya-suShamam
beautiful as the Kalaaya flower (blue lily)
sakala-IshvaraM tvAm
the Lord of all, Thee
dhyAnaM cha niShkalam-
and meditation on Nish-kala (non-part)
asau praNave khalu-uktvA
he (Shankara) in Pranava, indeed, describing
tvAm-eva tatra sakalaM
Thee alone there Sakal (in part)
nijagAda na-anyam
propounded, not any other
---------
In his famous work of Mantra Shastra, known as Prapanchasaara, Shri Shankara has described Thee as transcending the Trinity - Brahmaa, Vishnu and Mahesh. He has described Thee as a beautiful blue lily and the Lord of all. When he describes the meditation on Nishkala, while dealing with Pranava, he also propounds Thy Sakala form, and of no other deity, Thee as the object of meditation.

samastasAre cha purANasa~Ngrahe
visaMshayaM tvanmahimaiva varNyate |
trimUrtiyuksatyapadatribhAgata:
paraM padaM te kathitaM na shUlina: ||7||
---------
samasta-sAre
and inclusive of all the gist
cha purANa-sa~Ngrahe
in Puraana Sangraha
visaMshayaM
unequivocally (without doubt)
tvat-mahimA-eva varNyate
Thy supreme greatness alone is described
trimUrti-yuk-
the Trinity containing
satyapada-tribhAgata: paraM
the Satyaloka in three parts, transcending,
padaM te kathitaM
Thy abofe is described
na shUlina:
not (the abode) of Shiva

In the text of Puraana Sangraha where there is the gist of all the Puraanas,Thy supreme greatness alone is unequivocally described. The Trimurti occupying the Satyaloka in three parts has been depicted. But Thy abode, Vaikuntha has been described as distinct and superior to and so transcending Satyaloka. No reference is made to the abode of Shiva.
---------
yat brAhmakalpa iha bhAgavatadvitIya-
skandhoditaM vapuranAvRRitamIsha dhAtre |
tasyaiva nAma harisharvamukhaM jagAda
shrImAdhava: shivaparo.api purANasAre ||8||

yat brAhmakalpa iha
that which in the Braahmakalpa, here,
bhAgavata-dvitIya-skandha-uditaM
(and) in the second Skanda of Bhaagavata, narrated
vapu:-anAvRRitam-
that form, revealed
Isha dhAtre
O Lord! For Brahamaa
tasya-eva nAma
that form's, alone, name
hari-sharva-mukhaM
Hari, Shiva etc.,
jagAda shrImAdhava:
has been said of, by Shri Maadhavaachaarya
shiva-para:-api
who was a devotee od Shiva himself
purANa-sAre
in Puraanasaara
---------
O Lord! Here, at the time of Braahmakalpa, Thou had revealed Thy form to Brahmaa, which is described in the second Skanda of the Bhaagavatam. Maadhavaachaarya, who was himself a votary of Shiva, has referred to that same form with the names Hari, Shiva etc., in Puraanasaara.

ye svaprakRRityanuguNA girishaM bhajante
teShAM phalaM hi dRRiDhayaiva tadIyabhaktyA|
vyAso hi tena kRRitavAnadhikAriheto:
skandAdikeShu tava hAnivacho.arthavAdai: ||9||
---------
ye sva-prakRRiti-anuguNA
those who by their natural inclination worship Shiva
girishaM bhajante
worship Shiva
teShAM phalaM hi dRRiDhayA-eva
for them the results are by firmness only
tadIya-bhaktyA
in their devotion
vyAsa:-hi tena kRRitavAn-
sage Vyaasa himself has asserted
adhikAra-heto:
as a benefit for such devotion
skanda-AdikeShu
in the Skanda and other scriptures
tava hAni-vacha:-
(speaking for) belittling words
arthavAdai:
by way of eulogy

People who by their natural inclination are devoted to worship Shiva, for them, the results (liberation) are achieved by their firmness in their devotion only. In the Skanda and other Scriptures, sage Vyaasa has asserted this, for the benefit of such devotees, with statements that belittle Thee which are to be taken as eulogy.
---------
bhUtArthakIrtiranuvAdaviruddhavAdau
tredhArthavAdagataya: khalu rochanArthA: |
skAndAdikeShu bahavo.atra viruddhavAdA-
stvattAmasatvaparibhUtyupashikShaNAdyA: ||10||

bhUta-artha-kIrti:-
existing facts exaggeration
anuvAda-viruddha-vAdau
in accordance with experience, and contrary to experience, these two methods,
tredhA-artha-vAda-gataya:
(in all) these three are the modes (of Arthavaada)
khalu rochana-arthA:
indeed (they are to make) interesting the subject meaning
skAnd-AdikeShu
in the Skaanda and other scriptures
bahava:-atra
many are here
viruddha-vAdA:-
contrary statements
tvat-tAmasatva-
(for example) Thy Taamasic (nature)
paribhUti-upashikShaNa-AdyA:
(Thy) defeat, Thou being instructed by others etc.
---------
Arthavaada has three methods- 1) statements where existing facts are exaggerated, 2)statements are in accordance with experience, 3)statements are contrary to experience. These are used to make the subject matter interesting. In the Skaanda Puraana and other scriptures there are many contrary statements, referring to Thy Taamasic nature, Thy defeat or Thou being instructed by others etc., which are in the category of the third method.

yat ki~nchidapyaviduShA.api vibho mayoktaM
tanmantrashAstravachanAdyabhidRRiShTameva |
vyAsoktisAramayabhAgavatopagIta
kleshAn vidhUya kuru bhaktibharaM parAtman ||11||
---------
yat-ki~nchit-api-
what little even
aviduShA-api
by (me) the ignorant, though
vibho mayA-uktaM
O Lord! By me is said
tat-mantrashAstra-vachanAdi-
that expounded in Mantra Shaastra statements
abhidRRiShTam-eva
is in accordance (to that) only
vyAsa-ukti-sAra-maya-
all Vyaasa's sayings' essence contained
bhAgavata-upagIta
(in) Bhaagavata (where) are sung (Thy excellences)
kleshAn vidhUya
(That Thou) my ailments eradicating
kuru bhaktibharaM
endow firm devotion (to me)
parAtman
O Supreme Being!

O Supreme Being! Though I am an ignorant man, what little I have said, is in accordance to what is expounded in the Mantra Shaastra. Bhaagavata is the essence of all the sayings of sage Vyaasa and Thy excellences are sung there in. Deign to eradicate my ailments and endow firm devotion to me.

Narayaneeyam D091

Dashaka 91
---------
shrIkRRiShNa tvatpadopAsanamabhayatamaM baddhamithyArthadRRiShTe-
rmartyasyArtasya manye vyapasarati bhayaM yena sarvAtmanaiva |
yattAvat tvatpraNItAniha bhajanavidhInAsthito mohamArge
dhAvannapyAvRRitAkSha: skhalati na kuhachiddevadevAkhilAtman ||1||
---------
shrI kRRiShNa
O Lord Krishna!
tvat-pada-upAsanam-
Thy feets worship
abhayatamam
most fearless
baddha-mithyA-artha-dRRiShTe:-
(for those) bound by false material things looking for
martyasya-Artasya manye
the mortals, who are thus suffering, I believe
vyapasarati bhayaM
expels fear
yena sarvAtmanA-eva
by which in every way only
yat-tAvat
that (devotion) then
tvat-praNItAn-iha
by Thy taught, here (in this world)
bhajana-vidhIn-Asthita:
in the methods of worship steady
moha-mArge dhAvan-
(even if) on the path of delusion, running,
api-AvRRita-AkSha:
even (with) eyes closed
skhalati na kuhachit-
slips not at all
deva-deva-akhilAtman
O Lord of Lords! O Soul of All Beings!

O Lord Krishna! I believe that the worship of Thy feet is the most fear expelling and the only refuge for those mortals who are suffering because of being deeply bound by the false material notions and wrong acceptance of ephemeral values as true. By devotion to Thee all fear is expelled, in every way, the methods of which are taught by Thee (in Bhagvad Geeta etc.). O Lord of Lords! O Soul of all Beings! A person who is steady in Thy devotion will not slip or falter even a wee bit even if he runs on the path of delusion with his eyes closed.
---------
bhUman kAyena vAchA muhurapi manasA tvadbalapreritAtmA
yadyat kurve samastaM tadiha paratare tvayyasAvarpayAmi |
jAtyApIha shvapAkastvayi nihitamana:karmavAgindriyArtha-
prANo vishvaM punIte na tu vimukhamanAstvatpadAdvipravarya: ||2||

bhUman
O Supreme Being!
kAyena vAchA
by body and speech
muhu:-api manasA
again also by mind
tvat-bala-prerita-AtmA
with Thy power prompted my soul
yat-yat kurve
what what( it)does
samastaM tat-iha
all that, here
paratare tvayi-
O All Pervading Being! To Thee
asau-arpayAmi
this (me) offers (at Thy service)
jAtyA-api-iha shvapAka:-
by caste even, if here, (in this world) one is lowly
tvayi nihita-mana:-karma-
in Thee (has) resigned his mind, actions
vAk-indriyArtha-prANa:
speech senses and vital energies
vishvaM punIte na tu
(he) sanctifies the worlds, not indeed
vimukha-manA:-
indifferent minded
tvat-padAt-vipravarya:
from Thy feet, even a great Braahmin
---------
O Supreme Being! All the actions of my body speech and mind which are prompted by Thy power, I offer and dedicate to Thee, the Supreme Spirit who are here in the form of Lord Guruvaayur. A person may be of lowly caste, but if he has resigned his mind speech senses and vital energies at Thy feet, he sanctifies the worlds. It is not so even if a person is a Braahmin and is indifferent minded towards Thee.

bhItirnAma dvitIyAdbhavati nanu mana:kalpitaM cha dvitIyaM
tenaikyAbhyAsashIlo hRRidayamiha yathAshakti buddhyA nirundhyAm |
mAyAviddhe tu tasmin punarapi na tathA bhAti mAyAdhinAthaM
taM tvAM bhaktyA mahatyA satatamanubhajanIsha bhItiM vijahyAm ||3||
---------
bhIti:-nAma
fear indeed
dvitIyAt-bhavati nanu
from a second (entity) arises definitely
mana:- kalpitam cha dvitIyaM
and mind's projection is this second
tena-aikya-abhyAsa-shIla:
therefore, on oneness practicing
hRRidayam-iha yathA-shakti
my mind here, with effort
buddhyA nirundhyAm
and intelligence will control
mAyA-viddhe tu
by Maaya's infliction indeed
tasmin puna:-api
in the intellect again also
na tathA bhAti
does not shine (as before)
mAyA-adhinAthaM taM tvAm
Maaya's Master, therefore, Thee
bhaktyA mahatyA
with great Bhakti
satatam-anubhajan-Isha
constantly worshipping O Lord!
bhItiM vijahyAm
fear (I) will overcome

The feeling of fear arises from the consciousness of a second entity-different from oneself. This consciousness of a second entity is a projection of the mind. I will try to control my mind with effort and discriminative intelligence. But when this discriminative intelligence is overpowered and inflicted by Maaya, the consciousness of oneness does not reveal itself again. Therefore, O Lord! by constantly worshipping Thee with great Bhakti, I will overcome all fear.
---------
bhakterutpattivRRiddhI tava charaNajuShAM sa~Ngamenaiva puMsA-
mAsAdye puNyabhAjAM shriya iva jagati shrImatAM sa~Ngamena |
tatsa~Ngo deva bhUyAnmama khalu satataM tanmukhAdunmiShadbhi-
stvanmAhAtmyaprakArairbhavati cha sudRRiDhA bhaktiruddhUtapApA ||4||

bhakte:-utpatti-vRRiddhI
Bhakti's generation and growth
tava charaNa-juShAM
Thy feet worshipping (people)
sa~Ngamena-eva-puMsAm-
in association alone with such people
AsAdye puNya-bhAjAM
is possible (to attain) for people with meritorious deeds
shriya iva jagati
wealth, just as, in this world
shrImatAM sa~Ngamena
is (attainable) with wealthy people's association
tat-sa~Nga: deva
that type of association, O Lord!
bhUyAt-mama
may it come to me
khalu satataM
indeed always
tat-mukhAt-unmiShadbhi:-
from this mouth's coming out
tvat-mAhAtmya-prakArai:-
Thy glories when narrated
bhavati cha sudRRiDhA
it (devotion) becomes more firm
bhakti:-uddhUta-pApA
Bhakti which effaces all sins
---------
Bhakti, devotion, is generated in people with meritorious deeds and it grows by association with people who are always worshipping at Thy feet. Just as in this world, wealth and prosperity are generated by association with prosperous people. O Lord! May I always have such association, because intense and firm devotion, which effaces all sins, arises as a result of listening to Thy glories and narrations of Thy sportive activities which are sung by such devotees.

shreyomArgeShu bhaktAvadhikabahumatirjanmakarmANi bhUyo
gAyan kShemANi nAmAnyapi tadubhayata: pradrutaM pradrutAtmA |
udyaddhAsa: kadAchit kuhachidapi rudan kvApi garjan pragAya-
nnunmAdIva pranRRityannayi kuru karuNAM lokabAhyashchareyam ||5||
---------
shreya:-mArgeShu
among the many paths of Moksha
bhaktau-adhika-bahumati:-
in devotion there is much preference
janma-karmANi bhUya:
(Thy) birth and Thy deeds, again and again
gAyan kShemANi nAmAni-api
singing, and Thy blessings conferring names also
tat-ubhayata:
by these both
pradrutaM pradrutAtmA
speedily (my) mind melting (in devotion)
udyat-hAsa: kadAchit
springing into laughter suddenly
kuhachit-api rudan
sometimes even crying
kvApi garjan
at times also roaring
pragAyan-unmAdI-iva
and singing around as a mad man,
pranRRityan-
and dancing about
ayi kuru karuNAM
O Thou! Bestow Thy compassion
loka-bAhya:-chareyam
(so that) I may move out of the world

Among the many paths of liberation, the path of devotion is the most preferred. Treading this path I shall fervently sing Thy glories and Thy deeds in Thy various incarnations, and also chant Thy grace conferring names. I may burst into laughter or cry suddenly, or at times roar or sing and dance about like a mad man. O Thou! bestow Thy compassion so that going on the path of Bhakti I may move about at will and not have to follow the world and its social norms.
---------
bhUtAnyetAni bhUtAtmakamapi sakalaM pakShimatsyAn mRRigAdIn
martyAn mitrANi shatrUnapi yamitamatistvanmayAnyAnamAni |
tvatsevAyAM hi siddhyenmama tava kRRipayA bhaktidArDhyaM virAga-
stvattattvasyAvabodho.api cha bhuvanapate yatnabhedaM vinaiva ||6||

bhUtAni-etAni
the( five) elements, these
bhUtAtmakam-api sakalaM
everything comprising of these five elements also
pakShi-matsyAn
birds, fishes
mRRigAdIn martyAn
animals etc., and mortals
mitrANi shatrUn-api
friends and enemies also
yamita-mati:-
with a balanced mind
tvat-mayAni-AnamAni
(knowing to be ) Thy forms, saluting
tvat-sevAyAM hi
in Thy service (worship) only
siddhyet-mama
will be achieved by me
tava kRRipayA
with Thy grace
bhakti-dArDhyaM
in devotion firmness
virAga:-tvat-tattvasya-
dispassion, and Thy true nature's
avabodha:-api
knowledge also
cha bhuvanapate
and O Lord of the Universe!
yatnabhedaM vinA-eva
without separate effort for each
---------
I shall salute the five elements, everything comprising of the elements, fishes, birds, animals and other mortals, friends and enemies with the knowledge that they are all Thy forms alone. Thus with my mind balanced with Bhakti I will always be in Thy service and worship Thee. With Thy grace then I will achieve firm devotion, dispassion and the knowledge of the Truth in Reality, simultaneously and will not have to make an effort to achieve each one separately. (Just as swallowing a morsel of food gives the satisfaction of enjoyment, strength and appeasing of hunger).

no muhyan kShuttRRiDAdyairbhavasaraNibhavaistvannilInAshayatvA-
chchintAsAtatyashAlI nimiShalavamapi tvatpadAdaprakampa: |
iShTAniShTeShu tuShTivyasanavirahito mAyikatvAvabodhA-
jjyotsnAbhistvannakhendoradhikashishiritenAtmanA sa~nchareyam ||7||
---------
no muhyan
not misled
kShut-tRRiDA-Adyai:-
by hunger thirst etc.,
bhava-saraNi-bhavai:-
the universe's string of manifestations
tvat-nilIna-AshayatvAt-
(because of) in Thee engrossed my mind
chintA-sAtatyashAlI
ever meditating
nimiShalavam-api
for a fraction of a second also
tvat-padAt-aprakampa:
from Thy feet not deviating
iShTa-aniShTeShu
from good or bad
tuShTi-vyasana-virahita:
gratification and aversion indifferent
mAyikatva-avabodhAt
(these are) effects of Maayaa, with this knowledge
jyotsnAbhi:-
in the cool rays
tvat-nakha-indo:-
of Thy toe nail's moon's
adhika-shishiritena-
very well cooled
AtmanA sa~nchareyam
mind, I shall move about

The strings of sufferings created by the universe like hunger and thirst will not effect me because my mind will be engrossed in Thee. I shall constantly meditate on Thy feet, and will not deviate even for a fraction of a second from them. With the knowledge that good and bad and gratification and aversion are an effect of Maayaa I will be indifferent to them. I shall move about peacefully with my mind being cooled in the cool light of the moon of Thy toe-nails.
---------
bhUteShveShu tvadaikyasmRRitisamadhigatau nAdhikAro.adhunA che-
ttvatprema tvatkamaitrI jaDamatiShu kRRipA dviTsu bhUyAdupekShA |
archAyAM vA samarchAkutukamurutarashraddhayA vardhatAM me
tvatsaMsevI tathApi drutamupalabhate bhaktalokottamatvam ||8||

bhUteShu-eShu tvat-aikya-
in all these beings, Thy oneness
smRRiti-samadhigatau
(this) memory in achieving
na-adhikAra:-adhunA chet-
my right, if not, at present is there
tvat-prema tvatka-maitrI
for Thee love, for Thy people friendship
jaDamatiShu kRRipA
towards ignorant people kindness
dviTsu bhUyAt-upekShA
towards enemies may there be indifference
archAyAM vA
or towards Thy images
samarchA-kutukam-urutara-
the eagerness to worship may greatly
shraddhayA vardhatAM me
with faith increase in me
tvat-saMsevI tathApi
Thy worshipper, in this manner also
drutam-upalabhate
soon attains
bhakta-loka-uttamatvam
in the world of devotees high status
---------
It may be that I do not deserve now the experience of the knowledge of Thy oneness with all beings. May I have love for Thee and friendliness for Thy people, kindness for the ignorant, indifference towards the enemies. Or may I have the eagerness to worship Thy images with full faith. People who worship Thee in such a manner, also, without delay attain the highest pinnacle of divine love.

AvRRitya tvatsvarUpaM kShitijalamarudAdyAtmanA vikShipantI
jIvAn bhUyiShThakarmAvalivivashagatIn du:khajAle kShipantI |
tvanmAyA mAbhibhUnmAmayi bhuvanapate kalpate tatprashAntyai
tvatpAde bhaktirevetyavadadayi vibho siddhayogI prabuddha: ||9||
---------
AvRRitya tvat-svarUpaM
hiding Thy real nature
kShiti-jala-marut-Adi-
earth,water,air,etc.
AtmanA vikShipantI
itself (in these forms) projecting
jIvAn bhUyiShTha-karmAvali-
on the embodied souls, their string of actions
vivasha-gatIn
helplessly, (their resulted) reactions
du:kha-jAle kShipantI
in the sufferings' net throwing
tvat-mAyA
Thy Maayaa
mA-abhibhUt-mAm-
may it not overpower me
ayi bhuvanapate
O Thou Lord of the Universe!
kalpate tat-prashAntyai
is considered to overcome it
tvat-pAde bhakti:-eva-
in Thy feet devotion alone
iti-avadat-
thus said
ayi vibho
O All Pervading Being!
siddha-yogI prabuddha:
the enlightened Yogi named Prabuddha

Thy Maayaa by projecting itself as earth water air and other elements conceals Thy real nature. More over, it throws the embodied souls helplessly into a network of worldly sufferings based on the reactions created by their good or bad actions. O Lord of Universe! May that Maayaa not overpower me. O All pervading Being! the enlightened Yogi Prabuddha has said that this Thy Maayaa can be overcome only by devotion at Thy feet.
---------
du:khAnyAlokya jantuShvalamuditaviveko.ahamAchAryavaryA-
llabdhvA tvadrUpatattvaM guNacharitakathAdyudbhavadbhaktibhUmA |
mAyAmenAM taritvA paramasukhamaye tvatpade moditAhe
tasyAyaM pUrvara~Nga: pavanapurapate nAshayAsheSharogAn ||10||

du:khAni-Alokya jantuShu-
sufferings seeing in all beings
alam-udita-viveka:-
indeed obtaining discrimination
aham-AchAryavaryAt-
I from the great spiritual master
labdhvA tvat-rUpa-tatvaM
receiving Thy nature's reality and (being instructed)
guNa-charita-kathA-Adi-
in Thy excellences glories and deeds
udbhavat-bhakti-bhUmA
and with arising of devotion supreme
mAyAm-enAM-taritvA
this Maayaa crossing over
parama-sukhamaye-tvatpade
supreme bliss conferring, Thy feet
moditAhe
may give me delight
tasya-ayaM-pUrva:-a~Nga:
(to achieve this) for it this is the first step
pavanapurapate
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
nAshaya-asheSha-rogAn
remove my numerous ailments
---------
As I have been able to see the miseries of the creatures, in this world, by obtaining an insight due to a discriminative mind, may I be blessed with the instructions from a great spiritual master. From his instructions, may I receive the knowledge of Thy real nature, by the narrations of Thy excellences, glories and deeds will arise supreme devotion, by which crossing over Maayaa, at Thy feet that supreme bliss will be conferred on me which will give me great delight. To achieve this, this is the first step. O Lord! of Guruvaayur! remove my numerous ailments.

Narayaneeyam D092

Dashaka 92
---------
vedaissarvANi karmANyaphalaparatayA varNitAnIti budhvA
tAni tvayyarpitAnyeva hi samanucharan yAni naiShkarmyamIsha |
mA bhUdvedairniShiddhe kuhachidapi mana:karmavAchAM pravRRitti-
rdurvarjaM chedavAptaM tadapi khalu bhavatyarpaye chitprakAshe ||1||
---------
vedai:-sarvANi karmANi-
by the Vedas all the rituals
aphala-paratayA
beyond their results
varNitAni-iti budhvA
are described, so understanding
tAni tvayi-arpitAni-eva
all of them, to Thee dedicating only
hi samucharan
(may I) perform them
yAni naiShkarmyam-Isha
(so that I) may achieve freedom from action O Lord!
mA bhUt-
may there not be
vedai:-niShiddhe
by the Vedas forbidden (actions)
kuhachit-api
at all any
mana:-karma-vAchAm
by thought deed or speech
pravRRitti:-durvarjam-
inclination, if unavoidable
chet-avAptam
may they get
tat-api khalu
that also indeed
bhavati-arpaye
I will dedicate to Thee
chitprakAshe
O Light of Consciousness!

Understanding that the rituals described in the Vedas are beyond their seeming results-oriented nature, I shall dedicate all such rituals that I perform, to Thee O Lord! And become free from the bondage of action. May I not, even by mistake, by thought deed or speech attempt to do what is forbidden by the Vedas. If any such action becomes unavoidable, that too I will dedicate to Thee alone, O The Glowing Light of Consciousness!
---------
yastvanya: karmayogastava bhajanamayastatra chAbhIShTamUrtiM
hRRidyAM sattvaikarUpAM dRRiShadi hRRidi mRRidi kvApi vA bhAvayitvA |
puShpairgandhairnivedyairapi cha virachitai: shaktito bhaktipUtai-
rnityaM varyAM saparyAM vidadhadayi vibho tvatprasAdaM bhajeyam ||2||

ya:-tu-anya: karmayoga:-
that indeed the other (form of) ritualistic yoga
tava bhajanamaya:-tatra cha
(which is) of Thy devotion, there also
abhIShTa-mUrtiM
Thy form dear to me
hRRidyAM sattva-eka-rUpAM
in my heart, (the form) of pure Sattva
dRRiShadi hRRidi mRRidi
(in an image of) stone, in the heart, or of clay
kvApi vA bhAvayitvA
or of any other material, invoking
puShpai:-gandhai:-nivedyai:-
with flowers, incense and food offerings
api cha virachitai:
also making
shaktita: bhaktipUtai:-
according to my capacity, with pure devotion
nityaM varyAM saparyAM
everyday devoted worship
vidadhat-ayi vibho
performing O Lord!
tvat-prasAdaM bhajeyam
Thy grace will seek
---------
The other form of ritualistic Karma, (Aagama) where Thy devotion is propounded, following that, I will worship Thee everyday. The dear most pure Saatvic form of Thee I will invoke in my heart as an image of stone or clay or any other material and worship with offerings of flowers, incense and food, according to my capacity. O Lord! devotedly performing Thy worship, I will seek Thy grace.

strIshUdrAstvatkathAdishravaNavirahitA AsatAM te dayArhA-
stvatpAdAsannayAtAn dvijakulajanuSho hanta shochAmyashAntAn |
vRRittyarthaM te yajanto bahukathitamapi tvAmanAkarNayanto
dRRiptA vidyAbhijAtyai: kimu na vidadhate tAdRRishaM mA kRRithA mAm ||3||
---------
strI-shUdrA:-
women and people of lower castes
tvat-kathA-Adi-
Thy deed's narration etc.,
shravaNa-virahitA:-
of hearing deprived (unprivileged)
AsatAM te dayArhA:-
may they be sympathised with
tvat-pAda-Asanna-yAtAn
to Thy feets' proximity reaching
dvijakula-januSha: hanta
(those of) higher caste people, alas
shochAmi-ashAntAn
I pity, (for) they are unpeaceful
vRRittyarthaM te yajanta:
(because) for a livelihood (they) perform Yagyaas
bahu-kathitam-api
in spite of being told many times
tvAm-anAkarNayanta:
(they) to Thee (Thy teachings) do not hear (adhere to)
dRRiptA: vidyA-abhijAtyai:
arrogant (because of) learning and high birth
kimu na vidadhate
what (misdeeds) do they not do
tAdRRishaM
like that
mA kRRithA mAm
(Thou) may not make me

Women and people of the lower social order are unprivileged to hear the narrations of Thy deeds and excellences and for chanting Thy names. They are indeed to be pitied. But I bemoan the unpeaceful lot of people of the higher castes, who in spite of having all the facilities of worshipping Thee, would not do so being arrogant of their learning and high birth. In Thy teachings they have been repeatedly instructed about Thee, they perform Yagyaas as a livelihood and for material ends, and there is no misdeed that they do not do. O Lord! I pray, do not make me one like them.
---------
pApo.ayaM kRRiShNarAmetyabhilapati nijaM gUhituM dushcharitraM
nirlajjasyAsya vAchA bahutarakathanIyAni me vighnitAni |
bhrAtA me vandhyashIlo bhajati kila sadA viShNumitthaM budhAMste
nindantyuchchairhasanti tvayi nihitamatIMstAdRRishaM mA kRRithA mAm ||4||

pApa:-ayaM-kRRiShNa-rAma-
wicked is this Krishna and Raama
iti-abhilapati
thus keeps saying
nijaM gUhituM dushcharitraM
his own, to conceal misconduct
nirlajjasya-asya vAchA
by this shameless person's prattles
bahutara-kathanIyAni me
very many things that I wanted to say
vighnitAni
are hindered (could not be said)
bhrAtA me vandhyashIla:
my brother is a hypocrite
bhajati kila sadA viShNum-
and worships indeed always Vishnu
itthaM budhAn-te
in this manner, the wise devoted to Thee
nindanti-uchchai:-hasanti
of them, speak spitefully and laugh loudly
tvayi nihita-matIn
in Thee absorbed are whose minds
tAdRRishaM mA kRRithA mAm
like that (those people) do not make me
---------
Those worldly undevoted people laugh loudly at the wise people who are devoted to Thee with their minds absorbed in Thee. They speak spitefully of them with statements like -'This is a wicked fellow and keeps saying Krishna and Raama to conceal his misconduct. Because of this person's shameless prattles, I could not say many important things. My brother is an hypocrite and feigns to worship Vishnu all the time.' O Lord! Do not make me like them.

shvetachChAyaM kRRite tvAM munivaravapuShaM prINayante tapobhi-
stretAyAM sruksruvAdya~NkitamaruNatanuM yaj~narUpaM yajante |
sevante tantramArgairvilasadarigadaM dvApare shyAmalA~NgaM
nIlaM sa~NkIrtanAdyairiha kalisamaye mAnuShAstvAM bhajante ||5||
---------
shveta-chChAyaM kRRite
white and lustrous in Krita Yuga
tvAM munivaravapuShaM
Thou, in the form of a sage
prINayante tapobhi:-
propitiated by meditating men
tretAyAM
in the Treta Yuga
sruk-sruva-Adi-a~Nkitam-
Sruka and Sruva etc., bearing marks
aruNa-tanuM
with a red body
yaj~narUpaM yajante
(Thou) in the form of Yagya,are offered sacrifices
sevante tantra-mArgai:-
worship as per Taantric rites
vilasat-ari-gadaM
adorning sword and mace
dvApare shyAmala-a~Ngam
in the Dwaapara Yuga, (Thee as) the light blue bodied
nIlaM sa~NkIrtana-Adyai:-
(Thee) with blue (complexion) by chanting (Thy names) etc.,
iha kali-samaye
here in the Kali Yuga
mAnuShA:-tvAM bhajante
people, Thee worship

In the Krita Yuga people propitiate Thee with penance, in the form of a lustrous white sage. In the Treta Yuga, people offer sacrifices to Thee in the form as the Yagya itself, red in complexion marked with Sruka and Sruva (the Yaagyic accessories). According to the Taantric rites and rituals, in the Dwaapara Yuga, people worship Thee with a blue complexion resplendent with mace and discus etc. In this Kali Yuga Thou with a blue complexion are worshipped by people, with the chanting of Thy various names.
---------
so.ayaM kAleyakAlo jayati muraripo yatra sa~NkIrtanAdyai-
rniryatnaireva mArgairakhilada na chirAttvatprasAdaM bhajante |
jAtAstretAkRRitAdAvapi hi kila kalau sambhavaM kAmayante
daivAttatraiva jAtAn viShayaviSharasairmA vibho va~nchayAsmAn ||6||

sa:-ayaM kAleya-kAla:
that this is the Kali Yuga Kaala
jayati muraripo
may it be victorious, O Slayer of Mura!
yatra sa~NkIrtana-Adyai:-
where by chanting etc., only
niryatnai:-eva mArgai:-
without effort, alone, ways
akhilada na chirAt-
O Fulfiller of All Desires! Without delay
tvat-prasAdaM bhajante
Thy grace is achieved
jAtA:-tretA-kRRit-Adau-api
(those) born in Treta Krita etc also
hi kila kalau
indeed in Kali
sambhavaM kAmayante
to be born, desire
daivAt-tatra-eva jAtAn
fortunately, therein only born (we)
viShaya-viSha-rasai:-
by sensuous poisonous sense enjoyments
mA vibho va~nchaya-asmAn
Do not, O Lord! Deprive us
---------
O Slayer of Mura! That this Kali Yuga may be victorious, wherein by chanting Thy various names and glories alone Thy grace is achieved effortlessly and in no time. O Fulfiller of All Desires! Those born in Treta Krita Dwaapara also desire to be born indeed in Kali Kaala. Fortunately, those of us who are born now, in Kali, may we not O Lord! be deprived of Thy grace, because of the pursuit of poisonous sensuous sense enjoyments.

bhaktAstAvatkalau syurdramilabhuvi tato bhUrishastatra chochchai:
kAverIM tAmraparNImanu kila kRRitamAlAM cha puNyAM pratIchIm |
hA mAmapyetadantarbhavamapi cha vibho ki~nchida~nchadrasaM tva-
yyAshApAshairnibadhya bhramaya na bhagavan pUraya tvanniShevAm ||7||
---------
bhaktA:-tAvat-kalau
devotees, then, in Kaliyuga
syu:-dramila-bhuvi
will be in Dravid land
tata:-bhUrisha:-
from them most
tatra cha-uchchai::
and there are also, largely (in areas of)
kAverIM tAmraparNIm-
(the rivers) Kaaveri, Taamraparni,
anu kila kRRitamAlAM
and then indeed Kritmaalaa
cha puNyAM pratIchIm
towards the holy west
hA mAm-api-
Oh! me also
etat-antarbhavam-api
in this area born only
cha vibho
and O Lord!
ki~nchit-a~nchat-rasaM tvayi-
somewhat devotion to Thee (having)
AshA-pAshai:-nibadhya
in the ropes of desire, binding
bhramaya na bhagavan
delude, do not O God!
pUraya tvat-niShevAm
make complete, towards Thee my devotion

In the Kali Yuga devotees will abound, mostly in the Dravid land, i.e., South India. In the regions of the rivers Kaaveri, Taamraparni and the Kritamaalaa, the holy west, the devotees will be more. Oh Lord! I too am born in this region only, and have some devotion to Thee. O God! I pray, do not delude me by binding me with ropes of desire, and do make my devotion to Thee complete.
---------
dRRiShTvA dharmadruhaM taM kalimapakaruNaM prA~NmahIkShit parIkShit
hantuM vyAkRRiShTakhaDgo.api na vinihatavAn sAravedI guNAMshAt |
tvatsevAdyAshu siddhyedasadiha na tathA tvatpare chaiSha bhIru-
ryattu prAgeva rogAdibhirapaharate tatra hA shikShayainam ||8||

dRRiShTvA dharmadruhaM taM
seeing the enemy fo Dharma, him
kalim-apakaruNaM
Kaliyug the merciless Kali
prAk-mahIkShit parIkShit-
once the king Pareekshit
hantuM vyAkRRiShTa-khaDga:-api
to kill, drew his sword also
na vinihitavAn
(but) did not kill (Kali)
sAravedI guNa-aMshAt
the knower of the essence of Truth, (Kali) having some good
tvat-sevA-Adi-
worship of Thee etc.,
Ashu-siddhyet-
will bring results soon,
asat-iha na tathA
evil here, will not in the same manner (bring results)
tvat-pare cha-eSha bhIru:-
to Thy devotees and he (Kali) is afraid
yat-tu prAk-eva
because, before that only (firm devotion)
roga-Adibhi:-apaharate
by disease etc., he takes away
tatra hA
here (for this) Oh!
shikShaya-enam
do punish him
---------
Once king Pareekshit saw the merciless Kali who is the enemy of Dharma (righteousness), and to kill him, he drew his sword also. But he did not kill Kali, because Kali is a knower of the essence of Truth, and also because it has some good features. In Kali, Thy worship bears results very soon where as evil deeds take time to bring fruits. Kali is also afraid of Thy devotees, so he tries to take them away by disease etc., even before their devotion becomes firm. For this O Lord! punish him.

ga~NgA gItA cha gAyatryapi cha tulasikA gopikAchandanaM tat
sAlagrAmAbhipUjA parapuruSha tathaikAdashI nAmavarNA: |
etAnyaShTApyayatnAnyapi kalisamaye tvatprasAdapravRRiddhyA
kShipraM muktipradAnItyabhidadhu: RRiShayasteShu mAM sajjayethA: ||9||
---------
ga~NgA gItA cha
Gangaa (the river Ganges) Geetaa (the holy text)
gAyatrI-api cha
Gaayatri (Gaayatri Mantra) also
tulasikA
Tulsikaa (the holy plant)
gopikA chandanaM tat
and that Gopikaa chandana (sandal paste)
sAlagrAma-abhipUjA
Saalagraam (Vishnu's icon) worship
parapuruSha
O Supreme Lord!
tathA-ekAdashI
and Ekaadashi (the fast on the eleventh day of the fortnight)
nAmavarNA:
(and) chanting of Thy names
etAni-aShTa-api
these eight also
ayatnAni-ayi
are effortless, O Thou!
kali-samaye
in the time of Kali Yuga
tvat-prasAda-pravRRiddhyA
by Thy grace in abundance
kShipraM-mukti-pradAnI-iti-
quickly liberation gives, thus
abhidadhu:-RRiShaya:-
have clearly stated the sages
teShu mAM sajjayethA:
in these (eight), make me devoted completely

O Supreme Lord! In this Kali Yuga, Gangaa, Geetaa, Gaayatri, Tulsika, Gopichandana, Saalagraama worship, Ekaadashi fast and chanting of Thy names, these eight, the sages say, are quick and effortless means of salvation as they secure Thy abounding grace. O Thou! May I be intensely devoted to them all.
---------
devarShINAM pitRRiNAmapi na puna: RRiNI ki~Nkaro vA sa bhUman |
yo.asau sarvAtmanA tvAM sharaNamupagatassarvakRRityAni hitvA |
tasyotpannaM vikarmApyakhilamapanudasyeva chittasthitastvaM
tanme pApotthatApAn pavanapurapate rundhi bhaktiM praNIyA: ||10||

devarShINAM
of the gods (sages)
pitRRiNAm-api
of the Pitris (Manes) also
na puna: RRiNI
will not again be debtor
ki~Nkara: vA sa
a servant or he
bhUman
O Lord of the Universe!
ya:-asau sarvAtmanA
whoever wholeheartedly
tvAM sharaNam-upagata:-
in Thee refuge has taken
sarva-kRRityAni hitvA
abandoning all actions
tasya-utpannaM vikarma-api-
by him done misdeeds also
akhilam-apanudasi-eva
all of them are destroyed even
chitta-sthita:-tvaM
by Thee residing in his heart
tat-me pApa-uttha-tApAn
that by my sins' borne sufferings
pavanapurapate
O Lord of Guruvaayur!
rundhi bhaktiM praNIyA:
remove and generate devotion
---------
O Lord of the Universe! Who so ever, whole heartedly takes refuge in Thee, abandoning all actions, is no longer a debtor to the gods or sages, Pitris (or Manes), or a servant to them. Even if he has done any misdeeds, they are destroyed by Thee who do reside in his heart. O Lord of Guruvaayur! my sufferings, born of my sins, do remove and generate devotion in me.

Narayaneeyam D093

Dashaka 93
---------
bandhusnehaM vijahyAM tava hi karuNayA tvayyupAveshitAtmA
sarvaM tyaktvA chareyaM sakalamapi jagadvIkShya mAyAvilAsam |
nAnAtvAdbhrAntijanyAt sati khalu guNadoShAvabodhe vidhirvA
vyAsedho vA kathaM tau tvayi nihitamatervItavaiShamyabuddhe: ||1||
---------
bandhu-snehaM vijahyAM
to (my) relatives affection (I will) give up
tava hi karuNayA
by Thy grace alone
tvayi-upAveshita-AtmA
in Thee merged my mind
sarvaM tyaktvA chareyaM
abandoning everything will wander about
sakalam-api jagat-vIkShya
the whole world looking upon as only
mAyA-vilAsam
Maayaa's expression
nAnAtvAt-bhrAntijanyAt
multiplicity due to false comprehension
sati khalu guNa-doSha-
so being, indeed, good and bad
avabodhe vidhi:-vA
its understanding or the does-
vyAsedha: vA kathaM tau
and don'ts, how come they both
tvayi nihita-mate:-
into Thee (whose) absorbed is the mind
vIta-vaiShamya-buddhe:
and transcended the consciousness of differences

Thy grace alone will enable me to abandon my love and affection towards my relatives. With my mind merged in Thee, renouncing everything, I will wander about looking upon the whole world as an expression of Maayaa. The injunctions and prohibitions of the scriptures apply to the one who entertains the concepts of good or bad due to multiplicity caused by false comprehension. How can both of these apply to a person whose mind is absorbed in Thee and who has transcended the consciousness of differences.
---------
kShuttRRiShNAlopamAtre satatakRRitadhiyo jantava: santyanantA-
stebhyo vij~nAnavattvAt puruSha iha varastajjanirdurlabhaiva |
tatrApyAtmAtmana: syAtsuhRRidapi cha ripuryastvayi nyastachetA-
stApochChitterupAyaM smarati sa hi suhRRit svAtmavairI tato.anya: ||2||

kShut-tRRiShNA-lopa-mAtre
hunger and thirst appeasing merely
satata-kRRita-dhiya:
always absorbed whose minds
jantava: santi-anantA:-
(such) beings are there countless
tebhya: vij~nAnavattvAt
among them, because discriminative mind
puruSha iha vara:-
man, here, is superior
tat-jani:-durlabha-eva
therefore, this birth is rare indeed
tatra-api-AtmA-Atmana:
there again, one's self to his own self
syAt-suhRRit-api cha ripu:-
may be friend and also an enemy
tvayi nyasta-chetA:-
in Thee (whose) absorbed is mind
tApa-uchChitte:-upAyaM
is sorrows alleviating means
smarati sa hi suhRRit
(those who) think so, he alone is friend
sva-Atma-vairI tata:-anya:
one self's enemy (is) the other one
---------
There are countless beings who are always absorbed in satisfying their hunger and thirst. Among them, a man is superior for being endowed with a discriminative mind. Human birth indeed is rare. Among men also a person may be one's own friend or a foe. A person whose mind is absorbed in Thee, is always concerned in the means of alleviating sorrow, is ones own friend. All others are their own foes.

tvatkAruNye pravRRitte ka iva nahi gururlokavRRitte.api bhUman
sarvAkrAntApi bhUmirnahi chalati tatassatkShamAM shikShayeyam |
gRRihNIyAmIsha tattadviShayaparichaye.apyaprasaktiM samIrAt
vyAptatva~nchAtmano me gaganaguruvashAdbhAtu nirlepatA cha ||3
---------
tvat-kAruNye pravRRitte
(when) Thy grace operates
ka iva na hi guru:-
who, like, is not also a teacher
loka-vRRitte-api
in this worldly existence also
bhUman
O Lord of the Universe!
sarvAkrAntA-api bhUmi:-
oppressed by all also, the earth
na-hi chalati
it does not move
tata:-satkShamAM shikShayeyam
from her true forbearance let me learn
gRRihNIyAm-Isha
May I learn O God!
tat-tat-viShaya-
(that) from this that objects'
parichaye-api-
contact also
aprasaktiM samIrAt-
non-tainting from the air
vyAptatvam-cha-Atmana: me
and all pervasiveness of myself
gagana-guru-vashAt-
from the sky as a teacher
bhAtu nirlepatA cha
be made clear to me and also the unaffectedness

O Lord of the Universe! When Thy grace operates there is nothing in this worldly existence which may not become a spiritual teacher. I will learn the lesson of true forbearance from the earth who does not move in spite of being oppressed by all. The air is always in contact with various objects but is not tainted by them so I will learn nonattachment from the air. The nature of my soul which is all pervasive and unaffected, will be clear to me from the sky as a teacher.
---------
svachCha: syAM pAvano.ahaM madhura udakavadvahnivanmA sma gRRihNAM
sarvAnnIno.api doShaM taruShu tamiva mAM sarvabhUteShvaveyAm |
puShTirnaShTi: kalAnAM shashina iva tanornAtmano.astIti vidyAM
toyAdivyastamArtANDavadapi cha tanuShvekatAM tvatprasAdAt ||4||

svachCha: syAM
clean may be
pAvana:-ahaM
pure I
madhura udaka-vat-
sweet like water
vahni-vat-mA sma gRRihNAM
like fire may I not take on
sarva-annIna:-api doShaM
consuming all, their defects
taruShu tam-iva
in the trees, like it (fire)
mAM sarva-bhUteShu-aveyAm
me alone in all the beings recognising
puShTi-naShTi: kalAnAM
waxing and waning of the parts
shashina:-iva-tano:-
of the moon, like, of the body
na-Atmana:-
and not of the soul
asti-iti vidyAM
it is, this knowledge
toya-Adi-vyasta-
water etc., reflecting
mArtANDa-vat-api cha
the sun like also
tanuShu-ekatAM
in all bodies oneness
tvat-prasAdAt
by Thy grace
---------
May I be clean pure and sweet like the water. May I be not blemished by taking food of any type, just as fire though all consuming, is unaffected by the defects of any substance. Just as there is fire in every tree, let me recognize me in all beings. The growth and decay is of the body, like waxing and waning of the moon, and not of Aatman, the self. By Thy grace, may I realise, the oneness of all individual bodies, just like the reflected images of the sun in universal waters.

snehAdvyAdhAttaputrapraNayamRRitakapotAyito mA sma bhUvaM
prAptaM prAshnan saheya kShudhamapi shayuvat sindhuvatsyAmagAdha: |
mA paptaM yoShidAdau shikhini shalabhavat bhRRi~NgavatsArabhAgI
bhUyAsaM kintu tadvaddhanachayanavashAnmAhamIsha praNesham ||5||
---------
snehAt-vyAdha-
because of affection, by the hunter
Atta-putra-praNaya-
holding offspring attachment
mRRita-kapota-Ayita:
was dead the pigeon with them
mA sma bhUvaM
may I not be so
prAptaM prAshnan saheya
wherever is available, I eat, endure
kShudham-api shayu-vat
hunger also like a python
sindhu-vat-syAm-agAdha:
an ocean like may I be serene/deep
mA paptaM yoShit-Adau
may (I) not fall prey to female lust
shikhini shalabha-vat
like fire the moths
bhRRi~Nga-vat-sAra-bhAgI bhUyAsaM
like honey bee may I be a knower of essence
kintu tat-vat-dhana-chayana-
but like it, for accumulating wealth
vashAt-mA-aham-
by that may I not
Isha praNesham
O Lord! Perish

May I not be like the pigeon who for the love of its off springs was killed by the hunter, along with them. Like the python may I eat whatever is available and also endure hunger when nothing is available. Let me be deep and serene like the ocean. Let me not fall a prey to the lust of women like a moth to fire. O Lord! let me seek the essence of things like the honey bee and unlike it let me not perish in accumulating wealth.
---------
mA baddhyAsaM taruNyA gaja iva vashayA nArjayeyaM dhanaughaM
hartAnyastaM hi mAdhvIhara iva mRRigavanmA muhaM grAmyagItai: |
nAtyAsajjeya bhojye jhaSha iva balishe pi~NgalAvannirAsha:
supyAM bhartavyayogAt kurara iva vibho sAmiSho.anyairna hanyai ||6||

mA baddhyAsaM taruNyA
may I not be led to captivity by women
gaja iva vashayA
as an elephant is by a female
na-ArjayeyaM dhana-aughaM
let me not earn wealth in plenty
hartA-anya:-taM hi
(because) taken away by others it is
mAdhvIhara:-iva
like the honey gatherers
mRRiga-vat-mA muhaM
like a deer may I not be ensnared
grAmya-gItai:
by vulgar music
na-ati-Asajjeya
not very much attached may I be
bhojye jhaSha iva balishe
to food, like a fish to the bait
pi~NgalA-vat-nirAsha: supyAM
like Pingalaa, without a care, may I sleep
bhartavya-yogAt
guarding needed for
kurara iva vibho
like the Kurara bird, O Lord!
sAmiSha:-anyai:-na hanyai
carrying meat, by others may I not be killed
---------
Let me not be led to captivity by women as an elephant is by a female. Let me not earn wealth in plenty because it is taken away by others, like the honey gatherers. Let me not be attracted into a snare by sweet words, as a deer is by vulgar music. May I not be too attached to food like a fish is to a bait. Like Pingalaa may I sleep soundly without a care. O Lord! May I not be killed by others like the Kurara bird for having to guard the meat it was carrying.

varteya tyaktamAna: sukhamatishishuvannissahAyashchareyaM
kanyAyA ekasheSho valaya iva vibho varjitAnyonyaghoSha: |
tvachchitto nAvabudhyai paramiShukRRidiva kShmAbhRRidAyAnaghoShaM
geheShvanyapraNIteShvahiriva nivasAnyundurormandireShu ||7||
---------
varteya tyaktamAna:
will live abandoning the sense of honour and dishonour
sukham-ati-shishu-vat-
very happily like a child
nissahAya:-chareyaM
alone and unaccompanied, will move about
kanyAyA:-eka-sheSha:
a maiden's one last solitary
valaya iva vibho
bangle like, O Lord!
varjitAni-unya-ghoSha:
debarred and without noises (from contacts with the worldly objects)
tvat-chitta:
in Thee, my mind
na-avabudhyai param-
may not know anything beyond
iShu-kRRit-iva
like the arrow maker
kShmAbhRRita-AyAna-ghoShaM
by the king's approaching, announcement
geheShu-anya-praNIteShu-
in the houses by others made
ahi:-iva nivasAni-
like the snake, may I live
unduro:-mandireShu
in the rat's hole (houses)

Devoid of sense of honour and dishonour, I will live very happily like a child, unaccompanied and all alone, like a solitary bangle on a maiden's wrist, I will move about restricting myself from all other noises of contacts and conflicts.
